Foor says, “Ancestral lineage healing is a specific approach to relating directly with wise and loving lineage ancestors for the purposes of personal, family and cultural healing.” I was most drawn to this approach because of the multidimensional healing benefits.4 Foor outlines how relating to ancestors supports psychological and physical health, heals intergenerational family dysfunction, and culturally transforms historical and collective trauma.5
My personal experiences with ancestor healing practices increased my trust in the wisdom of our ancestors. I started using my ancestor-inspired meditations with clients (more about how I developed the meditations later). As I guided them through these meditations, they shared a knowing and familiar connection with their ancestors that enhanced their experience of healing. The presence of ancestors in the healing journey, I discovered, helps clients feel supported, understood, and loved. Many clients had never connected with ancestors and their wisdom prior to being introduced to my meditations. I encouraged them to invite their ancestors into their daily lives and into the therapy process, and to consult with them on decisions and challenges. My clients found the new relationship beneficial and yearned to stay connected so they could learn more about and from their ancestors.	My personal experiences with ancestor healing practices increased my trust in the wisdom of our ancestors. I started using my ancestor-inspired meditations with clients (more about how I developed the meditations later). As I guided them through these meditations, they shared a knowing and familiar connection with their ancestors that enhanced their experience of healing. The presence of ancestors in the healing journey, I discovered, helps clients feel supported, understood, and loved. Many clients had never connected with ancestors and their wisdom prior to being introduced to my meditations. I encouraged them to invite their ancestors into their daily lives and into the therapy process, and to consult with them on decisions and challenges. My clients found the new relationship beneficial and yearned to stay connected so they could learn more about and from their ancestors.	Мой личный опыт практики исцеления предков усилил мою веру в мудрость наших предков. Я начал использовать медитации, вдохновленные предками, с клиентами (подробнее о том, как я разработал эти медитации, позже). Когда я проводил их через эти медитации, они разделяли знакомую и знакомую связь со своими предками, которая обогатила их опыт исцеления. Я обнаружил, что присутствие предков на пути исцеления помогает клиентам чувствовать поддержку, понимание и любовь. Многие клиенты никогда не имели дела с предками и их мудростью до того, как познакомились с моими медитациями. Я призвал их пригласить своих предков в свою повседневную жизнь и процесс терапии, а также консультироваться с ними по поводу решений и проблем. Мои клиенты находили новые отношения полезными и стремились оставаться на связи, чтобы они могли больше узнать о своих предках и от них.	My personal experiences with ancestor healing practices increased my trust in the wisdom of our ancestors. I started using my ancestor-inspired meditations with clients (more about how I developed the meditations later). As I guided them through these meditations, they shared a knowing and familiar connection with their ancestors that enhanced their experience of healing. The presence of ancestors in the healing journey, I discovered, helps clients feel supported, understood, and loved. Many clients had never connected with ancestors and their wisdom prior to being introduced to my meditations. I encouraged them to invite their ancestors into their daily lives and into the therapy process, and to consult with them on decisions and challenges. My clients found the new relationship beneficial and yearned to stay connected so they could learn more about and from their ancestors.
I also brought ancestors into the IFS healing process through legacy burden work, which I’ll describe in Chapter 11. It made sense to me, when working with traumas inherited from generational lines, that ancestors need to actively participate in the healing process. Some of the burdens passed down to my Black female clients in particular are self-reliance; the need to be strong while denying vulnerability or emotions; striving and feeling guilty for resting; a scarcity perspective believing that there’s not enough and if they stop pushing they will miss out; caretaking others and ignoring self-care; sexualization of Black women and girls; colorism; racism; and of course slavery, which is the origin of many of these legacy burdens. Ancestors have an understanding about the burdens of their line and can contribute immensely to clearing its generational burdens. Inviting the ancestors to do the work of releasing the burdens, while clients observe the process, has resulted in remarkable transformations for the clients. In this process, ancestors also let the client know the gifts or heirlooms of the line and share them with the client. A few of the heirlooms of Black ancestral lines are family loyalty, a broad definition of family including “aunties” and “cousins” based on connection in addition to blood ties, family traditions, rituals and celebrations, common sense, instinct for survival, innovation, and traditional healing. I have found that inviting the ancestors to lead the unburdening process, allowing them to do the work with the ancestral line, results in a fuller, more complete release of the burdens and a deep connection between the client and their ancestral line.	I also brought ancestors into the IFS healing process through legacy burden work, which I’ll describe in Chapter 11. It made sense to me, when working with traumas inherited from generational lines, that ancestors need to actively participate in the healing process. Some of the burdens passed down to my Black female clients in particular are self-reliance; the need to be strong while denying vulnerability or emotions; striving and feeling guilty for resting; a scarcity perspective believing that there’s not enough and if they stop pushing they will miss out; caretaking others and ignoring self-care; sexualization of Black women and girls; colorism; racism; and of course slavery, which is the origin of many of these legacy burdens. Ancestors have an understanding about the burdens of their line and can contribute immensely to clearing its generational burdens. Inviting the ancestors to do the work of releasing the burdens, while clients observe the process, has resulted in remarkable transformations for the clients. In this process, ancestors also let the client know the gifts or heirlooms of the line and share them with the client. A few of the heirlooms of Black ancestral lines are family loyalty, a broad definition of family including “aunties” and “cousins” based on connection in addition to blood ties, family traditions, rituals and celebrations, common sense, instinct for survival, innovation, and traditional healing. I have found that inviting the ancestors to lead the unburdening process, allowing them to do the work with the ancestral line, results in a fuller, more complete release of the burdens and a deep connection between the client and their ancestral line.	Я также вовлек предков в процесс исцеления IFS посредством работы с бременем наследия, которую я опишу в главе 11. При работе с травмами, унаследованными по наследственным линиям, для меня имело смысл, что предкам необходимо активно участвовать в процессе исцеления. Некоторые из бремен, возложенных на моих чернокожих клиенток, в частности, связаны с уверенностью в своих силах; потребность быть сильным, отрицая при этом уязвимость и эмоции; стремление и чувство вины за отдых; точка зрения дефицита, полагающая, что этого недостаточно, и если они перестанут давить, они упустят выгоду; забота о других и игнорирование заботы о себе; сексуализация чернокожих женщин и девочек; колоризм; расизм; и, конечно же, рабство, которое является источником многих из этих бремени наследия. Предки понимают бремя своей линии и могут внести огромный вклад в устранение бремени поколений. Приглашение предков выполнить работу по освобождению от бремени, в то время как клиенты наблюдают за процессом, привело к замечательным преобразованиям для клиентов. В этом процессе предки также сообщают клиенту о подарках или семейных реликвиях этой линии и делятся ими с клиентом. Некоторыми из семейных реликвий черных предковых линий являются семейная верность, широкое определение семьи, включая «тетушек» и «двоюродных братьев», основанное на связях, помимо кровных уз, семейных традициях, ритуалах и праздниках, здравом смысле, инстинкте выживания, инновациях. и традиционное целительство. Я обнаружил, что приглашение предков возглавить процесс облегчения бремени, позволяя им выполнять работу с наследственной линией, приводит к более полному и совершенному освобождению от бремени и глубокой связи между клиентом и его наследственной линией.	I also brought ancestors into the IFS healing process through legacy burden work, which I’ll describe in Chapter 11. It made sense to me, when working with traumas inherited from generational lines, that ancestors need to actively participate in the healing process. Some of the burdens passed down to my Black female clients in particular are self-reliance; the need to be strong while denying vulnerability or emotions; striving and feeling guilty for resting; a scarcity perspective believing that there’s not enough and if they stop pushing they will miss out; caretaking others and ignoring self-care; sexualization of Black women and girls; colorism; racism; and of course slavery, which is the origin of many of these legacy burdens. Ancestors have an understanding about the burdens of their line and can contribute immensely to clearing its generational burdens. Inviting the ancestors to do the work of releasing the burdens, while clients observe the process, has resulted in remarkable transformations for the clients. In this process, ancestors also let the client know the gifts or heirlooms of the line and share them with the client. A few of the heirlooms of Black ancestral lines are family loyalty, a broad definition of family including “aunties” and “cousins” based on connection in addition to blood ties, family traditions, rituals and celebrations, common sense, instinct for survival, innovation, and traditional healing. I have found that inviting the ancestors to lead the unburdening process, allowing them to do the work with the ancestral line, results in a fuller, more complete release of the burdens and a deep connection between the client and their ancestral line.
My first session with Jamari started with an assessment of the health of each of my primary ancestral lines: mother’s mother’s, mother’s father’s, father’s mother’s, and father’s father’s line. This assessment revealed that my mother’s mother’s line was the healthiest and the one I felt the closest to. I decided to begin to get to know the ancestors in my mother’s mother’s lineage.	My first session with Jamari started with an assessment of the health of each of my primary ancestral lines: mother’s mother’s, mother’s father’s, father’s mother’s, and father’s father’s line. This assessment revealed that my mother’s mother’s line was the healthiest and the one I felt the closest to. I decided to begin to get to know the ancestors in my mother’s mother’s lineage.	Моя первая сессия с Джамари началась с оценки здоровья каждой из моих основных родовых линий: линии матери-матери, линии отца матери, линии отца-матери и линии отца-отца. Эта оценка показала, что линия матери моей матери была самой здоровой и той, к которой я чувствовал себя ближе всего. Я решила начать знакомиться с предками по линии матери моей матери.	My first session with Jamari started with an assessment of the health of each of my primary ancestral lines: mother’s mother’s, mother’s father’s, father’s mother’s, and father’s father’s line. This assessment revealed that my mother’s mother’s line was the healthiest and the one I felt the closest to. I decided to begin to get to know the ancestors in my mother’s mother’s lineage.
When I met my Ancestor Guide on my mother’s mother’s side, she showed up tall, dark, dancing expressively with her long limbs, dressed in brightly colored yellows and oranges. Seeing her brought both joy and sadness. Joy for how well and unburdened she appeared and sadness because I, too, wished to experience the lightness of an unburdened life. I asked her for a blessing for my sadness. Her body began to move rhythmically. Although there was no music, her movements were melodic. Her hands came together at her heart several times. I interpreted what she was doing as dancing and praying. She gently corrected my impression by saying, “The dance is the prayer.”	When I met my Ancestor Guide on my mother’s mother’s side, she showed up tall, dark, dancing expressively with her long limbs, dressed in brightly colored yellows and oranges. Seeing her brought both joy and sadness. Joy for how well and unburdened she appeared and sadness because I, too, wished to experience the lightness of an unburdened life. I asked her for a blessing for my sadness. Her body began to move rhythmically. Although there was no music, her movements were melodic. Her hands came together at her heart several times. I interpreted what she was doing as dancing and praying. She gently corrected my impression by saying, “The dance is the prayer.”	Когда я встретил своего Предка-Наставника со стороны матери моей матери, она появилась высокая, смуглая, выразительно танцующая со своими длинными конечностями, одетая в яркие желтые и оранжевые одежды. Встреча с ней принесла и радость, и печаль. Радость от того, какой здоровой и необремененной она казалась, и печаль от того, что мне тоже хотелось испытать легкость необремененной жизни. Я попросил у нее благословения на мою печаль. Ее тело начало ритмично двигаться. Хотя музыки не было, ее движения были мелодичны. Ее руки несколько раз соприкасались у сердца. Я интерпретировал то, что она делала, как танец и молитву. Она мягко исправила мое впечатление, сказав: «Танец – это молитва».	When I met my Ancestor Guide on my mother’s mother’s side, she showed up tall, dark, dancing expressively with her long limbs, dressed in brightly colored yellows and oranges. Seeing her brought both joy and sadness. Joy for how well and unburdened she appeared and sadness because I, too, wished to experience the lightness of an unburdened life. I asked her for a blessing for my sadness. Her body began to move rhythmically. Although there was no music, her movements were melodic. Her hands came together at her heart several times. I interpreted what she was doing as dancing and praying. She gently corrected my impression by saying, “The dance is the prayer.”
My guide turned her attention to the healing of my unwell ancestors. She held a quilt in her hands and waved it around to capture them. Each unwell ancestor landed on a square of the quilt that represented their unwellness and became one with the quilt.	My guide turned her attention to the healing of my unwell ancestors. She held a quilt in her hands and waved it around to capture them. Each unwell ancestor landed on a square of the quilt that represented their unwellness and became one with the quilt.	Моя гидка обратила свое внимание на исцеление моих нездоровых предков. Она держала в руках одеяло и махала им, чтобы поймать их. Каждый нездоровый предок приземлился на квадрат одеяла, который символизировал его нездоровье, и стал единым целым с одеялом.	My guide turned her attention to the healing of my unwell ancestors. She held a quilt in her hands and waved it around to capture them. Each unwell ancestor landed on a square of the quilt that represented their unwellness and became one with the quilt.
I tried to share what was happening with Jamari, but the words got caught in my throat. When I attempted to speak a second time, the sound was choked back. “No need to speak to me, just be with your ancestor,” Jamari suggested gently.	I tried to share what was happening with Jamari, but the words got caught in my throat. When I attempted to speak a second time, the sound was choked back. “No need to speak to me, just be with your ancestor,” Jamari suggested gently.	Я попыталась рассказать Джамари о том, что происходит, но слова застряли у меня в горле. Когда я попытался заговорить во второй раз, звук заглох. «Не нужно говорить со мной, просто будь со своим предком», — мягко предложил Джамари.	I tried to share what was happening with Jamari, but the words got caught in my throat. When I attempted to speak a second time, the sound was choked back. “No need to speak to me, just be with your ancestor,” Jamari suggested gently.
I asked my Ancestor Guide, “Are you the one who takes my voice away?” Around that time, I was frequently losing my voice while working with clients, as often as once a week. In the middle of a session, I would get a lump in my throat that only the smallest bit of sound could move past. I’d drink water, suck throat lozenges, clear my throat, and cough, but nothing loosened the lump. I even had to end a few sessions early, motioning to my client that I couldn’t speak.	I asked my Ancestor Guide, “Are you the one who takes my voice away?” Around that time, I was frequently losing my voice while working with clients, as often as once a week. In the middle of a session, I would get a lump in my throat that only the smallest bit of sound could move past. I’d drink water, suck throat lozenges, clear my throat, and cough, but nothing loosened the lump. I even had to end a few sessions early, motioning to my client that I couldn’t speak.	Я спросил своего Предка-Наставника: «Это ты забирает мой голос?» Примерно в то время я часто терял голос во время работы с клиентами, примерно раз в неделю. В середине сеанса у меня в горле стоял комок, сквозь который мог пройти лишь малейший звук. Я пила воду, сосала леденцы от горла, прочищала горло и кашляла, но ничто не ослабляло ком. Мне даже пришлось закончить несколько сеансов раньше, жестом сообщив клиенту, что я не могу говорить.	I asked my Ancestor Guide, “Are you the one who takes my voice away?” Around that time, I was frequently losing my voice while working with clients, as often as once a week. In the middle of a session, I would get a lump in my throat that only the smallest bit of sound could move past. I’d drink water, suck throat lozenges, clear my throat, and cough, but nothing loosened the lump. I even had to end a few sessions early, motioning to my client that I couldn’t speak.
“Yes, I am the one,” my guide said. She explained that she does it to help me slow down, rest, and be. I got a sense that I would soon use my voice in a new way. She invited me into relationship with her through connecting regularly and using my hands. Lastly, she told me that the gifts of this line are peace, wisdom, artful use of the hands, and uncomplicated living.	“Yes, I am the one,” my guide said. She explained that she does it to help me slow down, rest, and be. I got a sense that I would soon use my voice in a new way. She invited me into relationship with her through connecting regularly and using my hands. Lastly, she told me that the gifts of this line are peace, wisdom, artful use of the hands, and uncomplicated living.	«Да, это я», — сказал мой гид. Она объяснила, что делает это, чтобы помочь мне замедлиться, отдохнуть и жить. У меня появилось ощущение, что скоро я буду использовать свой голос по-новому. Она пригласила меня к отношениям с ней, регулярно общаясь и используя мои руки. Наконец, она сказала мне, что дары этой линии — это мир, мудрость, искусное использование рук и несложная жизнь.	“Yes, I am the one,” my guide said. She explained that she does it to help me slow down, rest, and be. I got a sense that I would soon use my voice in a new way. She invited me into relationship with her through connecting regularly and using my hands. Lastly, she told me that the gifts of this line are peace, wisdom, artful use of the hands, and uncomplicated living.
At one point in the session, I felt an explosion of pain on the right front side of my head. She said this happens when I won’t let things go. I realized she was right; I was trying to control the process instead of allowing it to happen. She suggested that I just be. When I allowed myself to be present without the need to control, her presence intensified, and the headache subsided, replaced with a sense of peace and calm. I had experienced unbearable migraine headaches since college and undergone many treatments with varying degrees of relief. My wise ancestor gave me an age-old antidote: stop controlling, allow, and be.	At one point in the session, I felt an explosion of pain on the right front side of my head. She said this happens when I won’t let things go. I realized she was right; I was trying to control the process instead of allowing it to happen. She suggested that I just be. When I allowed myself to be present without the need to control, her presence intensified, and the headache subsided, replaced with a sense of peace and calm. I had experienced unbearable migraine headaches since college and undergone many treatments with varying degrees of relief. My wise ancestor gave me an age-old antidote: stop controlling, allow, and be.	В какой-то момент сеанса я почувствовал резкую боль в правой передней части головы. Она сказала, что такое случается, когда я не позволяю всему идти своим чередом. Я понял, что она права; Я пытался контролировать процесс, вместо того, чтобы позволить ему произойти. Она предложила мне просто быть. Когда я позволил себе присутствовать без необходимости контроля, ее присутствие усилилось, а головная боль утихла, сменившись ощущением умиротворения и покоя. Еще со времен колледжа я страдал от невыносимых мигреней и прошел множество курсов лечения с разной степенью облегчения. Мой мудрый предок дал мне древнее противоядие: перестань контролировать, позволь и будь.	At one point in the session, I felt an explosion of pain on the right front side of my head. She said this happens when I won’t let things go. I realized she was right; I was trying to control the process instead of allowing it to happen. She suggested that I just be. When I allowed myself to be present without the need to control, her presence intensified, and the headache subsided, replaced with a sense of peace and calm. I had experienced unbearable migraine headaches since college and undergone many treatments with varying degrees of relief. My wise ancestor gave me an age-old antidote: stop controlling, allow, and be.
My dancing ancestor visited me in my dreams for the next two nights. She did not speak. She danced. I was drawn into her dance, unable to take my eyes off her. I was reminded of her words, “The dance is the prayer,” and realized she is praying for me, continually.	My dancing ancestor visited me in my dreams for the next two nights. She did not speak. She danced. I was drawn into her dance, unable to take my eyes off her. I was reminded of her words, “The dance is the prayer,” and realized she is praying for me, continually.	Мой танцующий предок приходил ко мне во сне следующие две ночи. Она не говорила. Она танцевала. Я был увлечен ее танцем, не в силах оторвать от нее взгляд. Мне вспомнились ее слова: «Танец – это молитва», и я понял, что она постоянно молится за меня.	My dancing ancestor visited me in my dreams for the next two nights. She did not speak. She danced. I was drawn into her dance, unable to take my eyes off her. I was reminded of her words, “The dance is the prayer,” and realized she is praying for me, continually.
ANCESTRAL HEIRLOOMS	ANCESTRAL HEIRLOOMS	ФАМИЛИОННЫЕ РЕВИКЦИИ ПРЕДКОВ	ANCESTRAL HEIRLOOMS
One week after my first ancestral lineage healing session, Deran Young, the founder of Black Therapists Rock (BTR), invited me to lead the morning meditation at BTR’s first Heirloom Summit: Transforming Legacy Burdens to Legacy Gifts three days later. Though I had no clue what I would do in the meditation, I agreed, and then immediately went online to research meditations that involved legacy burdens and gifts for inspiration. I found a few, but none were what I was looking for. Interestingly, I did not fret, which is what I would have done prior to my ancestral healing session. I had a serene sense that it would work out fine.	One week after my first ancestral lineage healing session, Deran Young, the founder of Black Therapists Rock (BTR), invited me to lead the morning meditation at BTR’s first Heirloom Summit: Transforming Legacy Burdens to Legacy Gifts three days later. Though I had no clue what I would do in the meditation, I agreed, and then immediately went online to research meditations that involved legacy burdens and gifts for inspiration. I found a few, but none were what I was looking for. Interestingly, I did not fret, which is what I would have done prior to my ancestral healing session. I had a serene sense that it would work out fine.	Через неделю после моего первого сеанса исцеления по линии предков Деран Янг, основатель Black Therapists Rock (BTR), пригласил меня провести утреннюю медитацию на первом саммите BTR по семейным реликвиям: преобразование бремени наследия в дары наследия, три дня спустя. Хотя я понятия не имел, что буду делать во время медитации, я согласился, а затем сразу же зашел в Интернет, чтобы исследовать медитации, которые включали в себя унаследованное бремя и дары для вдохновения. Я нашел несколько, но ни один из них не был тем, что я искал. Интересно, что я не волновался, что я бы сделал до сеанса исцеления предков. У меня было безмятежное ощущение, что все будет хорошо.	One week after my first ancestral lineage healing session, Deran Young, the founder of Black Therapists Rock (BTR), invited me to lead the morning meditation at BTR’s first Heirloom Summit: Transforming Legacy Burdens to Legacy Gifts three days later. Though I had no clue what I would do in the meditation, I agreed, and then immediately went online to research meditations that involved legacy burdens and gifts for inspiration. I found a few, but none were what I was looking for. Interestingly, I did not fret, which is what I would have done prior to my ancestral healing session. I had a serene sense that it would work out fine.
A group of ancestors came to me in a dream that night. The dancing ancestor was not one of them. These ancestors knew my need and generously shared a guided imagery meditation. When I had created meditations in the past, I experienced meditation from the outside, as a viewer and creator of what was happening. This time, my ancestors gifted the meditation as a firsthand experience from within the guided imagery. I was the main character. Instead of watching the meditation unfold, I was inside the meditation, experiencing it visually, tactilely, fragrantly, emotionally, auditorily. The dreamer and the dreamed merged. In my over 30 years of meditating, it was the most vibrant, tangible, and heartfelt experience I have ever had.	A group of ancestors came to me in a dream that night. The dancing ancestor was not one of them. These ancestors knew my need and generously shared a guided imagery meditation. When I had created meditations in the past, I experienced meditation from the outside, as a viewer and creator of what was happening. This time, my ancestors gifted the meditation as a firsthand experience from within the guided imagery. I was the main character. Instead of watching the meditation unfold, I was inside the meditation, experiencing it visually, tactilely, fragrantly, emotionally, auditorily. The dreamer and the dreamed merged. In my over 30 years of meditating, it was the most vibrant, tangible, and heartfelt experience I have ever had.	В ту ночь ко мне во сне пришла группа предков. Танцующий предок не был одним из них. Эти предки знали о моих нуждах и щедро поделились управляемой образной медитацией. Когда я создавал медитации в прошлом, я переживал медитацию со стороны, как зритель и творец происходящего. На этот раз мои предки подарили медитацию как непосредственный опыт, полученный с помощью управляемых образов. Я был главным героем. Вместо того, чтобы наблюдать, как разворачивается медитация, я находился внутри медитации, переживая ее визуально, тактильно, ароматно, эмоционально, слухово. Мечтатель и мечта слились воедино. За более чем 30 лет медитации это был самый яркий, осязаемый и душевный опыт, который я когда-либо испытывал.	A group of ancestors came to me in a dream that night. The dancing ancestor was not one of them. These ancestors knew my need and generously shared a guided imagery meditation. When I had created meditations in the past, I experienced meditation from the outside, as a viewer and creator of what was happening. This time, my ancestors gifted the meditation as a firsthand experience from within the guided imagery. I was the main character. Instead of watching the meditation unfold, I was inside the meditation, experiencing it visually, tactilely, fragrantly, emotionally, auditorily. The dreamer and the dreamed merged. In my over 30 years of meditating, it was the most vibrant, tangible, and heartfelt experience I have ever had.
When I woke, I knew this was the Summit meditation. I transcribed it with the guidance of my ancestors, who stood close behind me. They provided gentle nudges for correction when I got an idea or word wrong. At times, they assisted me in re-experiencing the meditation to truly capture the essence. The significance of my ancestors gifting me with the meditation for a Summit on Legacy Burdens and Legacy Gifts is not lost on me. I am immensely grateful to them for showing up when I had no idea what I would do a mere three days before the event.	When I woke, I knew this was the Summit meditation. I transcribed it with the guidance of my ancestors, who stood close behind me. They provided gentle nudges for correction when I got an idea or word wrong. At times, they assisted me in re-experiencing the meditation to truly capture the essence. The significance of my ancestors gifting me with the meditation for a Summit on Legacy Burdens and Legacy Gifts is not lost on me. I am immensely grateful to them for showing up when I had no idea what I would do a mere three days before the event.	Когда я проснулся, я знал, что это медитация Саммита. Я переписал его под руководством моих предков, которые стояли рядом со мной. Они мягко подталкивали меня к исправлению, когда я неправильно понимал идею или слово. Иногда они помогали мне заново пережить медитацию, чтобы по-настоящему уловить суть. Значимость того, что мои предки подарили мне медитацию для Саммита по бремени наследия и дарам наследия, не ускользнула от меня. Я безмерно благодарен им за то, что они появились, когда я еще за три дня до мероприятия понятия не имел, чем буду заниматься.	When I woke, I knew this was the Summit meditation. I transcribed it with the guidance of my ancestors, who stood close behind me. They provided gentle nudges for correction when I got an idea or word wrong. At times, they assisted me in re-experiencing the meditation to truly capture the essence. The significance of my ancestors gifting me with the meditation for a Summit on Legacy Burdens and Legacy Gifts is not lost on me. I am immensely grateful to them for showing up when I had no idea what I would do a mere three days before the event.
The meditation wasn’t the only gift I received that night. They declared that this meditation would be included in a book of IFS-inspired guided imagery meditations that I would eventually publish. They went on to assure me that they will assist me every step of the way. I was instructed that I should not distribute the meditations in written or recorded form yet—I should save them for the book—but I could lead people through them verbally. My excitement brimmed over, as this felt so deeply in line with my purpose.	The meditation wasn’t the only gift I received that night. They declared that this meditation would be included in a book of IFS-inspired guided imagery meditations that I would eventually publish. They went on to assure me that they will assist me every step of the way. I was instructed that I should not distribute the meditations in written or recorded form yet—I should save them for the book—but I could lead people through them verbally. My excitement brimmed over, as this felt so deeply in line with my purpose.	Медитация была не единственным подарком, который я получил в ту ночь. Они заявили, что эта медитация будет включена в книгу управляемых образных медитаций, вдохновленных IFS, которую я в конечном итоге опубликую. Они заверили меня, что будут помогать мне на каждом этапе пути. Меня проинструктировали, что мне пока не следует распространять медитации в письменной или записанной форме — мне следует сохранить их для книги, — но я могу вести людей через них устно. Мое волнение переполняло меня, поскольку это очень соответствовало моей цели.	The meditation wasn’t the only gift I received that night. They declared that this meditation would be included in a book of IFS-inspired guided imagery meditations that I would eventually publish. They went on to assure me that they will assist me every step of the way. I was instructed that I should not distribute the meditations in written or recorded form yet—I should save them for the book—but I could lead people through them verbally. My excitement brimmed over, as this felt so deeply in line with my purpose.
The Cabin with the Ancestor meditation went exceptionally well at the Summit. I shared with the group how my ancestors transported me in my dream state to the world where this meditation takes place and supported the transfer of the experience into the written word. The feedback I received included words like wonderful and amazing, and phrases like I felt so connected to my ancestors. It felt so real. I also got many comments expressing gratitude and appreciation for the meditation. One of the most meaningful compliments came when Dr. Richard Schwartz told me he had enjoyed it. “Be sure to remain connected to your ancestors,” he said. I was moved by three participants of the training reaching out to request a copy of the meditation, one saying she wanted to use it in an IFS training where she would discuss legacy burdens and the other two hoping to use it to continue the dialogue with their ancestors. Unfortunately, I had to say not yet to the distribution of the meditation; I wanted to honor my ancestors’ promise that it would become part of a book.	The Cabin with the Ancestor meditation went exceptionally well at the Summit. I shared with the group how my ancestors transported me in my dream state to the world where this meditation takes place and supported the transfer of the experience into the written word. The feedback I received included words like wonderful and amazing, and phrases like I felt so connected to my ancestors. It felt so real. I also got many comments expressing gratitude and appreciation for the meditation. One of the most meaningful compliments came when Dr. Richard Schwartz told me he had enjoyed it. “Be sure to remain connected to your ancestors,” he said. I was moved by three participants of the training reaching out to request a copy of the meditation, one saying she wanted to use it in an IFS training where she would discuss legacy burdens and the other two hoping to use it to continue the dialogue with their ancestors. Unfortunately, I had to say not yet to the distribution of the meditation; I wanted to honor my ancestors’ promise that it would become part of a book.	Медитация «Хижина с Предком» прошла на Саммите исключительно хорошо. Я рассказал группе, как мои предки перенесли меня в состоянии сна в мир, где происходит эта медитация, и поддержали передачу этого опыта в письменное слово. Отзывы, которые я получил, включали такие слова, как «чудесный» и «удивительный», а также фразы о том, что я чувствовал себя очень связанным со своими предками. Это было так реально. Я также получил много комментариев, выражающих благодарность и признательность за медитацию. Один из самых значимых комплиментов был сделан, когда доктор Ричард Шварц сказал мне, что ему это понравилось. «Обязательно сохраняйте связь со своими предками», — сказал он. Меня тронули три участницы тренинга, которые попросили копию медитации: одна сказала, что хочет использовать ее на тренинге IFS, где она будет обсуждать бремя наследия, а двое других надеялись использовать ее для продолжения диалога со своими предки. К сожалению, мне пришлось пока сказать не о распространении медитации; Я хотел выполнить обещание моих предков, что это станет частью книги.	The Cabin with the Ancestor meditation went exceptionally well at the Summit. I shared with the group how my ancestors transported me in my dream state to the world where this meditation takes place and supported the transfer of the experience into the written word. The feedback I received included words like wonderful and amazing, and phrases like I felt so connected to my ancestors. It felt so real. I also got many comments expressing gratitude and appreciation for the meditation. One of the most meaningful compliments came when Dr. Richard Schwartz told me he had enjoyed it. “Be sure to remain connected to your ancestors,” he said. I was moved by three participants of the training reaching out to request a copy of the meditation, one saying she wanted to use it in an IFS training where she would discuss legacy burdens and the other two hoping to use it to continue the dialogue with their ancestors. Unfortunately, I had to say not yet to the distribution of the meditation; I wanted to honor my ancestors’ promise that it would become part of a book.
The night after the success of the Cabin with the Ancestor meditation, my ancestors came to me in a dream proclaiming themselves my Writing Clan. They joined together to assist me in creating nine additional meditations, which you’ll find in this book. The Writing Clan came to me in times of rest, usually as I was falling asleep, in the twilight hours prior to waking, during my morning meditation, or as I sat simply being. In those times, as with the first meditation, I entered the world of the meditation with my ancestor guides. The meditation offerings continued for six months. Then, after delivering the meditation I call Labyrinth with the Elders, the Writing Clan went silent. However, I had several meditations already given me that I hadn’t transcribed from the notes I always jotted down at the end of the meditation session. Together with the Writing Clan, I completed the unfinished meditations. Although the Clan never explicitly told me we were complete, I knew it intuitively. These are the meditations that make up this book, along with three meditations that were created without the assistance of my ancestors: Qualities of Self, Be With, and Trailblazers.	The night after the success of the Cabin with the Ancestor meditation, my ancestors came to me in a dream proclaiming themselves my Writing Clan. They joined together to assist me in creating nine additional meditations, which you’ll find in this book. The Writing Clan came to me in times of rest, usually as I was falling asleep, in the twilight hours prior to waking, during my morning meditation, or as I sat simply being. In those times, as with the first meditation, I entered the world of the meditation with my ancestor guides. The meditation offerings continued for six months. Then, after delivering the meditation I call Labyrinth with the Elders, the Writing Clan went silent. However, I had several meditations already given me that I hadn’t transcribed from the notes I always jotted down at the end of the meditation session. Together with the Writing Clan, I completed the unfinished meditations. Although the Clan never explicitly told me we were complete, I knew it intuitively. These are the meditations that make up this book, along with three meditations that were created without the assistance of my ancestors: Qualities of Self, Be With, and Trailblazers.	В ночь после успеха Хижины с медитацией Предка мои предки пришли ко мне во сне и провозгласили себя моим Писающим Кланом. Они объединились, чтобы помочь мне создать девять дополнительных медитаций, которые вы найдете в этой книге. Клан Писателей приходил ко мне во время отдыха, обычно когда я засыпал, в сумеречные часы перед пробуждением, во время утренней медитации или когда я просто сидел. В те времена, как и во время первой медитации, я вошел в мир медитации вместе со своими наставниками-предками. Подношения медитации продолжались шесть месяцев. Затем, после проведения медитации, которую я называю Лабиринтом со Старейшинами, Клан Писателей замолчал. Однако у меня уже было несколько медитаций, которые я не расшифровал из заметок, которые я всегда записывал в конце сеанса медитации. Вместе с Кланом Писателей я завершил незавершенные медитации. Хотя Клан никогда прямо не говорил мне, что мы завершены, я знал это интуитивно. Именно эти медитации составляют эту книгу, а также три медитации, созданные без помощи моих предков: «Качества себя», «Быть ​​с» и «Первопроходцы».	The night after the success of the Cabin with the Ancestor meditation, my ancestors came to me in a dream proclaiming themselves my Writing Clan. They joined together to assist me in creating nine additional meditations, which you’ll find in this book. The Writing Clan came to me in times of rest, usually as I was falling asleep, in the twilight hours prior to waking, during my morning meditation, or as I sat simply being. In those times, as with the first meditation, I entered the world of the meditation with my ancestor guides. The meditation offerings continued for six months. Then, after delivering the meditation I call Labyrinth with the Elders, the Writing Clan went silent. However, I had several meditations already given me that I hadn’t transcribed from the notes I always jotted down at the end of the meditation session. Together with the Writing Clan, I completed the unfinished meditations. Although the Clan never explicitly told me we were complete, I knew it intuitively. These are the meditations that make up this book, along with three meditations that were created without the assistance of my ancestors: Qualities of Self, Be With, and Trailblazers.
My dancing ancestor reappeared in my dream that night too. She came to show me that she had started taking my speaking voice as a therapist away to replace it with my written voice, and that I would use my hands in this effort in the same way my ancestors did as quilters, tillers of soil, cultivators of gardens, and crafters of things to sell. The magnificence of this dream is that it showed scenes from the past when I had lost my voice and the ways I would use my written voice in the future. Like a movie, I saw myself in various stages of writing a book, longhand with paper and pen, typing on a laptop, researching, and reading source material. In juxtaposition, my ancestors were displayed across the screen using their hands to create, which clarified the connection between the use of my hands and theirs for creation. I feel a deep kinship with the ancestors of my mother’s mother’s line, women I never knew personally but know intimately by their significant influence in my life. The dance that night was one of celebration and prayer for my acceptance of the meditations and willingness to transform into a written-word healer.	My dancing ancestor reappeared in my dream that night too. She came to show me that she had started taking my speaking voice as a therapist away to replace it with my written voice, and that I would use my hands in this effort in the same way my ancestors did as quilters, tillers of soil, cultivators of gardens, and crafters of things to sell. The magnificence of this dream is that it showed scenes from the past when I had lost my voice and the ways I would use my written voice in the future. Like a movie, I saw myself in various stages of writing a book, longhand with paper and pen, typing on a laptop, researching, and reading source material. In juxtaposition, my ancestors were displayed across the screen using their hands to create, which clarified the connection between the use of my hands and theirs for creation. I feel a deep kinship with the ancestors of my mother’s mother’s line, women I never knew personally but know intimately by their significant influence in my life. The dance that night was one of celebration and prayer for my acceptance of the meditations and willingness to transform into a written-word healer.	Той ночью мой танцующий предок снова появился во сне. Она пришла, чтобы показать мне, что она начала забирать мой разговорный голос как терапевт, чтобы заменить его письменным голосом, и что я буду использовать свои руки в этом усилии так же, как мои предки, работая стегальщиками, земледельцами, земледельцами. садов и мастеров вещей на продажу. Великолепие этого сна в том, что он показал сцены из прошлого, когда я потерял голос, и то, как я буду использовать свой письменный голос в будущем. Как в кино, я видел себя на разных этапах написания книги, от руки с бумагой и ручкой, печатания на ноутбуке, исследования и чтения исходных материалов. Напротив, мои предки были показаны на экране, используя свои руки для творчества, что прояснило связь между использованием моих и их рук для творчества. Я чувствую глубокое родство с предками по материнской линии моей матери, женщинами, которых я никогда не знал лично, но знаю близко по их значительному влиянию на мою жизнь. Танец в тот вечер был празднованием и молитвой за мое согласие с медитациями и желание превратиться в письменного целителя.	My dancing ancestor reappeared in my dream that night too. She came to show me that she had started taking my speaking voice as a therapist away to replace it with my written voice, and that I would use my hands in this effort in the same way my ancestors did as quilters, tillers of soil, cultivators of gardens, and crafters of things to sell. The magnificence of this dream is that it showed scenes from the past when I had lost my voice and the ways I would use my written voice in the future. Like a movie, I saw myself in various stages of writing a book, longhand with paper and pen, typing on a laptop, researching, and reading source material. In juxtaposition, my ancestors were displayed across the screen using their hands to create, which clarified the connection between the use of my hands and theirs for creation. I feel a deep kinship with the ancestors of my mother’s mother’s line, women I never knew personally but know intimately by their significant influence in my life. The dance that night was one of celebration and prayer for my acceptance of the meditations and willingness to transform into a written-word healer.
FOLLOWING ANCESTOR INSPIRATIONS	FOLLOWING ANCESTOR INSPIRATIONS	ПО ВДОХНОВЕНИЮ ПРЕДКОВ	FOLLOWING ANCESTOR INSPIRATIONS
I want to speak to the importance of adhering to ancestor inspirations. After sharing the Cabin with the Ancestor meditation at the Summit, I went on to share it in IFS Level 1 trainings as I advanced from program assistant to solo lead trainer. Many people who experienced it suggested that I make the meditations available in an audio recording. I had offers of help and suggestions of quick ways to create the audio. I jumped into the project fully.	I want to speak to the importance of adhering to ancestor inspirations. After sharing the Cabin with the Ancestor meditation at the Summit, I went on to share it in IFS Level 1 trainings as I advanced from program assistant to solo lead trainer. Many people who experienced it suggested that I make the meditations available in an audio recording. I had offers of help and suggestions of quick ways to create the audio. I jumped into the project fully.	Я хочу поговорить о важности следования вдохновению предков. После того, как я поделился Хитиной с медитацией Предка на Саммите, я продолжил делиться ею на тренингах IFS Уровня 1, пройдя путь от ассистента программы до индивидуального ведущего тренера. Многие люди, пережившие это, предлагали мне сделать медитации доступными в аудиозаписи. Мне предлагали помощь и предлагали быстрые способы создания аудио. Я полностью погрузился в проект.	I want to speak to the importance of adhering to ancestor inspirations. After sharing the Cabin with the Ancestor meditation at the Summit, I went on to share it in IFS Level 1 trainings as I advanced from program assistant to solo lead trainer. Many people who experienced it suggested that I make the meditations available in an audio recording. I had offers of help and suggestions of quick ways to create the audio. I jumped into the project fully.
A consulting client of mine who was a partner in a publishing enterprise wanted to bring me on as an author. I shared my desire to create an audio of the meditations, and she was enthusiastic. I submitted a proposal, but the process stalled multiple times. About six months in I was still without a contract. Finally, my client came to me with the news that she had left the publishing company partnership due to irreconcilable differences. She told me she still believed in the project and offered to pass it on to an editor at Hay House. She made no promises, but she wished me success.	A consulting client of mine who was a partner in a publishing enterprise wanted to bring me on as an author. I shared my desire to create an audio of the meditations, and she was enthusiastic. I submitted a proposal, but the process stalled multiple times. About six months in I was still without a contract. Finally, my client came to me with the news that she had left the publishing company partnership due to irreconcilable differences. She told me she still believed in the project and offered to pass it on to an editor at Hay House. She made no promises, but she wished me success.	Мой клиент-консультант, который был партнером издательского предприятия, хотел привлечь меня в качестве автора. Я поделился своим желанием записать медитации на аудио, и она была полна энтузиазма. Я подал предложение, но процесс несколько раз останавливался. Около полугода я все еще был без контракта. Наконец, моя клиентка пришла ко мне с известием о том, что она вышла из партнерства издательства из-за непримиримых разногласий. Она сказала мне, что все еще верит в этот проект, и предложила передать его редактору Hay House. Она ничего не обещала, но пожелала мне успехов.	A consulting client of mine who was a partner in a publishing enterprise wanted to bring me on as an author. I shared my desire to create an audio of the meditations, and she was enthusiastic. I submitted a proposal, but the process stalled multiple times. About six months in I was still without a contract. Finally, my client came to me with the news that she had left the publishing company partnership due to irreconcilable differences. She told me she still believed in the project and offered to pass it on to an editor at Hay House. She made no promises, but she wished me success.
I had a Zoom call with an acquisitions editor at Hay House in September. The editor acknowledged my desire to create an audio but asked if I would consider writing a book instead. I was surprised by this reminder; I had pursued the vision of creating an audio so vigorously that I had lost sight of my ancestors’ promise that there would be a book. I said yes, I was definitely interested in writing a book, and immediately started working on a book proposal.	I had a Zoom call with an acquisitions editor at Hay House in September. The editor acknowledged my desire to create an audio but asked if I would consider writing a book instead. I was surprised by this reminder; I had pursued the vision of creating an audio so vigorously that I had lost sight of my ancestors’ promise that there would be a book. I said yes, I was definitely interested in writing a book, and immediately started working on a book proposal.	В сентябре у меня был звонок через Zoom с редактором отдела закупок Hay House. Редактор признал мое желание создать аудио, но спросил, не рассмотрю ли я вместо этого возможность написать книгу. Меня удивило это напоминание; Я так энергично преследовал идею создания аудио, что упустил из виду обещание моих предков о том, что будет книга. Я сказал да, мне определенно интересно написать книгу, и сразу же начал работать над предложением книги.	I had a Zoom call with an acquisitions editor at Hay House in September. The editor acknowledged my desire to create an audio but asked if I would consider writing a book instead. I was surprised by this reminder; I had pursued the vision of creating an audio so vigorously that I had lost sight of my ancestors’ promise that there would be a book. I said yes, I was definitely interested in writing a book, and immediately started working on a book proposal.
I had followed the audio path because it was what people in the IFS community were requesting. But I didn’t hear from the Writing Clan once while I was pursuing the project in audio form. Now my ancestors returned after a year of silence in honor of their word to support my writing process, and together we created a proposal I felt proud of. I pressed Send on the e-mail to the editor on October 12, and 20 days later, I got an e-mail with a subject line that read, “Hay House Offer.” At the time, I was on a transatlantic crossing from London back to the United States. I couldn’t think of a more beautiful place and time to receive the news.	I had followed the audio path because it was what people in the IFS community were requesting. But I didn’t hear from the Writing Clan once while I was pursuing the project in audio form. Now my ancestors returned after a year of silence in honor of their word to support my writing process, and together we created a proposal I felt proud of. I pressed Send on the e-mail to the editor on October 12, and 20 days later, I got an e-mail with a subject line that read, “Hay House Offer.” At the time, I was on a transatlantic crossing from London back to the United States. I couldn’t think of a more beautiful place and time to receive the news.	Я пошел по аудиопути, потому что это было то, что просили люди в сообществе IFS. Но я ни разу не услышал от Писательного клана, пока работал над проектом в аудиоформате. Теперь мои предки вернулись после года молчания в честь своего слова поддержать мой писательский процесс, и вместе мы создали предложение, которым я горжусь. Я нажал «Отправить» в электронном письме редактору от 12 октября, а 20 дней спустя я получил электронное письмо с темой «Предложение Hay House». В то время я совершал трансатлантический переход из Лондона обратно в Соединенные Штаты. Я не мог придумать более красивого места и времени, чтобы получить новости.	I had followed the audio path because it was what people in the IFS community were requesting. But I didn’t hear from the Writing Clan once while I was pursuing the project in audio form. Now my ancestors returned after a year of silence in honor of their word to support my writing process, and together we created a proposal I felt proud of. I pressed Send on the e-mail to the editor on October 12, and 20 days later, I got an e-mail with a subject line that read, “Hay House Offer.” At the time, I was on a transatlantic crossing from London back to the United States. I couldn’t think of a more beautiful place and time to receive the news.
I share this part of my journey to illuminate the difference between being on purpose with the inspiration of ancestors and acting in my own strength. When I pursued a quick way to get the meditations published that met the needs of my beloved IFS community, the project was stalled with no forward movement and ultimately aborted six months later. When I was in alignment with the inspiration of my ancestors, the first step of their promise of a book was realized in a mere four months after my work first came to the attention of Hay House.	I share this part of my journey to illuminate the difference between being on purpose with the inspiration of ancestors and acting in my own strength. When I pursued a quick way to get the meditations published that met the needs of my beloved IFS community, the project was stalled with no forward movement and ultimately aborted six months later. When I was in alignment with the inspiration of my ancestors, the first step of their promise of a book was realized in a mere four months after my work first came to the attention of Hay House.	Я делюсь этой частью своего пути, чтобы осветить разницу между намерением действовать по вдохновению предков и действовать собственными силами. Когда я искал быстрый способ опубликовать медитации, отвечающие потребностям моего любимого сообщества IFS, проект застопорился без какого-либо продвижения вперед и в конечном итоге был прерван шесть месяцев спустя. Когда я следовал вдохновению своих предков, первый шаг их обещания создать книгу был реализован всего за четыре месяца после того, как моя работа впервые попала в поле зрения Hay House.	I share this part of my journey to illuminate the difference between being on purpose with the inspiration of ancestors and acting in my own strength. When I pursued a quick way to get the meditations published that met the needs of my beloved IFS community, the project was stalled with no forward movement and ultimately aborted six months later. When I was in alignment with the inspiration of my ancestors, the first step of their promise of a book was realized in a mere four months after my work first came to the attention of Hay House.
The work of ancestral healing and connection is not magic, although it can feel and appear that way. I liken it to my relationship with my children. As a mom, I worked to meet most of my kids’ needs and many of their wants. They did not have to worry about where food, water, electricity, clothes, etc., would come from or if they would come. My husband and I provided for them out of love, responsibility, and care. Our ancestors are the same way. As an attuned parent, I anticipate or see a need and respond; when we connect with our ancestors, they do the same. They love and care about us and what we care about. They support us in cultivating the gifts of our ancestral lines. Just as my ancestors were waiting to connect and assist, yours are too.	The work of ancestral healing and connection is not magic, although it can feel and appear that way. I liken it to my relationship with my children. As a mom, I worked to meet most of my kids’ needs and many of their wants. They did not have to worry about where food, water, electricity, clothes, etc., would come from or if they would come. My husband and I provided for them out of love, responsibility, and care. Our ancestors are the same way. As an attuned parent, I anticipate or see a need and respond; when we connect with our ancestors, they do the same. They love and care about us and what we care about. They support us in cultivating the gifts of our ancestral lines. Just as my ancestors were waiting to connect and assist, yours are too.	Работа по исцелению предков и установлению связи не является магией, хотя она может так ощущаться и выглядеть. Я сравниваю это с моими отношениями с детьми. Как мама, я работала, чтобы удовлетворить большинство потребностей моих детей и многие их желания. Им не нужно было беспокоиться о том, откуда возьмут еду, воду, электричество, одежду и т. д. и придут ли они. Мы с мужем обеспечивали их из любви, ответственности и заботы. Наши предки такие же. Как настроенный родитель, я предчувствую или вижу потребность и реагирую; когда мы связываемся с нашими предками, они делают то же самое. Они любят и заботятся о нас и о том, что нам важно. Они поддерживают нас в развитии даров наших предков. Точно так же, как мои предки ждали возможности связаться и помочь, ваши тоже.	The work of ancestral healing and connection is not magic, although it can feel and appear that way. I liken it to my relationship with my children. As a mom, I worked to meet most of my kids’ needs and many of their wants. They did not have to worry about where food, water, electricity, clothes, etc., would come from or if they would come. My husband and I provided for them out of love, responsibility, and care. Our ancestors are the same way. As an attuned parent, I anticipate or see a need and respond; when we connect with our ancestors, they do the same. They love and care about us and what we care about. They support us in cultivating the gifts of our ancestral lines. Just as my ancestors were waiting to connect and assist, yours are too.
What I hope to offer you through the reading of this book is a return to the sacredness of your essential Self to affirm those parts of yourself you had to hide to gain acceptance, love, and care. I hope that through this work you grow to courageously and unapologetically express the whole of who you are. The healing I hope for you will come through the relationships you build with your parts and ancestors. Through the principles, exercises, tools, and meditations, you will learn your internal system. This includes building a trusting relationship with your parts, which will decrease their extreme behaviors and help you discover that you can heal them. I also hope to increase your access to Self by inviting your ancestors into your healing work with you.	What I hope to offer you through the reading of this book is a return to the sacredness of your essential Self to affirm those parts of yourself you had to hide to gain acceptance, love, and care. I hope that through this work you grow to courageously and unapologetically express the whole of who you are. The healing I hope for you will come through the relationships you build with your parts and ancestors. Through the principles, exercises, tools, and meditations, you will learn your internal system. This includes building a trusting relationship with your parts, which will decrease their extreme behaviors and help you discover that you can heal them. I also hope to increase your access to Self by inviting your ancestors into your healing work with you.	Читая эту книгу, я надеюсь предложить вам возвращение к святости вашего сущностного «Я», чтобы утвердить те части себя, которые вам приходилось скрывать, чтобы получить признание, любовь и заботу. Я надеюсь, что благодаря этой работе вы научитесь смело и без извинений выражать всю свою сущность. Исцеление, которое, я надеюсь, придет к вам через отношения, которые вы строите со своими частями тела и предками. С помощью принципов, упражнений, инструментов и медитаций вы изучите свою внутреннюю систему. Это включает в себя построение доверительных отношений со своими частями тела, что уменьшит их экстремальное поведение и поможет вам обнаружить, что вы можете их исцелить. Я также надеюсь расширить ваш доступ к Самости, приглашая ваших предков участвовать в вашей целительской работе вместе с вами.	What I hope to offer you through the reading of this book is a return to the sacredness of your essential Self to affirm those parts of yourself you had to hide to gain acceptance, love, and care. I hope that through this work you grow to courageously and unapologetically express the whole of who you are. The healing I hope for you will come through the relationships you build with your parts and ancestors. Through the principles, exercises, tools, and meditations, you will learn your internal system. This includes building a trusting relationship with your parts, which will decrease their extreme behaviors and help you discover that you can heal them. I also hope to increase your access to Self by inviting your ancestors into your healing work with you.
SIX ASSUMPTIONS	SIX ASSUMPTIONS	ШЕСТЬ ПРЕДПОЛОЖЕНИЙ	SIX ASSUMPTIONS
Richard Schwartz’s work on IFS identifies six assumptions that are foundational to the work we’ll do together in this book.6 As you work with your parts, hold each of these assumptions as truth. It will help support you as you get to know your parts.	Richard Schwartz’s work on IFS identifies six assumptions that are foundational to the work we’ll do together in this book.6 As you work with your parts, hold each of these assumptions as truth. It will help support you as you get to know your parts.	В работе Ричарда Шварца над IFS выделены шесть предположений, которые лежат в основе нашей совместной работы в этой книге.6 Работая над своими частями, воспринимайте каждое из этих предположений как истину. Это поможет вам, когда вы познакомитесь со своими деталями.	Richard Schwartz’s work on IFS identifies six assumptions that are foundational to the work we’ll do together in this book.6 As you work with your parts, hold each of these assumptions as truth. It will help support you as you get to know your parts.
Assumption 1: We all have parts	Assumption 1: We all have parts	Предположение 1: У всех нас есть части	Assumption 1: We all have parts
The model asserts that we all have parts. I have parts. You have parts. Even if we aren’t aware of them, we still have parts. Have you ever had the experience of being of two minds or more on a topic or situation? For example, with the possibility of a job promotion, you may hear a voice say, “You’re not qualified; you’re not ready.” And another says, “You’ve worked hard and earned this.” One part will tell you, show you, and even provide examples from your past about how qualified you are and what you’ve done to prepare for the promotion. While another part will have a strong stance that you will fail if you take the promotion, and it, too, will give reasons from your past and/or unforeseen future dangers to support why you are not ready. This is an example of how parts may show themselves within your internal system.	The model asserts that we all have parts. I have parts. You have parts. Even if we aren’t aware of them, we still have parts. Have you ever had the experience of being of two minds or more on a topic or situation? For example, with the possibility of a job promotion, you may hear a voice say, “You’re not qualified; you’re not ready.” And another says, “You’ve worked hard and earned this.” One part will tell you, show you, and even provide examples from your past about how qualified you are and what you’ve done to prepare for the promotion. While another part will have a strong stance that you will fail if you take the promotion, and it, too, will give reasons from your past and/or unforeseen future dangers to support why you are not ready. This is an example of how parts may show themselves within your internal system.	Модель утверждает, что у всех нас есть части. У меня есть запчасти. У вас есть части. Даже если мы о них не знаем, у нас все равно есть части. Был ли у вас когда-нибудь опыт раздвоения или более мнений по поводу какой-либо темы или ситуации? Например, при возможности продвижения по службе вы можете услышать голос: «Вы недостаточно квалифицированы; ты не готов». А другой говорит: «Вы много работали и заслужили это». Одна часть расскажет вам, покажет и даже приведет примеры из вашего прошлого о том, насколько вы квалифицированы и что вы сделали для подготовки к повышению. В то время как другая часть будет твердо убеждена, что вы потерпите неудачу, если пойдете на повышение, и она также будет приводить причины из вашего прошлого и/или непредвиденных будущих опасностей, подтверждающие, почему вы не готовы. Это пример того, как детали могут проявлять себя внутри вашей внутренней системы.	The model asserts that we all have parts. I have parts. You have parts. Even if we aren’t aware of them, we still have parts. Have you ever had the experience of being of two minds or more on a topic or situation? For example, with the possibility of a job promotion, you may hear a voice say, “You’re not qualified; you’re not ready.” And another says, “You’ve worked hard and earned this.” One part will tell you, show you, and even provide examples from your past about how qualified you are and what you’ve done to prepare for the promotion. While another part will have a strong stance that you will fail if you take the promotion, and it, too, will give reasons from your past and/or unforeseen future dangers to support why you are not ready. This is an example of how parts may show themselves within your internal system.
Assumption 2: Parts are forced into extreme roles	Assumption 2: Parts are forced into extreme roles	Предположение 2: Детали вынуждены играть крайние роли.	Assumption 2: Parts are forced into extreme roles
Parts have been forced into unnatural roles due to attachment wounds and/or trauma. Gina Ryder, an educator and journalist, defines the origin of attachment trauma as “a rupture in the bonding process between a child and their primary caregiver.”7 When our needs are not understood or met as children, or we experience abuse and/or trauma, parts take on extreme roles to protect us from the pain we previously experienced. Our parts may be activated with even the slightest provocation. If a situation is the least bit like the original one, parts will respond with intensity as if they are protecting us from the initial pain. Parts can express themselves extremely through emotions, such as rage or sadness, somatically through migraine headaches or nausea, with images in vivid dreams or horrifying nightmares or through beliefs like “I’m not good enough.”	Parts have been forced into unnatural roles due to attachment wounds and/or trauma. Gina Ryder, an educator and journalist, defines the origin of attachment trauma as “a rupture in the bonding process between a child and their primary caregiver.”7 When our needs are not understood or met as children, or we experience abuse and/or trauma, parts take on extreme roles to protect us from the pain we previously experienced. Our parts may be activated with even the slightest provocation. If a situation is the least bit like the original one, parts will respond with intensity as if they are protecting us from the initial pain. Parts can express themselves extremely through emotions, such as rage or sadness, somatically through migraine headaches or nausea, with images in vivid dreams or horrifying nightmares or through beliefs like “I’m not good enough.”	Детали были вынуждены играть неестественную роль из-за прикрепленных ран и/или травм. Джина Райдер, педагог и журналист, определяет причину травмы привязанности как «разрыв в процессе установления связи между ребенком и его основным опекуном». В результате травмы части берут на себя экстремальную роль, защищая нас от боли, которую мы испытывали ранее. Наши части могут быть активированы даже при малейшей провокации. Если ситуация хотя бы немного похожа на исходную, части будут реагировать интенсивно, как будто они защищают нас от первоначальной боли. Части могут выражать себя исключительно через эмоции, такие как ярость или печаль, соматически через мигрень или тошноту, с помощью образов в ярких снах или ужасающих кошмарах или через убеждения типа «Я недостаточно хорош».	Parts have been forced into unnatural roles due to attachment wounds and/or trauma. Gina Ryder, an educator and journalist, defines the origin of attachment trauma as “a rupture in the bonding process between a child and their primary caregiver.”7 When our needs are not understood or met as children, or we experience abuse and/or trauma, parts take on extreme roles to protect us from the pain we previously experienced. Our parts may be activated with even the slightest provocation. If a situation is the least bit like the original one, parts will respond with intensity as if they are protecting us from the initial pain. Parts can express themselves extremely through emotions, such as rage or sadness, somatically through migraine headaches or nausea, with images in vivid dreams or horrifying nightmares or through beliefs like “I’m not good enough.”
Assumption 3: All parts are welcome	Assumption 3: All parts are welcome	Предположение 3: Все части приветствуются	Assumption 3: All parts are welcome
Are all parts welcome? What about parts that hurt people or do bad things? IFS holds that all parts are welcome within an internal system that chooses to understand and get to know each of the parts. It is only through relationship with our parts that we can welcome them. Relationship builds trust. As trust deepens, our parts will share their experiences with us. We welcome our parts by being with them and validating their experiences as they share who they are. We say there are no bad parts. But parts do engage poor strategies to get their needs met.	Are all parts welcome? What about parts that hurt people or do bad things? IFS holds that all parts are welcome within an internal system that chooses to understand and get to know each of the parts. It is only through relationship with our parts that we can welcome them. Relationship builds trust. As trust deepens, our parts will share their experiences with us. We welcome our parts by being with them and validating their experiences as they share who they are. We say there are no bad parts. But parts do engage poor strategies to get their needs met.	Все части приветствуются? А как насчет частей, которые причиняют вред людям или делают плохие вещи? IFS считает, что все части приветствуются внутри внутренней системы, которая решает понять и изучить каждую из частей. Только через отношения со своими частями мы можем приветствовать их. Отношения создают доверие. По мере углубления доверия наши части будут делиться с нами своим опытом. Мы приветствуем наши части, находясь с ними и подтверждая их опыт, когда они делятся тем, кем они являются. Мы говорим, что нет плохих деталей. Но части действительно используют плохие стратегии для удовлетворения своих потребностей.	Are all parts welcome? What about parts that hurt people or do bad things? IFS holds that all parts are welcome within an internal system that chooses to understand and get to know each of the parts. It is only through relationship with our parts that we can welcome them. Relationship builds trust. As trust deepens, our parts will share their experiences with us. We welcome our parts by being with them and validating their experiences as they share who they are. We say there are no bad parts. But parts do engage poor strategies to get their needs met.
Assumption 4: We all have a Self	Assumption 4: We all have a Self	Предположение 4: У каждого из нас есть «Я»	Assumption 4: We all have a Self
Self is the core or essence of a person. Self is also called the Soul, the Seat of Consciousness, and Prana. Like parts, we all have a Self. It is the intuitive, wise, healing energy we all possess.	Self is the core or essence of a person. Self is also called the Soul, the Seat of Consciousness, and Prana. Like parts, we all have a Self. It is the intuitive, wise, healing energy we all possess.	Я – это ядро ​​или сущность человека. «Я» также называют Душой, Местом Сознания и Праной. Как и части, у всех нас есть «Я». Это интуитивная, мудрая, целительная энергия, которой мы все обладаем.	Self is the core or essence of a person. Self is also called the Soul, the Seat of Consciousness, and Prana. Like parts, we all have a Self. It is the intuitive, wise, healing energy we all possess.
Assumption 5: Parts carry burdens	Assumption 5: Parts carry burdens	Допущение 5: Детали несут нагрузку	Assumption 5: Parts carry burdens
Burdens are emotions, beliefs, and thoughts that affect how parts view themselves, others, and the world, and impact their interactions. Parts are not their burdens; they carry burdens. The extreme roles parts take on are their burdens. Instead of referring to a part as “The Rager,” which makes the part the burden, we want to say, a part that has, expresses, feels, or carries rage. This allows for separation between the part and its emotions or actions.	Burdens are emotions, beliefs, and thoughts that affect how parts view themselves, others, and the world, and impact their interactions. Parts are not their burdens; they carry burdens. The extreme roles parts take on are their burdens. Instead of referring to a part as “The Rager,” which makes the part the burden, we want to say, a part that has, expresses, feels, or carries rage. This allows for separation between the part and its emotions or actions.	Бремя — это эмоции, убеждения и мысли, которые влияют на то, как части воспринимают себя, других и мир, а также влияют на их взаимодействие. Части не являются их бременем; они несут бремя. Крайние роли, которые берут на себя части, — это их бремя. Вместо того, чтобы называть часть «Яростной», что делает ее бременем, мы хотим сказать, что это часть, которая испытывает, выражает, чувствует или несет ярость. Это позволяет разделить часть и ее эмоции или действия.	Burdens are emotions, beliefs, and thoughts that affect how parts view themselves, others, and the world, and impact their interactions. Parts are not their burdens; they carry burdens. The extreme roles parts take on are their burdens. Instead of referring to a part as “The Rager,” which makes the part the burden, we want to say, a part that has, expresses, feels, or carries rage. This allows for separation between the part and its emotions or actions.
Assumption 6: Parts are well-intentioned	Assumption 6: Parts are well-intentioned	Предположение 6: Части созданы из лучших побуждений	Assumption 6: Parts are well-intentioned
We must always remember that regardless of how parts behave, they are always well-intentioned. Our job is to connect with our parts and get to know them to understand their intentions. Even parts who cause problems and difficulties in our lives have the best intentions. Parts do what they do because they are not aware of their impact or alternatives. They often believe that if they stop, something bad will happen to us or someone important to us.	We must always remember that regardless of how parts behave, they are always well-intentioned. Our job is to connect with our parts and get to know them to understand their intentions. Even parts who cause problems and difficulties in our lives have the best intentions. Parts do what they do because they are not aware of their impact or alternatives. They often believe that if they stop, something bad will happen to us or someone important to us.	Мы всегда должны помнить, что независимо от того, как ведут себя части, они всегда действуют из лучших побуждений. Наша задача — установить связь с нашими частями и узнать их, чтобы понять их намерения. Даже те части, которые вызывают проблемы и трудности в нашей жизни, имеют самые благие намерения. Части делают то, что делают, потому что не осознают своего влияния или альтернатив. Они часто верят, что если остановятся, с нами или с кем-то важным для нас произойдет что-то плохое.	We must always remember that regardless of how parts behave, they are always well-intentioned. Our job is to connect with our parts and get to know them to understand their intentions. Even parts who cause problems and difficulties in our lives have the best intentions. Parts do what they do because they are not aware of their impact or alternatives. They often believe that if they stop, something bad will happen to us or someone important to us.
HOW TO USE THIS BOOK	HOW TO USE THIS BOOK	КАК ПОЛЬЗОВАТЬСЯ ЭТОЙ КНИГОЙ	HOW TO USE THIS BOOK
