While doing my own IFS therapy and working with my exiles, my ancestors allowed me to connect more fully with one of my exiles through this meditation.	Медитация «Луг» — третья, данная мне моими предками. Когда я проходил IFS-терапию и работал со своими изгнанниками, мои предки позволили мне более полно соединиться с одним из моих изгнанников посредством этой медитации.	The Meadow meditation is the third given to me by my ancestors. While doing my own IFS therapy and working with my exiles, my ancestors allowed me to connect more fully with one of my exiles through this meditation.
This meditation allows you to meet and get to know a new exile or deepen a connection with one you’ve met before.	This meditation allows you to meet and get to know a new exile or deepen a connection with one you’ve met before.	Эта медитация позволяет вам встретиться и узнать нового изгнанника или углубить связь с тем, кого вы встречали раньше.	This meditation allows you to meet and get to know a new exile or deepen a connection with one you’ve met before.
Close your eyes or soften your gaze.	Close your eyes or soften your gaze.	Закройте глаза или смягчите взгляд.	Close your eyes or soften your gaze.
Adjust your body until it settles.	Adjust your body until it settles.	Регулируйте свое тело, пока оно не успокоится.	Adjust your body until it settles.
Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.	Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.	Перенесите свое осознание на свое дыхание и просто дышите.	Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.
As you go inside, notice the pause at the end of each inhale and exhale. Right before the next inhale or exhale, there’s a space. Pause at that space.	As you go inside, notice the pause at the end of each inhale and exhale. Right before the next inhale or exhale, there’s a space. Pause at that space.	Заходя внутрь, обратите внимание на паузу в конце каждого вдоха и выдоха. Прямо перед следующим вдохом или выдохом есть пространство. Сделайте паузу в этом месте.	As you go inside, notice the pause at the end of each inhale and exhale. Right before the next inhale or exhale, there’s a space. Pause at that space.
Follow your breath through your body several times, noticing the pause.	Follow your breath through your body several times, noticing the pause.	Несколько раз проследите за дыханием по всему телу, замечая паузу.	Follow your breath through your body several times, noticing the pause.
Find yourself in a sunlit meadow with all the scents of spring in the air.	Find yourself in a sunlit meadow with all the scents of spring in the air.	Окажитесь на залитой солнцем поляне, в воздухе витают ароматы весны.	Find yourself in a sunlit meadow with all the scents of spring in the air.
The tall grass waves in the wind.	The tall grass waves in the wind.	Высокая трава колышется на ветру.	The tall grass waves in the wind.
The sun is warm on your face.	The sun is warm on your face.	Солнце греет твое лицо.	The sun is warm on your face.
And you notice a cool breeze.	And you notice a cool breeze.	И вы замечаете прохладный ветерок.	And you notice a cool breeze.
Walking in the warmth, you see a small child sitting on a patch of grass with their back to you.	Walking in the warmth, you see a small child sitting on a patch of grass with their back to you.	Прогуливаясь по теплу, вы видите маленького ребенка, сидящего на травке спиной к вам.	Walking in the warmth, you see a small child sitting on a patch of grass with their back to you.
As you walk closer, you recognize the child as a younger you.	As you walk closer, you recognize the child as a younger you.	Подойдя ближе, вы узнаете в ребенке себя младше.	As you walk closer, you recognize the child as a younger you.
You sense the child’s emotions and get as close as the child will allow.	You sense the child’s emotions and get as close as the child will allow.	Вы чувствуете эмоции ребенка и подходите настолько близко, насколько ребенок позволяет.	You sense the child’s emotions and get as close as the child will allow.
What do you notice about the younger you?	What do you notice about the younger you?	Что вы замечаете в молодости?	What do you notice about the younger you?
How do you feel toward them?	How do you feel toward them?	Как вы к ним относитесь?	How do you feel toward them?
If those feelings are open and/or positive, send the energy of those feelings to your younger self.	If those feelings are open and/or positive, send the energy of those feelings to your younger self.	Если эти чувства открыты и/или позитивны, пошлите энергию этих чувств своему молодому «я».	If those feelings are open and/or positive, send the energy of those feelings to your younger self.
If the feelings are not warm or positive, see if the parts with those feelings will step back and allow you to be with your younger self. If they will not step back, explore their concerns and/or fears.	If the feelings are not warm or positive, see if the parts with those feelings will step back and allow you to be with your younger self. If they will not step back, explore their concerns and/or fears.	Если чувства не теплые и не позитивные, посмотрите, отойдут ли части с этими чувствами и позволят ли вам побыть с самим собой в молодости. Если они не отступят, изучите их опасения и/или страхи.	If the feelings are not warm or positive, see if the parts with those feelings will step back and allow you to be with your younger self. If they will not step back, explore their concerns and/or fears.
As you send your younger self the positive energy, see if they will allow you to come closer.	As you send your younger self the positive energy, see if they will allow you to come closer.	Посылая себе положительную энергию, посмотрите, позволят ли они вам подойти ближе.	As you send your younger self the positive energy, see if they will allow you to come closer.
Be with your younger self in whatever way they need you to be there.	Be with your younger self in whatever way they need you to be there.	Будьте со своим младшим «я» так, как им нужно, чтобы вы были рядом.	Be with your younger self in whatever way they need you to be there.
If they want to talk, listen.	If they want to talk, listen.	Если они хотят поговорить, послушайте.	If they want to talk, listen.
If they want to be held, hold them.	If they want to be held, hold them.	Если они хотят, чтобы их держали, держите их.	If they want to be held, hold them.
If they want to play, play with them, or watch them play.	If they want to play, play with them, or watch them play.	Если они хотят играть, играйте с ними или смотрите, как они играют.	If they want to play, play with them, or watch them play.
Whatever they need, be there for them.	Whatever they need, be there for them.	Независимо от того, что им нужно, будьте рядом с ними.	Whatever they need, be there for them.
Ask your younger self if there’s more they need from you.	Ask your younger self if there’s more they need from you.	Спросите себя, молодого, нужно ли им от вас еще что-то.	Ask your younger self if there’s more they need from you.
Continue your time in the meadow together in whatever way your younger self needs.	Continue your time in the meadow together in whatever way your younger self needs.	Продолжайте проводить время вместе на лугу так, как нужно вашему младшему.	Continue your time in the meadow together in whatever way your younger self needs.
Now that you’re connected, let your younger self know they always have you.	Now that you’re connected, let your younger self know they always have you.	Теперь, когда вы на связи, дайте знать своему молодому «я», что вы всегда рядом.	Now that you’re connected, let your younger self know they always have you.
See if there’s anything more either of you want to share with the other before it’s time to go.	See if there’s anything more either of you want to share with the other before it’s time to go.	Посмотрите, есть ли что-нибудь еще, чем вы хотите поделиться с другим, прежде чем придет время идти.	See if there’s anything more either of you want to share with the other before it’s time to go.
See if there’s a place your younger self would like to stay until the two of you connect again. If so, take your younger self to that place.	See if there’s a place your younger self would like to stay until the two of you connect again. If so, take your younger self to that place.	Посмотрите, есть ли место, где вы, молодой человек, хотели бы остаться, пока вы двое снова не встретитесь. Если да, отведите себя в молодости в это место.	See if there’s a place your younger self would like to stay until the two of you connect again. If so, take your younger self to that place.
Let your younger self know it is time for you to leave, and reassure them that you will connect with them again.	Let your younger self know it is time for you to leave, and reassure them that you will connect with them again.	Дайте своему молодому «я» понять, что вам пора уйти, и заверьте его, что вы снова с ним соединитесь.	Let your younger self know it is time for you to leave, and reassure them that you will connect with them again.
Bring your awareness to your breath and the space between each inhale and exhale. When you’re ready, re-enter this moment and space by slowly opening your eyes.	Bring your awareness to your breath and the space between each inhale and exhale. When you’re ready, re-enter this moment and space by slowly opening your eyes.	Направьте свое внимание на свое дыхание и пространство между каждым вдохом и выдохом. Когда вы будете готовы, вернитесь в этот момент и пространство, медленно открывая глаза.	Bring your awareness to your breath and the space between each inhale and exhale. When you’re ready, re-enter this moment and space by slowly opening your eyes.
Exercise 1: Journal Capture	Exercise 1: Journal Capture	Упражнение 1. Ведение журнала	Exercise 1: Journal Capture
Take out your journal and quickly write whatever you would like to capture from this meditation. It could be a revelation, a reflection, a fleeting thought, or sensory perception.	Take out your journal and quickly write whatever you would like to capture from this meditation. It could be a revelation, a reflection, a fleeting thought, or sensory perception.	Достаньте свой дневник и быстро запишите все, что вы хотели бы уловить из этой медитации. Это может быть откровение, размышление, мимолетная мысль или чувственное восприятие.	Take out your journal and quickly write whatever you would like to capture from this meditation. It could be a revelation, a reflection, a fleeting thought, or sensory perception.
Exercise 2: The Meadow Journal Questions	Exercise 2: The Meadow Journal Questions	Упражнение 2: Вопросы для журнала Meadow	Exercise 2: The Meadow Journal Questions
After you’ve done the Meadow meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.	After you’ve done the Meadow meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.	После того, как вы выполнили Медоу-медитацию и написали быстрый дневник, потратьте некоторое время на более глубокое изучение, ответив на следующие подсказки журнала.	After you’ve done the Meadow meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.
What are the first things you noticed about your younger self?	What are the first things you noticed about your younger self?	Что вы в первую очередь заметили в себе в молодости?	What are the first things you noticed about your younger self?
What emotions did you sense from the younger you when you first came upon them?	What emotions did you sense from the younger you when you first came upon them?	Какие эмоции вы почувствовали у младших, когда впервые столкнулись с ними?	What emotions did you sense from the younger you when you first came upon them?
Were you already familiar with this part of yourself? If so, how has this part expressed itself in the past?	Were you already familiar with this part of yourself? If so, how has this part expressed itself in the past?	Вы уже были знакомы с этой частью себя? Если да, то как эта часть выражала себя в прошлом?	Were you already familiar with this part of yourself? If so, how has this part expressed itself in the past?
How did you feel toward the part? If it was positive or warm, how did the part respond?	How did you feel toward the part? If it was positive or warm, how did the part respond?	Как вы относились к этой роли? Если оно было положительным или теплым, как отреагировала часть?	How did you feel toward the part? If it was positive or warm, how did the part respond?
If it was not positive or warm, what parts came up and what were their fears or concerns?	If it was not positive or warm, what parts came up and what were their fears or concerns?	Если оно не было позитивным или теплым, какие части возникали и каковы были их страхи или опасения?	If it was not positive or warm, what parts came up and what were their fears or concerns?
What did your younger self need from you?	What did your younger self need from you?	Что нужно было от тебя твоему молодому «я»?	What did your younger self need from you?
What is the significance of this part showing up today?	What is the significance of this part showing up today?	Каково значение этой части, появившейся сегодня?	What is the significance of this part showing up today?
Exercise 3: Deepen the Connection	Exercise 3: Deepen the Connection	Упражнение 3. Углубляйте связь	Exercise 3: Deepen the Connection
Connect with this part daily for a week to learn more about them.	Connect with this part daily for a week to learn more about them.	Подключайтесь к этой части ежедневно в течение недели, чтобы узнать о них больше.	Connect with this part daily for a week to learn more about them.
Ask the part what more it wants to share with you.	Ask the part what more it wants to share with you.	Спросите часть, чем еще она хочет с вами поделиться.	Ask the part what more it wants to share with you.
Ask the part what has been difficult for it.	Ask the part what has been difficult for it.	Спросите часть, что для нее было трудным.	Ask the part what has been difficult for it.
What did it need that it didn’t get?	What did it need that it didn’t get?	Что ему нужно, чего он не получил?	What did it need that it didn’t get?
Journal what you learn.	Journal what you learn.	Записывайте то, что вы изучаете.	Journal what you learn.
CHAPTER 4	CHAPTER 4	ГЛАВА 4	CHAPTER 4
Self Qualities	Self Qualities	Личностные качества	Self Qualities
The You That’s Not a Part	The You That’s Not a Part	Ты, это не часть	The You That’s Not a Part
I sit in a translucent golden bubble. I am safe. I am present. I am open. I not only hear their words, but I feel them. I am leading an IFS training where some participants expected an affinity space for BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, People of Color) attendees, while others anticipated an affinity space for Black folks only. However, the training is designed to include predominantly people who identify as Black, followed by a smaller number of people who identify as BIPOC, and then a lesser number of participants who identify as white. Because most of the attendees did not expect the training to include white people, their parts feel unsafe, disappointed, fearful, angry, defensive, and harmed.	I sit in a translucent golden bubble. I am safe. I am present. I am open. I not only hear their words, but I feel them. I am leading an IFS training where some participants expected an affinity space for BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, People of Color) attendees, while others anticipated an affinity space for Black folks only. However, the training is designed to include predominantly people who identify as Black, followed by a smaller number of people who identify as BIPOC, and then a lesser number of participants who identify as white. Because most of the attendees did not expect the training to include white people, their parts feel unsafe, disappointed, fearful, angry, defensive, and harmed.	Я сижу в полупрозрачном золотом пузыре. Я в безопасности. Я присутствую. Я открыт. Я не только слышу их слова, но и чувствую их. Я провожу тренинг IFS, где некоторые участники ожидали, что пространство близости будет предназначено для участников BIPOC (чернокожие, коренные жители, цветные люди), в то время как другие ожидали, что пространство близости будет только для чернокожих людей. Тем не менее, обучение рассчитано преимущественно на людей, идентифицирующих себя как чернокожие, за которыми следует меньшее количество людей, идентифицирующих себя как BIPOC, а затем меньшее количество участников, идентифицирующих себя как белые. Поскольку большинство участников не ожидали, что в тренинге примут участие белые люди, их части чувствуют себя небезопасно, разочарованы, напуганы, злы, защищаются и обижены.	I sit in a translucent golden bubble. I am safe. I am present. I am open. I not only hear their words, but I feel them. I am leading an IFS training where some participants expected an affinity space for BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, People of Color) attendees, while others anticipated an affinity space for Black folks only. However, the training is designed to include predominantly people who identify as Black, followed by a smaller number of people who identify as BIPOC, and then a lesser number of participants who identify as white. Because most of the attendees did not expect the training to include white people, their parts feel unsafe, disappointed, fearful, angry, defensive, and harmed.
IFS training sessions are designed to use the model to address any conflict or difficulties that arise in the training. Therefore, processing time is built into the design of the training. However, this training required more processing than any other that I have led because so many people were activated so intensely. Every day of the training required some amount of processing related to the racial and ethnic makeup of the training cohort. As the lead trainer and the most visible, I was the target of the participants’ anger, rage, and blame. I realized from this experience there are situations that no amount of training and mentoring can prepare you for. What did prepare me to remain in my seat, without my parts taking over, was my commitment to my own IFS therapy that I had been doing for five years before this training.	IFS training sessions are designed to use the model to address any conflict or difficulties that arise in the training. Therefore, processing time is built into the design of the training. However, this training required more processing than any other that I have led because so many people were activated so intensely. Every day of the training required some amount of processing related to the racial and ethnic makeup of the training cohort. As the lead trainer and the most visible, I was the target of the participants’ anger, rage, and blame. I realized from this experience there are situations that no amount of training and mentoring can prepare you for. What did prepare me to remain in my seat, without my parts taking over, was my commitment to my own IFS therapy that I had been doing for five years before this training.	Тренинги IFS предназначены для использования модели для разрешения любых конфликтов или трудностей, возникающих в ходе обучения. Таким образом, время обработки заложено в структуру обучения. Однако это обучение потребовало больше обработки, чем любое другое, которое я проводил, потому что очень много людей было активировано очень интенсивно. Каждый день обучения требовал некоторой обработки, связанной с расовым и этническим составом обучающейся когорты. Как ведущий тренер и самый заметный человек, я стал объектом гнева, ярости и обвинений участников. Из этого опыта я понял, что существуют ситуации, к которым вас не подготовит никакое обучение и наставничество. Что действительно подготовило меня к тому, чтобы оставаться на своем месте, без того, чтобы мои части взяли на себя управление, так это моя приверженность моей собственной терапии IFS, которую я проходил в течение пяти лет до этого тренинга.	IFS training sessions are designed to use the model to address any conflict or difficulties that arise in the training. Therefore, processing time is built into the design of the training. However, this training required more processing than any other that I have led because so many people were activated so intensely. Every day of the training required some amount of processing related to the racial and ethnic makeup of the training cohort. As the lead trainer and the most visible, I was the target of the participants’ anger, rage, and blame. I realized from this experience there are situations that no amount of training and mentoring can prepare you for. What did prepare me to remain in my seat, without my parts taking over, was my commitment to my own IFS therapy that I had been doing for five years before this training.
In the most heated exchange and processing, I heard the following accusations from participants: “Leadership tricked us. We were led to believe this was going to be a safe place; I don’t feel safe. I didn’t expect to see white people in a training for BIPOC folks. Leadership has heard our complaints and hasn’t done anything to fix the problem. It doesn’t seem like leadership cares. We are being harmed in this training, and leadership isn’t doing anything about it.” Over and over, I heard, “I don’t feel safe, I’m being harmed, leadership doesn’t care enough to do anything to take care of me, and my needs are not important.”	In the most heated exchange and processing, I heard the following accusations from participants: “Leadership tricked us. We were led to believe this was going to be a safe place; I don’t feel safe. I didn’t expect to see white people in a training for BIPOC folks. Leadership has heard our complaints and hasn’t done anything to fix the problem. It doesn’t seem like leadership cares. We are being harmed in this training, and leadership isn’t doing anything about it.” Over and over, I heard, “I don’t feel safe, I’m being harmed, leadership doesn’t care enough to do anything to take care of me, and my needs are not important.”	В ходе самого горячего обмена мнениями и обработкой я услышал от участников следующие обвинения: «Лидерство нас обмануло. Нас заставили поверить, что это будет безопасное место; Я не чувствую себя в безопасности. Я не ожидал увидеть белых людей на тренинге для ребят из BIPOC. Руководство услышало наши жалобы и не предприняло ничего, чтобы решить проблему. Похоже, руководство это не волнует. Нам наносят вред во время этого обучения, и руководство ничего с этим не делает». Снова и снова я слышал: «Я не чувствую себя в безопасности, мне причиняют вред, руководство не заботится настолько, чтобы позаботиться обо мне, а мои потребности не важны».	In the most heated exchange and processing, I heard the following accusations from participants: “Leadership tricked us. We were led to believe this was going to be a safe place; I don’t feel safe. I didn’t expect to see white people in a training for BIPOC folks. Leadership has heard our complaints and hasn’t done anything to fix the problem. It doesn’t seem like leadership cares. We are being harmed in this training, and leadership isn’t doing anything about it.” Over and over, I heard, “I don’t feel safe, I’m being harmed, leadership doesn’t care enough to do anything to take care of me, and my needs are not important.”
Prior to learning about my system of parts and being in relationship with them, I would have become defensive and frustrated, justifying why things were the way they were, and attempting to explain my way out of a difficult situation. Instead, my parts did not take over. They trusted me. As I sat in my golden bubble, I envisioned each blaming statement as a fiery arrow leaving the hand of the one talking being shot toward me. As each flaming arrow got closer, it transformed into the pain under their words of blame and finger pointing. I saw the depth of their hurt, disappointment, fear, lack of safety, and unworthiness of their needs being met. I did not experience their words as a personal attack as I would have in my past. I experienced their words as requests for what they needed and I met them with compassion, calm, and curiosity. I genuinely wanted to understand what the participants were feeling and experiencing.	Prior to learning about my system of parts and being in relationship with them, I would have become defensive and frustrated, justifying why things were the way they were, and attempting to explain my way out of a difficult situation. Instead, my parts did not take over. They trusted me. As I sat in my golden bubble, I envisioned each blaming statement as a fiery arrow leaving the hand of the one talking being shot toward me. As each flaming arrow got closer, it transformed into the pain under their words of blame and finger pointing. I saw the depth of their hurt, disappointment, fear, lack of safety, and unworthiness of their needs being met. I did not experience their words as a personal attack as I would have in my past. I experienced their words as requests for what they needed and I met them with compassion, calm, and curiosity. I genuinely wanted to understand what the participants were feeling and experiencing.	До того, как я узнал о своей системе частей и вступил в отношения с ними, я бы занял оборонительную позицию и расстроился, оправдывая, почему все обстоит именно так, и пытаясь объяснить свой выход из трудной ситуации. Вместо этого мои части не взяли верх. Они доверяли мне. Сидя в своем золотом пузыре, я представлял себе каждое обвиняющее высказывание как огненную стрелу, покидающую руку говорящего и летящую в мою сторону. По мере того, как каждая пылающая стрела приближалась, она превращалась в боль от слов обвинения и тыканья пальцем. Я видел глубину их боли, разочарования, страха, отсутствия безопасности и недостойности удовлетворения их потребностей. Я не воспринял их слова как личную атаку, как это было в прошлом. Я воспринял их слова как просьбы о том, что им нужно, и встретил их с состраданием, спокойствием и любопытством. Мне искренне хотелось понять, что чувствовали и переживали участники.	Prior to learning about my system of parts and being in relationship with them, I would have become defensive and frustrated, justifying why things were the way they were, and attempting to explain my way out of a difficult situation. Instead, my parts did not take over. They trusted me. As I sat in my golden bubble, I envisioned each blaming statement as a fiery arrow leaving the hand of the one talking being shot toward me. As each flaming arrow got closer, it transformed into the pain under their words of blame and finger pointing. I saw the depth of their hurt, disappointment, fear, lack of safety, and unworthiness of their needs being met. I did not experience their words as a personal attack as I would have in my past. I experienced their words as requests for what they needed and I met them with compassion, calm, and curiosity. I genuinely wanted to understand what the participants were feeling and experiencing.
I also wanted to help ease their pain. Therefore, I not only listened, but I also encouraged them to tell me more. I didn’t shy away from the conversation I would have found quite difficult in the past. I delved deeper to understand more fully. I didn’t only listen with compassion and curiosity; I extended my Self-energy toward them. I let them experience that I could hold whatever the truth of their feelings was. To help them to trust me more, I took complete responsibility for what had happened—for the lack of clarity about the racial composition of the training. I expressed my understanding of how shocking and disappointing this must be for them. I assumed nothing. I asked them to share with me the injuries they experienced and what they needed from me as a repair. I persisted in my commitment to help them feel seen, heard, and understood by me.	I also wanted to help ease their pain. Therefore, I not only listened, but I also encouraged them to tell me more. I didn’t shy away from the conversation I would have found quite difficult in the past. I delved deeper to understand more fully. I didn’t only listen with compassion and curiosity; I extended my Self-energy toward them. I let them experience that I could hold whatever the truth of their feelings was. To help them to trust me more, I took complete responsibility for what had happened—for the lack of clarity about the racial composition of the training. I expressed my understanding of how shocking and disappointing this must be for them. I assumed nothing. I asked them to share with me the injuries they experienced and what they needed from me as a repair. I persisted in my commitment to help them feel seen, heard, and understood by me.	Я также хотел помочь облегчить их боль. Поэтому я не только слушал, но и побуждал их рассказать мне больше. Я не уклонялся от разговора, который раньше показался мне довольно трудным. Я копнул глубже, чтобы понять более полно. Я слушал не только с состраданием и любопытством; Я направил на них свою энергию Я. Я позволил им почувствовать, что могу выдержать истину их чувств. Чтобы помочь им больше доверять мне, я взял на себя полную ответственность за произошедшее — за отсутствие ясности относительно расового состава обучающихся. Я выразил свое понимание того, насколько это должно быть для них шокирующим и разочаровывающим. Я ничего не предполагал. Я попросил их рассказать мне о травмах, которые они получили, и о том, что им нужно от меня в качестве ремонта. Я настаивал на своем стремлении помочь им почувствовать, что я их вижу, слышу и понимаю.	I also wanted to help ease their pain. Therefore, I not only listened, but I also encouraged them to tell me more. I didn’t shy away from the conversation I would have found quite difficult in the past. I delved deeper to understand more fully. I didn’t only listen with compassion and curiosity; I extended my Self-energy toward them. I let them experience that I could hold whatever the truth of their feelings was. To help them to trust me more, I took complete responsibility for what had happened—for the lack of clarity about the racial composition of the training. I expressed my understanding of how shocking and disappointing this must be for them. I assumed nothing. I asked them to share with me the injuries they experienced and what they needed from me as a repair. I persisted in my commitment to help them feel seen, heard, and understood by me.
This experience taught me that Self-energy can hold big emotions. It can hold the pain of others. It can be the connection between the expression of hurt and the relief of that hurt with understanding. I learned that I am not harmed by the expression of someone else’s pain, even when that expression is directed at me. I also had an awareness that I was not efforting or searching for the “right” words to say. I wasn’t trying to placate, people-please or caretake the participants. Accessing my Self qualities allowed me to be with what was present in the room with the confidence of a compassionate listener connecting with the pain of those sharing. I remained curious to know their experiences as fully as they were willing to share. I had the courage to ask for clarity to deepen my understanding, and keeping a calm head made space for creative offerings to improve the situation. Through the entire process, the confidence of Self maintained that I could handle their concerns, repair the unintended impact, and not be diminished by their upset.	This experience taught me that Self-energy can hold big emotions. It can hold the pain of others. It can be the connection between the expression of hurt and the relief of that hurt with understanding. I learned that I am not harmed by the expression of someone else’s pain, even when that expression is directed at me. I also had an awareness that I was not efforting or searching for the “right” words to say. I wasn’t trying to placate, people-please or caretake the participants. Accessing my Self qualities allowed me to be with what was present in the room with the confidence of a compassionate listener connecting with the pain of those sharing. I remained curious to know their experiences as fully as they were willing to share. I had the courage to ask for clarity to deepen my understanding, and keeping a calm head made space for creative offerings to improve the situation. Through the entire process, the confidence of Self maintained that I could handle their concerns, repair the unintended impact, and not be diminished by their upset.	Этот опыт научил меня тому, что собственная энергия может удерживать сильные эмоции. Оно может удерживать боль других. Это может быть связь между выражением боли и облегчением этой боли пониманием. Я узнал, что выражение чужой боли не причиняет мне вреда, даже если это выражение направлено на меня. Я также осознавал, что не пытаюсь и не ищу «правильные» слова, чтобы сказать. Я не пытался успокоить, порадовать или позаботиться об участниках. Доступ к своим качествам Я позволил мне быть с тем, что присутствовало в комнате, с уверенностью сострадательного слушателя, соприкасающегося с болью тех, кто разделял это. Мне по-прежнему было любопытно узнать об их опыте настолько полно, насколько они были готовы поделиться. У меня хватило смелости попросить ясности, чтобы углубить мое понимание, и, сохраняя спокойствие, освободилось место для творческих предложений по улучшению ситуации. На протяжении всего процесса уверенность «Я» сохранялась в том, что я смогу справиться с их проблемами, исправить непреднамеренное воздействие и не ослабить их расстройство.	This experience taught me that Self-energy can hold big emotions. It can hold the pain of others. It can be the connection between the expression of hurt and the relief of that hurt with understanding. I learned that I am not harmed by the expression of someone else’s pain, even when that expression is directed at me. I also had an awareness that I was not efforting or searching for the “right” words to say. I wasn’t trying to placate, people-please or caretake the participants. Accessing my Self qualities allowed me to be with what was present in the room with the confidence of a compassionate listener connecting with the pain of those sharing. I remained curious to know their experiences as fully as they were willing to share. I had the courage to ask for clarity to deepen my understanding, and keeping a calm head made space for creative offerings to improve the situation. Through the entire process, the confidence of Self maintained that I could handle their concerns, repair the unintended impact, and not be diminished by their upset.
IFS CONCEPT 1: SELF QUALITIES	IFS CONCEPT 1: SELF QUALITIES	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 1: СОБСТВЕННЫЕ КАЧЕСТВА	IFS CONCEPT 1: SELF QUALITIES
Self is universal, and everyone has access to Self. It is who we are when we are not blended with one of our extreme parts. Self is whole and unaffected by the hurts and traumas we have experienced. This is the deepest essence or center of every person. Self is wise, intuitive, and able to heal and lead. The only agenda held by Self is one of healing detached from controlling how and when healing takes place. Self never goes away. However, we may lose connection to Self because of the harshness, abuses, and attachment injuries we’ve experienced. An analogy to describe what happens when we have little or no access to Self is the same as when clouds obscure the sun on an overcast day. The sun does not go away. It is still present but covered by the clouds. No matter how dampened or covered up Self may become, it is still present. The key is to bring awareness to our parts and develop a relationship between Self and our parts.	Self is universal, and everyone has access to Self. It is who we are when we are not blended with one of our extreme parts. Self is whole and unaffected by the hurts and traumas we have experienced. This is the deepest essence or center of every person. Self is wise, intuitive, and able to heal and lead. The only agenda held by Self is one of healing detached from controlling how and when healing takes place. Self never goes away. However, we may lose connection to Self because of the harshness, abuses, and attachment injuries we’ve experienced. An analogy to describe what happens when we have little or no access to Self is the same as when clouds obscure the sun on an overcast day. The sun does not go away. It is still present but covered by the clouds. No matter how dampened or covered up Self may become, it is still present. The key is to bring awareness to our parts and develop a relationship between Self and our parts.	«Я» универсально, и каждый имеет доступ к «Я». Это то, кем мы являемся, когда мы не смешаны с одной из наших крайних частей. «Я» целостно и не затронуто обидами и травмами, которые мы пережили. Это глубочайшая сущность или центр каждого человека. «Я» мудро, интуитивно понятно и способно исцелять и вести. Единственная программа, которой придерживается «Я», — это исцеление, отделенное от контроля над тем, как и когда происходит исцеление. Я никогда не уходит. Однако мы можем потерять связь с «Я» из-за жестокости, оскорблений и травм привязанности, которые мы пережили. Аналогия для описания того, что происходит, когда у нас мало или вообще нет доступа к Самости, такая же, как когда облака закрывают солнце в пасмурный день. Солнце не уходит. Он все еще существует, но скрыт облаками. Независимо от того, насколько приглушенным или скрытым может стать «Я», оно все равно присутствует. Ключевым моментом является привлечение внимания к нашим частям и развитие отношений между «Я» и нашими частями.	Self is universal, and everyone has access to Self. It is who we are when we are not blended with one of our extreme parts. Self is whole and unaffected by the hurts and traumas we have experienced. This is the deepest essence or center of every person. Self is wise, intuitive, and able to heal and lead. The only agenda held by Self is one of healing detached from controlling how and when healing takes place. Self never goes away. However, we may lose connection to Self because of the harshness, abuses, and attachment injuries we’ve experienced. An analogy to describe what happens when we have little or no access to Self is the same as when clouds obscure the sun on an overcast day. The sun does not go away. It is still present but covered by the clouds. No matter how dampened or covered up Self may become, it is still present. The key is to bring awareness to our parts and develop a relationship between Self and our parts.
Self has eight essential qualities, as we saw in Chapter 1—the eight Cs. When Self is expressed, we experience one or more of these qualities. The qualities are compassion, curiosity, calm, connectedness, confidence, clarity, creativity, and courage. The qualities are defined by Dr. Richard Schwartz1 and Julia Sullivan,2 a Level 2–trained IFS therapist, as follows:	Self has eight essential qualities, as we saw in Chapter 1—the eight Cs. When Self is expressed, we experience one or more of these qualities. The qualities are compassion, curiosity, calm, connectedness, confidence, clarity, creativity, and courage. The qualities are defined by Dr. Richard Schwartz1 and Julia Sullivan,2 a Level 2–trained IFS therapist, as follows:	Как мы видели в главе 1, «Я» обладает восемью основными качествами — восемью «С». Когда выражается «Я», мы испытываем одно или несколько из этих качеств. Качества: сострадание, любопытство, спокойствие, связность, уверенность, ясность, творчество и смелость. Эти качества определены доктором Ричардом Шварцем1 и Джулией Салливан2, терапевтом IFS 2-го уровня, следующим образом:	Self has eight essential qualities, as we saw in Chapter 1—the eight Cs. When Self is expressed, we experience one or more of these qualities. The qualities are compassion, curiosity, calm, connectedness, confidence, clarity, creativity, and courage. The qualities are defined by Dr. Richard Schwartz1 and Julia Sullivan,2 a Level 2–trained IFS therapist, as follows:
Compassion: The ability to see suffering and feel for another. It is different from empathy, which is feeling with another. When we have compassion for others, we want to do something to relieve their suffering. We simultaneously have empathy for the other and a belief that the other has a Self that can relieve the other’s own suffering. Compassion allows us to see beyond others’ angry parts to the fear or pain behind them. We can apply these concepts of compassion to our own parts as well in the form of self-compassion. Self offers compassion to our parts when they are attempting to deal with challenging life situations. Parts need to know through the experience of Self that they are not alone and have a resource to support and guide them.	Compassion: The ability to see suffering and feel for another. It is different from empathy, which is feeling with another. When we have compassion for others, we want to do something to relieve their suffering. We simultaneously have empathy for the other and a belief that the other has a Self that can relieve the other’s own suffering. Compassion allows us to see beyond others’ angry parts to the fear or pain behind them. We can apply these concepts of compassion to our own parts as well in the form of self-compassion. Self offers compassion to our parts when they are attempting to deal with challenging life situations. Parts need to know through the experience of Self that they are not alone and have a resource to support and guide them.	Сострадание: способность видеть страдания и сочувствовать другому. Это отличается от эмпатии, которая проявляется в отношениях с другим человеком. Когда мы сострадаем другим, мы хотим сделать что-то, чтобы облегчить их страдания. У нас одновременно есть сочувствие к другому и вера в то, что у другого есть «Я», способное облегчить страдания другого. Сострадание позволяет нам видеть за пределами гнева других людей страх или боль, стоящие за ними. Мы можем применить эти концепции сострадания к своим частям тела, а также в форме самосострадания. «Я» проявляет сострадание к нашим частям, когда они пытаются справиться со сложными жизненными ситуациями. Части должны знать через опыт Самости, что они не одиноки и что у них есть ресурс, который сможет поддержать и направить их.	Compassion: The ability to see suffering and feel for another. It is different from empathy, which is feeling with another. When we have compassion for others, we want to do something to relieve their suffering. We simultaneously have empathy for the other and a belief that the other has a Self that can relieve the other’s own suffering. Compassion allows us to see beyond others’ angry parts to the fear or pain behind them. We can apply these concepts of compassion to our own parts as well in the form of self-compassion. Self offers compassion to our parts when they are attempting to deal with challenging life situations. Parts need to know through the experience of Self that they are not alone and have a resource to support and guide them.
Curiosity: The ability to have a sense of wonder about the world and how things work. The ability to ask questions without an agenda. A genuine interest in knowing another’s perspective. It is the ability to bring agenda-free curiosity to your own actions too. The ability to show genuine interest in why people behave as they do or why they feel the way they do instead of becoming upset about what they say or do. Self allows natural curiosity when faced with another person’s anger or upset. Curiosity replaces our defensiveness or upset.	Curiosity: The ability to have a sense of wonder about the world and how things work. The ability to ask questions without an agenda. A genuine interest in knowing another’s perspective. It is the ability to bring agenda-free curiosity to your own actions too. The ability to show genuine interest in why people behave as they do or why they feel the way they do instead of becoming upset about what they say or do. Self allows natural curiosity when faced with another person’s anger or upset. Curiosity replaces our defensiveness or upset.	Любопытство: способность удивляться миру и тому, как все устроено. Умение задавать вопросы без повестки дня. Искренний интерес к знанию точки зрения другого. Это также способность привнести любопытство, не связанное с повесткой дня, в ваши собственные действия. Способность проявлять искренний интерес к тому, почему люди ведут себя так или иначе, вместо того, чтобы расстраиваться из-за того, что они говорят или делают. «Я» допускает естественное любопытство, когда сталкивается с гневом или расстройством другого человека. Любопытство заменяет нашу оборонительную позицию или расстройство.	Curiosity: The ability to have a sense of wonder about the world and how things work. The ability to ask questions without an agenda. A genuine interest in knowing another’s perspective. It is the ability to bring agenda-free curiosity to your own actions too. The ability to show genuine interest in why people behave as they do or why they feel the way they do instead of becoming upset about what they say or do. Self allows natural curiosity when faced with another person’s anger or upset. Curiosity replaces our defensiveness or upset.
Calm: The ability to experience physiological and mental serenity regardless of the circumstances. The ability to reduce activity of the mind and body. We remain physically calm during stressful situations, and we can have a peaceful presence with other people and with our parts. The Self quality of calm allows us to be with another’s upset without becoming defensive.	Calm: The ability to experience physiological and mental serenity regardless of the circumstances. The ability to reduce activity of the mind and body. We remain physically calm during stressful situations, and we can have a peaceful presence with other people and with our parts. The Self quality of calm allows us to be with another’s upset without becoming defensive.	Спокойствие: способность испытывать физиологическое и психическое спокойствие независимо от обстоятельств. Способность снижать активность ума и тела. Мы сохраняем физическое спокойствие во время стрессовых ситуаций и можем мирно находиться в общении с другими людьми и со своими частями тела. Качество спокойствия «Я» позволяет нам спокойно относиться к тому, что кто-то расстроен, не занимая оборонительную позицию.	Calm: The ability to experience physiological and mental serenity regardless of the circumstances. The ability to reduce activity of the mind and body. We remain physically calm during stressful situations, and we can have a peaceful presence with other people and with our parts. The Self quality of calm allows us to be with another’s upset without becoming defensive.
Connectedness: The ability to maintain connection with others and to every part of ourself. A desire to reconnect when disconnection occurs. It is feeling a part of a larger entity or community. When in connection with another, we feel accepted and can relax our defenses because we know we won’t be judged, controlled, or hurt. There’s also a knowing that any misunderstandings can be repaired because of the connection. The quality of connectedness allows us to remain in relationship with our parts even when they do things we do not like or are not proud of, recognizing that all of life is connected and the sense of separateness is an illusion.	Connectedness: The ability to maintain connection with others and to every part of ourself. A desire to reconnect when disconnection occurs. It is feeling a part of a larger entity or community. When in connection with another, we feel accepted and can relax our defenses because we know we won’t be judged, controlled, or hurt. There’s also a knowing that any misunderstandings can be repaired because of the connection. The quality of connectedness allows us to remain in relationship with our parts even when they do things we do not like or are not proud of, recognizing that all of life is connected and the sense of separateness is an illusion.	Связность: способность поддерживать связь с другими и с каждой частью себя. Желание восстановить соединение, когда происходит отключение. Это ощущение себя частью более крупной организации или сообщества. В отношениях с другим человеком мы чувствуем себя принятыми и можем ослабить свою защиту, потому что знаем, что нас не будут судить, контролировать или причинять боль. Также есть знание, что любые недоразумения можно исправить благодаря связи. Качество связанности позволяет нам оставаться в отношениях со своими частями, даже когда они делают вещи, которые нам не нравятся или которыми мы не гордимся, признавая, что вся жизнь связана, а чувство обособленности — это иллюзия.	Connectedness: The ability to maintain connection with others and to every part of ourself. A desire to reconnect when disconnection occurs. It is feeling a part of a larger entity or community. When in connection with another, we feel accepted and can relax our defenses because we know we won’t be judged, controlled, or hurt. There’s also a knowing that any misunderstandings can be repaired because of the connection. The quality of connectedness allows us to remain in relationship with our parts even when they do things we do not like or are not proud of, recognizing that all of life is connected and the sense of separateness is an illusion.
Confidence: A strong belief in one’s ability to handle or repair whatever happens in life. The ability to be self-assured and know that we are worthwhile and valuable even when we make mistakes or others are upset with us. Confidence allows us not to be reduced or made to feel less-than by someone else’s negative evaluations of us or by their being upset with us.	Confidence: A strong belief in one’s ability to handle or repair whatever happens in life. The ability to be self-assured and know that we are worthwhile and valuable even when we make mistakes or others are upset with us. Confidence allows us not to be reduced or made to feel less-than by someone else’s negative evaluations of us or by their being upset with us.	Уверенность: Твердая вера в свою способность справиться или исправить все, что происходит в жизни. Способность быть уверенным в себе и знать, что мы стоим и ценны, даже когда мы совершаем ошибки или другие недовольны нами. Уверенность позволяет нам не ослабевать и не чувствовать себя хуже, чем из-за негативных оценок нас или из-за того, что кто-то расстроен нами.	Confidence: A strong belief in one’s ability to handle or repair whatever happens in life. The ability to be self-assured and know that we are worthwhile and valuable even when we make mistakes or others are upset with us. Confidence allows us not to be reduced or made to feel less-than by someone else’s negative evaluations of us or by their being upset with us.
Clarity: The ability to maintain a clear, undistorted view of situations without extreme beliefs or emotions. The ability to have a “beginner’s mind” in which many possibilities exist. Clarity affords us the opportunity to take in the necessary information to make the best decision.	Clarity: The ability to maintain a clear, undistorted view of situations without extreme beliefs or emotions. The ability to have a “beginner’s mind” in which many possibilities exist. Clarity affords us the opportunity to take in the necessary information to make the best decision.	Ясность: способность сохранять ясный, неискаженный взгляд на ситуации без крайних убеждений или эмоций. Способность иметь «разум новичка», в котором существует множество возможностей. Ясность дает нам возможность получить необходимую информацию для принятия наилучшего решения.	Clarity: The ability to maintain a clear, undistorted view of situations without extreme beliefs or emotions. The ability to have a “beginner’s mind” in which many possibilities exist. Clarity affords us the opportunity to take in the necessary information to make the best decision.
Creativity: The ability to explore and enjoy novelty. The ability to enter the “flow state” in which expression spontaneously flows out of us while we’re engaged in a pleasurable activity. The ability to encourage our parts to express themselves without shame, fear, or worthlessness. Creativity produces out-of-the-box thinking. The Self quality of creativity leads us to new and novel solutions to problems.	Creativity: The ability to explore and enjoy novelty. The ability to enter the “flow state” in which expression spontaneously flows out of us while we’re engaged in a pleasurable activity. The ability to encourage our parts to express themselves without shame, fear, or worthlessness. Creativity produces out-of-the-box thinking. The Self quality of creativity leads us to new and novel solutions to problems.	Креативность: способность исследовать и наслаждаться новизной. Способность войти в «состояние потока», в котором выражение самопроизвольно вытекает из нас, пока мы занимаемся приятной деятельностью. Способность побуждать наши части выражать себя без стыда, страха или бесполезности. Креативность порождает нестандартное мышление. Само-качество творчества ведет нас к новым и нестандартным решениям проблем.	Creativity: The ability to explore and enjoy novelty. The ability to enter the “flow state” in which expression spontaneously flows out of us while we’re engaged in a pleasurable activity. The ability to encourage our parts to express themselves without shame, fear, or worthlessness. Creativity produces out-of-the-box thinking. The Self quality of creativity leads us to new and novel solutions to problems.
Courage: The strength to face threat, challenge, or danger. The ability to recognize, apologize, and make amends for any damage caused by our words or actions. The willingness to reflect and “go inside” toward our own pain and shame, come into relationship with hurting parts, and heal the pain. The ability to speak for our extreme parts like anger, disappointment, criticism in a way that does not hurt others. The willingness to speak up for injustice. The Self quality of courage allows us to engage in ways and do things that parts of us are afraid to do.	Courage: The strength to face threat, challenge, or danger. The ability to recognize, apologize, and make amends for any damage caused by our words or actions. The willingness to reflect and “go inside” toward our own pain and shame, come into relationship with hurting parts, and heal the pain. The ability to speak for our extreme parts like anger, disappointment, criticism in a way that does not hurt others. The willingness to speak up for injustice. The Self quality of courage allows us to engage in ways and do things that parts of us are afraid to do.	Мужество: Сила противостоять угрозе, вызову или опасности. Способность распознавать, извиняться и возмещать любой ущерб, причиненный нашими словами или действиями. Готовность задуматься и «пойти внутрь» к нашей собственной боли и стыду, вступить во взаимоотношения с повреждающими частями и исцелить боль. Способность высказывать свои крайние стороны, такие как гнев, разочарование, критика, так, чтобы не причинить вреда другим. Готовность выступать в защиту несправедливости. Личностное качество смелости позволяет нам действовать и делать то, чего некоторые части нас боятся делать.	Courage: The strength to face threat, challenge, or danger. The ability to recognize, apologize, and make amends for any damage caused by our words or actions. The willingness to reflect and “go inside” toward our own pain and shame, come into relationship with hurting parts, and heal the pain. The ability to speak for our extreme parts like anger, disappointment, criticism in a way that does not hurt others. The willingness to speak up for injustice. The Self quality of courage allows us to engage in ways and do things that parts of us are afraid to do.
Everyone has a Self; however, our access to it may be limited by our parts. Access to Self is granted by the parts when they choose to relax and step back. When parts do this, Self can lead the internal family of parts through the expression of the eight qualities. It is the resource that heals the trauma and pain of the past.	Everyone has a Self; however, our access to it may be limited by our parts. Access to Self is granted by the parts when they choose to relax and step back. When parts do this, Self can lead the internal family of parts through the expression of the eight qualities. It is the resource that heals the trauma and pain of the past.	У каждого есть Я; однако наш доступ к нему может быть ограничен нашими частями. Доступ к себе предоставляется частями, когда они решают расслабиться и отступить. Когда части делают это, Самость может руководить внутренней семьей частей посредством выражения восьми качеств. Это ресурс, который исцеляет травмы и боль прошлого.	Everyone has a Self; however, our access to it may be limited by our parts. Access to Self is granted by the parts when they choose to relax and step back. When parts do this, Self can lead the internal family of parts through the expression of the eight qualities. It is the resource that heals the trauma and pain of the past.
IFS CONCEPT 2: SELF-LIKE PARTS	IFS CONCEPT 2: SELF-LIKE PARTS	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 2: САМОПОДОБНЫЕ ЧАСТИ	IFS CONCEPT 2: SELF-LIKE PARTS
There are parts in the system that can appear like the Self but are not the Self. These parts are referred to as Self-like parts. They are managers who keep the system in balance by behaving similarly and possessing qualities like the Self. They are empathetic, care, and want to help, but they cannot heal parts—only Self can do that. Because Self-like parts respond from empathy, not compassion, they act from a desire to protect other parts, especially exiled parts, while Self is compassionate toward our parts with an offering of healing. Self is not afraid or overwhelmed by the experiences or wounds held by our vulnerable parts, while Self-like parts will attempt to comfort our wounded parts or keep them hidden, which is a form of protecting them. They may also try to explain away the pain of what happened to us when we were young.	There are parts in the system that can appear like the Self but are not the Self. These parts are referred to as Self-like parts. They are managers who keep the system in balance by behaving similarly and possessing qualities like the Self. They are empathetic, care, and want to help, but they cannot heal parts—only Self can do that. Because Self-like parts respond from empathy, not compassion, they act from a desire to protect other parts, especially exiled parts, while Self is compassionate toward our parts with an offering of healing. Self is not afraid or overwhelmed by the experiences or wounds held by our vulnerable parts, while Self-like parts will attempt to comfort our wounded parts or keep them hidden, which is a form of protecting them. They may also try to explain away the pain of what happened to us when we were young.	В системе есть части, которые могут выглядеть как «Я», но не являются «Я». Эти части называются самоподобными частями. Они — менеджеры, которые поддерживают систему в равновесии, ведя себя одинаково и обладая такими качествами, как «Я». Они сочувствуют, заботятся и хотят помочь, но не могут исцелить части тела — это может сделать только Я. Поскольку Самоподобные части реагируют сочувствием, а не состраданием, они действуют из желания защитить другие части, особенно изгнанные, в то время как «Я» сострадает нашим частям, предлагая исцеление. «Я» не боится и не подавляется переживаниями или ранами, нанесенными нашими уязвимыми частями, в то время как самоподобные части будут пытаться утешить наши раненые части или скрывать их, что является формой их защиты. Они также могут попытаться объяснить боль от того, что случилось с нами, когда мы были молоды.	There are parts in the system that can appear like the Self but are not the Self. These parts are referred to as Self-like parts. They are managers who keep the system in balance by behaving similarly and possessing qualities like the Self. They are empathetic, care, and want to help, but they cannot heal parts—only Self can do that. Because Self-like parts respond from empathy, not compassion, they act from a desire to protect other parts, especially exiled parts, while Self is compassionate toward our parts with an offering of healing. Self is not afraid or overwhelmed by the experiences or wounds held by our vulnerable parts, while Self-like parts will attempt to comfort our wounded parts or keep them hidden, which is a form of protecting them. They may also try to explain away the pain of what happened to us when we were young.
You may notice your Self-like parts when interacting with others or in relationship with other parts. To identify one, notice if your heart is open or closed. Ask yourself, does the part seem to have an agenda? Although Self wants to help our parts heal, it doesn’t push for healing. It offers healing as a choice and allows parts to decide. Self-like parts, on the other hand, try to push parts—and other people—in a particular direction. When Self-like parts express curiosity, it is often a figure-it-out type of curiosity coming from the head, while the curiosity of Self comes from a true desire to know about the other without any agenda.	You may notice your Self-like parts when interacting with others or in relationship with other parts. To identify one, notice if your heart is open or closed. Ask yourself, does the part seem to have an agenda? Although Self wants to help our parts heal, it doesn’t push for healing. It offers healing as a choice and allows parts to decide. Self-like parts, on the other hand, try to push parts—and other people—in a particular direction. When Self-like parts express curiosity, it is often a figure-it-out type of curiosity coming from the head, while the curiosity of Self comes from a true desire to know about the other without any agenda.	Вы можете заметить свои части, подобные Себе, при взаимодействии с другими людьми или во взаимоотношениях с другими частями. Чтобы определить его, обратите внимание, открыто ли ваше сердце или закрыто. Спросите себя, есть ли у этой части какие-то планы? Хотя «Я» хочет помочь нашим частям исцелиться, оно не настаивает на исцелении. Он предлагает исцеление как выбор и позволяет частям принимать решение. С другой стороны, самоподобные части пытаются подтолкнуть части – и других людей – в определенном направлении. Когда части, подобные Самости, выражают любопытство, это часто любопытство типа самоанализа, исходящее из головы, в то время как любопытство Самости исходит из истинного желания узнать о другом без какой-либо цели.	You may notice your Self-like parts when interacting with others or in relationship with other parts. To identify one, notice if your heart is open or closed. Ask yourself, does the part seem to have an agenda? Although Self wants to help our parts heal, it doesn’t push for healing. It offers healing as a choice and allows parts to decide. Self-like parts, on the other hand, try to push parts—and other people—in a particular direction. When Self-like parts express curiosity, it is often a figure-it-out type of curiosity coming from the head, while the curiosity of Self comes from a true desire to know about the other without any agenda.
Ancestors and Access to Self	Ancestors and Access to Self	Предки и доступ к себе	Ancestors and Access to Self
Our ancestors hold great knowledge about our lineage, history, strengths, and challenges. Connecting with them and their wisdom can enhance the healing process. Bringing your ancestors into the process creates greater access to Self, both your own and your ancestors’. As we saw earlier, Self is the healing agent within our system. Therefore, it makes sense that having more access to Self internally and externally can positively impact the healing process.	Our ancestors hold great knowledge about our lineage, history, strengths, and challenges. Connecting with them and their wisdom can enhance the healing process. Bringing your ancestors into the process creates greater access to Self, both your own and your ancestors’. As we saw earlier, Self is the healing agent within our system. Therefore, it makes sense that having more access to Self internally and externally can positively impact the healing process.	Наши предки обладают огромными знаниями о нашем происхождении, истории, сильных сторонах и проблемах. Общение с ними и их мудростью может ускорить процесс исцеления. Вовлечение ваших предков в этот процесс создает больший доступ к себе, как вашему собственному, так и вашим предкам. Как мы видели ранее, «Я» — это исцеляющий агент внутри нашей системы. Следовательно, имеет смысл, что больший доступ к себе как внутри, так и снаружи может положительно повлиять на процесс исцеления.	Our ancestors hold great knowledge about our lineage, history, strengths, and challenges. Connecting with them and their wisdom can enhance the healing process. Bringing your ancestors into the process creates greater access to Self, both your own and your ancestors’. As we saw earlier, Self is the healing agent within our system. Therefore, it makes sense that having more access to Self internally and externally can positively impact the healing process.
Connecting with your ancestors in the IFS healing process increases the amount of Self-energy available for healing. Instead of only having access to your Self-energy (which is sufficient for healing all by itself), you magnify the amount and intensity of Self-energy by inviting connection with your Self-led ancestors. This increase of Self-energy may help you to heal more quickly, more deeply, and more completely. Our ancestors are rooting for us and will assist and support us when we invite them to do so. Just as my ancestors joined me in creating the meditations I share in this book, your ancestors are available as guides in your life too.	Connecting with your ancestors in the IFS healing process increases the amount of Self-energy available for healing. Instead of only having access to your Self-energy (which is sufficient for healing all by itself), you magnify the amount and intensity of Self-energy by inviting connection with your Self-led ancestors. This increase of Self-energy may help you to heal more quickly, more deeply, and more completely. Our ancestors are rooting for us and will assist and support us when we invite them to do so. Just as my ancestors joined me in creating the meditations I share in this book, your ancestors are available as guides in your life too.	Соединение со своими предками в процессе исцеления IFS увеличивает количество внутренней энергии, доступной для исцеления. Вместо того, чтобы иметь доступ только к вашей Само-энергии (которой достаточно для исцеления), вы увеличиваете количество и интенсивность Само-энергии, приглашая к связи со своими Самостоятельными предками. Это увеличение собственной энергии может помочь вам исцелиться быстрее, глубже и полнее. Наши предки болеет за нас и будут помогать и поддерживать нас, когда мы пригласим их сделать это. Точно так же, как мои предки присоединились ко мне в создании медитаций, которыми я делюсь в этой книге, ваши предки также могут стать наставниками в вашей жизни.	Connecting with your ancestors in the IFS healing process increases the amount of Self-energy available for healing. Instead of only having access to your Self-energy (which is sufficient for healing all by itself), you magnify the amount and intensity of Self-energy by inviting connection with your Self-led ancestors. This increase of Self-energy may help you to heal more quickly, more deeply, and more completely. Our ancestors are rooting for us and will assist and support us when we invite them to do so. Just as my ancestors joined me in creating the meditations I share in this book, your ancestors are available as guides in your life too.
Case Vignette: Grieved Empty Nester	Case Vignette: Grieved Empty Nester	Краткое описание дела: Опечаленный пустой Нестер	Case Vignette: Grieved Empty Nester
Christina, a married 48-year-old Black woman, came to therapy feeling depressed, directionless, useless, and without purpose after her only living son, Evan, graduated from medical school, moved across the country for employment, and asked his girlfriend to marry him. The feelings of loss were compounded by the loss of Evan’s identical twin, Kevin, who had died in a boating accident at age 12. Christina realized that she had not allowed herself to fully grieve the earlier loss because she poured herself into her surviving son. Both her sons were on the capsizing boat that took Kevin’s life, and she is thankful she did not lose them both.	Christina, a married 48-year-old Black woman, came to therapy feeling depressed, directionless, useless, and without purpose after her only living son, Evan, graduated from medical school, moved across the country for employment, and asked his girlfriend to marry him. The feelings of loss were compounded by the loss of Evan’s identical twin, Kevin, who had died in a boating accident at age 12. Christina realized that she had not allowed herself to fully grieve the earlier loss because she poured herself into her surviving son. Both her sons were on the capsizing boat that took Kevin’s life, and she is thankful she did not lose them both.	Кристина, замужняя 48-летняя чернокожая женщина, пришла на терапию с чувством депрессии, бесцельности, бесполезности и бесцельности после того, как ее единственный живой сын Эван окончил медицинскую школу, переехал через всю страну в поисках работы и попросил свою девушку выйти за него замуж. Чувство утраты усугублялось потерей однояйцевого близнеца Эвана, Кевина, который погиб в катастрофе в возрасте 12 лет. Кристина осознала, что не позволила себе полностью оплакать предыдущую потерю, потому что отдала себя выжившему сыну. Оба ее сына были на перевернувшейся лодке, которая унесла жизнь Кевина, и она благодарна, что не потеряла их обоих.	Christina, a married 48-year-old Black woman, came to therapy feeling depressed, directionless, useless, and without purpose after her only living son, Evan, graduated from medical school, moved across the country for employment, and asked his girlfriend to marry him. The feelings of loss were compounded by the loss of Evan’s identical twin, Kevin, who had died in a boating accident at age 12. Christina realized that she had not allowed herself to fully grieve the earlier loss because she poured herself into her surviving son. Both her sons were on the capsizing boat that took Kevin’s life, and she is thankful she did not lose them both.
Prior to Kevin’s death, Christina had a vibrant social life. She belonged to local clubs. She spent time traveling with her family and with girlfriends. She was active in her church. She worked in her husband’s medical practice as the office manager. However, after the loss of Kevin, she collapsed her life to solely focusing on Evan. He became the center of her world. She pulled back from social engagements. She quit her job. The one connection she maintained outside of her family was to the church. She explained it was the one connection that “kept me from losing my mind.”	Prior to Kevin’s death, Christina had a vibrant social life. She belonged to local clubs. She spent time traveling with her family and with girlfriends. She was active in her church. She worked in her husband’s medical practice as the office manager. However, after the loss of Kevin, she collapsed her life to solely focusing on Evan. He became the center of her world. She pulled back from social engagements. She quit her job. The one connection she maintained outside of her family was to the church. She explained it was the one connection that “kept me from losing my mind.”	До смерти Кевина Кристина вела яркую светскую жизнь. Она принадлежала к местным клубам. Она проводила время, путешествуя со своей семьей и подругами. Она была активна в своей церкви. Она работала в медицинской практике мужа офис-менеджером. Однако после потери Кевина она изменила свою жизнь, сосредоточившись исключительно на Эване. Он стал центром ее мира. Она отказалась от социальных обязательств. Она ушла с работы. Единственная связь, которую она поддерживала за пределами своей семьи, была с церковью. Она объяснила, что это была единственная связь, которая «не давала мне сойти с ума».	Prior to Kevin’s death, Christina had a vibrant social life. She belonged to local clubs. She spent time traveling with her family and with girlfriends. She was active in her church. She worked in her husband’s medical practice as the office manager. However, after the loss of Kevin, she collapsed her life to solely focusing on Evan. He became the center of her world. She pulled back from social engagements. She quit her job. The one connection she maintained outside of her family was to the church. She explained it was the one connection that “kept me from losing my mind.”
Our work together was long and arduous. Christina’s system was highly protective and did not want to address the connection between Evan’s launch into adult life and the earlier loss of his twin, Kevin. She felt comfortable talking about being an empty nester and her desire to find purpose, yet she was unwilling to accept that her son did not need her in the same capacity he once did. She found his behavior toward her dismissive and hurtful. She was jealous of the amount of time he spent with his fiancée and resented how little time he had for her and his father. I noticed an overinvestment in her son’s life and little focus on her own, even though she had come into therapy with the stated goal of finding purpose in her life for that very reason: so she wouldn’t be hyper-focused on and enmeshed with her son. I realized that to help her create purpose in her life as an empty nester, we would have to come into relationship with the parts of her that were experiencing grief, which she called depression.	Our work together was long and arduous. Christina’s system was highly protective and did not want to address the connection between Evan’s launch into adult life and the earlier loss of his twin, Kevin. She felt comfortable talking about being an empty nester and her desire to find purpose, yet she was unwilling to accept that her son did not need her in the same capacity he once did. She found his behavior toward her dismissive and hurtful. She was jealous of the amount of time he spent with his fiancée and resented how little time he had for her and his father. I noticed an overinvestment in her son’s life and little focus on her own, even though she had come into therapy with the stated goal of finding purpose in her life for that very reason: so she wouldn’t be hyper-focused on and enmeshed with her son. I realized that to help her create purpose in her life as an empty nester, we would have to come into relationship with the parts of her that were experiencing grief, which she called depression.	Наша совместная работа была долгой и трудной. Система Кристины была очень защитной и не хотела учитывать связь между выходом Эвана во взрослую жизнь и более ранней потерей его близнеца Кевина. Ей было комфортно говорить о том, что она пустое гнездо, и о своем желании найти цель, но она не желала признавать, что ее сын не нуждался в ней в том же качестве, в котором он когда-то нуждался. Она нашла его поведение по отношению к ней пренебрежительным и обидным. Она завидовала тому, сколько времени он проводил со своей невестой, и возмущалась, как мало времени он уделял ей и своему отцу. Я заметил чрезмерный вклад в жизнь ее сына и мало внимания к себе, хотя она пришла на терапию с заявленной целью найти цель в своей жизни именно по этой причине: чтобы она не была чрезмерно сосредоточена на ней и не была запуталась в ней. ее сын. Я понял, что для того, чтобы помочь ей найти цель в ее жизни в пустом гнезде, нам придется установить отношения с теми частями ее личности, которые испытывают горе, которое она называет депрессией.	Our work together was long and arduous. Christina’s system was highly protective and did not want to address the connection between Evan’s launch into adult life and the earlier loss of his twin, Kevin. She felt comfortable talking about being an empty nester and her desire to find purpose, yet she was unwilling to accept that her son did not need her in the same capacity he once did. She found his behavior toward her dismissive and hurtful. She was jealous of the amount of time he spent with his fiancée and resented how little time he had for her and his father. I noticed an overinvestment in her son’s life and little focus on her own, even though she had come into therapy with the stated goal of finding purpose in her life for that very reason: so she wouldn’t be hyper-focused on and enmeshed with her son. I realized that to help her create purpose in her life as an empty nester, we would have to come into relationship with the parts of her that were experiencing grief, which she called depression.
Christina made many attempts to re-engage life by resuming activities she had found fulfilling before Kevin’s death. She tried crocheting, which had been an enjoyable stress reliever in the past. This time, though, she would start projects, lose interest, and not finish them. Then she would take on a new project with renewed excitement, but within a few weeks she’d discard the new project too. She would make promises to her friends to get together, then cancel as the date approached, sometimes even on the day of the event. She even considered going back to work in her husband’s practice or returning to school for an advanced degree, but found reasons not to follow through on either. Her life remained reduced to housekeeping and church.	Christina made many attempts to re-engage life by resuming activities she had found fulfilling before Kevin’s death. She tried crocheting, which had been an enjoyable stress reliever in the past. This time, though, she would start projects, lose interest, and not finish them. Then she would take on a new project with renewed excitement, but within a few weeks she’d discard the new project too. She would make promises to her friends to get together, then cancel as the date approached, sometimes even on the day of the event. She even considered going back to work in her husband’s practice or returning to school for an advanced degree, but found reasons not to follow through on either. Her life remained reduced to housekeeping and church.	Кристина предприняла множество попыток вернуться к жизни, возобновив деятельность, которая приносила ей удовлетворение до смерти Кевина. Она попробовала вязать крючком, что раньше помогало ей снять стресс. Однако на этот раз она начала проекты, потеряла интерес и не завершила их. Затем она с новым энтузиазмом бралась за новый проект, но через несколько недель отказывалась и от нового проекта. Она обещала своим друзьям собраться вместе, а затем отменяла их по мере приближения даты, иногда даже в день мероприятия. Она даже подумывала о том, чтобы вернуться к работе в практике мужа или вернуться в школу, чтобы получить ученую степень, но нашла причины не доводить дело до конца. Ее жизнь по-прежнему сводилась к ведению домашнего хозяйства и церкви.	Christina made many attempts to re-engage life by resuming activities she had found fulfilling before Kevin’s death.
