I extend curiosity too, because I am genuinely interested in the root of her panicked state. I begin to deepen our connection by silently being with Antsy, with my hand on my heart, allowing her to feel my presence with her.	Первое, что я делаю после того, как Антси рассталась, — это сочувствую ей. Я хочу, чтобы она испытала то, что я к ней чувствую. Я также проявляю любопытство, потому что меня искренне интересует причина ее панического состояния. Я начинаю углублять нашу связь, молча находясь с Энси, положив руку на сердце, позволяя ей чувствовать мое присутствие с ней.	The first thing I do after Antsy unblends is extend compassion toward her. I want her to experience what I feel for her. I extend curiosity too, because I am genuinely interested in the root of her panicked state. I begin to deepen our connection by silently being with Antsy, with my hand on my heart, allowing her to feel my presence with her.
Compassionately I ask, “What’s causing you panic right now?” Antsy responds, “It’s terrifying to get everything I’ve always wanted. I’m terrified. This is so scary for me.” A torrent of Antsy’s tears streams down my face with this revelation. I experience it as an emotional release of what she has been holding as she acknowledges her terror out loud. I tell Antsy that she doesn’t have to be alone in her fear. I reassure her that I am with her and will not leave her. I reassure her that she doesn’t have to do anything. I can be with her and handle what terrifies her. I assure her that if she remains separate from me like she is right now in the face of what scares her, I can support her as she moves forward. She responds with an audible sigh, which causes my body to relax even more. The chest pain, although still present, lessens, and the fast heartbeat and grip are less intense. She says, “I didn’t know you were here. I thought I had to handle what comes next by myself.”	Compassionately I ask, “What’s causing you panic right now?” Antsy responds, “It’s terrifying to get everything I’ve always wanted. I’m terrified. This is so scary for me.” A torrent of Antsy’s tears streams down my face with this revelation. I experience it as an emotional release of what she has been holding as she acknowledges her terror out loud. I tell Antsy that she doesn’t have to be alone in her fear. I reassure her that I am with her and will not leave her. I reassure her that she doesn’t have to do anything. I can be with her and handle what terrifies her. I assure her that if she remains separate from me like she is right now in the face of what scares her, I can support her as she moves forward. She responds with an audible sigh, which causes my body to relax even more. The chest pain, although still present, lessens, and the fast heartbeat and grip are less intense. She says, “I didn’t know you were here. I thought I had to handle what comes next by myself.”	Я сочувственно спрашиваю: «Что вызывает у вас сейчас панику?» Энси отвечает: «Ужасно получить все, что я всегда хотел. Я в ужасе. Это так страшно для меня». При этом откровении по моему лицу текут потоки слез Анси. Я переживаю это как эмоциональное освобождение от того, что она держала в себе, когда она вслух признает свой ужас. Я говорю Энси, что ей не обязательно оставаться одной в своем страхе. Я успокаиваю ее, что я с ней и не оставлю ее. Я успокаиваю ее, что ей не нужно ничего делать. Я могу быть с ней и справиться с тем, что ее пугает. Я уверяю ее, что если она останется отдельно от меня, как сейчас, перед лицом того, что ее пугает, я смогу поддержать ее в ее движении вперед. Она отвечает громким вздохом, отчего мое тело расслабляется еще больше. Боль в груди, хотя и присутствует, уменьшается, а учащенное сердцебиение и хватка становятся менее интенсивными. Она говорит: «Я не знала, что ты здесь. Я думал, что мне придется справиться с тем, что будет дальше, самому».	Compassionately I ask, “What’s causing you panic right now?” Antsy responds, “It’s terrifying to get everything I’ve always wanted. I’m terrified. This is so scary for me.” A torrent of Antsy’s tears streams down my face with this revelation. I experience it as an emotional release of what she has been holding as she acknowledges her terror out loud. I tell Antsy that she doesn’t have to be alone in her fear. I reassure her that I am with her and will not leave her. I reassure her that she doesn’t have to do anything. I can be with her and handle what terrifies her. I assure her that if she remains separate from me like she is right now in the face of what scares her, I can support her as she moves forward. She responds with an audible sigh, which causes my body to relax even more. The chest pain, although still present, lessens, and the fast heartbeat and grip are less intense. She says, “I didn’t know you were here. I thought I had to handle what comes next by myself.”
Antsy reminds me of the significant achievements I’ve accomplished in the past two years. The last two of my five children were launched. My husband and I embarked on a dream, seven years in the making, of becoming permanent international travelers. I achieved the goal of becoming an IFS Solo lead trainer after a five-year process, and I signed a contract with Hay House for the publication of this book.	Antsy reminds me of the significant achievements I’ve accomplished in the past two years. The last two of my five children were launched. My husband and I embarked on a dream, seven years in the making, of becoming permanent international travelers. I achieved the goal of becoming an IFS Solo lead trainer after a five-year process, and I signed a contract with Hay House for the publication of this book.	Antsy напоминает мне о значительных достижениях, которых я достиг за последние два года. Последние двое из моих пяти детей были выпущены на воду. Мы с мужем осуществили семилетнюю мечту — стать постоянными путешественниками за границу. После пятилетнего процесса я достиг цели стать ведущим тренером IFS Solo и подписал контракт с Hay House на публикацию этой книги.	Antsy reminds me of the significant achievements I’ve accomplished in the past two years. The last two of my five children were launched. My husband and I embarked on a dream, seven years in the making, of becoming permanent international travelers. I achieved the goal of becoming an IFS Solo lead trainer after a five-year process, and I signed a contract with Hay House for the publication of this book.
“All of this goodness reminds me of the fear I felt when graduating from college with plans to pursue a master’s degree in social work,” Antsy tells me. “Do you remember how scary that was?”	“All of this goodness reminds me of the fear I felt when graduating from college with plans to pursue a master’s degree in social work,” Antsy tells me. “Do you remember how scary that was?”	«Вся эта доброта напоминает мне о страхе, который я испытывал, когда заканчивал колледж и планировал получить степень магистра в области социальной работы», — говорит мне Антси. — Ты помнишь, как это было страшно?	“All of this goodness reminds me of the fear I felt when graduating from college with plans to pursue a master’s degree in social work,” Antsy tells me. “Do you remember how scary that was?”
“Yes, I do remember your panic back then. What’s the connection between now and then?”	“Yes, I do remember your panic back then. What’s the connection between now and then?”	«Да, я помню твою тогдашнюю панику. Какая связь между сейчас и тогда?»	“Yes, I do remember your panic back then. What’s the connection between now and then?”
“I want you to be successful. I want you to fulfill your dreams and goals, and it scares me when you do.”	“I want you to be successful. I want you to fulfill your dreams and goals, and it scares me when you do.”	«Я хочу, чтобы ты добился успеха. Я хочу, чтобы ты осуществил свои мечты и цели, и меня пугает, когда ты это делаешь».	“I want you to be successful. I want you to fulfill your dreams and goals, and it scares me when you do.”
“I’m not sure I’m understanding the connection between wanting me to succeed and getting fearful when I do.”	“I’m not sure I’m understanding the connection between wanting me to succeed and getting fearful when I do.”	«Я не уверен, что понимаю связь между желанием добиться успеха и страхом, когда я это делаю».	“I’m not sure I’m understanding the connection between wanting me to succeed and getting fearful when I do.”
Antsy takes a deep breath in and lets out a loud sigh. “I cause you to feel anxious when we begin a goal. I do this because I want to push you to get what you set out to achieve. I want to motivate you to stay on track, to not stop. The anxiety is there so you don’t lose sight of what you want.”	Antsy takes a deep breath in and lets out a loud sigh. “I cause you to feel anxious when we begin a goal. I do this because I want to push you to get what you set out to achieve. I want to motivate you to stay on track, to not stop. The anxiety is there so you don’t lose sight of what you want.”	Энси глубоко вздыхает и громко вздыхает. «Я заставляю вас чувствовать беспокойство, когда мы приступаем к достижению цели. Я делаю это, потому что хочу подтолкнуть вас к достижению того, чего вы намеревались достичь. Я хочу мотивировать вас оставаться на правильном пути и не останавливаться. Тревога присутствует, поэтому вы не упускаете из виду то, чего хотите».	Antsy takes a deep breath in and lets out a loud sigh. “I cause you to feel anxious when we begin a goal. I do this because I want to push you to get what you set out to achieve. I want to motivate you to stay on track, to not stop. The anxiety is there so you don’t lose sight of what you want.”
Nodding, I say, “It sounds like you become invested in my goal and work hard to support me in getting there.”	Nodding, I say, “It sounds like you become invested in my goal and work hard to support me in getting there.”	Кивнув, я говорю: «Похоже, что ты увлекся моей целью и усердно работаешь, чтобы поддержать меня в ее достижении».	Nodding, I say, “It sounds like you become invested in my goal and work hard to support me in getting there.”
“Yeah, but when you achieve many things at once, I become overwhelmed and panicky, like now. I worry that you’re reaching for too much and you’ll fail. I panic because I’m terrified of your failure. My job is to help you achieve.”	“Yeah, but when you achieve many things at once, I become overwhelmed and panicky, like now. I worry that you’re reaching for too much and you’ll fail. I panic because I’m terrified of your failure. My job is to help you achieve.”	«Да, но когда ты добиваешься многого одновременно, я становлюсь подавленным и паникую, как сейчас. Я беспокоюсь, что вы стремитесь к слишком многому и потерпите неудачу. Я паникую, потому что боюсь твоей неудачи. Моя задача – помочь вам добиться успеха».	“Yeah, but when you achieve many things at once, I become overwhelmed and panicky, like now. I worry that you’re reaching for too much and you’ll fail. I panic because I’m terrified of your failure. My job is to help you achieve.”
When Antsy shares this, I feel the emotion of another part coming to the surface. Tears well in my eyes. This other part is the exile that Antsy protects by keeping busy helping me achieve. I turn my attention calmly to the exile and say, “I feel you here. I promise I’ll come back and talk with you. Can you relax back and allow space for me to spend more time with Antsy?” I feel the desperation of this little one as it softens back.	When Antsy shares this, I feel the emotion of another part coming to the surface. Tears well in my eyes. This other part is the exile that Antsy protects by keeping busy helping me achieve. I turn my attention calmly to the exile and say, “I feel you here. I promise I’ll come back and talk with you. Can you relax back and allow space for me to spend more time with Antsy?” I feel the desperation of this little one as it softens back.	Когда Антси делится этим, я чувствую, как на поверхность выходят эмоции другой части. Слёзы на глазах. Другая часть — это изгнанник, которого Антси защищает, помогая мне достичь цели. Я спокойно обращаю внимание на изгнанника и говорю: «Я чувствую тебя здесь. Обещаю, что вернусь и поговорю с тобой. Можете ли вы расслабиться и дать мне возможность проводить больше времени с Антси?» Я чувствую отчаяние этого малыша, когда он смягчается.	When Antsy shares this, I feel the emotion of another part coming to the surface. Tears well in my eyes. This other part is the exile that Antsy protects by keeping busy helping me achieve. I turn my attention calmly to the exile and say, “I feel you here. I promise I’ll come back and talk with you. Can you relax back and allow space for me to spend more time with Antsy?” I feel the desperation of this little one as it softens back.
“Tell me more about your terror of my failure.”	“Tell me more about your terror of my failure.”	«Расскажи мне больше о своем ужасе перед моей неудачей».	“Tell me more about your terror of my failure.”
“Maybe it’s my failure I’m afraid of. Maybe I’m afraid I will fail at keeping you adequately motivated. You’re always reaching for the next big thing, and I don’t know that I can keep up with your bigger and grander goals.”	“Maybe it’s my failure I’m afraid of. Maybe I’m afraid I will fail at keeping you adequately motivated. You’re always reaching for the next big thing, and I don’t know that I can keep up with your bigger and grander goals.”	«Может быть, я боюсь своей неудачи. Возможно, я боюсь, что мне не удастся поддерживать в вас адекватную мотивацию. Ты всегда стремишься к чему-то новому, и я не знаю, смогу ли я идти в ногу с твоими более масштабными и грандиозными целями».	“Maybe it’s my failure I’m afraid of. Maybe I’m afraid I will fail at keeping you adequately motivated. You’re always reaching for the next big thing, and I don’t know that I can keep up with your bigger and grander goals.”
“Antsy, when did you start motivating me in this way?”	“Antsy, when did you start motivating me in this way?”	— Энси, когда ты начал меня таким образом мотивировать?	“Antsy, when did you start motivating me in this way?”
“Probably when you were in elementary school.”	“Probably when you were in elementary school.”	— Наверное, когда ты учился в начальной школе.	“Probably when you were in elementary school.”
Interestedly, I ask, “What was going on during elementary school to cause you to use anxiety as a way to motivate me?”	Interestedly, I ask, “What was going on during elementary school to cause you to use anxiety as a way to motivate me?”	Я с интересом спрашиваю: «Что происходило в начальной школе, что заставило тебя использовать тревогу как способ мотивировать меня?»	Interestedly, I ask, “What was going on during elementary school to cause you to use anxiety as a way to motivate me?”
“I noticed that everyone around you responded positively when you achieved. Your parents were happy and proud and showed you love. Your teachers supported and encouraged your success. So I wanted more of those good feelings for you.”	“I noticed that everyone around you responded positively when you achieved. Your parents were happy and proud and showed you love. Your teachers supported and encouraged your success. So I wanted more of those good feelings for you.”	«Я заметил, что все вокруг положительно реагировали на ваши достижения. Твои родители были счастливы и горды и проявили к тебе любовь. Ваши учителя поддерживали и поощряли ваши успехи. Поэтому я хотел, чтобы к тебе было больше этих добрых чувств».	“I noticed that everyone around you responded positively when you achieved. Your parents were happy and proud and showed you love. Your teachers supported and encouraged your success. So I wanted more of those good feelings for you.”
“Antsy, I’m wondering what you’re afraid would happen if you did not cause anxiety and panic.”	“Antsy, I’m wondering what you’re afraid would happen if you did not cause anxiety and panic.”	«Энтси, мне интересно, чего бы ты боялся, если бы ты не вызывал беспокойства и паники».	“Antsy, I’m wondering what you’re afraid would happen if you did not cause anxiety and panic.”
“Failure!” Antsy shouts.	“Failure!” Antsy shouts.	"Отказ!" — кричит Энси.	“Failure!” Antsy shouts.
“Okay, what are you afraid would happen if we failed?” Antsy sits quietly, with her arms crossed, as she thinks. When she speaks, her voice is much lower. “I’m afraid that if we failed, no one would see you as valuable, and you’d be unlovable and alone.”	“Okay, what are you afraid would happen if we failed?” Antsy sits quietly, with her arms crossed, as she thinks. When she speaks, her voice is much lower. “I’m afraid that if we failed, no one would see you as valuable, and you’d be unlovable and alone.”	«Хорошо, а чего ты боишься, если мы потерпим неудачу?» Энси тихо сидит, скрестив руки, и думает. Когда она говорит, ее голос намного ниже. «Я боюсь, что если мы потерпим неудачу, никто не будет считать тебя ценным, и ты будешь непривлекательным и одиноким».	“Okay, what are you afraid would happen if we failed?” Antsy sits quietly, with her arms crossed, as she thinks. When she speaks, her voice is much lower. “I’m afraid that if we failed, no one would see you as valuable, and you’d be unlovable and alone.”
Over time, I have gained clarity that Antsy’s role in my system is achievement. She does an excellent job of creating a level of anxiety to motivate me to keep moving toward my goals. However, she experiences what feels like life-threatening panic when major goals are achieved. At these times, she finds herself in a transitional space of not knowing what I will pursue next and, more importantly, whether she can measure up to the next challenge. She uses my entire body to communicate her terror of failure. Antsy believes I receive love by achieving. Ultimately, she is protecting me from feeling unlovable and being alone. The only way to learn the true purpose behind the extreme behaviors and beliefs of our parts is to come into relationship with them through befriending. When we show them genuine interests, they feel seen and valued, which encourages them to trust us enough to share.	Over time, I have gained clarity that Antsy’s role in my system is achievement. She does an excellent job of creating a level of anxiety to motivate me to keep moving toward my goals. However, she experiences what feels like life-threatening panic when major goals are achieved. At these times, she finds herself in a transitional space of not knowing what I will pursue next and, more importantly, whether she can measure up to the next challenge. She uses my entire body to communicate her terror of failure. Antsy believes I receive love by achieving. Ultimately, she is protecting me from feeling unlovable and being alone. The only way to learn the true purpose behind the extreme behaviors and beliefs of our parts is to come into relationship with them through befriending. When we show them genuine interests, they feel seen and valued, which encourages them to trust us enough to share.	Со временем я понял, что роль Antsy в моей системе — это достижения. Она отлично справляется с созданием определенного уровня тревоги, мотивирующей меня продолжать двигаться к своим целям. Однако, когда основные цели достигнуты, она испытывает нечто похожее на опасную для жизни панику. В такие моменты она оказывается в переходном состоянии, когда не знает, чем я буду заниматься дальше и, что более важно, сможет ли она справиться со следующим испытанием. Она использует все мое тело, чтобы выразить свой ужас перед неудачей. Энси считает, что я получаю любовь, достигая чего-то. В конечном счете, она защищает меня от чувства непривлекательности и одиночества. Единственный способ узнать истинную цель экстремального поведения и убеждений наших частей — это вступить с ними в отношения, подружившись с ними. Когда мы показываем им искренние интересы, они чувствуют, что их видят и ценят, что побуждает их достаточно доверять нам, чтобы делиться.	Over time, I have gained clarity that Antsy’s role in my system is achievement. She does an excellent job of creating a level of anxiety to motivate me to keep moving toward my goals. However, she experiences what feels like life-threatening panic when major goals are achieved. At these times, she finds herself in a transitional space of not knowing what I will pursue next and, more importantly, whether she can measure up to the next challenge. She uses my entire body to communicate her terror of failure. Antsy believes I receive love by achieving. Ultimately, she is protecting me from feeling unlovable and being alone. The only way to learn the true purpose behind the extreme behaviors and beliefs of our parts is to come into relationship with them through befriending. When we show them genuine interests, they feel seen and valued, which encourages them to trust us enough to share.
IFS CONCEPT 1: BEFRIEND	IFS CONCEPT 1: BEFRIEND	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 1: ДРУГ	IFS CONCEPT 1: BEFRIEND
Befriending is getting to know a part by interacting with it and building a Self-to-part relationship. Parts are leading the system because they lack awareness of Self or, if they do have awareness, they don’t trust Self. Therefore, our protectors continue in the extreme roles they have taken on because they believe they don’t have any other choice. They do not know they can rely on Self as a resource to guide, support, and heal. Before Self can befriend a part, there needs to be awareness of the part in or around the body. We have to notice the part before we can come into relationship with it. Once there is a sense of the part, we may have to ask the part to unblend or separate from us, allowing us to come into relationship with it. We know Self is preparing to befriend the part and not another part, when we experience one of the qualities of Self, compassion, curiosity, calm, connectedness, clarity, confidence, courage, or creativity toward the part. If we feel something other than a Self quality, then another part is present, and we need to ask that part to step back. For example, when I felt the energy of the young exile while working with Antsy, I asked that part to step back and allow Antsy and me more time.	Befriending is getting to know a part by interacting with it and building a Self-to-part relationship. Parts are leading the system because they lack awareness of Self or, if they do have awareness, they don’t trust Self. Therefore, our protectors continue in the extreme roles they have taken on because they believe they don’t have any other choice. They do not know they can rely on Self as a resource to guide, support, and heal. Before Self can befriend a part, there needs to be awareness of the part in or around the body. We have to notice the part before we can come into relationship with it. Once there is a sense of the part, we may have to ask the part to unblend or separate from us, allowing us to come into relationship with it. We know Self is preparing to befriend the part and not another part, when we experience one of the qualities of Self, compassion, curiosity, calm, connectedness, clarity, confidence, courage, or creativity toward the part. If we feel something other than a Self quality, then another part is present, and we need to ask that part to step back. For example, when I felt the energy of the young exile while working with Antsy, I asked that part to step back and allow Antsy and me more time.	Подружиться — значит узнать часть, взаимодействуя с ней и выстраивая отношения «Я-часть». Части руководят системой, потому что им не хватает осознания «Я», а если оно и есть, то они не доверяют «Я». Поэтому наши защитники продолжают выполнять экстремальные роли, которые они взяли на себя, потому что считают, что у них нет другого выбора. Они не знают, что могут полагаться на «Я» как на ресурс, направляющий, поддерживающий и исцеляющий. Прежде чем «Я» сможет подружиться с частью, необходимо осознать эту часть внутри тела или вокруг него. Мы должны заметить эту часть, прежде чем мы сможем вступить с ней в отношения. Как только мы почувствуем часть, нам, возможно, придется попросить эту часть отделиться от нас, позволив нам войти в отношения с ней. Мы знаем, что «Я» готовится подружиться с этой частью, а не с другой частью, когда мы испытываем одно из качеств «Я»: сострадание, любопытство, спокойствие, связанность, ясность, уверенность, смелость или творческий подход по отношению к части. Если мы чувствуем что-то иное, чем качество Самости, значит, присутствует другая часть, и нам нужно попросить эту часть отступить. Например, когда я почувствовал энергию молодого изгнанника во время работы с Антси, я попросил эту часть отступить и дать нам с Антси больше времени.	Befriending is getting to know a part by interacting with it and building a Self-to-part relationship. Parts are leading the system because they lack awareness of Self or, if they do have awareness, they don’t trust Self. Therefore, our protectors continue in the extreme roles they have taken on because they believe they don’t have any other choice. They do not know they can rely on Self as a resource to guide, support, and heal. Before Self can befriend a part, there needs to be awareness of the part in or around the body. We have to notice the part before we can come into relationship with it. Once there is a sense of the part, we may have to ask the part to unblend or separate from us, allowing us to come into relationship with it. We know Self is preparing to befriend the part and not another part, when we experience one of the qualities of Self, compassion, curiosity, calm, connectedness, clarity, confidence, courage, or creativity toward the part. If we feel something other than a Self quality, then another part is present, and we need to ask that part to step back. For example, when I felt the energy of the young exile while working with Antsy, I asked that part to step back and allow Antsy and me more time.
When we experience one of the eight Cs, or essential qualities of Self, toward a part, we want to share that energy with the part by directing it toward the part. If we’re feeling connected to the part, we want to energetically share that connectedness with the part. Often, the part will relax or express curiosity or interest in us. We want to extend the energy of Self until we notice some change in the part. This may happen quickly, or it may take some time. If we are feeling compassion or curiosity or any other quality in addition to connection, we want to extend that energy too. This is especially true if the part is skeptical of Self or takes longer to relax in the presence of Self. Proximity also helps parts connect with Self. If the part is at a distance or has its back turned or seems disinterested, moving physically closer to the part while extending the energy of one of the eight Cs may open the part to the presence of Self.	When we experience one of the eight Cs, or essential qualities of Self, toward a part, we want to share that energy with the part by directing it toward the part. If we’re feeling connected to the part, we want to energetically share that connectedness with the part. Often, the part will relax or express curiosity or interest in us. We want to extend the energy of Self until we notice some change in the part. This may happen quickly, or it may take some time. If we are feeling compassion or curiosity or any other quality in addition to connection, we want to extend that energy too. This is especially true if the part is skeptical of Self or takes longer to relax in the presence of Self. Proximity also helps parts connect with Self. If the part is at a distance or has its back turned or seems disinterested, moving physically closer to the part while extending the energy of one of the eight Cs may open the part to the presence of Self.	Когда мы испытываем одно из восьми С, или существенных качеств Самости, по отношению к части, мы хотим поделиться этой энергией с частью, направляя ее на эту часть. Если мы чувствуем связь с частью, мы хотим энергетически поделиться этой связью с частью. Часто эта часть расслабляется или выражает любопытство или интерес к нам. Мы хотим расширять энергию «Я» до тех пор, пока не заметим какое-то изменение в этой части. Это может произойти быстро, а может занять некоторое время. Если мы чувствуем сострадание, любопытство или какое-либо другое качество помимо связи, мы хотим расширить и эту энергию. Это особенно верно, если часть скептически относится к «Я» или ей требуется больше времени, чтобы расслабиться в присутствии «Я». Близость также помогает частям соединиться с «Я». Если часть находится на расстоянии, повернута спиной или кажется незаинтересованной, физическое перемещение ближе к части, одновременно расширяя энергию одного из восьми С, может открыть часть для присутствия Самости.	When we experience one of the eight Cs, or essential qualities of Self, toward a part, we want to share that energy with the part by directing it toward the part. If we’re feeling connected to the part, we want to energetically share that connectedness with the part. Often, the part will relax or express curiosity or interest in us. We want to extend the energy of Self until we notice some change in the part. This may happen quickly, or it may take some time. If we are feeling compassion or curiosity or any other quality in addition to connection, we want to extend that energy too. This is especially true if the part is skeptical of Self or takes longer to relax in the presence of Self. Proximity also helps parts connect with Self. If the part is at a distance or has its back turned or seems disinterested, moving physically closer to the part while extending the energy of one of the eight Cs may open the part to the presence of Self.
There are several ways to deepen the befriending process. When we extend the quality of Self toward the part, we want to notice how the part responds. This provides information about how interested the part is in connecting with us. Does the part relax or ignore us? Do we get the sense that a different part is present? We want the part to notice Self. If the part has no awareness of Self before this interaction, it may take it a while to acknowledge or understand what is happening. We want to allow time for the part to feel our presence with it. We can slow down and take our time at this point and be with the part in a way that feels right for the part. Different parts of us will need different amounts and kinds of connection and energy from Self. They are not one-size-fits-all parts. However, because of the intuitive nature of Self, we will know how to engage our parts, giving them what they need in the present. Once the part notices Self, relaxes, or seems interested, we let the part know we want to get to know it better. As the part shares about itself, we want to express genuine curiosity, validating and demonstrating compassion for the part’s experiences. We also want to learn how the part protects us. The conversation with the part is not one-sided. We can say what we would like to say or ask of the part.	There are several ways to deepen the befriending process. When we extend the quality of Self toward the part, we want to notice how the part responds. This provides information about how interested the part is in connecting with us. Does the part relax or ignore us? Do we get the sense that a different part is present? We want the part to notice Self. If the part has no awareness of Self before this interaction, it may take it a while to acknowledge or understand what is happening. We want to allow time for the part to feel our presence with it. We can slow down and take our time at this point and be with the part in a way that feels right for the part. Different parts of us will need different amounts and kinds of connection and energy from Self. They are not one-size-fits-all parts. However, because of the intuitive nature of Self, we will know how to engage our parts, giving them what they need in the present. Once the part notices Self, relaxes, or seems interested, we let the part know we want to get to know it better. As the part shares about itself, we want to express genuine curiosity, validating and demonstrating compassion for the part’s experiences. We also want to learn how the part protects us. The conversation with the part is not one-sided. We can say what we would like to say or ask of the part.	Есть несколько способов углубить процесс дружбы. Когда мы распространяем качество Я на часть, мы хотим заметить, как эта часть реагирует. Это дает информацию о том, насколько заинтересована эта часть в контакте с нами. Часть расслабляется или игнорирует нас? Ощущаем ли мы, что присутствует другая часть? Мы хотим, чтобы эта часть заметила Я. Если перед этим взаимодействием часть не осознавала Себя, может потребоваться некоторое время, чтобы признать или понять, что происходит. Мы хотим дать части время почувствовать наше присутствие рядом с ней. На этом этапе мы можем замедлиться и не торопиться и работать с ролью так, как нам кажется правильным для этой роли. Разным частям нас потребуется разное количество и вид связи и энергии от «Я». Это не универсальные детали. Однако благодаря интуитивной природе «Я» мы будем знать, как задействовать свои части, давая им то, что им нужно в настоящем. Как только часть замечает «Я», расслабляется или проявляет интерес, мы даем ей понять, что хотим узнать ее получше. Когда часть рассказывает о себе, мы хотим выразить искреннее любопытство, подтверждая и демонстрируя сострадание к переживаниям части. Мы также хотим узнать, как эта часть нас защищает. Разговор с частью не односторонний. Мы можем сказать то, что хотели бы сказать или спросить о части.	There are several ways to deepen the befriending process. When we extend the quality of Self toward the part, we want to notice how the part responds. This provides information about how interested the part is in connecting with us. Does the part relax or ignore us? Do we get the sense that a different part is present? We want the part to notice Self. If the part has no awareness of Self before this interaction, it may take it a while to acknowledge or understand what is happening. We want to allow time for the part to feel our presence with it. We can slow down and take our time at this point and be with the part in a way that feels right for the part. Different parts of us will need different amounts and kinds of connection and energy from Self. They are not one-size-fits-all parts. However, because of the intuitive nature of Self, we will know how to engage our parts, giving them what they need in the present. Once the part notices Self, relaxes, or seems interested, we let the part know we want to get to know it better. As the part shares about itself, we want to express genuine curiosity, validating and demonstrating compassion for the part’s experiences. We also want to learn how the part protects us. The conversation with the part is not one-sided. We can say what we would like to say or ask of the part.
Let’s turn back to Antsy. When she separated or unblended from me by decreasing the intensity of somatic sensations, I (Self) was able to befriend her. To recap: I started by expressing curiosity about the cause of Antsy’s panic. I learned that she was terrified as I reached several significant life goals within a two-year period. Achieving the goal of successfully raising and launching five children with my husband allowed us to pursue the dream life of traveling internationally full-time. I had pursued the goal of writing a book for over 20 years and the goal of becoming an IFS Lead Trainer for five years. With these major accomplishments coming to fruition, Antsy’s terror of failure was amplified. She seemed to express anxiety while in pursuit of a goal, but panicked when the goal was attained.	Let’s turn back to Antsy. When she separated or unblended from me by decreasing the intensity of somatic sensations, I (Self) was able to befriend her. To recap: I started by expressing curiosity about the cause of Antsy’s panic. I learned that she was terrified as I reached several significant life goals within a two-year period. Achieving the goal of successfully raising and launching five children with my husband allowed us to pursue the dream life of traveling internationally full-time. I had pursued the goal of writing a book for over 20 years and the goal of becoming an IFS Lead Trainer for five years. With these major accomplishments coming to fruition, Antsy’s terror of failure was amplified. She seemed to express anxiety while in pursuit of a goal, but panicked when the goal was attained.	Вернемся к Анси. Когда она отделилась от меня или разделилась со мной, уменьшив интенсивность соматических ощущений, я (Самость) смог подружиться с ней. Подведем итог: я начал с того, что выразил любопытство по поводу причины паники Антси. Я узнал, что она была в ужасе, когда за два года я достиг нескольких важных жизненных целей. Достижение цели успешного воспитания и рождения пятерых детей вместе с моим мужем позволило нам осуществить мечту о путешествиях по всему миру на постоянной основе. Я преследовал цель написать книгу более 20 лет и стать ведущим тренером IFS в течение пяти лет. Когда эти важные достижения стали реальностью, ужас Антси перед неудачей усилился. Казалось, она выражала тревогу, преследуя цель, но запаниковала, когда цель была достигнута.	Let’s turn back to Antsy. When she separated or unblended from me by decreasing the intensity of somatic sensations, I (Self) was able to befriend her. To recap: I started by expressing curiosity about the cause of Antsy’s panic. I learned that she was terrified as I reached several significant life goals within a two-year period. Achieving the goal of successfully raising and launching five children with my husband allowed us to pursue the dream life of traveling internationally full-time. I had pursued the goal of writing a book for over 20 years and the goal of becoming an IFS Lead Trainer for five years. With these major accomplishments coming to fruition, Antsy’s terror of failure was amplified. She seemed to express anxiety while in pursuit of a goal, but panicked when the goal was attained.
As Self befriended Antsy, she experienced the presence of Self more fully. In a Self-led way, I continued to encourage her to calm and reassure her that she was safe. The placing of the hand on the heart was another way that Self let Antsy know she was not alone. Self is intuitive and had a sense that touch would deepen the connection with Antsy and help her to calm. Touch is a very powerful comforter for some parts. If touch is something your parts respond positively to, use it to support the unblending and befriending process. If not, that’s okay too. The use of a calming voice with words of reassurance is the basis for building a trusting relationship with parts.	As Self befriended Antsy, she experienced the presence of Self more fully. In a Self-led way, I continued to encourage her to calm and reassure her that she was safe. The placing of the hand on the heart was another way that Self let Antsy know she was not alone. Self is intuitive and had a sense that touch would deepen the connection with Antsy and help her to calm. Touch is a very powerful comforter for some parts. If touch is something your parts respond positively to, use it to support the unblending and befriending process. If not, that’s okay too. The use of a calming voice with words of reassurance is the basis for building a trusting relationship with parts.	Когда Селф подружился с Энси, она более полно ощутила присутствие Селфа. Самостоятельно я продолжал убеждать ее успокоиться и заверить ее, что она в безопасности. Положив руку на сердце, Селф дал понять Энси, что она не одна. Селф обладает интуицией и чувствовал, что прикосновение углубит связь с Энси и поможет ей успокоиться. Прикосновение — очень мощное утешительное средство для некоторых частей тела. Если прикосновение — это то, на что ваши части тела реагируют положительно, используйте его, чтобы поддержать процесс разделения и сближения. Если нет, это тоже нормально. Использование успокаивающего голоса со словами подбадривания – основа построения доверительных отношений с частями.	As Self befriended Antsy, she experienced the presence of Self more fully. In a Self-led way, I continued to encourage her to calm and reassure her that she was safe. The placing of the hand on the heart was another way that Self let Antsy know she was not alone. Self is intuitive and had a sense that touch would deepen the connection with Antsy and help her to calm. Touch is a very powerful comforter for some parts. If touch is something your parts respond positively to, use it to support the unblending and befriending process. If not, that’s okay too. The use of a calming voice with words of reassurance is the basis for building a trusting relationship with parts.
Self continued to befriend Antsy, allowing her to experience qualities of Self-energy. The qualities shared with Antsy were compassion, curiosity, calm, and connectedness. Self also took its time with her; there was no rush for her to do something or change states. During the befriending process, we learned about Antsy’s experiences, which encouraged the relationship to deepen. Self continued to express compassion with curiosity as it began to inquire about what is causing the panic. Self offered more acceptance and reassurance after Antsy shared her fears. She was encouraged to remain separate in times of high fear in order to be in relationship with Self, who can support her through the fear and panic about what comes next.	Self continued to befriend Antsy, allowing her to experience qualities of Self-energy. The qualities shared with Antsy were compassion, curiosity, calm, and connectedness. Self also took its time with her; there was no rush for her to do something or change states. During the befriending process, we learned about Antsy’s experiences, which encouraged the relationship to deepen. Self continued to express compassion with curiosity as it began to inquire about what is causing the panic. Self offered more acceptance and reassurance after Antsy shared her fears. She was encouraged to remain separate in times of high fear in order to be in relationship with Self, who can support her through the fear and panic about what comes next.	Селф продолжал дружить с Энси, позволяя ей ощутить качества энергии Самости. Качествами, общими для Антси, были сострадание, любопытство, спокойствие и коммуникабельность. Селф тоже не торопился с ней; ей не нужно было спешить что-то делать или менять состояние. В процессе дружбы мы узнали об опыте Антси, который способствовал углублению отношений. Селф продолжал с любопытством выражать сострадание и начал расспрашивать о том, что вызывает панику. После того, как Антси поделилась своими страхами, Селф выразила больше признания и уверенности. Ее поощряли оставаться отдельной во времена сильного страха, чтобы поддерживать отношения с Я, который может поддержать ее, несмотря на страх и панику по поводу того, что будет дальше.	Self continued to befriend Antsy, allowing her to experience qualities of Self-energy. The qualities shared with Antsy were compassion, curiosity, calm, and connectedness. Self also took its time with her; there was no rush for her to do something or change states. During the befriending process, we learned about Antsy’s experiences, which encouraged the relationship to deepen. Self continued to express compassion with curiosity as it began to inquire about what is causing the panic. Self offered more acceptance and reassurance after Antsy shared her fears. She was encouraged to remain separate in times of high fear in order to be in relationship with Self, who can support her through the fear and panic about what comes next.
Self can only befriend parts after they unblend. Antsy did not quickly unblend; she did so with the reassuring support of Self. However, parts don’t always unblend even with encouragement and patience. When this happens, Self needs to discover and address the reasons parts won’t unblend. Unblending is necessary to befriend our parts.	Self can only befriend parts after they unblend. Antsy did not quickly unblend; she did so with the reassuring support of Self. However, parts don’t always unblend even with encouragement and patience. When this happens, Self needs to discover and address the reasons parts won’t unblend. Unblending is necessary to befriend our parts.	«Я» может подружиться с частями только после того, как они разъединятся. Энси не сразу растаял; она сделала это при обнадеживающей поддержке Селфа. Однако части не всегда сливаются воедино даже при поддержке и терпении. Когда это происходит, «Я» необходимо обнаружить и устранить причины, по которым части не сливаются. Растворение необходимо, чтобы подружиться с нашими частями.	Self can only befriend parts after they unblend. Antsy did not quickly unblend; she did so with the reassuring support of Self. However, parts don’t always unblend even with encouragement and patience. When this happens, Self needs to discover and address the reasons parts won’t unblend. Unblending is necessary to befriend our parts.
IFS CONCEPT 2: FLESH OUT	IFS CONCEPT 2: FLESH OUT	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 2: КОНКРЕТНОСТЬ	IFS CONCEPT 2: FLESH OUT
Fleshing out is how we get to know more about our parts and build a deeper, trusting relationship between them and Self. Once we befriend a part, we can ask the part what it would like to share about itself and its experiences. I think about fleshing out as how we might engage a dear friend as they share something difficult about their life or history. We would listen, ask questions based on what they are sharing, show interest and care. This is what Self does: it supports the unfolding of the part’s story and sharing. Self does a good job reflecting to the part the hardship, pain, confusion, overwhelm, or anything else the part is experiencing.	Fleshing out is how we get to know more about our parts and build a deeper, trusting relationship between them and Self. Once we befriend a part, we can ask the part what it would like to share about itself and its experiences. I think about fleshing out as how we might engage a dear friend as they share something difficult about their life or history. We would listen, ask questions based on what they are sharing, show interest and care. This is what Self does: it supports the unfolding of the part’s story and sharing. Self does a good job reflecting to the part the hardship, pain, confusion, overwhelm, or anything else the part is experiencing.	Детализация — это то, как мы узнаем больше о своих частях и выстраиваем более глубокие, доверительные отношения между ними и Собой. Подружившись с частью, мы можем спросить ее, чем она хотела бы поделиться о себе и своем опыте. Я думаю о том, чтобы конкретизировать то, как мы могли бы привлечь дорогого друга, когда он расскажет что-то сложное из своей жизни или истории. Мы слушали, задавали вопросы, исходя из того, чем они делятся, проявляли интерес и заботу. Это то, что делает «Я»: оно поддерживает раскрытие истории части и обмен ею. «Я» хорошо справляется с задачей отражения в той части трудностей, боли, замешательства, подавленности или чего-либо еще, что эта часть испытывает.	Fleshing out is how we get to know more about our parts and build a deeper, trusting relationship between them and Self. Once we befriend a part, we can ask the part what it would like to share about itself and its experiences. I think about fleshing out as how we might engage a dear friend as they share something difficult about their life or history. We would listen, ask questions based on what they are sharing, show interest and care. This is what Self does: it supports the unfolding of the part’s story and sharing. Self does a good job reflecting to the part the hardship, pain, confusion, overwhelm, or anything else the part is experiencing.
Validation and understanding are important in fleshing out. When parts feel seen by Self, we can find out their role in the system, how they took on their current role, and what they hope to accomplish. These questions often point to an early wounding experienced by us. Which leads to who the part is protecting and informs Self where healing can occur.	Validation and understanding are important in fleshing out. When parts feel seen by Self, we can find out their role in the system, how they took on their current role, and what they hope to accomplish. These questions often point to an early wounding experienced by us. Which leads to who the part is protecting and informs Self where healing can occur.	Проверка и понимание важны для конкретизации. Когда части чувствуют, что их видит «Я», мы можем узнать их роль в системе, как они взяли на себя свою текущую роль и чего они надеются достичь. Эти вопросы часто указывают на раннюю рану, которую мы пережили. Это приводит к тому, кого защищает эта часть, и сообщает Себе, где может произойти исцеление.	Validation and understanding are important in fleshing out. When parts feel seen by Self, we can find out their role in the system, how they took on their current role, and what they hope to accomplish. These questions often point to an early wounding experienced by us. Which leads to who the part is protecting and informs Self where healing can occur.
IFS CONCEPT 3: DIRECT ACCESS	IFS CONCEPT 3: DIRECT ACCESS	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 3: ПРЯМОЙ ДОСТУП	IFS CONCEPT 3: DIRECT ACCESS
Up to this point, I have shared how to notice, get to know, and befriend parts from your Self. In IFS, this is called In-sight. In-sight is hyphenated to highlight that it is the seeing or sight that happens when we go inside. Parts come into relationship with you (your Self), building a Self-to-part relationship. There’s another way to connect with parts that requires working with another person, usually a therapist, practitioner, or coach. This technique is called Direct Access. Instead of you coming into relationship with your parts, the therapist or other professional builds a Self-to-part relationship with your parts using their Self. This involves you blending with the part or becoming the part, allowing the therapist to speak directly with your part. Direct Access is most beneficial with parts that don’t trust you or have no awareness of Self (you). Direct Access allows these parts an opportunity to experience the healing power of Self outside of your system. This usually results in parts being open to connecting with you after interacting with a compassionate other in the Self of the therapist. The goals of Direct Access are to validate the part, to be curious about its experiences, to address its fears, and build trust. Once the part feels heard and its concerns have been adequately addressed, it is more willing and likely to unblend and come into relationship with you.	Up to this point, I have shared how to notice, get to know, and befriend parts from your Self. In IFS, this is called In-sight. In-sight is hyphenated to highlight that it is the seeing or sight that happens when we go inside. Parts come into relationship with you (your Self), building a Self-to-part relationship. There’s another way to connect with parts that requires working with another person, usually a therapist, practitioner, or coach. This technique is called Direct Access. Instead of you coming into relationship with your parts, the therapist or other professional builds a Self-to-part relationship with your parts using their Self. This involves you blending with the part or becoming the part, allowing the therapist to speak directly with your part. Direct Access is most beneficial with parts that don’t trust you or have no awareness of Self (you). Direct Access allows these parts an opportunity to experience the healing power of Self outside of your system. This usually results in parts being open to connecting with you after interacting with a compassionate other in the Self of the therapist. The goals of Direct Access are to validate the part, to be curious about its experiences, to address its fears, and build trust. Once the part feels heard and its concerns have been adequately addressed, it is more willing and likely to unblend and come into relationship with you.	До этого момента я рассказывал, как замечать, узнавать и подружиться с частями своего Я. В IFS это называется In-sight. In-sight пишется через дефис, чтобы подчеркнуть, что именно видение или зрелище происходит, когда мы заходим внутрь. Части вступают во взаимоотношения с вами (вашим «Я»), выстраивая отношения «Я-части». Есть еще один способ соединения частей, требующий работы с другим человеком, обычно с терапевтом, практикующим специалистом или тренером. Этот метод называется прямым доступом. Вместо того, чтобы вы вступали в отношения со своими частями, терапевт или другой профессионал выстраивает отношения «Я-часть» с вашими частями, используя их «Я». Это предполагает, что вы сливаетесь с частью или становитесь ею, позволяя терапевту говорить напрямую с вашей частью. Прямой доступ наиболее полезен для частей, которые вам не доверяют или не осознают себя (вас). Прямой доступ дает этим частям возможность ощутить целительную силу «Я» вне вашей системы. Обычно это приводит к тому, что части тела открываются для связи с вами после взаимодействия с сострадательным другим в Самости терапевта. Цели прямого доступа — проверить деталь, поинтересоваться ее опытом, развеять ее страхи и укрепить доверие. Как только часть почувствует, что ее услышали и ее проблемы были адекватно решены, она с большей вероятностью расстанется и вступит в отношения с вами.	Up to this point, I have shared how to notice, get to know, and befriend parts from your Self. In IFS, this is called In-sight. In-sight is hyphenated to highlight that it is the seeing or sight that happens when we go inside. Parts come into relationship with you (your Self), building a Self-to-part relationship. There’s another way to connect with parts that requires working with another person, usually a therapist, practitioner, or coach. This technique is called Direct Access. Instead of you coming into relationship with your parts, the therapist or other professional builds a Self-to-part relationship with your parts using their Self. This involves you blending with the part or becoming the part, allowing the therapist to speak directly with your part. Direct Access is most beneficial with parts that don’t trust you or have no awareness of Self (you). Direct Access allows these parts an opportunity to experience the healing power of Self outside of your system. This usually results in parts being open to connecting with you after interacting with a compassionate other in the Self of the therapist. The goals of Direct Access are to validate the part, to be curious about its experiences, to address its fears, and build trust. Once the part feels heard and its concerns have been adequately addressed, it is more willing and likely to unblend and come into relationship with you.
The following case vignette is an example of the use of Direct Access to befriend a part with suicidal thoughts and actions. Since IFS holds that all parts have positive intentions, a key factor in befriending parts that think about harm and/or act on these thoughts is to discover their positive intentions.	The following case vignette is an example of the use of Direct Access to befriend a part with suicidal thoughts and actions. Since IFS holds that all parts have positive intentions, a key factor in befriending parts that think about harm and/or act on these thoughts is to discover their positive intentions.	Следующий случай представляет собой пример использования прямого доступа для подружки с частью с суицидальными мыслями и действиями. Поскольку IFS утверждает, что все части имеют позитивные намерения, ключевым фактором в подружке с частями, которые думают о вреде и/или действуют в соответствии с этими мыслями, является обнаружение их позитивных намерений.	The following case vignette is an example of the use of Direct Access to befriend a part with suicidal thoughts and actions. Since IFS holds that all parts have positive intentions, a key factor in befriending parts that think about harm and/or act on these thoughts is to discover their positive intentions.
Case Vignette: The Suicidal Part	Case Vignette: The Suicidal Part	Пример из дела: Суицидальная часть	Case Vignette: The Suicidal Part
When I met Fern, she was estranged from her family of origin for several years. She identifies as biracial with a Black mother and white father. She never met her biological father and was raised by a stepfather who is also white. Fern came for therapy with severe depression and suicidal thoughts. She has a history of traumatic sexual abuse by her stepfather and his brother. The depth of her despair and worthlessness filled the therapy room. Fern has attempted suicide multiple times since childhood and experienced more hospitalizations than she could give an accurate count of.	When I met Fern, she was estranged from her family of origin for several years. She identifies as biracial with a Black mother and white father. She never met her biological father and was raised by a stepfather who is also white. Fern came for therapy with severe depression and suicidal thoughts. She has a history of traumatic sexual abuse by her stepfather and his brother. The depth of her despair and worthlessness filled the therapy room. Fern has attempted suicide multiple times since childhood and experienced more hospitalizations than she could give an accurate count of.	Когда я встретил Ферн, она несколько лет жила отдельно от своей родной семьи. Она идентифицирует себя как двухрасовую с чернокожей матерью и белым отцом. Она никогда не встречалась со своим биологическим отцом, и ее воспитывал отчим, который тоже был белым. Ферн пришла на терапию с тяжелой депрессией и суицидальными мыслями. В прошлом она подвергалась травмирующему сексуальному насилию со стороны отчима и его брата. Глубина ее отчаяния и никчемности наполнила терапевтическую комнату. С детства Ферн несколько раз пыталась покончить жизнь самоубийством, и ее госпитализировали чаще, чем она могла точно подсчитать.	When I met Fern, she was estranged from her family of origin for several years. She identifies as biracial with a Black mother and white father. She never met her biological father and was raised by a stepfather who is also white. Fern came for therapy with severe depression and suicidal thoughts. She has a history of traumatic sexual abuse by her stepfather and his brother. The depth of her despair and worthlessness filled the therapy room. Fern has attempted suicide multiple times since childhood and experienced more hospitalizations than she could give an accurate count of.
I believe therapists are most activated by parts that want to hurt or kill the client. With Fern, we worked with such a part—her part that considers suicide and has attempted suicide on multiple occasions.	I believe therapists are most activated by parts that want to hurt or kill the client. With Fern, we worked with such a part—her part that considers suicide and has attempted suicide on multiple occasions.	Я считаю, что терапевтов больше всего активизируют части, которые хотят причинить вред или убить клиента. С Ферн мы работали с такой частью — той частью, которая думает о самоубийстве и неоднократно предпринимала попытки самоубийства.	I believe therapists are most activated by parts that want to hurt or kill the client. With Fern, we worked with such a part—her part that considers suicide and has attempted suicide on multiple occasions.
When Fern arrives at the session, she is already blended with this part that views suicide as an option to her despair and depression. She sits crumpled on the couch.	When Fern arrives at the session, she is already blended with this part that views suicide as an option to her despair and depression. She sits crumpled on the couch.	Когда Ферн приходит на сеанс, она уже смешалась с той частью, которая рассматривает самоубийство как вариант своего отчаяния и депрессии. Она сидит, скорчившись, на диване.	When Fern arrives at the session, she is already blended with this part that views suicide as an option to her despair and depression. She sits crumpled on the couch.
“Nothing is ever going to change,” Fern’s suicidal part says. “I’ve tried everything. The pain is never going to stop.”	“Nothing is ever going to change,” Fern’s suicidal part says. “I’ve tried everything. The pain is never going to stop.”	«Ничто никогда не изменится», — говорит суицидальная часть Ферн. «Я перепробовал все. Боль никогда не прекратится».	“Nothing is ever going to change,” Fern’s suicidal part says. “I’ve tried everything. The pain is never going to stop.”
“I hear that things feel hopeless right now,” I offer.	“I hear that things feel hopeless right now,” I offer.	«Я слышал, что сейчас все кажется безнадежным», — предлагаю я.	“I hear that things feel hopeless right now,” I offer.
“Hopeless, dark, unending. I need the pain to end, it’s too much.”	“Hopeless, dark, unending. I need the pain to end, it’s too much.”	«Безнадежное, темное, бесконечное. Мне нужно, чтобы боль прекратилась, это слишком сильно».	“Hopeless, dark, unending. I need the pain to end, it’s too much.”
“Tell me more about the pain being too much,” I inquire softly.	“Tell me more about the pain being too much,” I inquire softly.	— Расскажи мне подробнее о том, что боль слишком сильная, — тихо спрашиваю я.	“Tell me more about the pain being too much,” I inquire softly.
“It feels like being on a medieval torture rack being twisted and stretched to the point of excruciating pain. Why would I want to stick around for more of that?”	“It feels like being on a medieval torture rack being twisted and stretched to the point of excruciating pain. Why would I want to stick around for more of that?”	«Это похоже на то, как будто находишься на средневековой пыточной стойке, когда тебя скручивают и растягивают до мучительной боли. Зачем мне оставаться здесь ради большего?»	“It feels like being on a medieval torture rack being twisted and stretched to the point of excruciating pain. Why would I want to stick around for more of that?”
“Maybe you want to stick around because a small part of you has a glimmer of hope,” I say compassionately.	“Maybe you want to stick around because a small part of you has a glimmer of hope,” I say compassionately.	«Может быть, ты хочешь остаться здесь, потому что у небольшой части тебя есть проблеск надежды», — говорю я сочувственно.	“Maybe you want to stick around because a small part of you has a glimmer of hope,” I say compassionately.
“Hope has let me down a thousand times. Hope is useless. I know a sure way out of this pain.”	“Hope has let me down a thousand times. Hope is useless. I know a sure way out of this pain.”	«Надежда меня подводила тысячу раз. Надежда бесполезна. Я знаю верный выход из этой боли.	“Hope has let me down a thousand times. Hope is useless. I know a sure way out of this pain.”
“So, what I’m hearing is you want the pain to stop, right?”	“So, what I’m hearing is you want the pain to stop, right?”	«Итак, я слышу, что ты хочешь, чтобы боль прекратилась, верно?»	“So, what I’m hearing is you want the pain to stop, right?”
“I can’t. I can’t keep suffering like this,” Fern shakes her head with closed eyes. “I’ve tried to stop the pain with pills, drugs, and cutting many times, but it didn’t work. Someone always saves me. For what? For me to survive to endure the same agony. No one can fix this for me. Only I can.”	“I can’t. I can’t keep suffering like this,” Fern shakes her head with closed eyes. “I’ve tried to stop the pain with pills, drugs, and cutting many times, but it didn’t work. Someone always saves me. For what? For me to survive to endure the same agony. No one can fix this for me. Only I can.”	«Я не могу. Я не могу продолжать так страдать, — Ферн качает головой с закрытыми глазами. «Я много раз пыталась остановить боль таблетками, лекарствами и порезами, но это не помогало. Меня всегда кто-то спасает. За что? Чтобы мне выжить, нужно пережить такую ​​же агонию. Никто не может исправить это за меня. Только я могу.	“I can’t. I can’t keep suffering like this,” Fern shakes her head with closed eyes. “I’ve tried to stop the pain with pills, drugs, and cutting many times, but it didn’t work. Someone always saves me. For what? For me to survive to endure the same agony. No one can fix this for me. Only I can.”
“Wow, that makes so much sense. Your goal is not to hurt, and the way you accomplish that is by killing yourself.”	“Wow, that makes so much sense. Your goal is not to hurt, and the way you accomplish that is by killing yourself.”	«Ух ты, в этом столько смысла. Ваша цель — не причинить вреда, и вы можете добиться этого, убив себя».	“Wow, that makes so much sense. Your goal is not to hurt, and the way you accomplish that is by killing yourself.”
The part nods and smiles.	The part nods and smiles.	Часть кивает и улыбается.	The part nods and smiles.
“What if I could offer another way to stop your pain without hurting or killing yourself. Would you be interested?”	“What if I could offer another way to stop your pain without hurting or killing yourself. Would you be interested?”	«Что, если бы я мог предложить другой способ остановить вашу боль, не причиняя себе вреда и не убивая себя? Вам будет интересно?»	“What if I could offer another way to stop your pain without hurting or killing yourself. Would you be interested?”
The part looks both confused and curious. “Maybe, but I don’t think there is any other way.”	The part looks both confused and curious. “Maybe, but I don’t think there is any other way.”	Эта часть выглядит одновременно растерянной и любопытной. — Возможно, но я не думаю, что есть другой выход.	The part looks both confused and curious. “Maybe, but I don’t think there is any other way.”
“I know you don’t, but would you be willing to try?”	“I know you don’t, but would you be willing to try?”	— Я знаю, что нет, но ты бы хотел попробовать?	“I know you don’t, but would you be willing to try?”
Slowing, with emphasis on each word, the part says, “I . . . only . . . want . . . to. . . stop . . . hurting!”	Slowing, with emphasis on each word, the part says, “I . . . only . . . want . . . to. . . stop . . . hurting!”	Медленно, с акцентом на каждое слово, часть произносит: «Я. . . только . . . хотеть . . . к. . . останавливаться . . . больно!»	Slowing, with emphasis on each word, the part says, “I . . . only . . . want . . . to. . . stop . . . hurting!”
“Is that a yes?” I ask, because I want to be certain before moving forward.	“Is that a yes?” I ask, because I want to be certain before moving forward.	«Это да?» Я спрашиваю, потому что хочу быть уверенным, прежде чем двигаться дальше.	“Is that a yes?” I ask, because I want to be certain before moving forward.
“Yes, I’ll try.”	“Yes, I’ll try.”	«Да, я попробую».	“Yes, I’ll try.”
After using Direct Access and receiving buy-in from the part, my work with Fern moves into a new phase. I encourage the part to unblend from Fern and come into relationship with Fern’s Self. Once the part unblends, I support Fern in befriending the part to increase the trust between the part and Fern’s Self. With trust established, we work toward healing the exile the suicidal part protects.	After using Direct Access and receiving buy-in from the part, my work with Fern moves into a new phase. I encourage the part to unblend from Fern and come into relationship with Fern’s Self. Once the part unblends, I support Fern in befriending the part to increase the trust between the part and Fern’s Self. With trust established, we work toward healing the exile the suicidal part protects.	После использования Direct Access и получения поддержки со стороны моя работа с Fern переходит в новый этап. Я призываю эту часть отделиться от Ферн и вступить в отношения с Самостью Ферн. Как только часть распадается, я поддерживаю Ферн в ее дружбе, чтобы повысить доверие между частью и Самостью Ферн. Установив доверие, мы работаем над исцелением изгнанника, которого защищает суицидальная часть.	After using Direct Access and receiving buy-in from the part, my work with Fern moves into a new phase. I encourage the part to unblend from Fern and come into relationship with Fern’s Self. Once the part unblends, I support Fern in befriending the part to increase the trust between the part and Fern’s Self. With trust established, we work toward healing the exile the suicidal part protects.
Meditation: Crystal Cave with the Ancestors	Meditation: Crystal Cave with the Ancestors	Медитация: Кристальная пещера с предками	Meditation: Crystal Cave with the Ancestors
As I spent more time getting to know my ancestors in my mother’s mother’s line, they continued to support me in learning the IFS model by offering meditations inspired by the model. I found this extremely surprising. I wondered, “How do they know my heart so clearly and offer precisely what I need to achieve my goals?” What I learned is our ancestors love us immensely and conspire for our highest good. To this end, my ancestors led me to work with my most challenging parts by drawing on the Self-energy of my ancestral lines.	As I spent more time getting to know my ancestors in my mother’s mother’s line, they continued to support me in learning the IFS model by offering meditations inspired by the model. I found this extremely surprising. I wondered, “How do they know my heart so clearly and offer precisely what I need to achieve my goals?” What I learned is our ancestors love us immensely and conspire for our highest good. To this end, my ancestors led me to work with my most challenging parts by drawing on the Self-energy of my ancestral lines.	Поскольку я тратил больше времени на знакомство со своими предками по материнской линии, они продолжали поддерживать меня в изучении модели IFS, предлагая медитации, вдохновленные этой моделью. Я нашел это чрезвычайно удивительным. Я задавался вопросом: «Как они так ясно знают мое сердце и предлагают именно то, что мне нужно для достижения моих целей?» Я узнал, что наши предки безмерно любят нас и действуют ради нашего высшего блага. С этой целью мои предки заставили меня работать с самыми сложными частями тела, опираясь на внутреннюю энергию моих родовых линий.	As I spent more time getting to know my ancestors in my mother’s mother’s line, they continued to support me in learning the IFS model by offering meditations inspired by the model. I found this extremely surprising. I wondered, “How do they know my heart so clearly and offer precisely what I need to achieve my goals?” What I learned is our ancestors love us immensely and conspire for our highest good. To this end, my ancestors led me to work with my most challenging parts by drawing on the Self-energy of my ancestral lines.
This meditation is offered to provide the additional support of ancestor wisdom and Self-energy to support you when working with parts you struggle with.	This meditation is offered to provide the additional support of ancestor wisdom and Self-energy to support you when working with parts you struggle with.	Эта медитация предлагается для того, чтобы обеспечить дополнительную поддержку мудрости предков и внутренней энергии, чтобы поддержать вас при работе с частями, с которыми вы боретесь.	This meditation is offered to provide the additional support of ancestor wisdom and Self-energy to support you when working with parts you struggle with.
Adjust your body until it feels comfortable.	Adjust your body until it feels comfortable.	Регулируйте свое тело, пока оно не почувствует себя комфортно.	Adjust your body until it feels comfortable.
Close your eyes or soften your gaze.	Close your eyes or soften your gaze.	Закройте глаза или смягчите взгляд.	Close your eyes or soften your gaze.
Notice how your body connects with the surface that supports you.	Notice how your body connects with the surface that supports you.	Обратите внимание, как ваше тело соединяется с поверхностью, которая вас поддерживает.	Notice how your body connects with the surface that supports you.
Inhale from the bottom of your feet, bringing the breath up through your body.	Inhale from the bottom of your feet, bringing the breath up through your body.	Вдохните из ступней, поднимая дыхание через тело.	Inhale from the bottom of your feet, bringing the breath up through your body.
Exhale through your body and out the bottom of your feet.	Exhale through your body and out the bottom of your feet.	Выдохните через тело и через ступни.	Exhale through your body and out the bottom of your feet.
Do this a few times.	Do this a few times.	Сделайте это несколько раз.	Do this a few times.
Picture yourself hiking or walking in a canyon, admiring the breathtaking sites along your way.	Picture yourself hiking or walking in a canyon, admiring the breathtaking sites along your way.	Представьте себя в походе или прогулке по каньону, любуясь захватывающими дух местами на своем пути.	Picture yourself hiking or walking in a canyon, admiring the breathtaking sites along your way.
During your trek, you get caught in a downpour.	During your trek, you get caught in a downpour.	Во время похода вы попадаете под ливень.	During your trek, you get caught in a downpour.
Looking around for a place to wait out the rain, you see a cave.	Looking around for a place to wait out the rain, you see a cave.	Оглядываясь вокруг в поисках места, где можно переждать дождь, вы видите пещеру.	Looking around for a place to wait out the rain, you see a cave.
As you focus on the entrance through the cascading water, you see an ancestor waving for you to join them.	As you focus on the entrance through the cascading water, you see an ancestor waving for you to join them.	Сосредоточившись на входе в каскад воды, вы видите предка, махающего вам рукой, чтобы вы присоединились к ним.	As you focus on the entrance through the cascading water, you see an ancestor waving for you to join them.
Dashing for the cave, you duck inside.	Dashing for the cave, you duck inside.	Бросившись к пещере, вы ныряете внутрь.	Dashing for the cave, you duck inside.
Your ancestor accompanies you deeper inside the darkened space until you see a faint light in the distance.	Your ancestor accompanies you deeper inside the darkened space until you see a faint light in the distance.	Ваш предок сопровождает вас глубже в затемненное пространство, пока вы не увидите вдалеке слабый свет.	Your ancestor accompanies you deeper inside the darkened space until you see a faint light in the distance.
Curiously you take in your surroundings. Your eyes are drawn to the walls of the cave, and you notice colorful, luminous crystals embedded there.	Curiously you take in your surroundings. Your eyes are drawn to the walls of the cave, and you notice colorful, luminous crystals embedded there.	С любопытством вы рассматриваете свое окружение. Your eyes are drawn to the walls of the cave, and you notice colorful, luminous crystals embedded there.
When your eyes fully adjust to the limited lighting, you see a second ancestor seated on the floor.	When your eyes fully adjust to the limited lighting, you see a second ancestor seated on the floor.	Когда ваши глаза полностью привыкают к ограниченному освещению, вы видите второго предка, сидящего на полу.	When your eyes fully adjust to the limited lighting, you see a second ancestor seated on the floor.
This ancestor welcomes you and invites you and the ancestor who greeted you at the entrance to sit with them.	This ancestor welcomes you and invites you and the ancestor who greeted you at the entrance to sit with them.	Этот предок приветствует вас и приглашает вас и предка, встретившего вас у входа, посидеть с ним.	This ancestor welcomes you and invites you and the ancestor who greeted you at the entrance to sit with them.
Take a moment to visually capture how your ancestors look.	Take a moment to visually capture how your ancestors look.	Найдите минутку, чтобы визуально запечатлеть, как выглядели ваши предки.	Take a moment to visually capture how your ancestors look.
The ancestor who was in the cave says, “We are here to help you with a part of yourself you struggle with. Notice this part and invite it to join us wherever it feels comfortable.”	The ancestor who was in the cave says, “We are here to help you with a part of yourself you struggle with. Notice this part and invite it to join us wherever it feels comfortable.”	Предок, который был в пещере, говорит: «Мы здесь, чтобы помочь вам с той частью вас самих, с которой вы боретесь. Обратите внимание на эту часть и пригласите ее присоединиться к нам, где ей будет удобно».	The ancestor who was in the cave says, “We are here to help you with a part of yourself you struggle with. The ancestor who greeted you says, “We have seen you wrestle with this part and come to offer wisdom from your ancestral line to support you as you work with this part of yourself.”	The ancestor who greeted you says, “We have seen you wrestle with this part and come to offer wisdom from your ancestral line to support you as you work with this part of yourself.”	Приветствующий вас предок говорит: «Мы видели, как вы боретесь с этой частью и пришли предложить мудрость вашей наследственной линии, чтобы поддержать вас в работе с этой частью себя».	The ancestor who greeted you says, “We have seen you wrestle with this part and come to offer wisdom from your ancestral line to support you as you work with this part of yourself.”

The ancestors encourage you to draw on their energy to increase the Self energy in space if you need to.
