The ancestors encourage you to draw on their energy to increase the Self energy in space if you need to.
Then the three of you sit with the part emanating Self-energy toward the part.	Then the three of you sit with the part emanating Self-energy toward the part.	Затем вы втроем садитесь так, чтобы часть излучала Самоэнергию в сторону этой части.	Then the three of you sit with the part emanating Self-energy toward the part.
The ancestors take turns with questions to help you get to know this part.	The ancestors take turns with questions to help you get to know this part.	Предки по очереди задают вопросы, чтобы помочь вам узнать эту часть.	The ancestors take turns with questions to help you get to know this part.
The first ancestor encourages you to ask the part, “How do you help me?”	The first ancestor encourages you to ask the part, “How do you help me?”	Первопредок призывает вас спросить часть: «Чем ты мне поможешь?»	The first ancestor encourages you to ask the part, “How do you help me?”
The second ancestor asks you to ask the part, “How did you start helping me in this way?”	The second ancestor asks you to ask the part, “How did you start helping me in this way?”	Второй предок просит вас спросить часть: «Как ты начал мне таким образом помогать?»	The second ancestor asks you to ask the part, “How did you start helping me in this way?”
Next, you’re instructed to ask, “How long have you been doing this for me?”	Next, you’re instructed to ask, “How long have you been doing this for me?”	Затем вам предлагается спросить: «Как долго вы делаете это для меня?»	Next, you’re instructed to ask, “How long have you been doing this for me?”
The next question you hear is, “What are you trying to accomplish by doing this for me?”	The next question you hear is, “What are you trying to accomplish by doing this for me?”	Следующий вопрос, который вы услышите: «Чего вы пытаетесь достичь, делая это для меня?»	The next question you hear is, “What are you trying to accomplish by doing this for me?”
The first ancestor suggests asking, “Do you like what you’re doing?” Next you hear, “Ask the part what it would rather do if it didn’t need to protect you in this way.”	The first ancestor suggests asking, “Do you like what you’re doing?” Next you hear, “Ask the part what it would rather do if it didn’t need to protect you in this way.”	Первопредок предлагает спросить: «Тебе нравится то, что ты делаешь?» Затем вы слышите: «Спросите часть, что бы она предпочла сделать, если бы ей не нужно было защищать вас таким образом».	The first ancestor suggests asking, “Do you like what you’re doing?” Next you hear, “Ask the part what it would rather do if it didn’t need to protect you in this way.”

Exercise 2: Crystal Cave with the Ancestors Journal Questions	Exercise 2: Crystal Cave with the Ancestors Journal Questions	Упражнение 2: Кристальная пещера с вопросами по журналу предков	Exercise 2: Crystal Cave with the Ancestors Journal Questions
After you’ve done the Crystal Cave with the Ancestors meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.	After you’ve done the Crystal Cave with the Ancestors meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts. What was your experience with your ancestors?	What was your experience with your ancestors?	Какой у вас был опыт общения с предками?	What was your experience with your ancestors?
Which part did you befriend?	Which part did you befriend?	С какой частью вы подружились?	Which part did you befriend?
What did you learn from the part?	What did you learn from the part?	Что вы узнали из этой роли?	What did you learn from the part?
How has what you learned impacted how you view this part?	How has what you learned impacted how you view this part?	Как то, что вы узнали, повлияло на ваше отношение к этой части?	How has what you learned impacted how you view this part?
What would the part rather do than protect you in the way that it does?	What would the part rather do than protect you in the way that it does?	Что эта часть предпочла бы делать, чем защищать вас так, как она это делает?	What would the part rather do than protect you in the way that it does?
Describe the crystal given to you by the ancestor that represents this part?	Describe the crystal given to you by the ancestor that represents this part?	Опишите кристалл, данный вам предком и олицетворяющий эту часть?	Describe the crystal given to you by the ancestor that represents this part?
Who were the two ancestors? Describe them.	Who were the two ancestors? Describe them.	Кем были два предка? Опишите их.	Who were the two ancestors? Describe them.
Exercise 3: Deepening the Relationship	Exercise 3: Deepening the Relationship	Упражнение 3: Углубление отношений	Exercise 3: Deepening the Relationship

Survive: “I can’t believe you’re even considering closing your therapy practice. What are you thinking? How will you make it? You’ll starve. You need to be rational about this. Why change what’s working? Just leave well enough alone.”	Survive: “I can’t believe you’re even considering closing your therapy practice. What are you thinking? How will you make it? You’ll starve. You need to be rational about this. Why change what’s working? Just leave well enough alone.”	Выжить: «Я не могу поверить, что ты вообще подумываешь о закрытии своей терапевтической практики. О чем ты думаешь? Как ты это сделаешь? Вы будете голодать. Вы должны подходить к этому рационально. Зачем менять то, что работает? Просто оставьте в покое. Вы пытаетесь заниматься постоянно и стать тренером. Это похоже на то, что вы работаете на двух работах полный рабочий день. Это убивает тебя. Вы не можете одновременно держаться за свою старую жизнь и создавать новую. Если вы беспокоитесь о финансах, не беспокойтесь. С тобой все будет в порядке. You know what you’re doing works. You’ve spent years building your practice. Don’t walk away. And what about your clients? They need you.”	Survive: “It won’t be fine. Нет никакой гарантии, что этот тренажер сработает. Нам нужно придерживаться того, что мы знаем. Вы знаете, что то, что вы делаете, работает. Вы потратили годы на создание своей практики. Не уходи. А как насчет ваших клиентов? Ты им нужен.	Survive: “It won’t be fine. Bills don’t get paid by themselves. We don’t have a crystal ball. There’s no guarantee this trainer thing will work out. We need to stick with what we know. You know what you’re doing works. You’ve spent years building your practice. Don’t walk away. And what about your clients? They need you.”
Thrive: “Refuse to move in fear. Survive’s decisions are based on fear. Trust the plan. You said you wanted to build a flourishing practice focusing on consultation, training, workshops/retreats, writing, and speaking. I believe it will be more successful than your therapy practice. To make this dream a reality, you have to close your practice. That’s the only way.”	Thrive: “Refuse to move in fear. Survive’s decisions are based on fear. Trust the plan. Вы сказали, что хотите создать процветающую практику, сосредоточенную на консультациях, обучении, семинарах/ретритах, письме и устных выступлениях. Я верю, что это будет более успешным, чем ваша терапевтическая практика. Чтобы воплотить эту мечту в реальность, вам придется закрыть свою практику. Это единственный путь». You have been doing this for 10 years and you want to throw it all away for the unknown. That’s foolish!”	Survive: “Yeah, yeah, yeah! But that’s all future promise that may or may not happen. Но это все будущие обещания, которые могут произойти, а могут и не произойти. Пожалуйста, не выбрасывайте то, над созданием чего вы так усердно работали. Вы занимаетесь этим уже 10 лет и хотите бросить все это ради неизвестности. Это глупо!»	Survive: “Yeah, yeah, yeah! But that’s all future promise that may or may not happen. Теперь, когда это стало комфортным, он не хочет, чтобы вы стремились к более высоким целям».	Thrive: “We’ve taken risks before and reaped great benefits. We’re comfortable; things are stable and profitable. Why start over again? Why? I say we leave things as they are.”	Survive: “I think you’re making a mistake if you listen to Thrive. I say we leave things as they are.”	Survive: «Я думаю, что ты совершаешь ошибку, если слушаешь Thrive. Он любит рисковать, и это здорово, в прошлый раз все получилось, но мы какое-то время боролись, прежде чем это получилось. Нам комфортно; дела идут стабильно и прибыльно. Зачем начинать заново? Почему? Я говорю, что мы оставим все как есть».	Survive: “I think you’re making a mistake if you listen to Thrive. He is a risk-taker, and great, the last time worked out, but we struggled for a time before it worked out. We’re comfortable; things are stable and profitable. Why start over again? Why? I say we leave things as they are.”
Thrive: “We’ve already done the private practice thing. It’s time to spread our wings and have a greater impact on the field. You believe in IFS therapy and want to bring it to as many people as possible. I can help you to do that. Sure, it will be uncomfortable for a while, but the discomfort will be brief, just as it was when you were building your private practice. I say close your psychotherapy practice and focus on becoming an IFS trainer and consultant.”	Thrive: “We’ve already done the private practice thing. It’s time to spread our wings and have a greater impact on the field. You believe in IFS therapy and want to bring it to as many people as possible. I can help you to do that. Пришло время расправить крылья и оказать большее влияние на поле. Вы верите в терапию IFS и хотите донести ее до как можно большего числа людей. Я могу помочь вам сделать это. Конечно, какое-то время вам будет некомфортно, но дискомфорт будет кратковременным, точно так же, как это было, когда вы строили свою частную практику. Я советую закрыть свою психотерапевтическую практику и сосредоточиться на том, чтобы стать тренером и консультантом IFS».	Thrive: “We’ve already done the private practice thing. It’s time to spread our wings and have a greater impact on the field. You believe in IFS therapy and want to bring it to as many people as possible. I can help you to do that. Sure, it will be uncomfortable for a while, but the discomfort will be brief, just as it was when you were building your private practice. I say close your psychotherapy practice and focus on becoming an IFS trainer and consultant.”
Have you ever had two voices in your head telling you to do two completely different things? Well, that was my experience with Survive and Thrive. I had a successful private practice, and I was being mentored toward becoming an IFS trainer. I came to a point in the process where exhaustion was setting in because, essentially, I had two full-time jobs. I found myself at a crossroads. It was no longer possible for me to continue with both in the same manner. I found that the trainer track required much more from me than I could have predicted, and I was committed to giving this new career path my full attention and effort. So I was faced with a decision to close my psychotherapy practice or significantly reduce my caseload to continue my pursuit of becoming the first Black IFS Solo lead trainer.	Have you ever had two voices in your head telling you to do two completely different things? Well, that was my experience with Survive and Thrive. I had a successful private practice, and I was being mentored toward becoming an IFS trainer. I came to a point in the process where exhaustion was setting in because, essentially, I had two full-time jobs. I found myself at a crossroads. It was no longer possible for me to continue with both in the same manner. I found that the trainer track required much more from me than I could have predicted, and I was committed to giving this new career path my full attention and effort. So I was faced with a decision to close my psychotherapy practice or significantly reduce my caseload to continue my pursuit of becoming the first Black IFS Solo lead trainer.	Были ли у вас когда-нибудь два голоса в голове, говорящие вам сделать два совершенно разных дела? Ну, это был мой опыт работы с Survive and Thrive. У меня была успешная частная практика, и меня готовили стать тренером IFS. Я подошел к моменту, когда наступило утомление, потому что, по сути, у меня было две работы с полной занятостью. Я оказался на распутье. Я больше не мог продолжать делать то и другое одинаково. Я обнаружил, что тренерская карьера требует от меня гораздо большего, чем я мог предсказать, и я был полон решимости уделить этому новому карьерному пути все свое внимание и усилия. Поэтому я столкнулся с решением закрыть свою психотерапевтическую практику или значительно сократить нагрузку, чтобы продолжить стремление стать первым ведущим тренером Black IFS Solo.	Have you ever had two voices in your head telling you to do two completely different things? Well, that was my experience with Survive and Thrive. I had a successful private practice, and I was being mentored toward becoming an IFS trainer. I came to a point in the process where exhaustion was setting in because, essentially, I had two full-time jobs. I found myself at a crossroads. It was no longer possible for me to continue with both in the same manner. I found that the trainer track required much more from me than I could have predicted, and I was committed to giving this new career path my full attention and effort. So I was faced with a decision to close my psychotherapy practice or significantly reduce my caseload to continue my pursuit of becoming the first Black IFS Solo lead trainer.
Thrive and Survive continued to bicker and were unwilling to compromise. They each held that their position was the best solution. When one tried to convince me to side with them, the other strongly opposed and argued for their point of view. This dynamic is referred to as polarization.	Thrive and Survive continued to bicker and were unwilling to compromise. They each held that their position was the best solution. When one tried to convince me to side with them, the other strongly opposed and argued for their point of view. This dynamic is referred to as polarization.	Thrive и Survive продолжали ссориться и не желали идти на компромисс. Каждый из них считал, что их позиция — лучшее решение. Когда один пытался убедить меня встать на их сторону, другой категорически возражал и отстаивал свою точку зрения. Эта динамика называется поляризацией.	Thrive and Survive continued to bicker and were unwilling to compromise. They each held that their position was the best solution. When one tried to convince me to side with them, the other strongly opposed and argued for their point of view. This dynamic is referred to as polarization.
IFS CONCEPT 1: POLARIZATION	IFS CONCEPT 1: POLARIZATION	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 1: ПОЛЯРИЗАЦИЯ	IFS CONCEPT 1: POLARIZATION
Polarization is what happens when two or more parts hold differing and sometimes opposite positions. Often these parts have little access to Self. They are so focused on their viewpoint and not allowing the other part to take over that they do not notice the availability of Self. Their hyper-focus on preventing the other from taking over keeps them in a vicious loop of maintaining balance by not giving in or even considering a compromise.	Polarization is what happens when two or more parts hold differing and sometimes opposite positions. Often these parts have little access to Self. They are so focused on their viewpoint and not allowing the other part to take over that they do not notice the availability of Self. Their hyper-focus on preventing the other from taking over keeps them in a vicious loop of maintaining balance by not giving in or even considering a compromise.	Поляризация — это то, что происходит, когда две или более частей занимают разные, а иногда и противоположные позиции. Часто эти части имеют ограниченный доступ к «Я». Они настолько сосредоточены на своей точке зрения и не позволяют другой части взять верх, что не замечают присутствия «Я». Их чрезмерная сосредоточенность на предотвращении захвата власти другим держит их в порочном круге поддержания баланса, не сдаваясь и даже не рассматривая компромисс.	Polarization is what happens when two or more parts hold differing and sometimes opposite positions. Often these parts have little access to Self. They are so focused on their viewpoint and not allowing the other part to take over that they do not notice the availability of Self. Their hyper-focus on preventing the other from taking over keeps them in a vicious loop of maintaining balance by not giving in or even considering a compromise.
Experiencing polarization is common, since most of our parts are polarized with another part. The polarization can be experienced as fear, dislike, or disagreement between parts. The most common polarizations are between protectors, such as manager/firefighter, manager/manager, and firefighter/firefighter. However parts can also be polarized with exiles. Polarized protectors are like people who hold differing views and opinions. Protectors do not want the opposing view to dominate the system, so they do their best to ensure that their position prevails. These polarized parts function usually to protect a vulnerable part or exile, and they can serve as distractions from deeper emotions or pain. Ultimately, these parts want the same outcome, but their tactics differ. The goal is to attend to each view equally to understand what parts need and what they are attempting to do.	Experiencing polarization is common, since most of our parts are polarized with another part. The polarization can be experienced as fear, dislike, or disagreement between parts. The most common polarizations are between protectors, such as manager/firefighter, manager/manager, and firefighter/firefighter. However parts can also be polarized with exiles. Polarized protectors are like people who hold differing views and opinions. Protectors do not want the opposing view to dominate the system, so they do their best to ensure that their position prevails. These polarized parts function usually to protect a vulnerable part or exile, and they can serve as distractions from deeper emotions or pain. Ultimately, these parts want the same outcome, but their tactics differ. The goal is to attend to each view equally to understand what parts need and what they are attempting to do.	Поляризация является обычным явлением, поскольку большинство наших частей поляризованы с другой частью. Поляризация может переживаться как страх, неприязнь или разногласия между частями. Наиболее распространенная поляризация наблюдается между защитниками, такими как менеджер/пожарный, менеджер/менеджер и пожарный/пожарный. Однако части также могут быть поляризованы изгнанниками. Поляризованные защитники подобны людям, придерживающимся разных взглядов и мнений. Защитники не хотят, чтобы в системе доминировала противоположная точка зрения, поэтому они делают все возможное, чтобы их позиция возобладала. Эти поляризованные части обычно защищают уязвимую часть или изгнание и могут отвлекать от более глубоких эмоций или боли. В конечном счете, эти части хотят одного и того же результата, но их тактика различается. Цель состоит в том, чтобы одинаково внимательно относиться к каждому представлению, чтобы понять, что нужно частям и что они пытаются сделать.	Experiencing polarization is common, since most of our parts are polarized with another part. The polarization can be experienced as fear, dislike, or disagreement between parts. The most common polarizations are between protectors, such as manager/firefighter, manager/manager, and firefighter/firefighter. However parts can also be polarized with exiles. Polarized protectors are like people who hold differing views and opinions. Protectors do not want the opposing view to dominate the system, so they do their best to ensure that their position prevails. These polarized parts function usually to protect a vulnerable part or exile, and they can serve as distractions from deeper emotions or pain. Ultimately, these parts want the same outcome, but their tactics differ. The goal is to attend to each view equally to understand what parts need and what they are attempting to do.
IFS CONCEPT 2: WORKING WITH POLARIZED PARTS	IFS CONCEPT 2: WORKING WITH POLARIZED PARTS	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 2: РАБОТА С ПОЛЯРИЗОВАННЫМИ ЧАСТЯМИ	IFS CONCEPT 2: WORKING WITH POLARIZED PARTS
The first step in working with a polarization is identifying the parts involved. We want to understand the relationship between the polarized parts. Is one part fearful of another? Are parts in a struggle with one another? Are parts reacting to each other in some way? We want to identify the parts on either side of the polarization, keeping in mind there can be more than two parts involved in a polarization; in that case, a coalition of parts exists on either side.	The first step in working with a polarization is identifying the parts involved. We want to understand the relationship between the polarized parts. Is one part fearful of another? Are parts in a struggle with one another? Are parts reacting to each other in some way? We want to identify the parts on either side of the polarization, keeping in mind there can be more than two parts involved in a polarization; in that case, a coalition of parts exists on either side.	Первым шагом в работе с поляризацией является определение участвующих в ней частей. Мы хотим понять взаимоотношения между поляризованными частями. Боится ли одна часть другой? Части борются друг с другом? Части как-то реагируют друг на друга? Мы хотим идентифицировать части по обе стороны от поляризации, имея в виду, что в поляризации может участвовать более двух частей; в этом случае с обеих сторон существует коалиция частей.	The first step in working with a polarization is identifying the parts involved. We want to understand the relationship between the polarized parts. Is one part fearful of another? Are parts in a struggle with one another? Are parts reacting to each other in some way? We want to identify the parts on either side of the polarization, keeping in mind there can be more than two parts involved in a polarization; in that case, a coalition of parts exists on either side.
As an example, a coalition of people-pleasing parts could include a part that goes along to get along, another part that keeps quiet as a way to please others, and another part that allows others to use it as a doormat. The other side of the polarization may include a coalition of parts that get angry to protect. This coalition has a part that gets angry at the people-pleasing parts, another part that gets angry at the object of the people-pleasing parts, and a third part that criticizes everyone involved. Remember, the biggest fear of polarized parts, or coalitions of parts, is the other side dominating and taking over. It is important when working with a polarization to address this fear by letting each part know that you will not allow the other side to take over and you will hear from each part.	As an example, a coalition of people-pleasing parts could include a part that goes along to get along, another part that keeps quiet as a way to please others, and another part that allows others to use it as a doormat. The other side of the polarization may include a coalition of parts that get angry to protect. This coalition has a part that gets angry at the people-pleasing parts, another part that gets angry at the object of the people-pleasing parts, and a third part that criticizes everyone involved. Remember, the biggest fear of polarized parts, or coalitions of parts, is the other side dominating and taking over. It is important when working with a polarization to address this fear by letting each part know that you will not allow the other side to take over and you will hear from each part.	Например, коалиция частей, угодных людям, может включать часть, которая идет навстречу, чтобы ладить, другую часть, которая хранит молчание, чтобы доставить удовольствие другим, и третью часть, которая позволяет другим использовать ее как тряпку. Другая сторона поляризации может включать в себя коалицию сторон, которые злятся, чтобы защитить. В этой коалиции есть часть, которая злится на части, угодные людям, другая часть, которая злится на объект частей, угодных людям, и третья часть, которая критикует всех участников. Помните: самый большой страх перед поляризованными частями или коалициями частей – это доминирование и захват власти другой стороны. При работе с поляризацией важно справиться с этим страхом, давая понять каждой части, что вы не позволите другой стороне взять верх и что вы услышите от каждой части.	As an example, a coalition of people-pleasing parts could include a part that goes along to get along, another part that keeps quiet as a way to please others, and another part that allows others to use it as a doormat. The other side of the polarization may include a coalition of parts that get angry to protect. This coalition has a part that gets angry at the people-pleasing parts, another part that gets angry at the object of the people-pleasing parts, and a third part that criticizes everyone involved. Remember, the biggest fear of polarized parts, or coalitions of parts, is the other side dominating and taking over. It is important when working with a polarization to address this fear by letting each part know that you will not allow the other side to take over and you will hear from each part.
Again, when we begin working with a polarization, we consider every part involved. (To simplify the process, I will use the example of two polarized parts instead of a coalition; however, the same steps apply when working with a coalition.)	Again, when we begin working with a polarization, we consider every part involved. (To simplify the process, I will use the example of two polarized parts instead of a coalition; however, the same steps apply when working with a coalition.)	Опять же, когда мы начинаем работать с поляризацией, мы рассматриваем каждую задействованную часть. (Чтобы упростить процесс, я буду использовать пример двух поляризованных частей вместо коалиции; однако те же шаги применимы и при работе с коалицией.)	Again, when we begin working with a polarization, we consider every part involved. (To simplify the process, I will use the example of two polarized parts instead of a coalition; however, the same steps apply when working with a coalition.)
First, we want to focus on both sides of the polarization at the same time. To help us do this, we can notice how each part shows up in or around the body, we can draw each part on a sheet of paper, or we can imagine holding one part in each hand.	First, we want to focus on both sides of the polarization at the same time. To help us do this, we can notice how each part shows up in or around the body, we can draw each part on a sheet of paper, or we can imagine holding one part in each hand.	Во-первых, мы хотим сосредоточиться на обеих сторонах поляризации одновременно. Чтобы помочь нам в этом, мы можем заметить, как каждая часть проявляется внутри или вокруг тела, мы можем нарисовать каждую часть на листе бумаги или представить, что держим по одной части в каждой руке.	First, we want to focus on both sides of the polarization at the same time. To help us do this, we can notice how each part shows up in or around the body, we can draw each part on a sheet of paper, or we can imagine holding one part in each hand.
Let’s take the example of noticing how each part shows up in or around the body. I noticed that Thrive showed up outside of my body on the left side, impatient and eager to move forward. He used his hands and body to punctuate his words. Survive expressed as a nervous pit in my stomach. After sensing how each part reveals itself, we want to notice how we feel toward each part. We might notice parts that align with either side of the polarized pair or parts that have an agenda. If those parts are present, we ask them to step back. Once those parts unblend, we want to notice how we feel toward each part of the polarization again. When we unblend from parts, what remains is Self. We continue to check how we feel toward the parts until we have Self energy toward each part of the polarization.	Let’s take the example of noticing how each part shows up in or around the body. I noticed that Thrive showed up outside of my body on the left side, impatient and eager to move forward. He used his hands and body to punctuate his words. Survive expressed as a nervous pit in my stomach. After sensing how each part reveals itself, we want to notice how we feel toward each part. We might notice parts that align with either side of the polarized pair or parts that have an agenda. If those parts are present, we ask them to step back. Once those parts unblend, we want to notice how we feel toward each part of the polarization again. When we unblend from parts, what remains is Self. We continue to check how we feel toward the parts until we have Self energy toward each part of the polarization.	Давайте возьмем пример наблюдения за тем, как каждая часть проявляется внутри или вокруг тела. Я заметил, что Трайв появился снаружи моего тела с левой стороны, нетерпеливый и жаждущий двигаться вперед. Он использовал руки и тело, чтобы подчеркнуть свои слова. «Выжить» выражается в виде нервной ямки в животе. Почувствовав, как раскрывается каждая часть, мы хотим отметить, что мы чувствуем по отношению к каждой части. Мы можем заметить части, которые совпадают с любой из сторон поляризованной пары, или части, имеющие определенную повестку дня. Если эти части присутствуют, мы просим их отступить. Как только эти части сольются, мы хотим снова обратить внимание на то, как мы относимся к каждой части поляризации. Когда мы отделяемся от частей, остается только Я. Мы продолжаем проверять, как мы чувствуем себя по отношению к частям, пока у нас не появится энергия Самости по отношению к каждой части поляризации.	Let’s take the example of noticing how each part shows up in or around the body. I noticed that Thrive showed up outside of my body on the left side, impatient and eager to move forward. He used his hands and body to punctuate his words. Survive expressed as a nervous pit in my stomach. After sensing how each part reveals itself, we want to notice how we feel toward each part. We might notice parts that align with either side of the polarized pair or parts that have an agenda. If those parts are present, we ask them to step back. Once those parts unblend, we want to notice how we feel toward each part of the polarization again. When we unblend from parts, what remains is Self. We continue to check how we feel toward the parts until we have Self energy toward each part of the polarization.
If we feel one or more of the qualities of Self (compassion, curiosity, calm, confidence, creativity, connectedness, courage, or clarity), we can energetically extend that quality of Self to one or both parts.	If we feel one or more of the qualities of Self (compassion, curiosity, calm, confidence, creativity, connectedness, courage, or clarity), we can energetically extend that quality of Self to one or both parts.	Если мы чувствуем одно или несколько качеств «Я» (сострадание, любопытство, спокойствие, уверенность, творчество, связанность, смелость или ясность), мы можем энергетически распространить это качество «Я» на одну или обе части.	If we feel one or more of the qualities of Self (compassion, curiosity, calm, confidence, creativity, connectedness, courage, or clarity), we can energetically extend that quality of Self to one or both parts.
If we feel something other than these qualities, it means that another part is present, so we ask it to step back (unblend).	If we feel something other than these qualities, it means that another part is present, so we ask it to step back (unblend).	Если мы чувствуем что-то иное, чем эти качества, значит, присутствует другая часть, поэтому мы просим ее отойти (разъединиться).	If we feel something other than these qualities, it means that another part is present, so we ask it to step back (unblend).
After extending qualities of Self, we ask permission to get to know each side of the polarization. This means we ask each side not to blend or take over while getting to know the other side. If one side has more energy, that may be the part we talk to first. If the energy of the parts is similar, ask the parts who would like to share first, reminding them that each will have their turn.	After extending qualities of Self, we ask permission to get to know each side of the polarization. This means we ask each side not to blend or take over while getting to know the other side. If one side has more energy, that may be the part we talk to first. If the energy of the parts is similar, ask the parts who would like to share first, reminding them that each will have their turn.	Расширив качества «Я», мы просим разрешения узнать каждую сторону поляризации. Это означает, что мы просим каждую сторону не смешиваться и не брать верх во время знакомства с другой стороной. Если у одной стороны больше энергии, возможно, именно с ней мы поговорим в первую очередь. Если энергии частей схожи, спросите те части, которые хотели бы поделиться первыми, напоминая им, что у каждой будет своя очередь.	After extending qualities of Self, we ask permission to get to know each side of the polarization. This means we ask each side not to blend or take over while getting to know the other side. If one side has more energy, that may be the part we talk to first. If the energy of the parts is similar, ask the parts who would like to share first, reminding them that each will have their turn.
In getting to know each part, we want to learn their role in the system. What do they do, and what are they trying to accomplish? Since all parts have positive intentions, we know these parts are attempting to help, and we want to discover their positive intentions. We want to know how this struggle is working for them. Oftentimes, struggle between the parts does not result in them getting what they want. Asking these questions helps the parts to see the results of their efforts. They may not have noticed that they’re not getting the outcomes they want because they have been too focused on the struggle with each other.	In getting to know each part, we want to learn their role in the system. What do they do, and what are they trying to accomplish? Since all parts have positive intentions, we know these parts are attempting to help, and we want to discover their positive intentions. We want to know how this struggle is working for them. Oftentimes, struggle between the parts does not result in them getting what they want. Asking these questions helps the parts to see the results of their efforts. They may not have noticed that they’re not getting the outcomes they want because they have been too focused on the struggle with each other.	Познакомившись с каждой частью, мы хотим узнать их роль в системе. Что они делают и чего пытаются достичь? Поскольку все части имеют позитивные намерения, мы знаем, что эти части пытаются помочь, и мы хотим обнаружить их позитивные намерения. Мы хотим знать, как эта борьба работает для них. Часто борьба между частями не приводит к тому, что они получают то, что хотят. Задание этих вопросов помогает частям увидеть результаты своих усилий. Они, возможно, не заметили, что не получают желаемых результатов, потому что были слишком сосредоточены на борьбе друг с другом.	In getting to know each part, we want to learn their role in the system. What do they do, and what are they trying to accomplish? Since all parts have positive intentions, we know these parts are attempting to help, and we want to discover their positive intentions. We want to know how this struggle is working for them. Oftentimes, struggle between the parts does not result in them getting what they want. Asking these questions helps the parts to see the results of their efforts. They may not have noticed that they’re not getting the outcomes they want because they have been too focused on the struggle with each other.
After getting to know one side of the polarization, spend time asking the same questions of the other part. In this way, each side gets to learn how the other side is trying to help and protect you. When the parts realize each other’s role and that neither is getting their desired outcome, they usually soften and calm.	After getting to know one side of the polarization, spend time asking the same questions of the other part. In this way, each side gets to learn how the other side is trying to help and protect you. When the parts realize each other’s role and that neither is getting their desired outcome, they usually soften and calm.	Познакомившись с одной стороной поляризации, потратьте время, задавая те же вопросы другой стороне. Таким образом, каждая сторона узнает, как другая сторона пытается помочь и защитить вас. Когда стороны осознают роль друг друга и что ни одна из них не достигает желаемого результата, они обычно смягчаются и успокаиваются.	After getting to know one side of the polarization, spend time asking the same questions of the other part. In this way, each side gets to learn how the other side is trying to help and protect you. When the parts realize each other’s role and that neither is getting their desired outcome, they usually soften and calm.
Next, we want to get curious about whom the polarized parts protect. Often, we discover they are protecting the same exiled part. Even though they may be using different methods and strategies, they are doing the same job. This revelation can open the parts to trying something new instead of continuing in their struggle. We want to take time to understand what each part is afraid would happen if they stopped protecting in the way they do. We will find our parts protect ferociously because they do not want us to experience the pain the exile is holding. When we know their fears and who they protect, we can offer to heal the one they protect if they are interested and give permission. If permission is granted, we can begin to build a Self-to-part relationship with the exile and heal it using the steps in Chapter 10.	Next, we want to get curious about whom the polarized parts protect. Often, we discover they are protecting the same exiled part. Even though they may be using different methods and strategies, they are doing the same job. This revelation can open the parts to trying something new instead of continuing in their struggle. We want to take time to understand what each part is afraid would happen if they stopped protecting in the way they do. We will find our parts protect ferociously because they do not want us to experience the pain the exile is holding. When we know their fears and who they protect, we can offer to heal the one they protect if they are interested and give permission. If permission is granted, we can begin to build a Self-to-part relationship with the exile and heal it using the steps in Chapter 10.	Далее мы хотим поинтересоваться, кого защищают поляризованные части. Часто мы обнаруживаем, что они защищают одну и ту же изгнанную часть. Хотя они могут использовать разные методы и стратегии, они выполняют одну и ту же работу. Это откровение может открыть частям возможность попробовать что-то новое вместо того, чтобы продолжать борьбу. Нам нужно время, чтобы понять, чего боится каждая часть, если они перестанут защищать так, как они это делают. Мы обнаружим, что наши части яростно защищаются, потому что они не хотят, чтобы мы испытали боль, которую несет изгнанник. Когда мы знаем их страхи и то, кого они защищают, мы можем предложить исцелить того, кого они защищают, если они заинтересованы, и дать разрешение. Если разрешение будет дано, мы можем начать строить отношения «Я-расставание» с изгнанником и исцелять его, используя шаги, описанные в Главе 10.	Next, we want to get curious about whom the polarized parts protect. Often, we discover they are protecting the same exiled part. Even though they may be using different methods and strategies, they are doing the same job. This revelation can open the parts to trying something new instead of continuing in their struggle. We want to take time to understand what each part is afraid would happen if they stopped protecting in the way they do. We will find our parts protect ferociously because they do not want us to experience the pain the exile is holding. When we know their fears and who they protect, we can offer to heal the one they protect if they are interested and give permission. If permission is granted, we can begin to build a Self-to-part relationship with the exile and heal it using the steps in Chapter 10.
It is important to note that even after getting polarized parts to relax and calm, they will not stop protecting until the one they protect is healed (unburdened). However, they now have a relationship with Self that they did not have previously. We can ask parts to trust Self to address the problem that concerns them. After the exile is unburdened, the polarized parts can take on different roles in the system because they will not need to protect the exile in the same manner after it is healed. We can have them talk and listen to each other with Self as a mediator. This will help them decide on new roles that could somehow include working together as allies instead of adversaries fearing domination by the other.	It is important to note that even after getting polarized parts to relax and calm, they will not stop protecting until the one they protect is healed (unburdened). However, they now have a relationship with Self that they did not have previously. We can ask parts to trust Self to address the problem that concerns them. After the exile is unburdened, the polarized parts can take on different roles in the system because they will not need to protect the exile in the same manner after it is healed. We can have them talk and listen to each other with Self as a mediator. This will help them decide on new roles that could somehow include working together as allies instead of adversaries fearing domination by the other.	Важно отметить, что даже после того, как поляризованные части расслабятся и успокоятся, они не перестанут защищать, пока тот, кого они защищают, не исцелится (освободится от бремени). Однако теперь у них есть отношения с «Я», которых у них не было раньше. Мы можем попросить части довериться Себе в решении проблемы, которая их беспокоит. После того, как изгнанник освобожден от бремени, поляризованные части могут брать на себя разные роли в системе, поскольку им не нужно будет защищать изгнанника таким же образом после его исцеления. Мы можем заставить их говорить и слушать друг друга, используя «Я» в качестве посредника. Это поможет им определиться с новыми ролями, которые могут каким-то образом включать совместную работу в качестве союзников, а не противников, опасающихся доминирования друг друга.	It is important to note that even after getting polarized parts to relax and calm, they will not stop protecting until the one they protect is healed (unburdened). However, they now have a relationship with Self that they did not have previously. We can ask parts to trust Self to address the problem that concerns them. After the exile is unburdened, the polarized parts can take on different roles in the system because they will not need to protect the exile in the same manner after it is healed. We can have them talk and listen to each other with Self as a mediator. This will help them decide on new roles that could somehow include working together as allies instead of adversaries fearing domination by the other.
Case Vignette:	Case Vignette:	Виньетка по делу:	Case Vignette:
Go Along to Get Along vs. Bulldog	Go Along to Get Along vs. Bulldog	Иди, чтобы ладить против Бульдога	Go Along to Get Along vs. Bulldog
Angel is a 39-year-old, well-educated, successful female Nigerian immigrant working in international finance. She came to therapy for anxiety. She was experiencing constant worry, inability to focus on work, nervousness, sleeplessness, and irritability. She believed her symptoms were the result of racialized workplace trauma.	Angel is a 39-year-old, well-educated, successful female Nigerian immigrant working in international finance. She came to therapy for anxiety. She was experiencing constant worry, inability to focus on work, nervousness, sleeplessness, and irritability. She believed her symptoms were the result of racialized workplace trauma.	Анхель — 39-летняя, хорошо образованная, успешная иммигрантка из Нигерии, работающая в сфере международных финансов. Она пришла на терапию из-за тревоги. Она испытывала постоянное беспокойство, неспособность сосредоточиться на работе, нервозность, бессонницу и раздражительность. Она считала, что ее симптомы были результатом расовой травмы на рабочем месте.	Angel is a 39-year-old, well-educated, successful female Nigerian immigrant working in international finance. She came to therapy for anxiety. She was experiencing constant worry, inability to focus on work, nervousness, sleeplessness, and irritability. She believed her symptoms were the result of racialized workplace trauma.
In our session, Angel describes her immediate boss’s low and derogatory views of people of color. She shares that her boss constantly compares her to other Black employees she has managed in the past. Her boss gives what she considers compliments, but Angel experiences them as stressful microaggressions: for example, “You’re highly driven for a Black person,” or “You’re not lazy like the other Black women who’ve worked for me,” or “You’re a real pack mule when it comes to how many projects you can manage.”	In our session, Angel describes her immediate boss’s low and derogatory views of people of color. She shares that her boss constantly compares her to other Black employees she has managed in the past. Her boss gives what she considers compliments, but Angel experiences them as stressful microaggressions: for example, “You’re highly driven for a Black person,” or “You’re not lazy like the other Black women who’ve worked for me,” or “You’re a real pack mule when it comes to how many projects you can manage.”	На нашем сеансе Ангел описывает низкое и уничижительное отношение своего непосредственного начальника к цветным людям. Она рассказывает, что ее начальник постоянно сравнивает ее с другими чернокожими сотрудниками, которыми она руководила в прошлом. Ее начальник делает то, что она считает комплиментами, но Энджел воспринимает их как стрессовую микроагрессию: например: «Ты очень целеустремленна для чернокожего человека» или «Ты не ленива, как другие чернокожие женщины, которые работали на меня. или «Вы настоящий вьючный мул, когда дело касается количества проектов, которыми вы можете управлять».	In our session, Angel describes her immediate boss’s low and derogatory views of people of color. She shares that her boss constantly compares her to other Black employees she has managed in the past. Her boss gives what she considers compliments, but Angel experiences them as stressful microaggressions: for example, “You’re highly driven for a Black person,” or “You’re not lazy like the other Black women who’ve worked for me,” or “You’re a real pack mule when it comes to how many projects you can manage.”
Angel says that although her workplace was toxic to begin with, her anxiety became impossible to manage when she was overlooked for a promotion after doing the job for six months without a title or pay increase, and while possessing more education, experience, and qualifications than the person who was ultimately selected for the position. When I asked Angel about her experiences at work and her anxiety, I immediately met her polarized parts.	Angel says that although her workplace was toxic to begin with, her anxiety became impossible to manage when she was overlooked for a promotion after doing the job for six months without a title or pay increase, and while possessing more education, experience, and qualifications than the person who was ultimately selected for the position. When I asked Angel about her experiences at work and her anxiety, I immediately met her polarized parts.	Анхель говорит, что, хотя ее рабочее место с самого начала было токсичным, с ее тревогой стало невозможно справиться, когда ее упустили из виду при повышении по службе после шести месяцев работы без звания или повышения заработной платы, и при этом она обладала большим образованием, опытом и квалификацией, чем человек, который в конечном итоге был выбран на эту должность. Когда я спросил Энджел о ее переживаниях на работе и ее беспокойстве, я сразу же обнаружил ее поляризованные части.	Angel says that although her workplace was toxic to begin with, her anxiety became impossible to manage when she was overlooked for a promotion after doing the job for six months without a title or pay increase, and while possessing more education, experience, and qualifications than the person who was ultimately selected for the position. When I asked Angel about her experiences at work and her anxiety, I immediately met her polarized parts.
“I am by far the most qualified for the promotion. I hold degrees from two Ivy League universities. I spent six months doing the job required of the position. I’ve taken on every project my boss has offered, carrying a much higher workload than my co-workers. I want to say something about not getting the promotion, but it’s better not to rock the boat and ruin my chances for future promotions.”	“I am by far the most qualified for the promotion. I hold degrees from two Ivy League universities. I spent six months doing the job required of the position. I’ve taken on every project my boss has offered, carrying a much higher workload than my co-workers. I want to say something about not getting the promotion, but it’s better not to rock the boat and ruin my chances for future promotions.”	«Я, безусловно, наиболее квалифицирован для повышения. У меня есть степени двух университетов Лиги плюща. Я провел шесть месяцев, выполняя работу, необходимую для этой должности. Я брал на себя каждый проект, предложенный моим начальником, и брал на себя гораздо большую рабочую нагрузку, чем мои коллеги. Я хочу сказать кое-что о том, что не получил повышения, но лучше не раскачивать лодку и не разрушать свои шансы на будущее повышение».	“I am by far the most qualified for the promotion. I hold degrees from two Ivy League universities. I spent six months doing the job required of the position. I’ve taken on every project my boss has offered, carrying a much higher workload than my co-workers. I want to say something about not getting the promotion, but it’s better not to rock the boat and ruin my chances for future promotions.”
“What would you want to know from your boss?”	“What would you want to know from your boss?”	«Что бы вы хотели узнать от своего начальника?»	“What would you want to know from your boss?”
“I want to know what I can do to improve my chances for promotion. I know how to give people exactly what they want from me. All she needs to do is tell me, and I’ll deliver. But on the other hand, I deserve to know why I didn’t get the damn promotion. No one else works their ass off the way I do. I’ve been doing the job for six months! I want to storm into her office and demand the truth. I tolerated her racist comments and microaggressions. I’m tired of it! I thought this promotion was a sure way to get out from under her thumb and to work in a new division in another office.”	“I want to know what I can do to improve my chances for promotion. I know how to give people exactly what they want from me. All she needs to do is tell me, and I’ll deliver. But on the other hand, I deserve to know why I didn’t get the damn promotion. No one else works their ass off the way I do. I’ve been doing the job for six months! I want to storm into her office and demand the truth. I tolerated her racist comments and microaggressions. I’m tired of it! I thought this promotion was a sure way to get out from under her thumb and to work in a new division in another office.”	«Я хочу знать, что я могу сделать, чтобы улучшить свои шансы на повышение. Я знаю, как дать людям именно то, что они от меня хотят. Все, что ей нужно сделать, это сказать мне, и я доставлю. Но с другой стороны, я заслуживаю знать, почему я не получил чертово повышение. Никто больше не работает так, как я. Я работаю полгода! Я хочу ворваться в ее офис и потребовать правду. Я терпел ее расистские комментарии и микроагрессию. Я устал от этого! Я подумал, что это повышение — верный способ выйти из-под ее власти и работать в новом подразделении в другом офисе».	“I want to know what I can do to improve my chances for promotion. I know how to give people exactly what they want from me. All she needs to do is tell me, and I’ll deliver. But on the other hand, I deserve to know why I didn’t get the damn promotion. No one else works their ass off the way I do. I’ve been doing the job for six months! I want to storm into her office and demand the truth. I tolerated her racist comments and microaggressions. I’m tired of it! I thought this promotion was a sure way to get out from under her thumb and to work in a new division in another office.”
“Angel, I’m hearing that you’re torn between not making waves and wanting to demand answers. It also sounds like you feel slighted and angry after doing the job for six months, is that correct?”	“Angel, I’m hearing that you’re torn between not making waves and wanting to demand answers. It also sounds like you feel slighted and angry after doing the job for six months, is that correct?”	«Ангел, я слышал, что ты разрываешься между тем, чтобы не поднимать волну, и желанием потребовать ответов. Это также звучит так, будто вы чувствуете себя обиженным и злым после шести месяцев работы на работе, верно?»	“Angel, I’m hearing that you’re torn between not making waves and wanting to demand answers. It also sounds like you feel slighted and angry after doing the job for six months, is that correct?”
“Yes.” After a long pause she adds, “And no. I want to know why she didn’t promote the most qualified person on her team. I want to know if I’m wasting my time. But if I ask, I’m afraid I’ll never get promoted. I can wait. I will wait. Then I think, this is bullshit! I have worked hard and proven my value. Yet it is the white men on the team who get promoted. To add insult to being overlooked, she asked me to bring the white man who got promoted up to speed. I am so damn angry. I don’t know who I’m most angry with, her or myself.” Angel closes her eyes, shakes her head, and sighs in disbelief.	“Yes.” After a long pause she adds, “And no. I want to know why she didn’t promote the most qualified person on her team. I want to know if I’m wasting my time. But if I ask, I’m afraid I’ll never get promoted. I can wait. I will wait. Then I think, this is bullshit! I have worked hard and proven my value. Yet it is the white men on the team who get promoted. To add insult to being overlooked, she asked me to bring the white man who got promoted up to speed. I am so damn angry. I don’t know who I’m most angry with, her or myself.” Angel closes her eyes, shakes her head, and sighs in disbelief.	"Да." После долгой паузы она добавляет: «И нет. Я хочу знать, почему она не повысила самого квалифицированного человека в своей команде. Я хочу знать, трачу ли я время зря. Но если я спрошу, боюсь, меня никогда не повысят. Я могу подождать. Я подожду. Тогда я думаю, это ерунда! Я много работал и доказал свою ценность. Тем не менее, повышение получают белые мужчины в команде. Чтобы еще больше оскорбить то, что ее не заметили, она попросила меня ввести в курс дела белого мужчину, получившего повышение. Я так чертовски зол. Я не знаю, на кого я злюсь больше: на нее или на себя». Ангел закрывает глаза, качает головой и недоверчиво вздыхает.	“Yes.” After a long pause she adds, “And no. I want to know why she didn’t promote the most qualified person on her team. I want to know if I’m wasting my time. But if I ask, I’m afraid I’ll never get promoted. I can wait. I will wait. Then I think, this is bullshit! I have worked hard and proven my value. Yet it is the white men on the team who get promoted. To add insult to being overlooked, she asked me to bring the white man who got promoted up to speed. I am so damn angry. I don’t know who I’m most angry with, her or myself.” Angel closes her eyes, shakes her head, and sighs in disbelief.
“I hear how hard you’re working and not being recognized for your contribution. I get a sense that you’re most angry about tolerating your boss’s microaggressions and still not being promoted.”	“I hear how hard you’re working and not being recognized for your contribution. I get a sense that you’re most angry about tolerating your boss’s microaggressions and still not being promoted.”	«Я слышал, как усердно вы работаете, а ваш вклад не получают признания. У меня такое ощущение, что больше всего вас злит то, что вы терпите микроагрессию своего начальника и при этом не получаете повышения по службе».	“I hear how hard you’re working and not being recognized for your contribution. I get a sense that you’re most angry about tolerating your boss’s microaggressions and still not being promoted.”
“Thank you for saying that, because sometimes I feel like I’m not seeing or experiencing what I am. When my boss comments that I’m different from other Black people she’s managed—when she displays genuine surprise that I consistently arrive to work on time, complete projects on or ahead of schedule, and don’t complain about my workload—I think it’s going to pay off. I refuse to live down to her low expectations of me as a Black professional. The fact that she has such low expectations of me and other Black people pisses me off, but if I express my anger, I could lose my job. I even feel I’ll lose my job if I ask why I didn’t get promoted. I feel like I have no options but to keep doing what I’ve been doing: work hard and continue to take on the special projects, because if I keep demonstrating my worth, she’ll take note.”	“Thank you for saying that, because sometimes I feel like I’m not seeing or experiencing what I am. When my boss comments that I’m different from other Black people she’s managed—when she displays genuine surprise that I consistently arrive to work on time, complete projects on or ahead of schedule, and don’t complain about my workload—I think it’s going to pay off. I refuse to live down to her low expectations of me as a Black professional. The fact that she has such low expectations of me and other Black people pisses me off, but if I express my anger, I could lose my job. I even feel I’ll lose my job if I ask why I didn’t get promoted. I feel like I have no options but to keep doing what I’ve been doing: work hard and continue to take on the special projects, because if I keep demonstrating my worth, she’ll take note.”	«Спасибо, что сказали это, потому что иногда мне кажется, что я не вижу и не испытываю того, кто я есть. Когда мой начальник отмечает, что я отличаюсь от других чернокожих людей, которыми она руководит, — когда она искренне удивляется тому, что я всегда прихожу на работу вовремя, завершаю проекты в срок или раньше срока и не жалуюсь на свою рабочую нагрузку — я думаю, что это окупится. Я отказываюсь оправдывать ее низкие ожидания от меня как от чернокожего профессионала. Тот факт, что она так мало ожидает от меня и других чернокожих, меня бесит, но если я выражу свой гнев, я могу потерять работу. Я даже чувствую, что потеряю работу, если спрошу, почему меня не повысили. Я чувствую, что у меня нет другого выбора, кроме как продолжать делать то, что я делал: усердно работать и продолжать заниматься специальными проектами, потому что, если я продолжу демонстрировать свою ценность, она примет это к сведению».	“Thank you for saying that, because sometimes I feel like I’m not seeing or experiencing what I am. When my boss comments that I’m different from other Black people she’s managed—when she displays genuine surprise that I consistently arrive to work on time, complete projects on or ahead of schedule, and don’t complain about my workload—I think it’s going to pay off. I refuse to live down to her low expectations of me as a Black professional. The fact that she has such low expectations of me and other Black people pisses me off, but if I express my anger, I could lose my job. I even feel I’ll lose my job if I ask why I didn’t get promoted. I feel like I have no options but to keep doing what I’ve been doing: work hard and continue to take on the special projects, because if I keep demonstrating my worth, she’ll take note.”
“I hear you going back and forth between trying to please the boss by being a model employee, taking on extra projects and roles, and not being appreciated or rewarded for your dedication, which makes you angry.”	“I hear you going back and forth between trying to please the boss by being a model employee, taking on extra projects and roles, and not being appreciated or rewarded for your dedication, which makes you angry.”	«Я слышу, как вы мечетесь между попытками угодить начальнику, будучи образцовым сотрудником, беря на себя дополнительные проекты и роли, и тем, что вас не ценят и не вознаграждают за вашу преданность делу, что вас злит».	“I hear you going back and forth between trying to please the boss by being a model employee, taking on extra projects and roles, and not being appreciated or rewarded for your dedication, which makes you angry.”
“Yes, that’s exactly it. I have my Go Along to Get Along part that wants to please everybody, and then I have the Bulldog who wants to fight for what’s right.”	“Yes, that’s exactly it. I have my Go Along to Get Along part that wants to please everybody, and then I have the Bulldog who wants to fight for what’s right.”	«Да, это именно так. У меня есть часть «Идти вместе, чтобы ладить», которая хочет угодить всем, а также есть Бульдог, который хочет бороться за то, что правильно».	“Yes, that’s exactly it. I have my Go Along to Get Along part that wants to please everybody, and then I have the Bulldog who wants to fight for what’s right.”
“How do you feel toward these parts?”	“How do you feel toward these parts?”	«Как вы относитесь к этим местам?»	“How do you feel toward these parts?”
“I don’t like either.”	“I don’t like either.”	— Мне тоже не нравится.	“I don’t like either.”
“Angel, can you ask the part that doesn’t like either to step back?”	“Angel, can you ask the part that doesn’t like either to step back?”	«Ангел, можешь ли ты попросить ту часть, которая не любит ни того, ни другого, отступить?»	“Angel, can you ask the part that doesn’t like either to step back?”
“Oh, sure.” She closes her eyes and speaks silently with that part.	“Oh, sure.” She closes her eyes and speaks silently with that part.	«О, конечно». Она закрывает глаза и молча говорит этой частью.	“Oh, sure.” She closes her eyes and speaks silently with that part.
“Now, how do you feel toward the Go Along to Get Along part and the Bulldog?”	“Now, how do you feel toward the Go Along to Get Along part and the Bulldog?”	«А как вы относитесь к части «Иди вместе, чтобы ладить» и к Бульдогу?»	“Now, how do you feel toward the Go Along to Get Along part and the Bulldog?”
“I want to understand them more. I’m curious about them both.”	“I want to understand them more. I’m curious about them both.”	«Я хочу понять их больше. Мне интересно узнать о них обоих».	“I want to understand them more. I’m curious about them both.”
“Okay, that’s good. Let the parts know you’re curious and see if they’re willing to get to know you and each other.”	“Okay, that’s good. Let the parts know you’re curious and see if they’re willing to get to know you and each other.”	«Хорошо, это хорошо. Дайте частям понять, что вам интересно, и посмотрите, захотят ли они узнать вас и друг друга».	“Okay, that’s good. Let the parts know you’re curious and see if they’re willing to get to know you and each other.”
When Angel felt curious about both parts, they agreed to listen to each other and share their fears and concerns with her. We discovered that Go Along to Get Along is Angel’s face to the world. This part assists her in succeeding in school, career, and relationships by insisting that she go along with what other people want and expect of her, even when she doesn’t want to, because this part believes being likeable and not rocking the boat is how Angel will get ahead. Go Along to Get Along helps Angel to feel valued and seen by others by pleasing them and being likable. She also hopes that by appeasing others, she can keep Bulldog under control. Go Along to Get Along fears two outcomes if she stops doing her job. First, that Bulldog will blow up Angel’s life and cause irrevocable damage. Second, that Angel will feel worthless and unlovable and this will result in her being alone.	When Angel felt curious about both parts, they agreed to listen to each other and share their fears and concerns with her. We discovered that Go Along to Get Along is Angel’s face to the world. This part assists her in succeeding in school, career, and relationships by insisting that she go along with what other people want and expect of her, even when she doesn’t want to, because this part believes being likeable and not rocking the boat is how Angel will get ahead. Go Along to Get Along helps Angel to feel valued and seen by others by pleasing them and being likable. She also hopes that by appeasing others, she can keep Bulldog under control. Go Along to Get Along fears two outcomes if she stops doing her job. First, that Bulldog will blow up Angel’s life and cause irrevocable damage. Second, that Angel will feel worthless and unlovable and this will result in her being alone.	Когда Ангел почувствовала интерес к обеим сторонам, они согласились выслушать друг друга и поделиться с ней своими страхами и опасениями. Мы обнаружили, что «Иди вместе, чтобы ладить» — это лицо Ангела миру. Эта часть помогает ей добиться успеха в школе, карьере и отношениях, настаивая на том, чтобы она соглашалась с тем, чего хотят и ожидают от нее другие люди, даже когда она этого не хочет, потому что эта часть считает, что нужно быть симпатичным и не раскачивать лодку. как Ангел будет продвигаться вперед. «Иди вместе, чтобы ладить» помогает Ангелу чувствовать, что его ценят и видят другие, доставляя им удовольствие и вызывая симпатию. Она также надеется, что, умиротворяя других, она сможет держать Бульдога под контролем. «Иди вместе, чтобы ладить» опасается двух последствий, если она перестанет выполнять свою работу. Во-первых, этот Бульдог разрушит жизнь Ангела и нанесет непоправимый ущерб. Во-вторых, этот Ангел почувствует себя никчемным и непривлекательным, и это приведет к тому, что она останется одна.	When Angel felt curious about both parts, they agreed to listen to each other and share their fears and concerns with her. We discovered that Go Along to Get Along is Angel’s face to the world. This part assists her in succeeding in school, career, and relationships by insisting that she go along with what other people want and expect of her, even when she doesn’t want to, because this part believes being likeable and not rocking the boat is how Angel will get ahead. Go Along to Get Along helps Angel to feel valued and seen by others by pleasing them and being likable. She also hopes that by appeasing others, she can keep Bulldog under control. Go Along to Get Along fears two outcomes if she stops doing her job. First, that Bulldog will blow up Angel’s life and cause irrevocable damage. Second, that Angel will feel worthless and unlovable and this will result in her being alone.
In spending time getting to know Bulldog, we found there are two situations likely to activate this part’s rage. This part is angered when it believes Angel is being victimized or allowing others to take advantage of her. Bulldog holds that Angel is responsible at least partly for what it views as mistreatment because she won’t stand up for herself. It becomes enraged when Angel feels the emotional pain of worthlessness. In this particular situation, Bulldog was enraged and ready to confront Angel’s boss for devaluing her and causing feelings of unworthiness to surface.	In spending time getting to know Bulldog, we found there are two situations likely to activate this part’s rage. This part is angered when it believes Angel is being victimized or allowing others to take advantage of her. Bulldog holds that Angel is responsible at least partly for what it views as mistreatment because she won’t stand up for herself. It becomes enraged when Angel feels the emotional pain of worthlessness. In this particular situation, Bulldog was enraged and ready to confront Angel’s boss for devaluing her and causing feelings of unworthiness to surface.	Потратив время на знакомство с Бульдогом, мы обнаружили, что есть две ситуации, которые могут активировать ярость этой части. Эта часть возмущается, когда считает, что Ангел становится жертвой или позволяет другим воспользоваться ею. Бульдог считает, что Энджел несет ответственность, по крайней мере частично, за то, что она считает жестоким обращением, потому что она не может постоять за себя. Он приходит в ярость, когда Ангел чувствует эмоциональную боль своей никчемности. В этой конкретной ситуации Бульдог был в ярости и готов противостоять боссу Ангела за то, что он обесценил ее и вызвал на поверхность чувство своей никчемности.	In spending time getting to know Bulldog, we found there are two situations likely to activate this part’s rage. This part is angered when it believes Angel is being victimized or allowing others to take advantage of her. Bulldog holds that Angel is responsible at least partly for what it views as mistreatment because she won’t stand up for herself. It becomes enraged when Angel feels the emotional pain of worthlessness. In this particular situation, Bulldog was enraged and ready to confront Angel’s boss for devaluing her and causing feelings of unworthiness to surface.
In this exchange, Angel gained valuable information that she didn’t have before getting to know these parts. Her biggest takeaway was that neither part wanted her to feel worthless. They were both protecting the same exile. Go Along to Get Along protected Angel from feeling worthless by meeting others’ needs and requests in order to prove her value. If others see her as invaluable, she will not feel worthless, this part reasons. Bulldog’s strategy was to get angry, challenge, and criticize when Angel experienced worthlessness. Both Go Along to Get Along and Bulldog are protectors in Angel’s system. Go Along to Get Along is a manager who is working to keep Angel from ever feeling the worthlessness of the exile, and Bulldog is a firefighter who springs into action when Angel feels devalued and worthless. When these two parts gained awareness of how similar their roles are, they relaxed and granted access to the exile they both protected.	In this exchange, Angel gained valuable information that she didn’t have before getting to know these parts. Her biggest takeaway was that neither part wanted her to feel worthless. They were both protecting the same exile. Go Along to Get Along protected Angel from feeling worthless by meeting others’ needs and requests in order to prove her value. If others see her as invaluable, she will not feel worthless, this part reasons. Bulldog’s strategy was to get angry, challenge, and criticize when Angel experienced worthlessness. Both Go Along to Get Along and Bulldog are protectors in Angel’s system. Go Along to Get Along is a manager who is working to keep Angel from ever feeling the worthlessness of the exile, and Bulldog is a firefighter who springs into action when Angel feels devalued and worthless. When these two parts gained awareness of how similar their roles are, they relaxed and granted access to the exile they both protected.	В ходе этого разговора Ангел получила ценную информацию, которой у нее не было до знакомства с этими местами. Ее самым большим выводом было то, что ни одна из сторон не хотела, чтобы она чувствовала себя никчемной. Они оба защищали одного и того же изгнанника. Программа «Иди вместе, чтобы ладить» защитила Ангел от чувства никчемности, удовлетворяя нужды и запросы других, чтобы доказать свою ценность. Если другие видят в ней бесценную ценность, она не будет чувствовать себя никчемной, рассуждает эта часть. Стратегия Бульдога заключалась в том, чтобы злиться, бросать вызов и критиковать, когда Ангел чувствовал свою никчемность. И «Иди, чтобы ладить», и Бульдог — защитники в системе Ангела. «Иди вместе, чтобы ладить» — менеджер, который работает над тем, чтобы Ангел никогда не чувствовал никчемности изгнанника, а Бульдог — пожарный, который бросается в бой, когда Ангел чувствует себя обесцененным и бесполезным. Когда эти две части осознали, насколько схожи их роли, они расслабились и предоставили доступ к изгнаннику, которого оба защищали.	In this exchange, Angel gained valuable information that she didn’t have before getting to know these parts. Her biggest takeaway was that neither part wanted her to feel worthless. They were both protecting the same exile. Go Along to Get Along protected Angel from feeling worthless by meeting others’ needs and requests in order to prove her value. If others see her as invaluable, she will not feel worthless, this part reasons. Bulldog’s strategy was to get angry, challenge, and criticize when Angel experienced worthlessness. Both Go Along to Get Along and Bulldog are protectors in Angel’s system. Go Along to Get Along is a manager who is working to keep Angel from ever feeling the worthlessness of the exile, and Bulldog is a firefighter who springs into action when Angel feels devalued and worthless. When these two parts gained awareness of how similar their roles are, they relaxed and granted access to the exile they both protected.
Parts will give access to the vulnerable exile they protect when they feel heard. In the case of a polarization, the part needs to be heard and understood not only by the Self but also by the parts it’s polarized with. If parts do not allow access to the exile, it means you need to take more time to get to know these parts. It is important to discover what they are afraid would happen if they let you connect with the one they protect. Again, you need to hear them out, express compassion and curiosity for their concerns. Sometimes, it is too difficult to access an exile on your own, and it may require professional help. (See “Still Listening Resources” at the end of this book to locate a therapist or practitioner if you need to.)	Parts will give access to the vulnerable exile they protect when they feel heard. In the case of a polarization, the part needs to be heard and understood not only by the Self but also by the parts it’s polarized with. If parts do not allow access to the exile, it means you need to take more time to get to know these parts. It is important to discover what they are afraid would happen if they let you connect with the one they protect. Again, you need to hear them out, express compassion and curiosity for their concerns. Sometimes, it is too difficult to access an exile on your own, and it may require professional help. (See “Still Listening Resources” at the end of this book to locate a therapist or practitioner if you need to.)	Части откроют доступ к уязвимому изгнаннику, которого они защищают, когда почувствуют, что их услышали. В случае поляризации часть должна быть услышана и понята не только Самостью, но и частями, с которыми она поляризована. Если части не открывают доступ к изгнанию, значит, вам нужно потратить больше времени на знакомство с этими частями. Важно выяснить, чего они боятся, если они позволят вам связаться с тем, кого они защищают. Опять же, вам нужно выслушать их, выразить сострадание и интерес к их проблемам. Иногда самостоятельно получить доступ к изгнанию слишком сложно, и может потребоваться профессиональная помощь. (См. «Ресурсы для того, чтобы все еще слушать» в конце этой книги, чтобы найти терапевта или практикующего врача, если вам нужно.)	Parts will give access to the vulnerable exile they protect when they feel heard. In the case of a polarization, the part needs to be heard and understood not only by the Self but also by the parts it’s polarized with. If parts do not allow access to the exile, it means you need to take more time to get to know these parts. It is important to discover what they are afraid would happen if they let you connect with the one they protect. Again, you need to hear them out, express compassion and curiosity for their concerns. Sometimes, it is too difficult to access an exile on your own, and it may require professional help. (See “Still Listening Resources” at the end of this book to locate a therapist or practitioner if you need to.)
Meditation: Polarization Picnic	Meditation: Polarization Picnic	Медитация: пикник поляризации	Meditation: Polarization Picnic
The Polarization Picnic meditation is the sixth given to me by my ancestors. At the time I received this, I had been going back and forth about whether it was time to significantly reduce my private practice caseload. My burgeoning IFS consultation business and my pursuit of becoming an IFS trainer were requiring significantly more attention and time. One day I had certainty about cutting back my practice, and the very next day, I’d convince myself not to. During this dilemma, my generous and wise ancestors gifted me with the Polarization Picnic meditation. By listening to each side of my polarization, I gained clarity and ultimately was able to make a Self-led decision about my practice.	The Polarization Picnic meditation is the sixth given to me by my ancestors. At the time I received this, I had been going back and forth about whether it was time to significantly reduce my private practice caseload. My burgeoning IFS consultation business and my pursuit of becoming an IFS trainer were requiring significantly more attention and time. One day I had certainty about cutting back my practice, and the very next day, I’d convince myself not to. During this dilemma, my generous and wise ancestors gifted me with the Polarization Picnic meditation. By listening to each side of my polarization, I gained clarity and ultimately was able to make a Self-led decision about my practice.	Медитация «Поляризационный пикник» — шестая медитация, данная мне моими предками. В то время, когда я получил это письмо, я размышлял о том, не пора ли значительно сократить нагрузку на мою частную практику. Мой растущий консультационный бизнес по IFS и мое стремление стать тренером IFS требовали значительно больше внимания и времени. Однажды я был уверен, что сокращу свою практику, а уже на следующий день убедил себя не делать этого. Во время этой дилеммы мои щедрые и мудрые предки подарили мне медитацию «Поляризационный пикник». Прислушиваясь к каждой стороне своей поляризации, я обрел ясность и, в конечном итоге, смог принять самостоятельное решение относительно своей практики.	The Polarization Picnic meditation is the sixth given to me by my ancestors. At the time I received this, I had been going back and forth about whether it was time to significantly reduce my private practice caseload. My burgeoning IFS consultation business and my pursuit of becoming an IFS trainer were requiring significantly more attention and time.
