One day I had certainty about cutting back my practice, and the very next day, I’d convince myself not to. During this dilemma, my generous and wise ancestors gifted me with the Polarization Picnic meditation. By listening to each side of my polarization, I gained clarity and ultimately was able to make a Self-led decision about my practice.
This meditation invites you to get to know the story of two of your polarized parts, develop a relationship with them, and discover the vulnerable part they protect.	This meditation invites you to get to know the story of two of your polarized parts, develop a relationship with them, and discover the vulnerable part they protect.	Эта медитация предлагает вам узнать историю двух ваших поляризованных частей, развить с ними отношения и обнаружить уязвимую часть, которую они защищают.	This meditation invites you to get to know the story of two of your polarized parts, develop a relationship with them, and discover the vulnerable part they protect.
Find a comfortable seat.	Find a comfortable seat.	Найдите удобное сиденье.	Find a comfortable seat.
Close your eyes or soften your gaze.	Close your eyes or soften your gaze.	Закройте глаза или смягчите взгляд.	Close your eyes or soften your gaze.
Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.	Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.	Перенесите свое осознание на свое дыхание и просто дышите.	Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.
Breathe in for four counts and breathe out for four counts.	Breathe in for four counts and breathe out for four counts.	Вдохните на четыре счета и выдохните на четыре счета.	Breathe in for four counts and breathe out for four counts.
Do that a few times, increasing your relaxation.	Do that a few times, increasing your relaxation.	Сделайте это несколько раз, увеличивая расслабление.	Do that a few times, increasing your relaxation.
Visualize you’re in a park, sitting on a picnic blanket.	Visualize you’re in a park, sitting on a picnic blanket.	Представьте, что вы находитесь в парке и сидите на одеяле для пикника.	Visualize you’re in a park, sitting on a picnic blanket.
You have a picnic basket with a spread of your favorite foods, enough to feed you and several others.	You have a picnic basket with a spread of your favorite foods, enough to feed you and several others.	У вас есть корзина для пикника с набором ваших любимых продуктов, которой хватит, чтобы накормить вас и еще нескольких человек.	You have a picnic basket with a spread of your favorite foods, enough to feed you and several others.
While removing items from the basket, you hear arguing.	While removing items from the basket, you hear arguing.	Вынимая товары из корзины, вы слышите спор.	While removing items from the basket, you hear arguing.
You look in the direction of the disagreeable noise and see two parts of yourself.	You look in the direction of the disagreeable noise and see two parts of yourself.	Вы смотрите в сторону неприятного шума и видите две части себя.	You look in the direction of the disagreeable noise and see two parts of yourself.
They are speaking in raised tones with neither listening.	They are speaking in raised tones with neither listening.	Они говорят на повышенных тонах, но их никто не слушает.	They are speaking in raised tones with neither listening.
You do what you can to get their attention.	You do what you can to get their attention.	Вы делаете все возможное, чтобы привлечь их внимание.	You do what you can to get their attention.
When they notice, you invite them to join you on the blanket.	When they notice, you invite them to join you on the blanket.	Когда они это заметят, вы приглашаете их присоединиться к вам на одеяле.	When they notice, you invite them to join you on the blanket.
They sit down and start explaining their side of the argument.	They sit down and start explaining their side of the argument.	Они садятся и начинают объяснять свою точку зрения.	They sit down and start explaining their side of the argument.
Compassionately, you tell them you want to help.	Compassionately, you tell them you want to help.	Вы из сострадания говорите им, что хотите помочь.	Compassionately, you tell them you want to help.
Again, they respond by speaking over one another.	Again, they respond by speaking over one another.	И снова они отвечают, переговариваясь друг с другом.	Again, they respond by speaking over one another.
Share that you’re curious to get to know each of them one at a time.	Share that you’re curious to get to know each of them one at a time.	Поделитесь, что вам интересно познакомиться с каждым из них по отдельности.	Share that you’re curious to get to know each of them one at a time.
Reassure them that each will get a chance, and you will not allow one to take over.	Reassure them that each will get a chance, and you will not allow one to take over.	Убедите их, что у каждого будет шанс, и вы не позволите никому взять верх.	Reassure them that each will get a chance, and you will not allow one to take over.
Next, you ask them if they are willing to listen to each other.	Next, you ask them if they are willing to listen to each other.	Затем вы спрашиваете их, готовы ли они выслушать друг друга.	Next, you ask them if they are willing to listen to each other.
If they are not, listen and address their concerns.	If they are not, listen and address their concerns.	Если это не так, выслушайте и решите их проблемы.	If they are not, listen and address their concerns.
If they are, ask the first part why it is doing what it’s doing.	If they are, ask the first part why it is doing what it’s doing.	Если да, спросите первую часть, почему она делает то, что делает.	If they are, ask the first part why it is doing what it’s doing.
Then ask how it is trying to help.	Then ask how it is trying to help.	Затем спросите, как он пытается помочь.	Then ask how it is trying to help.
Once you have a sense of how this part is trying to help, turn to the second part and ask why it is doing what it’s doing.	Once you have a sense of how this part is trying to help, turn to the second part and ask why it is doing what it’s doing.	Как только вы поймете, как эта часть пытается помочь, обратитесь ко второй части и спросите, почему она делает то, что делает.	Once you have a sense of how this part is trying to help, turn to the second part and ask why it is doing what it’s doing.
Now ask how it is trying to help.	Now ask how it is trying to help.	Теперь спросите, как он пытается помочь.	Now ask how it is trying to help.
Notice how both parts are trying to help you and acknowledge their positive intent.	Notice how both parts are trying to help you and acknowledge their positive intent.	Обратите внимание, как обе части пытаются вам помочь, и признайте их позитивные намерения.	Notice how both parts are trying to help you and acknowledge their positive intent.
Ask them what their behavior costs them.	Ask them what their behavior costs them.	Спросите их, чего им стоит их поведение.	Ask them what their behavior costs them.
Allow each an opportunity to speak in turn.	Allow each an opportunity to speak in turn.	Дайте каждому возможность высказаться по очереди.	Allow each an opportunity to speak in turn.
When that feels complete, ask each of them what they are afraid would happen if they didn’t do this.	When that feels complete, ask each of them what they are afraid would happen if they didn’t do this.	Когда вы почувствуете, что все готово, спросите каждого из них, чего, по их мнению, произойдет, если они этого не сделают.	When that feels complete, ask each of them what they are afraid would happen if they didn’t do this.
Lastly, ask them to show you the vulnerable one they are protecting.	Lastly, ask them to show you the vulnerable one they are protecting.	Наконец, попросите их показать вам уязвимого человека, которого они защищают.	Lastly, ask them to show you the vulnerable one they are protecting.
If they do, let them know that you can help that part.	If they do, let them know that you can help that part.	Если да, дайте им знать, что вы можете помочь в этой части.	If they do, let them know that you can help that part.
If they do not, that’s okay. You may need to spend more time getting to know them.	If they do not, that’s okay. You may need to spend more time getting to know them.	Если они этого не делают, это нормально. Возможно, вам придется потратить больше времени на их знакомство.	If they do not, that’s okay. You may need to spend more time getting to know them.
Invite them to share your picnic meal, and over the meal, explore with the parts anything else they want to share with you.	Invite them to share your picnic meal, and over the meal, explore with the parts anything else they want to share with you.	Пригласите их разделить с вами еду для пикника, а во время еды вместе с частями изучите все, чем они хотят с вами поделиться.	Invite them to share your picnic meal, and over the meal, explore with the parts anything else they want to share with you.
Let them know you would like to continue connecting with them, and set intentions to do so.	Let them know you would like to continue connecting with them, and set intentions to do so.	Сообщите им, что вы хотели бы продолжить общение с ними, и поставьте перед собой такое намерение.	Let them know you would like to continue connecting with them, and set intentions to do so.
If it feels right, show them some appreciation for what they shared with you and each other.	If it feels right, show them some appreciation for what they shared with you and each other.	Если это кажется правильным, покажите им некоторую признательность за то, чем они поделились с вами и друг с другом.	If it feels right, show them some appreciation for what they shared with you and each other.
Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe as you re-enter this moment and space.	Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe as you re-enter this moment and space.	Сосредоточьте свое внимание на своем дыхании и просто дышите, возвращаясь в этот момент и пространство.	Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe as you re-enter this moment and space.
Slowly open your eyes when you are ready.	Slowly open your eyes when you are ready.	Медленно откройте глаза, когда будете готовы.	Slowly open your eyes when you are ready.
Exercise 1: Journal Capture	Exercise 1: Journal Capture	Упражнение 1. Ведение журнала	Exercise 1: Journal Capture
Journal what you would like to capture from this meditation, like a revelation, reflection, or anything significant you want to remember from this experience.	Journal what you would like to capture from this meditation, like a revelation, reflection, or anything significant you want to remember from this experience.	Запишите то, что вы хотели бы уловить в результате этой медитации, например, откровение, размышление или что-то важное, что вы хотите запомнить из этого опыта.	Journal what you would like to capture from this meditation, like a revelation, reflection, or anything significant you want to remember from this experience.
Exercise 2: Polarization Picnic Journal Questions	Exercise 2: Polarization Picnic Journal Questions	Упражнение 2: Вопросы для журнала «Поляризация пикника»	Exercise 2: Polarization Picnic Journal Questions
After you’ve done the Polarization Picnic meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.	After you’ve done the Polarization Picnic meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.	После того, как вы выполнили медитацию «Поляризационный пикник» и написали быстрый «Захват журнала», потратьте некоторое время на более глубокое изучение, отвечая на следующие подсказки журнала.	After you’ve done the Polarization Picnic meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.
Who are your polarized parts?	Who are your polarized parts?	Кто ваши поляризованные части?	Who are your polarized parts?
Describe how your parts are polarized.	Describe how your parts are polarized.	Опишите, как поляризованы ваши части.	Describe how your parts are polarized.
Were your parts able to listen to each other? Why? Why not?	Were your parts able to listen to each other? Why? Why not?	Смогли ли ваши части услышать друг друга? Почему? Почему нет?	Were your parts able to listen to each other? Why? Why not?
What is the position of each part?	What is the position of each part?	Каково положение каждой части?	What is the position of each part?
Why is each part doing what they are doing?	Why is each part doing what they are doing?	Почему каждая часть делает то, что делает?	Why is each part doing what they are doing?
How is each part trying to help you?	How is each part trying to help you?	Как каждая часть пытается вам помочь?	How is each part trying to help you?
Who is the vulnerable one(s) your parts protect?	Who is the vulnerable one(s) your parts protect?	Кого уязвимы ваши части?	Who is the vulnerable one(s) your parts protect?
What are the situations and/or people in your life that activate these parts?	What are the situations and/or people in your life that activate these parts?	Какие ситуации и/или люди в вашей жизни активизируют эти части?	What are the situations and/or people in your life that activate these parts?
What more did you learn from these parts?	What more did you learn from these parts?	Что еще вы узнали из этих мест?	What more did you learn from these parts?
Exercise 3: Drawing the Polarized System	Exercise 3: Drawing the Polarized System	Упражнение 3. Рисование поляризованной системы	Exercise 3: Drawing the Polarized System
Before starting this exercise, get some drawing supplies: paper, markers, colored pencils, paints, whatever works for you. Then move through the steps of this exercise.	Before starting this exercise, get some drawing supplies: paper, markers, colored pencils, paints, whatever works for you. Then move through the steps of this exercise.	Прежде чем приступить к этому упражнению, приобретите принадлежности для рисования: бумагу, маркеры, цветные карандаши, краски — все, что вам подходит. Затем выполните шаги этого упражнения.	Before starting this exercise, get some drawing supplies: paper, markers, colored pencils, paints, whatever works for you. Then move through the steps of this exercise.
Step 1: Go inside and connect with the first part from the Polarization Picnic meditation. It may express itself with words, images, sensations, emotions, or a felt sense.	Step 1: Go inside and connect with the first part from the Polarization Picnic meditation. It may express itself with words, images, sensations, emotions, or a felt sense.	Шаг 1: Зайдите внутрь и соединитесь с первой частью медитации «Пикник поляризации». Он может выражать себя словами, образами, ощущениями, эмоциями или чувствами.	Step 1: Go inside and connect with the first part from the Polarization Picnic meditation. It may express itself with words, images, sensations, emotions, or a felt sense.
Step 2: Once you have a sense of this part, ask it how it wants to be represented on the page, then draw it.	Step 2: Once you have a sense of this part, ask it how it wants to be represented on the page, then draw it.	Шаг 2: Как только вы поймете эту часть, спросите ее, как она хочет быть представлена ​​на странице, а затем нарисуйте ее.	Step 2: Once you have a sense of this part, ask it how it wants to be represented on the page, then draw it.
Step 3: Go inside and connect with the second part from the Polarization Picnic meditation.	Step 3: Go inside and connect with the second part from the Polarization Picnic meditation.	Шаг 3: Зайдите внутрь и соединитесь со второй частью медитации «Пикник поляризации».	Step 3: Go inside and connect with the second part from the Polarization Picnic meditation.
Step 4: Once you have a sense of this part, ask it how it wants to be represented on the page and where it wants to be on the page in relationship to the first part, then draw it.	Step 4: Once you have a sense of this part, ask it how it wants to be represented on the page and where it wants to be on the page in relationship to the first part, then draw it.	Шаг 4: Как только вы поймете эту часть, спросите ее, как она хочет быть представлена ​​на странице и где она хочет находиться на странице по отношению к первой части, а затем нарисуйте ее.	Step 4: Once you have a sense of this part, ask it how it wants to be represented on the page and where it wants to be on the page in relationship to the first part, then draw it.
Step 5: Look at the first part you drew. How do you feel toward this part? If it is a quality of Self (compassion, curiosity, calm, confidence, creativity, connectedness, courage, or clarity), draw a representation of the quality of Self near the part. If it’s not a quality of Self, connect with this new part and draw it on the page where it wants to be placed.	Step 5: Look at the first part you drew. How do you feel toward this part? If it is a quality of Self (compassion, curiosity, calm, confidence, creativity, connectedness, courage, or clarity), draw a representation of the quality of Self near the part. If it’s not a quality of Self, connect with this new part and draw it on the page where it wants to be placed.	Шаг 5: Посмотрите на первую часть, которую вы нарисовали. Как вы относитесь к этой части? Если это качество Личности (сострадание, любопытство, спокойствие, уверенность, творчество, связность, смелость или ясность), нарисуйте изображение качества Личности рядом с этой деталью. Если это не качество Самости, соединитесь с этой новой частью и нарисуйте ее на странице, где она хочет быть размещена.	Step 5: Look at the first part you drew. How do you feel toward this part? If it is a quality of Self (compassion, curiosity, calm, confidence, creativity, connectedness, courage, or clarity), draw a representation of the quality of Self near the part. If it’s not a quality of Self, connect with this new part and draw it on the page where it wants to be placed.
Step 6: Look at the second part you drew. How do you feel toward this part? If it is a quality of Self (compassion, curiosity, calm, confidence, creativity, connectedness, courage, or clarity), draw a representation of the quality of Self near the part. If it’s not a quality of Self, connect with this new part and draw it on the page where it wants to be placed.	Step 6: Look at the second part you drew. How do you feel toward this part? If it is a quality of Self (compassion, curiosity, calm, confidence, creativity, connectedness, courage, or clarity), draw a representation of the quality of Self near the part. If it’s not a quality of Self, connect with this new part and draw it on the page where it wants to be placed.	Шаг 6: Посмотрите на вторую часть, которую вы нарисовали. Как вы относитесь к этой части? Если это качество Личности (сострадание, любопытство, спокойствие, уверенность, творчество, связность, смелость или ясность), нарисуйте изображение качества Личности рядом с этой деталью. Если это не качество Самости, соединитесь с этой новой частью и нарисуйте ее на странице, где она хочет быть размещена.	Step 6: Look at the second part you drew. How do you feel toward this part? If it is a quality of Self (compassion, curiosity, calm, confidence, creativity, connectedness, courage, or clarity), draw a representation of the quality of Self near the part. If it’s not a quality of Self, connect with this new part and draw it on the page where it wants to be placed.
Step 7: Take some time to look at your parts on the page. Take as long as you need. As you look at your polarized system, what do you notice?	Step 7: Take some time to look at your parts on the page. Take as long as you need. As you look at your polarized system, what do you notice?	Шаг 7: Найдите время, чтобы просмотреть свои части на странице. Возьмите столько времени, сколько вам нужно. Что вы замечаете, глядя на свою поляризованную систему?	Step 7: Take some time to look at your parts on the page. Take as long as you need. As you look at your polarized system, what do you notice?
Step 8: You can continue to connect with your polarized system using your drawing to get to know more about each of these parts.	Step 8: You can continue to connect with your polarized system using your drawing to get to know more about each of these parts.	Шаг 8: Вы можете продолжать подключаться к своей поляризованной системе, используя рисунок, чтобы узнать больше о каждой из этих частей.	Step 8: You can continue to connect with your polarized system using your drawing to get to know more about each of these parts.
CHAPTER 8	CHAPTER 8	ГЛАВА 8	CHAPTER 8
Waterfall	Waterfall	Водопад	Waterfall
Working with Trauma Expressed in the Body	Working with Trauma Expressed in the Body	Работа с травмой, выраженной в теле	Working with Trauma Expressed in the Body
I was a passenger in a terrible car accident at 19 years old. My boyfriend at the time was driving. He had a green arrow for a left turn when a car came through the intersection and T-boned us on my side of the car. My injuries made it necessary for me to leave my job and college studies to recover. The lasting effects of the accident were severe lower back pain that worsened in times of stress, overwork, and emotional challenge. I sought pain relief from a multitude of medications, physical therapies, yoga, and homeopathic remedies, but nothing provided sustained improvement. I lived with the limitations of excruciating back pain for 26 years before finding true relief.	I was a passenger in a terrible car accident at 19 years old. My boyfriend at the time was driving. He had a green arrow for a left turn when a car came through the intersection and T-boned us on my side of the car. My injuries made it necessary for me to leave my job and college studies to recover. The lasting effects of the accident were severe lower back pain that worsened in times of stress, overwork, and emotional challenge. I sought pain relief from a multitude of medications, physical therapies, yoga, and homeopathic remedies, but nothing provided sustained improvement. I lived with the limitations of excruciating back pain for 26 years before finding true relief.	В 19 лет я был пассажиром ужасной автокатастрофы. Мой парень в это время был за рулем. У него была зеленая стрелка для поворота налево, когда машина проезжала перекресток и врезалась в нас с моей стороны машины. Из-за травм мне пришлось оставить работу и учебу в колледже, чтобы восстановиться. Последствиями аварии стали сильные боли в пояснице, которые усиливались во время стресса, переутомления и эмоциональных испытаний. Я искал облегчения боли с помощью множества лекарств, физиотерапии, йоги и гомеопатических средств, но ничто не давало устойчивого улучшения. Я жил с мучительной болью в спине в течение 26 лет, прежде чем нашел истинное облегчение.	I was a passenger in a terrible car accident at 19 years old. My boyfriend at the time was driving. He had a green arrow for a left turn when a car came through the intersection and T-boned us on my side of the car. My injuries made it necessary for me to leave my job and college studies to recover. The lasting effects of the accident were severe lower back pain that worsened in times of stress, overwork, and emotional challenge. I sought pain relief from a multitude of medications, physical therapies, yoga, and homeopathic remedies, but nothing provided sustained improvement. I lived with the limitations of excruciating back pain for 26 years before finding true relief.
Two books, The Mindbody Prescription: Healing the Body, Healing the Pain, by Dr. John Sarno,1 and The MindBody Workbook: A Thirty Day Program of Insight and Awareness for People with Back Pain and Other Disorders, by Dr. David Schechter,2 changed the course of how my parts used my body and back pain to communicate with me. Although neither book expressly mentions parts, they both speak of “repressed emotions” such as anger, fear, and unresolved grief and “aspects of personality” such as people pleasing, perfectionism, criticism, controlling, and over-responsibility, all of which are ways parts express in their extreme states.	Two books, The Mindbody Prescription: Healing the Body, Healing the Pain, by Dr. John Sarno,1 and The MindBody Workbook: A Thirty Day Program of Insight and Awareness for People with Back Pain and Other Disorders, by Dr. David Schechter,2 changed the course of how my parts used my body and back pain to communicate with me. Although neither book expressly mentions parts, they both speak of “repressed emotions” such as anger, fear, and unresolved grief and “aspects of personality” such as people pleasing, perfectionism, criticism, controlling, and over-responsibility, all of which are ways parts express in their extreme states.	Две книги: «Рецепт для тела и тела: исцеление тела, исцеление боли» доктора Джона Сарно1 и «Рабочая тетрадь MindBody: тридцатидневная программа понимания и осознания для людей с болями в спине и другими заболеваниями» доктора Дэвида Шехтера. 2 изменил способ того, как мои части использовали мое тело и боль в спине для общения со мной. Хотя ни в одной книге конкретно не упоминаются отдельные части, в обеих говорится о «подавленных эмоциях», таких как гнев, страх и неразрешимое горе, а также о «аспектах личности», таких как угождение людям, перфекционизм, критика, контроль и чрезмерная ответственность. способы выражения частей в своих крайних состояниях.	Two books, The Mindbody Prescription: Healing the Body, Healing the Pain, by Dr. John Sarno,1 and The MindBody Workbook: A Thirty Day Program of Insight and Awareness for People with Back Pain and Other Disorders, by Dr. David Schechter,2 changed the course of how my parts used my body and back pain to communicate with me. Although neither book expressly mentions parts, they both speak of “repressed emotions” such as anger, fear, and unresolved grief and “aspects of personality” such as people pleasing, perfectionism, criticism, controlling, and over-responsibility, all of which are ways parts express in their extreme states.
At the time I read these two books, my life was driven by each of these aspects of personality (parts) and the repressed emotions (parts) of rage, rejection, and shame. I would not allow myself to accept how inadequate I felt as a parent of a child who experienced an unbelievable amount of trauma in the foster care system prior to me adopting her. I believed my education and training as a social worker and my profession as a psychotherapist meant I should be able to help my child recover from their traumatic experiences, and simultaneously I carried the shame of my inability to do so.	At the time I read these two books, my life was driven by each of these aspects of personality (parts) and the repressed emotions (parts) of rage, rejection, and shame. I would not allow myself to accept how inadequate I felt as a parent of a child who experienced an unbelievable amount of trauma in the foster care system prior to me adopting her. I believed my education and training as a social worker and my profession as a psychotherapist meant I should be able to help my child recover from their traumatic experiences, and simultaneously I carried the shame of my inability to do so.	В то время, когда я читал эти две книги, моя жизнь определялась каждым из этих аспектов личности (частей) и подавленными эмоциями (частями) гнева, неприятия и стыда. Я не позволил себе смириться с тем, насколько неадекватным я себя чувствовал как родитель ребенка, который перенес невероятную травму в системе приемной семьи до того, как я ее усыновил. Я верил, что мое образование и подготовка социального работника, а также моя профессия психотерапевта означают, что я должен быть в состоянии помочь моему ребенку оправиться от травматического опыта, и одновременно я носил стыд за свою неспособность сделать это.	At the time I read these two books, my life was driven by each of these aspects of personality (parts) and the repressed emotions (parts) of rage, rejection, and shame. I would not allow myself to accept how inadequate I felt as a parent of a child who experienced an unbelievable amount of trauma in the foster care system prior to me adopting her. I believed my education and training as a social worker and my profession as a psychotherapist meant I should be able to help my child recover from their traumatic experiences, and simultaneously I carried the shame of my inability to do so.
My denial of reality, the self-rage at my shortcomings as a parent, the rejection I felt from my child, and the shame of not being the perfect mother of my imaginations expressed in my body by intensifying my back pain.	My denial of reality, the self-rage at my shortcomings as a parent, the rejection I felt from my child, and the shame of not being the perfect mother of my imaginations expressed in my body by intensifying my back pain.	Мое отрицание реальности, гнев на себя из-за своих недостатков как родителя, отвержение, которое я чувствовал со стороны своего ребенка, и стыд за то, что я не идеальная мать моего воображения, выразились в моем теле, усилив боль в спине.	My denial of reality, the self-rage at my shortcomings as a parent, the rejection I felt from my child, and the shame of not being the perfect mother of my imaginations expressed in my body by intensifying my back pain.
IFS CONCEPT 1: PROTECTORS AND THE BODY	IFS CONCEPT 1: PROTECTORS AND THE BODY	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 1: ЗАЩИТНИКИ И КОРПУС	IFS CONCEPT 1: PROTECTORS AND THE BODY
Parts are both impacted by the body and have impact on the body. They inhibit the body as a way of self-expression to shut us down or rev us up. Each of the three types of parts discussed in earlier chapters uses the body. In the book Internal Family Systems Therapy, 2nd Edition, Dr. Richard Schwartz states that parts can create symptoms, maintain, exacerbate, or prolong them.3 Parts express bodily sensations such as a tightening of the stomach, heat in the torso, or expansiveness in the heart. They may express pain such as a migraine, back pain, or pain in an area of the body that was injured in the past. Parts also assert themselves through illness, either causing illness or using an existing illness to express themselves.	Parts are both impacted by the body and have impact on the body. They inhibit the body as a way of self-expression to shut us down or rev us up. Each of the three types of parts discussed in earlier chapters uses the body. In the book Internal Family Systems Therapy, 2nd Edition, Dr. Richard Schwartz states that parts can create symptoms, maintain, exacerbate, or prolong them.3 Parts express bodily sensations such as a tightening of the stomach, heat in the torso, or expansiveness in the heart. They may express pain such as a migraine, back pain, or pain in an area of the body that was injured in the past. Parts also assert themselves through illness, either causing illness or using an existing illness to express themselves.	Части как подвергаются воздействию тела, так и оказывают воздействие на тело. Они подавляют тело как способ самовыражения, чтобы отключить или активизировать нас. Каждый из трех типов частей, обсуждавшихся в предыдущих главах, использует тело. В книге «Внутренняя семейная системная терапия, 2-е издание» д-р Ричард Шварц утверждает, что части могут создавать симптомы, поддерживать, усугублять или продлевать их.3 Части выражают телесные ощущения, такие как сжатие желудка, жар в туловище или расширение тела. в сердце. Они могут выражать такие боли, как мигрень, боль в спине или боль в той части тела, которая была повреждена в прошлом. Части также самоутверждаются посредством болезни, либо вызывая болезнь, либо используя существующую болезнь для выражения себя.	Parts are both impacted by the body and have impact on the body. They inhibit the body as a way of self-expression to shut us down or rev us up. Each of the three types of parts discussed in earlier chapters uses the body. In the book Internal Family Systems Therapy, 2nd Edition, Dr. Richard Schwartz states that parts can create symptoms, maintain, exacerbate, or prolong them.3 Parts express bodily sensations such as a tightening of the stomach, heat in the torso, or expansiveness in the heart. They may express pain such as a migraine, back pain, or pain in an area of the body that was injured in the past. Parts also assert themselves through illness, either causing illness or using an existing illness to express themselves.
Earlier we learned that protectors are either managers or firefighters. These two types of protectors use the body differently. The preemptive managers need to control vulnerability. They will employ the muscle to keep our attention away from vulnerable parts. A person may experience chronic muscle and/or joint pain to avoid facing feelings of shame. The more exiles in a person’s system or the more intense the person’s trauma, the more physical ailments managers may use. It is not uncommon for me to have clients who experience multiple manager-related complaints such as tension and migraine headaches, fibromyalgia, jaw pain, fatigue, and/or re-experiencing pain that had previously been controlled. While the person in pain is consumed with diagnoses and treatments, which can take years to prove effective, managers are doing their job of keeping the person’s exiles out of awareness.	Earlier we learned that protectors are either managers or firefighters. These two types of protectors use the body differently. The preemptive managers need to control vulnerability. They will employ the muscle to keep our attention away from vulnerable parts. A person may experience chronic muscle and/or joint pain to avoid facing feelings of shame. The more exiles in a person’s system or the more intense the person’s trauma, the more physical ailments managers may use. It is not uncommon for me to have clients who experience multiple manager-related complaints such as tension and migraine headaches, fibromyalgia, jaw pain, fatigue, and/or re-experiencing pain that had previously been controlled. While the person in pain is consumed with diagnoses and treatments, which can take years to prove effective, managers are doing their job of keeping the person’s exiles out of awareness.	Ранее мы узнали, что защитники — это либо менеджеры, либо пожарные. Эти два типа защитников по-разному используют тело. Упреждающим менеджерам необходимо контролировать уязвимость. Они задействуют мышцы, чтобы отвлечь наше внимание от уязвимых частей. Человек может испытывать хроническую боль в мышцах и/или суставах, чтобы избежать чувства стыда. Чем больше изгнанников в системе человека или чем интенсивнее его травма, тем больше физических недугов могут использовать менеджеры. У меня нередко есть клиенты, которые испытывают многочисленные жалобы, связанные с менеджером, такие как напряжение и мигрени, фибромиалгия, боль в челюсти, усталость и/или повторное возникновение боли, которую ранее контролировали. В то время как человек, страдающий от боли, поглощен диагнозами и лечением, эффективность которого может занять годы, менеджеры выполняют свою работу по тому, чтобы скрыть изгнанников этого человека.	Earlier we learned that protectors are either managers or firefighters. These two types of protectors use the body differently. The preemptive managers need to control vulnerability. They will employ the muscle to keep our attention away from vulnerable parts. A person may experience chronic muscle and/or joint pain to avoid facing feelings of shame. The more exiles in a person’s system or the more intense the person’s trauma, the more physical ailments managers may use. It is not uncommon for me to have clients who experience multiple manager-related complaints such as tension and migraine headaches, fibromyalgia, jaw pain, fatigue, and/or re-experiencing pain that had previously been controlled. While the person in pain is consumed with diagnoses and treatments, which can take years to prove effective, managers are doing their job of keeping the person’s exiles out of awareness.
Reactive firefighters are tasked with suppressing vulnerable feelings once they are experienced. Their behaviors activate fight, flight, freeze, or fawn responses. Their reactions are impulsive and immediate because the threat of vulnerability feels like imminent danger to our firefighters. They may cause heart palpitations to the point of pain, shortness of breath making it hard to breathe, and intense nausea. Additionally, Schwartz explains that “firefighters use physical arousal or desire (e.g., cravings for food, sex, alcohol, drugs, or sleep) to distract from emotions they view as a threat.”4 Firefighters will employ multiple strategies for as long as needed until the emotional pain is completely extinguished.	Reactive firefighters are tasked with suppressing vulnerable feelings once they are experienced. Their behaviors activate fight, flight, freeze, or fawn responses. Their reactions are impulsive and immediate because the threat of vulnerability feels like imminent danger to our firefighters. They may cause heart palpitations to the point of pain, shortness of breath making it hard to breathe, and intense nausea. Additionally, Schwartz explains that “firefighters use physical arousal or desire (e.g., cravings for food, sex, alcohol, drugs, or sleep) to distract from emotions they view as a threat.”4 Firefighters will employ multiple strategies for as long as needed until the emotional pain is completely extinguished.	Перед реактивными пожарными стоит задача подавлять уязвимые чувства, как только они возникают. Их поведение активирует реакции борьбы, бегства, замирания или подхалимства. Их реакция импульсивна и немедленна, потому что угроза уязвимости кажется непосредственной опасностью для наших пожарных. Они могут вызывать учащенное сердцебиение до боли, одышку, затрудняющую дыхание, и сильную тошноту. Кроме того, Шварц объясняет, что «пожарные используют физическое возбуждение или желание (например, тягу к еде, сексу, алкоголю, наркотикам или сну), чтобы отвлечься от эмоций, которые они считают угрозой». до тех пор, пока эмоциональная боль не угаснет полностью.	Reactive firefighters are tasked with suppressing vulnerable feelings once they are experienced. Their behaviors activate fight, flight, freeze, or fawn responses. Their reactions are impulsive and immediate because the threat of vulnerability feels like imminent danger to our firefighters. They may cause heart palpitations to the point of pain, shortness of breath making it hard to breathe, and intense nausea. Additionally, Schwartz explains that “firefighters use physical arousal or desire (e.g., cravings for food, sex, alcohol, drugs, or sleep) to distract from emotions they view as a threat.”4 Firefighters will employ multiple strategies for as long as needed until the emotional pain is completely extinguished.
IFS CONCEPT 2: EXILES AND THE BODY	IFS CONCEPT 2: EXILES AND THE BODY	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 2: ИЗГНАННЫЕ И ТЕЛО	IFS CONCEPT 2: EXILES AND THE BODY
Exiles use the body to signal their need for help. They have been silenced and hidden away by other parts, caregivers, life experiences, and trauma. They are desperate to receive redemption and tell their story. Because exiles were injured at a young age, some before they were verbal, the pain of their experiences is held in the body. In their quest for redemption and help, they need to be believed. They will use body sensations to get our attention. The ways in which they use the body is directly connected to the abuse, neglect, or terror they experienced. They may communicate through tears, freezing, trembling, smells, and/or the physical pain of their trauma. Exiles hold that if they are heard and believed, they will be redeemed and viewed as worthwhile and lovable.	Exiles use the body to signal their need for help. They have been silenced and hidden away by other parts, caregivers, life experiences, and trauma. They are desperate to receive redemption and tell their story. Because exiles were injured at a young age, some before they were verbal, the pain of their experiences is held in the body. In their quest for redemption and help, they need to be believed. They will use body sensations to get our attention. The ways in which they use the body is directly connected to the abuse, neglect, or terror they experienced. They may communicate through tears, freezing, trembling, smells, and/or the physical pain of their trauma. Exiles hold that if they are heard and believed, they will be redeemed and viewed as worthwhile and lovable.	Изгнанники используют тело, чтобы сигнализировать о своей потребности в помощи. Их заставили замолчать и спрятали другие части тела, лица, осуществляющие уход, жизненный опыт и травмы. Они отчаянно пытаются получить искупление и рассказать свою историю. Поскольку ссыльные получили ранения в молодом возрасте, а некоторые еще до того, как разговорились, боль от их переживаний сохраняется в теле. В их стремлении к искуплению и помощи им нужно верить. Они будут использовать телесные ощущения, чтобы привлечь наше внимание. То, как они используют свое тело, напрямую связано с насилием, пренебрежением или ужасом, которые они пережили. Они могут общаться через слезы, замерзание, дрожь, запахи и/или физическую боль от травмы. Изгнанники считают, что если их услышат и поверят, они будут искуплены и будут считаться достойными и достойными любви.	Exiles use the body to signal their need for help. They have been silenced and hidden away by other parts, caregivers, life experiences, and trauma. They are desperate to receive redemption and tell their story. Because exiles were injured at a young age, some before they were verbal, the pain of their experiences is held in the body. In their quest for redemption and help, they need to be believed. They will use body sensations to get our attention. The ways in which they use the body is directly connected to the abuse, neglect, or terror they experienced. They may communicate through tears, freezing, trembling, smells, and/or the physical pain of their trauma. Exiles hold that if they are heard and believed, they will be redeemed and viewed as worthwhile and lovable.
IFS CONCEPT 3: POLARIZED PARTS AND THE BODY	IFS CONCEPT 3: POLARIZED PARTS AND THE BODY	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 3: ПОЛЯРИЗОВАННЫЕ ЧАСТИ И ТЕЛО	IFS CONCEPT 3: POLARIZED PARTS AND THE BODY
As we saw in Chapter 7, we are polarized when two parts or groups of parts are in opposition with little access to Self. Each side of the polarization fears the other side taking over, which leads to a power struggle. The most common polarization is that between a manager and a firefighter. The manager’s role is to keep us from experiencing painful emotions and vulnerability, while firefighters want to take us out of those feelings when they occur. For example, a person struggling with the decision to stay in an unfulfilling relationship or leave has a polarization. Certain parts have reasons to stay, while opposing parts have reasons to end the relationship. Understandably, there are emotions connected with each side of this decision, and exiled feelings of not being good enough and fear of loneliness. Managers use the person’s body to express anxiety to keep them from feeling hurt, sadness, and unworthiness. While the person remains in the relationship, they may experience an upset stomach, tension headaches, and sustained nervous energy. These experiences are polarized with firefighters who are triggered when the managers’ attempts to control these undesirable emotions fail. To douse the unwanted feelings of not being good enough, firefighters use physical arousal of food or alcohol. Due to the polarization, each side will fight to control the person, creating a vicious cycle of physical bodily upset followed by the use of food or alcohol for emotional numbing.	As we saw in Chapter 7, we are polarized when two parts or groups of parts are in opposition with little access to Self. Each side of the polarization fears the other side taking over, which leads to a power struggle. The most common polarization is that between a manager and a firefighter. The manager’s role is to keep us from experiencing painful emotions and vulnerability, while firefighters want to take us out of those feelings when they occur. For example, a person struggling with the decision to stay in an unfulfilling relationship or leave has a polarization. Certain parts have reasons to stay, while opposing parts have reasons to end the relationship. Understandably, there are emotions connected with each side of this decision, and exiled feelings of not being good enough and fear of loneliness. Managers use the person’s body to express anxiety to keep them from feeling hurt, sadness, and unworthiness. While the person remains in the relationship, they may experience an upset stomach, tension headaches, and sustained nervous energy. These experiences are polarized with firefighters who are triggered when the managers’ attempts to control these undesirable emotions fail. To douse the unwanted feelings of not being good enough, firefighters use physical arousal of food or alcohol. Due to the polarization, each side will fight to control the person, creating a vicious cycle of physical bodily upset followed by the use of food or alcohol for emotional numbing.	Как мы видели в главе 7, мы поляризованы, когда две части или группы частей находятся в противоречии и имеют ограниченный доступ к Самости. Каждая сторона поляризации боится, что другая сторона захватит власть, что приводит к борьбе за власть. Наиболее распространенная поляризация – между менеджером и пожарным. Роль менеджера состоит в том, чтобы не дать нам испытывать болезненные эмоции и уязвимость, в то время как пожарные хотят избавить нас от этих чувств, когда они возникают. Например, человек, который борется с решением остаться в неудовлетворительных отношениях или уйти, имеет поляризацию. У определенных частей есть причины остаться, в то время как у противоположных частей есть причины прекратить отношения. Понятно, что с каждой стороной этого решения связаны эмоции, а также изгнанное чувство недостаточности и страха одиночества. Менеджеры используют тело человека, чтобы выразить беспокойство и удержать его от чувства обиды, печали и никчемности. Пока человек остается в отношениях, он может испытывать расстройство желудка, головные боли напряжения и постоянную нервную энергию. Эти переживания поляризованы у пожарных, которые срабатывают, когда попытки менеджеров контролировать эти нежелательные эмоции терпят неудачу. Чтобы подавить нежелательное чувство собственной недостаточности, пожарные используют физическое возбуждение с помощью еды или алкоголя. Из-за поляризации каждая сторона будет бороться за контроль над человеком, создавая порочный круг физических телесных расстройств, за которыми следует употребление еды или алкоголя для эмоционального оцепенения.	As we saw in Chapter 7, we are polarized when two parts or groups of parts are in opposition with little access to Self. Each side of the polarization fears the other side taking over, which leads to a power struggle. The most common polarization is that between a manager and a firefighter. The manager’s role is to keep us from experiencing painful emotions and vulnerability, while firefighters want to take us out of those feelings when they occur. For example, a person struggling with the decision to stay in an unfulfilling relationship or leave has a polarization. Certain parts have reasons to stay, while opposing parts have reasons to end the relationship. Understandably, there are emotions connected with each side of this decision, and exiled feelings of not being good enough and fear of loneliness. Managers use the person’s body to express anxiety to keep them from feeling hurt, sadness, and unworthiness. While the person remains in the relationship, they may experience an upset stomach, tension headaches, and sustained nervous energy. These experiences are polarized with firefighters who are triggered when the managers’ attempts to control these undesirable emotions fail. To douse the unwanted feelings of not being good enough, firefighters use physical arousal of food or alcohol. Due to the polarization, each side will fight to control the person, creating a vicious cycle of physical bodily upset followed by the use of food or alcohol for emotional numbing.
IFS CONCEPT 4: SELF AND THE BODY	IFS CONCEPT 4: SELF AND THE BODY	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 4: Я И ТЕЛО	IFS CONCEPT 4: SELF AND THE BODY
In Chapter 4, we learned that Self is the healing agent in the system, and we talked about the eight qualities of Self that the system embodies when parts relax and unblend. There are both similarities and differences between the physical expression of the eight qualities of Self in the body. Let’s look at each of the qualities and how they express in the body. This list is not exhaustive. As you read through it, consider how your system embodies the qualities of Self.	In Chapter 4, we learned that Self is the healing agent in the system, and we talked about the eight qualities of Self that the system embodies when parts relax and unblend. There are both similarities and differences between the physical expression of the eight qualities of Self in the body. Let’s look at each of the qualities and how they express in the body. This list is not exhaustive. As you read through it, consider how your system embodies the qualities of Self.	В главе 4 мы узнали, что «Я» является исцеляющим агентом в системе, и говорили о восьми качествах «Я», которые воплощает система, когда части расслабляются и разъединяются. Между физическим выражением восьми качеств «Я» в теле есть как сходства, так и различия. Давайте рассмотрим каждое из качеств и то, как они выражаются в теле. Этот список не является исчерпывающим. Читая ее, подумайте, как ваша система воплощает качества Самости.	In Chapter 4, we learned that Self is the healing agent in the system, and we talked about the eight qualities of Self that the system embodies when parts relax and unblend. There are both similarities and differences between the physical expression of the eight qualities of Self in the body. Let’s look at each of the qualities and how they express in the body. This list is not exhaustive. As you read through it, consider how your system embodies the qualities of Self.
Calm is experienced as emotionally and mentally relaxed with a decrease in heart rate, blood pressure, muscle tension, and breathing, creating a feeling of a relaxed mind and body. Clarity is embodied as feeling present, focused, and spacious. Compassion expresses in the body as openheartedness, feeling with another person or part, and an energy toward helping. Confidence is present in the body as a belief in yourself, trusting and accepting yourself, or inner knowing of your abilities. Connectedness embodies ease and comfort with another person or part and feelings of being valued, seen, heard, and validated. Courage is experienced in the body as mental and emotional strength and the ability to overcome fear and act. Creativity expresses as a feeling of being “in flow” or “in the zone.” Curiosity embodies openness to learn more and inquisitiveness. It is good practice to notice how Self embodies your system. This will help you to know when Self is leading versus when parts are in the driver’s seat.	Calm is experienced as emotionally and mentally relaxed with a decrease in heart rate, blood pressure, muscle tension, and breathing, creating a feeling of a relaxed mind and body. Clarity is embodied as feeling present, focused, and spacious. Compassion expresses in the body as openheartedness, feeling with another person or part, and an energy toward helping. Confidence is present in the body as a belief in yourself, trusting and accepting yourself, or inner knowing of your abilities. Connectedness embodies ease and comfort with another person or part and feelings of being valued, seen, heard, and validated. Courage is experienced in the body as mental and emotional strength and the ability to overcome fear and act. Creativity expresses as a feeling of being “in flow” or “in the zone.” Curiosity embodies openness to learn more and inquisitiveness. It is good practice to notice how Self embodies your system. This will help you to know when Self is leading versus when parts are in the driver’s seat.	Спокойствие переживается как эмоциональное и умственное расслабление с уменьшением частоты сердечных сокращений, артериального давления, мышечного напряжения и дыхания, что создает ощущение расслабленности ума и тела. Ясность воплощается в ощущении присутствия, сосредоточенности и простора. Сострадание выражается в теле как открытость сердца, чувство к другому человеку или его части, а также энергия, направленная на помощь. Уверенность присутствует в теле как вера в себя, доверие и принятие себя или внутреннее знание своих способностей. Связанность воплощает в себе легкость и комфорт с другим человеком или его частью, а также ощущение того, что тебя ценят, видят, слышат и признают. Смелость переживается телом как умственная и эмоциональная сила, а также способность преодолевать страх и действовать. Креативность выражается как ощущение пребывания «в потоке» или «в зоне». Любопытство воплощает в себе готовность узнать больше и любознательность. Хорошей практикой будет обратить внимание на то, как «Я» воплощает вашу систему. Это поможет вам узнать, когда лидирует «Я», а не когда за рулем находятся детали.	Calm is experienced as emotionally and mentally relaxed with a decrease in heart rate, blood pressure, muscle tension, and breathing, creating a feeling of a relaxed mind and body. Clarity is embodied as feeling present, focused, and spacious. Compassion expresses in the body as openheartedness, feeling with another person or part, and an energy toward helping. Confidence is present in the body as a belief in yourself, trusting and accepting yourself, or inner knowing of your abilities. Connectedness embodies ease and comfort with another person or part and feelings of being valued, seen, heard, and validated. Courage is experienced in the body as mental and emotional strength and the ability to overcome fear and act. Creativity expresses as a feeling of being “in flow” or “in the zone.” Curiosity embodies openness to learn more and inquisitiveness. It is good practice to notice how Self embodies your system. This will help you to know when Self is leading versus when parts are in the driver’s seat.
Case Vignette: A Dose of Nausea	Case Vignette: A Dose of Nausea	Пример из случая: Доза тошноты	Case Vignette: A Dose of Nausea
Nausea, retching, and with some clients, vomiting, presents as a powerful and effective firefighter for emergent exile energy. These physical reactions quickly change the focus from the work at hand to what’s happening in the body. Sherrie, a white 32-year-old female, was referred to me by her OB/GYN provider for postpartum depression. She had given birth to her third child four months earlier. Her symptoms included depressed mood most days, uncontrollable crying, a desire to “be left alone and sleep,” loss of appetite, and shame about not feeling close to her youngest child as she did to her older children. She also experienced pelvic pain with no physical cause found by her medical doctors.	Nausea, retching, and with some clients, vomiting, presents as a powerful and effective firefighter for emergent exile energy. These physical reactions quickly change the focus from the work at hand to what’s happening in the body. Sherrie, a white 32-year-old female, was referred to me by her OB/GYN provider for postpartum depression. She had given birth to her third child four months earlier. Her symptoms included depressed mood most days, uncontrollable crying, a desire to “be left alone and sleep,” loss of appetite, and shame about not feeling close to her youngest child as she did to her older children. She also experienced pelvic pain with no physical cause found by her medical doctors.	Тошнота, рвота, а у некоторых клиентов и рвота, являются мощными и эффективными средствами борьбы с возникающей энергией изгнания. Эти физические реакции быстро переключают внимание с текущей работы на то, что происходит в организме. Шерри, 32-летняя белая женщина, была направлена ​​ко мне своим акушером-гинекологом по поводу послеродовой депрессии. Четыре месяца назад она родила третьего ребенка. Ее симптомы включали депрессивное настроение большую часть дня, неконтролируемый плач, желание «остаться в покое и поспать», потерю аппетита и стыд из-за того, что она не чувствовала близости со своим младшим ребенком, как со старшими детьми. Она также испытывала боль в области таза, врачи которой не обнаружили физической причины.	Nausea, retching, and with some clients, vomiting, presents as a powerful and effective firefighter for emergent exile energy. These physical reactions quickly change the focus from the work at hand to what’s happening in the body. Sherrie, a white 32-year-old female, was referred to me by her OB/GYN provider for postpartum depression. She had given birth to her third child four months earlier. Her symptoms included depressed mood most days, uncontrollable crying, a desire to “be left alone and sleep,” loss of appetite, and shame about not feeling close to her youngest child as she did to her older children. She also experienced pelvic pain with no physical cause found by her medical doctors.
We started our work with the part of her who was having difficulty bonding with her child. This is what she found most upsetting. We spent several sessions building trust and relationship with this part. When she focused on it, she found it in her lower pelvic area and described it as a reddish-orange fiery ball that caused pain. During our session, we had to ask the part to unblend a bit by reducing the intensity of the pain to allow Sherrie to be with it. It took several attempts to get the part to titrate the pain to a level that was tolerable for Sherrie. Once this was accomplished, we learned that the part believed that Sherrie was incapable of taking care of her baby because she was incapable of taking care of herself. Therefore, the part renders her unable to function. She has low energy because she’s not eating and she’s sleeping a lot, which makes her less available to take care of her child, and her shame about not bonding with her baby is also connected to a fear that she might hurt her child in some way.	We started our work with the part of her who was having difficulty bonding with her child. This is what she found most upsetting. We spent several sessions building trust and relationship with this part. When she focused on it, she found it in her lower pelvic area and described it as a reddish-orange fiery ball that caused pain. During our session, we had to ask the part to unblend a bit by reducing the intensity of the pain to allow Sherrie to be with it. It took several attempts to get the part to titrate the pain to a level that was tolerable for Sherrie. Once this was accomplished, we learned that the part believed that Sherrie was incapable of taking care of her baby because she was incapable of taking care of herself. Therefore, the part renders her unable to function. She has low energy because she’s not eating and she’s sleeping a lot, which makes her less available to take care of her child, and her shame about not bonding with her baby is also connected to a fear that she might hurt her child in some way.	Мы начали нашу работу с той ее части, которая испытывала трудности в общении с ребенком. Это ее больше всего расстроило. Мы провели несколько сессий, выстраивая доверие и отношения с этой частью. Когда она сосредоточилась на нем, то обнаружила его в нижней части таза и описала как красновато-оранжевый огненный шар, вызывающий боль. Во время сеанса нам пришлось попросить эту часть немного расслабиться, уменьшив интенсивность боли, чтобы позволить Шерри остаться с ней. Потребовалось несколько попыток, чтобы деталь смогла снизить боль до уровня, приемлемого для Шерри. Как только это было достигнуто, мы узнали, что часть считала Шерри неспособной позаботиться о своем ребенке, потому что она была неспособна позаботиться о себе. Таким образом, эта часть делает ее неспособной функционировать. У нее низкий уровень энергии, потому что она не ест и много спит, что делает ее менее готовой заботиться о своем ребенке, а ее стыд из-за того, что она не привязана к своему ребенку, также связан со страхом, что она может каким-то образом навредить своему ребенку. .	We started our work with the part of her who was having difficulty bonding with her child. This is what she found most upsetting. We spent several sessions building trust and relationship with this part. When she focused on it, she found it in her lower pelvic area and described it as a reddish-orange fiery ball that caused pain. During our session, we had to ask the part to unblend a bit by reducing the intensity of the pain to allow Sherrie to be with it. It took several attempts to get the part to titrate the pain to a level that was tolerable for Sherrie. Once this was accomplished, we learned that the part believed that Sherrie was incapable of taking care of her baby because she was incapable of taking care of herself. Therefore, the part renders her unable to function. She has low energy because she’s not eating and she’s sleeping a lot, which makes her less available to take care of her child, and her shame about not bonding with her baby is also connected to a fear that she might hurt her child in some way.
It seemed to me that this part did not know Sherrie was an adult. Its view of her appeared juvenile. I asked Sherrie to ask the part, “How old do you think I am?” The part answered, “Three or four.” I asked Sherrie to ask the part to look at her to see if it could see that she was a grown-up now. The part still saw her as a child. Next, I had her tell the part her age and share with the part what had happened in her life since she was three or four. Sherrie did this by showing the part highlights of her life like a movie. The part expressed surprise and amazement at her success and ability to take care of herself.	It seemed to me that this part did not know Sherrie was an adult. Its view of her appeared juvenile. I asked Sherrie to ask the part, “How old do you think I am?” The part answered, “Three or four.” I asked Sherrie to ask the part to look at her to see if it could see that she was a grown-up now. The part still saw her as a child. Next, I had her tell the part her age and share with the part what had happened in her life since she was three or four. Sherrie did this by showing the part highlights of her life like a movie. The part expressed surprise and amazement at her success and ability to take care of herself.	Мне казалось, что эта часть не знала, что Шерри взрослая. Ее взгляд на нее казался юношеским. Я попросил Шерри спросить эту роль: «Как ты думаешь, сколько мне лет?» Часть ответила: «Три или четыре». Я попросил Шерри попросить часть посмотреть на нее и проверить, видит ли она, что она теперь взрослая. Часть все еще видела ее ребенком. Затем я попросил ее рассказать части свой возраст и рассказать ей, что произошло в ее жизни с тех пор, как ей было три или четыре года. Шерри сделала это, показав самые яркие моменты своей жизни, как в кино. Часть выразила удивление и изумление ее успехами и способностью позаботиться о себе.	It seemed to me that this part did not know Sherrie was an adult. Its view of her appeared juvenile. I asked Sherrie to ask the part, “How old do you think I am?” The part answered, “Three or four.” I asked Sherrie to ask the part to look at her to see if it could see that she was a grown-up now. The part still saw her as a child. Next, I had her tell the part her age and share with the part what had happened in her life since she was three or four. Sherrie did this by showing the part highlights of her life like a movie. The part expressed surprise and amazement at her success and ability to take care of herself.
We found out that the part took on its role of protecting Sherrie from things it believed she couldn’t handle around age four by making her sad. When asked what caused it to protect in this way, it shared, “Sherrie had a slew of different babysitters and . . .” Mid-sentence of the part’s sharing, Sherrie said, “I feel nauseous.” She started to sway in her seat, with her head seemingly being rocked on her neck involuntarily. She brought her hand to her mouth, and beads of perspiration were forming on her forehead and top lip. I asked if she was present with this part. She responded, “Barely.” I asked if I could speak directly to the part. She nodded. I asked the part, “What are you reacting to?” The part answered, “To all of this—it is too much for her.” Curious I asked, “What’s too much?” The part responded, “I have to keep her from being hurt.” I questioned, “What will hurt her?” The nausea seemed to intensify; Sherrie began sweating more and her stomach started to jerk. I asked the part if it would decrease the nausea. It refused emphatically. Curious about its refusal, I asked, “What are you afraid would happen if you didn’t make Sherrie sick and nauseated?” Firmly the part stated, “Sherrie can’t handle what happened. I keep that hidden. If I don’t stop her . . .” Holding her mouth, Sherrie bolted from her seat and retreated to the bathroom connected to my office. I could hear her retching and spitting. After about a minute, I heard the faucet running. She returned with a wet paper towel, dabbing her forehead and cheeks. She grabbed her purse, said a quick, “I’m sorry,” and rushed from my office.	We found out that the part took on its role of protecting Sherrie from things it believed she couldn’t handle around age four by making her sad. When asked what caused it to protect in this way, it shared, “Sherrie had a slew of different babysitters and . . .” Mid-sentence of the part’s sharing, Sherrie said, “I feel nauseous.” She started to sway in her seat, with her head seemingly being rocked on her neck involuntarily. She brought her hand to her mouth, and beads of perspiration were forming on her forehead and top lip. I asked if she was present with this part. She responded, “Barely.” I asked if I could speak directly to the part. She nodded. I asked the part, “What are you reacting to?” The part answered, “To all of this—it is too much for her.” Curious I asked, “What’s too much?” The part responded, “I have to keep her from being hurt.” I questioned, “What will hurt her?” The nausea seemed to intensify; Sherrie began sweating more and her stomach started to jerk. I asked the part if it would decrease the nausea. It refused emphatically. Curious about its refusal, I asked, “What are you afraid would happen if you didn’t make Sherrie sick and nauseated?” Firmly the part stated, “Sherrie can’t handle what happened. I keep that hidden. If I don’t stop her . . .” Holding her mouth, Sherrie bolted from her seat and retreated to the bathroom connected to my office. I could hear her retching and spitting. After about a minute, I heard the faucet running. She returned with a wet paper towel, dabbing her forehead and cheeks. She grabbed her purse, said a quick, “I’m sorry,” and rushed from my office.	Мы выяснили, что эта роль взяла на себя роль защиты Шерри от вещей, с которыми, по ее мнению, она не могла справиться примерно в четыре года, заставляя ее грустить. Когда его спросили, что заставило его защищаться таким образом, он ответил: «У Шерри было множество разных нянь и… . ». В середине предложения Шерри сказала: «Меня тошнит». Она начала покачиваться на своем сиденье, ее голова, казалось, непроизвольно покачивалась на шее. Она поднесла руку ко рту, и на ее лбу и верхней губе выступили капельки пота. Я спросил, присутствовала ли она с этой ролью. Она ответила: «Едва». Я спросил, могу ли я поговорить напрямую с этой частью. Она кивнула. Я спросил часть: «На что ты реагируешь?» Часть ответила: «Все это — для нее это слишком». Я с любопытством спросил: «Что слишком много?» Часть ответила: «Я должна уберечь ее от боли». Я спросил: «Что ей повредит?» Тошнота, казалось, усилилась; Шерри начала сильнее потеть, и ее живот начал дергаться. Я спросил часть, уменьшит ли это тошноту. Оно категорически отказалось. Заинтересовавшись его отказом, я спросил: «Чего вы боитесь, если бы вы не вызвали у Шерри тошноту и тошноту?» В этой части твердо говорилось: «Шерри не может справиться с тем, что произошло. Я держу это в тайне. Если я не остановлю ее. . ». Зажав рот, Шерри вскочила со своего места и направилась в ванную, примыкающую к моему кабинету. Я слышал, как она блевала и плевалась. Примерно через минуту я услышал, как работает кран. Она вернулась с мокрым бумажным полотенцем, вытирая лоб и щеки. Она схватила сумочку, быстро сказала: «Мне очень жаль» и выбежала из моего офиса.	We found out that the part took on its role of protecting Sherrie from things it believed she couldn’t handle around age four by making her sad. When asked what caused it to protect in this way, it shared, “Sherrie had a slew of different babysitters and . . .” Mid-sentence of the part’s sharing, Sherrie said, “I feel nauseous.” She started to sway in her seat, with her head seemingly being rocked on her neck involuntarily. She brought her hand to her mouth, and beads of perspiration were forming on her forehead and top lip. I asked if she was present with this part. She responded, “Barely.” I asked if I could speak directly to the part. She nodded. I asked the part, “What are you reacting to?” The part answered, “To all of this—it is too much for her.” Curious I asked, “What’s too much?” The part responded, “I have to keep her from being hurt.” I questioned, “What will hurt her?” The nausea seemed to intensify; Sherrie began sweating more and her stomach started to jerk. I asked the part if it would decrease the nausea. It refused emphatically. Curious about its refusal, I asked, “What are you afraid would happen if you didn’t make Sherrie sick and nauseated?” Firmly the part stated, “Sherrie can’t handle what happened. I keep that hidden. If I don’t stop her . . .” Holding her mouth, Sherrie bolted from her seat and retreated to the bathroom connected to my office. I could hear her retching and spitting. After about a minute, I heard the faucet running. She returned with a wet paper towel, dabbing her forehead and cheeks. She grabbed her purse, said a quick, “I’m sorry,” and rushed from my office.
Sherrie’s parts used her body in multiple ways. Her manager parts expressed in her body through uncontrollable crying, a loss of appetite, and intense pelvic pain to keep her from experiencing emotional pain and vulnerability. The nausea-causing firefighter took hold of her body with overwhelming nausea, sweating, and retching. This firefighter believed it must take her out to keep experiences from her consciousness. This part continued to show up in future sessions anytime we approached talking about the babysitters. Due to Sherrie’s willingness to heal and recover from postpartum depression, we were able to eventually build a Self-to-part relationship with the nausea-causing firefighter and heal the exile under its protection.	Sherrie’s parts used her body in multiple ways. Her manager parts expressed in her body through uncontrollable crying, a loss of appetite, and intense pelvic pain to keep her from experiencing emotional pain and vulnerability. The nausea-causing firefighter took hold of her body with overwhelming nausea, sweating, and retching. This firefighter believed it must take her out to keep experiences from her consciousness. This part continued to show up in future sessions anytime we approached talking about the babysitters. Due to Sherrie’s willingness to heal and recover from postpartum depression, we were able to eventually build a Self-to-part relationship with the nausea-causing firefighter and heal the exile under its protection.	Части Шерри использовали ее тело по-разному. Ее менеджерские части выражаются в ее теле через неконтролируемый плач, потерю аппетита и сильную боль в области таза, чтобы удержать ее от переживания эмоциональной боли и уязвимости. Вызвавший тошноту пожарный схватил ее тело, ощущая непреодолимую тошноту, потливость и рвоту. Этот пожарный считал, что ее нужно вывести, чтобы скрыть переживания от ее сознания. Эта часть продолжала появляться в будущих сеансах каждый раз, когда мы подходили к разговору о нянях. Благодаря желанию Шерри исцелиться и выздороветь от послеродовой депрессии, мы смогли в конечном итоге построить отношения «Сам-расставание» с пожарным, вызывающим тошноту, и исцелить изгнанника под его защитой.	Sherrie’s parts used her body in multiple ways. Her manager parts expressed in her body through uncontrollable crying, a loss of appetite, and intense pelvic pain to keep her from experiencing emotional pain and vulnerability. The nausea-causing firefighter took hold of her body with overwhelming nausea, sweating, and retching. This firefighter believed it must take her out to keep experiences from her consciousness. This part continued to show up in future sessions anytime we approached talking about the babysitters. Due to Sherrie’s willingness to heal and recover from postpartum depression, we were able to eventually build a Self-to-part relationship with the nausea-causing firefighter and heal the exile under its protection.
Meditation: Waterfall	Meditation: Waterfall	Медитация: Водопад	Meditation: Waterfall
Waterfall is the eighth meditation co-created with my ancestors. I have parts that communicate with me through my body. I shared one such part, Antsy, in Chapters 5 and 6. At times, I am not even aware of their presence as a part because the physical experience can be overwhelming and even terrifying. This meditation helps me to listen to parts who show up in my body. As with the other meditations they co-created with me, I found it surprising how well my ancestors know me and what I need.	Waterfall is the eighth meditation co-created with my ancestors. I have parts that communicate with me through my body. I shared one such part, Antsy, in Chapters 5 and 6. At times, I am not even aware of their presence as a part because the physical experience can be overwhelming and even terrifying. This meditation helps me to listen to parts who show up in my body. As with the other meditations they co-created with me, I found it surprising how well my ancestors know me and what I need.	Водопад — восьмая медитация, созданная совместно с моими предками. У меня есть части, которые общаются со мной через мое тело. Об одной такой части, Antsy, я рассказал в главах 5 и 6. Иногда я даже не осознаю их присутствия как части, потому что физический опыт может быть ошеломляющим и даже пугающим. Эта медитация помогает мне прислушиваться к частям моего тела. Как и в случае с другими медитациями, которые они создали вместе со мной, меня удивило, насколько хорошо мои предки знают меня и то, что мне нужно.	Waterfall is the eighth meditation co-created with my ancestors. I have parts that communicate with me through my body. I shared one such part, Antsy, in Chapters 5 and 6. At times, I am not even aware of their presence as a part because the physical experience can be overwhelming and even terrifying. This meditation helps me to listen to parts who show up in my body. As with the other meditations they co-created with me, I found it surprising how well my ancestors know me and what I need.
For this meditation, you may want to lie down; however, it can be done sitting up also. This is a parts awareness meditation. Parts can show up in various places in our bodies. This meditation will help you to discover their location in your body and how parts are experienced in your body. If you do not notice a part in a particular location of your body, that’s okay; simply allow your awareness to rest on that part of your body.	For this meditation, you may want to lie down; however, it can be done sitting up also. This is a parts awareness meditation. Parts can show up in various places in our bodies. This meditation will help you to discover their location in your body and how parts are experienced in your body. If you do not notice a part in a particular location of your body, that’s okay; simply allow your awareness to rest on that part of your body.	Для этой медитации вы можете лечь; однако это можно делать и сидя. Это медитация осознания частей. Части могут появляться в разных местах нашего тела. Эта медитация поможет вам обнаружить их расположение в вашем теле и то, как части тела ощущаются в вашем теле. Если вы не замечаете какой-либо части тела в определенном месте, это нормально; просто позвольте своему сознанию остановиться на этой части тела.	For this meditation, you may want to lie down; however, it can be done sitting up also. This is a parts awareness meditation. Parts can show up in various places in our bodies. This meditation will help you to discover their location in your body and how parts are experienced in your body. If you do not notice a part in a particular location of your body, that’s okay; simply allow your awareness to rest on that part of your body.
Close your eyes or soften your gaze.	Close your eyes or soften your gaze.	Закройте глаза или смягчите взгляд.	Close your eyes or soften your gaze.
Adjust your body in whatever way is needed for you to become comfortable.	Adjust your body in whatever way is needed for you to become comfortable.	Настройте свое тело так, как вам необходимо, чтобы вам было комфортно.	Adjust your body in whatever way is needed for you to become comfortable.
Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.	Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.	Перенесите свое осознание на свое дыхание и просто дышите.	Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.
If it feels right and helps you relax, breathe in for four counts and breathe out for four counts; you can do this several times.	If it feels right and helps you relax, breathe in for four counts and breathe out for four counts; you can do this several times.	Если это кажется вам правильным и помогает вам расслабиться, вдохните на четыре счета и выдохните на четыре счета; вы можете сделать это несколько раз.	If it feels right and helps you relax, breathe in for four counts and breathe out for four counts; you can do this several times.
Imagine yourself in the presence of a magnificent waterfall.	Imagine yourself in the presence of a magnificent waterfall.	Представьте себя перед великолепным водопадом.	Imagine yourself in the presence of a magnificent waterfall.
You admire its power, grace, and majesty.	You admire its power, grace, and majesty.	Вы восхищаетесь его силой, грацией и величием.	You admire its power, grace, and majesty.
You feel the spray of its mist on your face.	You feel the spray of its mist on your face.	Вы чувствуете брызги его тумана на своем лице.	You feel the spray of its mist on your face.
Deciding to lie at its feet, you find a soft patch of grass.	Deciding to lie at its feet, you find a soft patch of grass.	Решив лечь у его ног, вы обнаруживаете мягкий участок травы.	Deciding to lie at its feet, you find a soft patch of grass.
With your eyes closed, you begin to calm as the earth cradles you in its arms.	With your eyes closed, you begin to calm as the earth cradles you in its arms.
