Self continued to offer my younger self the sincerest compassion for her experience and the shock of it. Pricklee went on to share that she made a promise to never allow anything to catch her unaware again. It hurt much too much. Her life would be predictable and knowable to protect her heart from this unbearable pain.	The next thing my nine-year-old self communicates comes in the feeling of having the wind knocked out of her. She felt blindsided and abandoned. There was no one to help her manage her overwhelming feelings. Her heart physically hurt, and she didn’t understand the agonizing pain. Her tears began to flow from my eyes. I felt the intensity of her suffering and desperation. She didn’t want to face what she knew. She wanted someone to tell her that her fears were not true, but their secrecy only confirmed them. She had sensed high tension between her parents before she left for Louisiana. She knew her mother was unhappy. In her mind, her parents’ fighting, not speaking to each other, her mother’s unhappiness, and her father’s new address meant her parents were getting a divorce and her father had moved out. Self continued to offer my younger self the sincerest compassion for her experience and the shock of it. Pricklee went on to share that she made a promise to never allow anything to catch her unaware again. It hurt much too much. Her life would be predictable and knowable to protect her heart from this unbearable pain.	Следующее, что сообщает мне девятилетняя девочка, — это ощущение, что из нее выбивается ветер. Она чувствовала себя ошеломленной и брошенной. Не было никого, кто мог бы помочь ей справиться с ее переполняющими чувствами. Сердце у нее физически болело, и она не понимала мучительной боли. Ее слезы начали течь из моих глаз. Я почувствовал интенсивность ее страданий и отчаяния. Она не хотела сталкиваться с тем, что знала. Ей хотелось, чтобы кто-нибудь сказал ей, что ее опасения не соответствуют действительности, но их секретность только подтверждала их. Еще до отъезда в Луизиану она почувствовала сильное напряжение между родителями. Она знала, что ее мать несчастна. По ее мнению, ссоры ее родителей, молчание друг с другом, несчастье ее матери и новый адрес ее отца означали, что ее родители разводятся, и ее отец уезжает. Селф продолжал выражать себе в молодости самое искреннее сострадание к ее опыту и шоку, который он испытал. Далее Прикли рассказала, что дала обещание никогда больше не позволять ничему застать ее врасплох. Это было слишком больно. Ее жизнь будет предсказуемой и познаваемой, чтобы защитить ее сердце от этой невыносимой боли.	The next thing my nine-year-old self communicates comes in the feeling of having the wind knocked out of her. She felt blindsided and abandoned. There was no one to help her manage her overwhelming feelings. Her heart physically hurt, and she didn’t understand the agonizing pain. Her tears began to flow from my eyes. I felt the intensity of her suffering and desperation. She didn’t want to face what she knew. She wanted someone to tell her that her fears were not true, but their secrecy only confirmed them. She had sensed high tension between her parents before she left for Louisiana. She knew her mother was unhappy. In her mind, her parents’ fighting, not speaking to each other, her mother’s unhappiness, and her father’s new address meant her parents were getting a divorce and her father had moved out. Self continued to offer my younger self the sincerest compassion for her experience and the shock of it. Pricklee went on to share that she made a promise to never allow anything to catch her unaware again. It hurt much too much. Her life would be predictable and knowable to protect her heart from this unbearable pain.
From connecting with my parts from Self-energy, I became aware that Pricklee is the part of me who becomes irritable, and she exiled nine-year-old Tamala as a way to make life predictable and protect her from the pain of being blindsided again. Pricklee’s carefree, fun-loving nature was eclipsed by the responsibility to protect the system from experiencing the pain of abandonment and being alone with big, scary emotions.	From connecting with my parts from Self-energy, I became aware that Pricklee is the part of me who becomes irritable, and she exiled nine-year-old Tamala as a way to make life predictable and protect her from the pain of being blindsided again. Pricklee’s carefree, fun-loving nature was eclipsed by the responsibility to protect the system from experiencing the pain of abandonment and being alone with big, scary emotions.	Соединившись со своими частями Само-энергии, я осознал, что Прикли — это та часть меня, которая становится раздражительной, и она изгнала девятилетнюю Тамалу, чтобы сделать жизнь предсказуемой и защитить ее от боли, связанной с повторным ошеломлением. . Беззаботный и веселый характер Прикли затмевался обязанностью защищать систему от боли покинутости и одиночества с сильными, пугающими эмоциями.	From connecting with my parts from Self-energy, I became aware that Pricklee is the part of me who becomes irritable, and she exiled nine-year-old Tamala as a way to make life predictable and protect her from the pain of being blindsided again. Pricklee’s carefree, fun-loving nature was eclipsed by the responsibility to protect the system from experiencing the pain of abandonment and being alone with big, scary emotions.
After sharing how hard she’s been working to protect young Tamala, Pricklee expresses how exhausted she is. She admits feeling stressed out trying to control everything and predict every outcome. She is constantly on high alert, looking for what could go wrong. Pricklee is only calm when things go as planned, and any deviation from the plan causes anxiety, annoyance, or anger. Self asks her, “What are you afraid would happen if you didn’t control everything and predict every outcome?” She answers, “The brokenhearted pain will come and steal our joy forever, and we’ll never be carefree again.” Self feels deep compassion for the dedication of this part to protect and offers, “What if I could go to the one who feels the brokenhearted pain and heal it so you wouldn’t have to feel so exhausted. Would you be interested?” With relief and slight doubt, she asks, “You can do that?” In reassurance Self answers, “Yes, with your permission I can.”	After sharing how hard she’s been working to protect young Tamala, Pricklee expresses how exhausted she is. She admits feeling stressed out trying to control everything and predict every outcome. She is constantly on high alert, looking for what could go wrong. Pricklee is only calm when things go as planned, and any deviation from the plan causes anxiety, annoyance, or anger. Self asks her, “What are you afraid would happen if you didn’t control everything and predict every outcome?” She answers, “The brokenhearted pain will come and steal our joy forever, and we’ll never be carefree again.” Self feels deep compassion for the dedication of this part to protect and offers, “What if I could go to the one who feels the brokenhearted pain and heal it so you wouldn’t have to feel so exhausted. Would you be interested?” With relief and slight doubt, she asks, “You can do that?” In reassurance Self answers, “Yes, with your permission I can.”	Поделившись тем, как усердно она работала, чтобы защитить юную Тамалу, Прикли рассказала, насколько она измотана. Она признается, что испытывает стресс из-за попыток все контролировать и предугадать каждый результат. Она постоянно находится в состоянии повышенной готовности, выискивая, что может пойти не так. Прикли спокоен только тогда, когда дела идут по плану, и любое отклонение от плана вызывает тревогу, раздражение или гнев. Селф спрашивает ее: «Чего ты боишься, если бы ты не контролировала все и не предсказывала каждый результат?» Она отвечает: «Боль разбитого сердца придет и навсегда украдет нашу радость, и мы больше никогда не будем беззаботны». «Я» испытывает глубокое сострадание к преданности этой части защите и предлагает: «Что, если бы я мог пойти к тому, кто чувствует боль разбитого сердца, и исцелить ее, чтобы тебе не пришлось чувствовать себя таким изнуренным? Вам будет интересно?» С облегчением и легким сомнением она спрашивает: «Ты сможешь это сделать?» В качестве успокоения Селф отвечает: «Да, с вашего разрешения могу».	After sharing how hard she’s been working to protect young Tamala, Pricklee expresses how exhausted she is. She admits feeling stressed out trying to control everything and predict every outcome. She is constantly on high alert, looking for what could go wrong. Pricklee is only calm when things go as planned, and any deviation from the plan causes anxiety, annoyance, or anger. Self asks her, “What are you afraid would happen if you didn’t control everything and predict every outcome?” She answers, “The brokenhearted pain will come and steal our joy forever, and we’ll never be carefree again.” Self feels deep compassion for the dedication of this part to protect and offers, “What if I could go to the one who feels the brokenhearted pain and heal it so you wouldn’t have to feel so exhausted. Would you be interested?” With relief and slight doubt, she asks, “You can do that?” In reassurance Self answers, “Yes, with your permission I can.”
It’s not surprising that our parts are exhausted. Many have been protecting us since we were young. The irony of their tiring work is that the vulnerable parts they protect are not changed or healed by their efforts. Our young parts continue to feel and express their pain, unworthiness, and/or shame. The experiences Pricklee is trying to protect me from, joylessness and not being carefree, are exactly what she creates when things don’t go as she expects. The joy of arriving to Isla Holbox by ferry for the first time was overshadowed by Pricklee’s irritation and anger. Enjoying the beach in a rain shower was not the day Pricklee had planned, therefore her ire canceled what could have been a carefree, fun experience. Our protectors’ intention is to protect us, but their strategies fall short.	It’s not surprising that our parts are exhausted. Many have been protecting us since we were young. The irony of their tiring work is that the vulnerable parts they protect are not changed or healed by their efforts. Our young parts continue to feel and express their pain, unworthiness, and/or shame. The experiences Pricklee is trying to protect me from, joylessness and not being carefree, are exactly what she creates when things don’t go as she expects. The joy of arriving to Isla Holbox by ferry for the first time was overshadowed by Pricklee’s irritation and anger. Enjoying the beach in a rain shower was not the day Pricklee had planned, therefore her ire canceled what could have been a carefree, fun experience. Our protectors’ intention is to protect us, but their strategies fall short.	Неудивительно, что наши части исчерпаны. Многие защищали нас с тех пор, как мы были молоды. Ирония их утомительной работы заключается в том, что уязвимые части, которые они защищают, не изменяются и не исцеляются их усилиями. Наши молодые части продолжают чувствовать и выражать свою боль, никчемность и/или стыд. Переживания, от которых Прикли пытается меня защитить, безрадостность и беззаботность — это именно то, что она создает, когда дела идут не так, как она ожидает. Радость от первого прибытия на остров Холбокс на пароме была омрачена раздражением и гневом Прикли. Наслаждение пляжем под ливневым душем было не тем днем, который планировала Прикли, поэтому ее гнев свел на нет то, что могло быть беззаботным и веселым опытом. Намерение наших защитников состоит в том, чтобы защитить нас, но их стратегии терпят неудачу.	It’s not surprising that our parts are exhausted. Many have been protecting us since we were young. The irony of their tiring work is that the vulnerable parts they protect are not changed or healed by their efforts. Our young parts continue to feel and express their pain, unworthiness, and/or shame. The experiences Pricklee is trying to protect me from, joylessness and not being carefree, are exactly what she creates when things don’t go as she expects. The joy of arriving to Isla Holbox by ferry for the first time was overshadowed by Pricklee’s irritation and anger. Enjoying the beach in a rain shower was not the day Pricklee had planned, therefore her ire canceled what could have been a carefree, fun experience. Our protectors’ intention is to protect us, but their strategies fall short.
It’s important to understand that our parts are forced into extreme protective roles based on their experiences. Pricklee wasn’t born irritable and needing to protect. In her natural state, she was fun-loving, curious, expressive, and adventurous. She both absorbed the life occurring around her and became a part of it. Her firsthand experience of being left alone with her emotions and unanswered questions led her to feel unsafe and increased her need for certainty and predictability. Today, when she doesn’t get those, she escalates to irritability and anger in fear that the nine-year-old she protects will be harmed again.	It’s important to understand that our parts are forced into extreme protective roles based on their experiences. Pricklee wasn’t born irritable and needing to protect. In her natural state, she was fun-loving, curious, expressive, and adventurous. She both absorbed the life occurring around her and became a part of it. Her firsthand experience of being left alone with her emotions and unanswered questions led her to feel unsafe and increased her need for certainty and predictability. Today, when she doesn’t get those, she escalates to irritability and anger in fear that the nine-year-old she protects will be harmed again.	Важно понимать, что наши части вынуждены играть крайнюю защитную роль на основе своего опыта. Прикли не родился раздражительным и нуждающимся в защите. В своем естественном состоянии она была веселой, любопытной, выразительной и предприимчивой. Она не только впитывала происходящую вокруг жизнь, но и становилась ее частью. Ее непосредственный опыт того, что она осталась наедине со своими эмоциями и вопросами без ответов, привел к тому, что она почувствовала себя небезопасно и увеличила ее потребность в уверенности и предсказуемости. Сегодня, когда она этого не получает, ее раздражительность и гнев перерастают в страх, что девятилетнему ребенку, которого она защищает, снова причинят вред.	It’s important to understand that our parts are forced into extreme protective roles based on their experiences. Pricklee wasn’t born irritable and needing to protect. In her natural state, she was fun-loving, curious, expressive, and adventurous. She both absorbed the life occurring around her and became a part of it. Her firsthand experience of being left alone with her emotions and unanswered questions led her to feel unsafe and increased her need for certainty and predictability. Today, when she doesn’t get those, she escalates to irritability and anger in fear that the nine-year-old she protects will be harmed again.
Meditation: The Weary One	Meditation: The Weary One	Медитация: Утомленный	Meditation: The Weary One
The Weary One meditation is the fourth meditation given me by my ancestors. This meditation came at a time when many of my parts were tired and overworked. I was seeing psychotherapy clients full-time while building an IFS consultation practice for therapists and working toward becoming an IFS lead trainer. Not to mention all the other activities of life.	The Weary One meditation is the fourth meditation given me by my ancestors. This meditation came at a time when many of my parts were tired and overworked. I was seeing psychotherapy clients full-time while building an IFS consultation practice for therapists and working toward becoming an IFS lead trainer. Not to mention all the other activities of life.	Медитация «Усталый» — четвертая медитация, данная мне моими предками. Эта медитация пришла в то время, когда многие мои части тела были утомлены и перегружены работой. Я постоянно принимал клиентов-психотерапевтов, одновременно создавая консультационную практику IFS для терапевтов и работая над тем, чтобы стать ведущим тренером IFS. Не говоря уже обо всех остальных сферах жизни.	The Weary One meditation is the fourth meditation given me by my ancestors. This meditation came at a time when many of my parts were tired and overworked. I was seeing psychotherapy clients full-time while building an IFS consultation practice for therapists and working toward becoming an IFS lead trainer. Not to mention all the other activities of life.
This meditation supports parts that are exhausted in their role. It’s a chance to connect and learn the part’s story, its job, and why it’s exhausted. This meditation offers hope to a weary part that life can be different, and it doesn’t have to work so hard.	This meditation supports parts that are exhausted in their role. It’s a chance to connect and learn the part’s story, its job, and why it’s exhausted. This meditation offers hope to a weary part that life can be different, and it doesn’t have to work so hard.	Эта медитация поддерживает части, которые исчерпаны в своей роли. Это шанс пообщаться и узнать историю детали, ее работу и то, почему она исчерпана. Эта медитация дает утомленной части надежду на то, что жизнь может быть другой, и ей не придется так много работать.	This meditation supports parts that are exhausted in their role. It’s a chance to connect and learn the part’s story, its job, and why it’s exhausted. This meditation offers hope to a weary part that life can be different, and it doesn’t have to work so hard.
Relax and find a comfortable position to help your body settle.	Relax and find a comfortable position to help your body settle.	Расслабьтесь и найдите удобное положение, которое поможет вашему телу успокоиться.	Relax and find a comfortable position to help your body settle.
Close your eyes if that feels right.	Close your eyes if that feels right.	Закройте глаза, если это кажется правильным.	Close your eyes if that feels right.
As you go inside, notice your breath.	As you go inside, notice your breath.	Заходя внутрь, обратите внимание на свое дыхание.	As you go inside, notice your breath.
Is it shallow and short or deep and long?	Is it shallow and short or deep and long?	Оно мелкое и короткое или глубокое и длинное?	Is it shallow and short or deep and long?
As you notice, see if you can lengthen and deepen each breath.	As you notice, see if you can lengthen and deepen each breath.	Как заметите, проверьте, можете ли вы удлинить и углубить каждое дыхание.	As you notice, see if you can lengthen and deepen each breath.
Find a part that is weary, exhausted, or tired.	Find a part that is weary, exhausted, or tired.	Найдите часть, которая утомлена, измотана или устала.	Find a part that is weary, exhausted, or tired.
Notice where this part shows up in or near your body.	Notice where this part shows up in or near your body.	Обратите внимание, где эта часть появляется внутри или рядом с вашим телом.	Notice where this part shows up in or near your body.
Focus on how tired this part is.	Focus on how tired this part is.	Сосредоточьтесь на том, насколько устала эта часть.	Focus on how tired this part is.
As you focus, what do you notice?	As you focus, what do you notice?	Что вы замечаете, когда фокусируетесь?	As you focus, what do you notice?
Choose a place to go with the part to relax and learn more.	Choose a place to go with the part to relax and learn more.	Выберите место, куда пойдете с частью, чтобы расслабиться и узнать больше.	Choose a place to go with the part to relax and learn more.
This could be a place in nature, you could cuddle near a fire, or take a relaxing walk; you can go anywhere you’d like to go.	This could be a place in nature, you could cuddle near a fire, or take a relaxing walk; you can go anywhere you’d like to go.	Это может быть место на природе, вы можете пообниматься у костра или совершить расслабляющую прогулку; вы можете пойти куда угодно.	This could be a place in nature, you could cuddle near a fire, or take a relaxing walk; you can go anywhere you’d like to go.
Encourage the part to rest in your presence if it can.	Encourage the part to rest in your presence if it can.	Поощряйте эту часть отдыхать в вашем присутствии, если она может.	Encourage the part to rest in your presence if it can.
You can talk if the part wants to, but it is not necessary; you can just be with the part for a while.	You can talk if the part wants to, but it is not necessary; you can just be with the part for a while.	Вы можете говорить, если часть хочет, но это не обязательно; ты можешь просто побыть с этой ролью какое-то время.	You can talk if the part wants to, but it is not necessary; you can just be with the part for a while.
If the part wants to talk, ask the part about its weariness.	If the part wants to talk, ask the part about its weariness.	Если часть хочет поговорить, спросите ее о ее усталости.	If the part wants to talk, ask the part about its weariness.
What causes the exhaustion?	What causes the exhaustion?	Что вызывает истощение?	What causes the exhaustion?
How long has it been doing what causes the tiredness?	How long has it been doing what causes the tiredness?	Как долго он занимается тем, что вызывает усталость?	How long has it been doing what causes the tiredness?
Why did the part take on this role?	Why did the part take on this role?	Почему роль взяла на себя эту роль?	Why did the part take on this role?
Listen and offer compassion for how hard this part is working.	Listen and offer compassion for how hard this part is working.	Выслушайте и проявите сострадание к тому, как усердно работает эта часть.	Listen and offer compassion for how hard this part is working.
Ask the part, “What are you afraid would happen if you stopped doing this role?”	Ask the part, “What are you afraid would happen if you stopped doing this role?”	Спросите часть: «Чего ты боишься, если ты перестанешь играть эту роль?»	Ask the part, “What are you afraid would happen if you stopped doing this role?”
Address the fears the part shares with you.	Address the fears the part shares with you.	Обратитесь к страхам, которые часть разделяет с вами.	Address the fears the part shares with you.
Offer hope by saying, “What if I could heal the vulnerable one you protect so you won’t be so weary. Would you be interested?”	Offer hope by saying, “What if I could heal the vulnerable one you protect so you won’t be so weary. Would you be interested?”	Предложите надежду, сказав: «Что, если бы я мог исцелить уязвимого человека, которого вы защищаете, чтобы вы не были так утомлены. Вам будет интересно?»	Offer hope by saying, “What if I could heal the vulnerable one you protect so you won’t be so weary. Would you be interested?”
Be with the part as it expresses its concerns or interests.	Be with the part as it expresses its concerns or interests.	Будьте с частью, когда она выражает свои заботы или интересы.	Be with the part as it expresses its concerns or interests.
If it has concerns, address them.	If it has concerns, address them.	Если у него есть проблемы, решите их.	If it has concerns, address them.
If the part is interested, let it know that all it has to do is give permission and step back.	If the part is interested, let it know that all it has to do is give permission and step back.	Если часть заинтересована, дайте ей знать, что все, что ей нужно сделать, это дать разрешение и отступить.	If the part is interested, let it know that all it has to do is give permission and step back.
Express gratitude for how hard this part is working and set an intention with the part.	Express gratitude for how hard this part is working and set an intention with the part.	Выразите благодарность за то, как усердно работает эта часть, и определите с этой частью намерение.	Express gratitude for how hard this part is working and set an intention with the part.
Bring your awareness to your breath, and when it feels right, reenter this moment and space. Slowly open your eyes when you’re ready.	Bring your awareness to your breath, and when it feels right, reenter this moment and space. Slowly open your eyes when you’re ready.	Перенесите свое осознание на свое дыхание, и когда оно почувствует себя нужным, вернитесь в этот момент и пространство. Медленно откройте глаза, когда будете готовы.	Bring your awareness to your breath, and when it feels right, reenter this moment and space. Slowly open your eyes when you’re ready.
Exercise 1: Journal Capture	Exercise 1: Journal Capture	Упражнение 1. Ведение журнала	Exercise 1: Journal Capture
Journal what you would like to capture from this meditation, like a revelation, reflection, or anything significant you want to remember from this experience.	Journal what you would like to capture from this meditation, like a revelation, reflection, or anything significant you want to remember from this experience.	Запишите то, что вы хотели бы уловить в результате этой медитации, например, откровение, размышление или что-то важное, что вы хотите запомнить из этого опыта.	Journal what you would like to capture from this meditation, like a revelation, reflection, or anything significant you want to remember from this experience.
Exercise 2: The Weary One Journal Questions	Exercise 2: The Weary One Journal Questions	Упражнение 2: Вопросы для журнала «Усталый»	Exercise 2: The Weary One Journal Questions
After you’ve done the Weary One meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.	After you’ve done the Weary One meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.	После того, как вы выполнили медитацию «Усталый» и написали свой быстрый дневник, потратьте некоторое время на более глубокое изучение, ответив на следующие подсказки журнала.	After you’ve done the Weary One meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.
What did you notice when you first connected with your part?	What did you notice when you first connected with your part?	Что вы заметили, когда впервые соединились со своей частью?	What did you notice when you first connected with your part?
Where and how does the weary part show up in your body?	Where and how does the weary part show up in your body?	Где и как в вашем теле появляется утомленная часть?	Where and how does the weary part show up in your body?
If there is an image connected with this part, draw it here or in your journal. Does this part have a name? If so, write it in your journal.	If there is an image connected with this part, draw it here or in your journal. Does this part have a name? If so, write it in your journal.	Если есть изображение, связанное с этой частью, нарисуйте его здесь или в своем дневнике. Есть ли у этой части название? Если да, напишите об этом в своем дневнике.	If there is an image connected with this part, draw it here or in your journal. Does this part have a name? If so, write it in your journal.
As you got to know the part, what did you learn about its weariness? Causes of the exhaustion	As you got to know the part, what did you learn about its weariness? Causes of the exhaustion	Познакомившись с этой деталью, что вы узнали о ее усталости? Причины истощения	As you got to know the part, what did you learn about its weariness? Causes of the exhaustion
How long it’s been doing its job	How long it’s been doing its job	Как долго он выполняет свою работу	How long it’s been doing its job
Why it took on its job	Why it took on its job	Почему он взялся за свою работу	Why it took on its job
How did you feel toward this part after hearing its story?	How did you feel toward this part after hearing its story?	Что вы почувствовали по отношению к этой части, услышав ее историю?	How did you feel toward this part after hearing its story?
What did you discover about this part’s fears about releasing its role?	What did you discover about this part’s fears about releasing its role?	Что вы узнали о страхах этой части по поводу освобождения от своей роли?	What did you discover about this part’s fears about releasing its role?
Did you notice a change in the part’s weariness during the meditation? If so, what did you notice?	Did you notice a change in the part’s weariness during the meditation? If so, what did you notice?	Заметили ли вы изменение усталости этой части во время медитации? Если да, то что вы заметили?	Did you notice a change in the part’s weariness during the meditation? If so, what did you notice?
Who is the vulnerable one this part protects?	Who is the vulnerable one this part protects?	Кто уязвим, кого защищает эта часть?	Who is the vulnerable one this part protects?
Is the part willing to step back? If not, why not?	Is the part willing to step back? If not, why not?	Готова ли часть отступить? Если нет, то почему?	Is the part willing to step back? If not, why not?
What intentions did you set with this part?	What intentions did you set with this part?	Какие намерения вы поставили перед этой частью?	What intentions did you set with this part?
Journal anything else about this experience you want to capture.	Journal anything else about this experience you want to capture.	Запишите еще что-нибудь об этом опыте, который вы хотите запечатлеть.	Journal anything else about this experience you want to capture.
Exercise 3: Hope Merchant Practice	Exercise 3: Hope Merchant Practice	Упражнение 3: Практика торговца надеждой	Exercise 3: Hope Merchant Practice
In this practice, you will get to know a protector and offer hope for change.	In this practice, you will get to know a protector and offer hope for change.	В этой практике вы познакомитесь с защитником и подарите надежду на перемены.	In this practice, you will get to know a protector and offer hope for change.
Step 1: Identify a part you want to get to know.	Step 1: Identify a part you want to get to know.	Шаг 1: Определите ту часть, которую вы хотите узнать.	Step 1: Identify a part you want to get to know.
Step 2: Notice where/how the part expresses in/around your body.	Step 2: Notice where/how the part expresses in/around your body.	Шаг 2: Обратите внимание, где/как эта часть проявляется внутри/вокруг вашего тела.	Step 2: Notice where/how the part expresses in/around your body.
Step 3: Focus on how you experience this part.	Step 3: Focus on how you experience this part.	Шаг 3: Сосредоточьтесь на том, как вы переживаете эту часть.	Step 3: Focus on how you experience this part.
Step 4: How do you feel toward this part? If it’s one of the eight Cs, send that energy to the part. If not one of the eight Cs, ask the new part to step back. If the part does not step back, spend time getting to know that part; address its fears. If and when it is willing to step back, move to Step 5.	Step 4: How do you feel toward this part? If it’s one of the eight Cs, send that energy to the part. If not one of the eight Cs, ask the new part to step back. If the part does not step back, spend time getting to know that part; address its fears. If and when it is willing to step back, move to Step 5.	Шаг 4: Как вы относитесь к этой части? Если это одна из восьми «С», направьте эту энергию в эту часть. Если это не одно из восьми С, попросите новую часть отступить. Если часть не отступает, потратьте время на ее изучение; разобраться со своими страхами. Если и когда он захочет отступить, переходите к шагу 5.	Step 4: How do you feel toward this part? If it’s one of the eight Cs, send that energy to the part. If not one of the eight Cs, ask the new part to step back. If the part does not step back, spend time getting to know that part; address its fears. If and when it is willing to step back, move to Step 5.
Step 5: Notice how the part responds to your Self-energy. If there is a positive shift, acknowledge it and offer appreciation.	Step 5: Notice how the part responds to your Self-energy. If there is a positive shift, acknowledge it and offer appreciation.	Шаг 5: Обратите внимание, как эта часть реагирует на вашу собственную энергию. Если есть положительный сдвиг, признайте это и выразите признательность.	Step 5: Notice how the part responds to your Self-energy. If there is a positive shift, acknowledge it and offer appreciation.
Step 6: Continue to extend Self-energy (one or more of the eight Cs).	Step 6: Continue to extend Self-energy (one or more of the eight Cs).	Шаг 6: Продолжайте расширять свою энергию (одну или несколько из восьми С).	Step 6: Continue to extend Self-energy (one or more of the eight Cs).
Step 7: Create a Self-to-part relationship by asking the part what it wants you to know about itself.	Step 7: Create a Self-to-part relationship by asking the part what it wants you to know about itself.	Шаг 7. Создайте отношения «Я-часть», спросив часть, что она хочет, чтобы вы знали о себе.	Step 7: Create a Self-to-part relationship by asking the part what it wants you to know about itself.
Step 8: Validate the part’s experiences.	Step 8: Validate the part’s experiences.	Шаг 8: Подтвердите опыт части.	Step 8: Validate the part’s experiences.
Step 9: Continue to extend Self-energy (one or more of the eight Cs).	Step 9: Continue to extend Self-energy (one or more of the eight Cs).	Шаг 9: Продолжайте расширять свою энергию (одну или несколько из восьми С).	Step 9: Continue to extend Self-energy (one or more of the eight Cs).
Step 10: Ask the part to share more of its story with you (it may use images, bodily sensations, words, etc.).	Step 10: Ask the part to share more of its story with you (it may use images, bodily sensations, words, etc.).	Шаг 10: Попросите часть рассказать вам больше своей истории (она может использовать образы, телесные ощущения, слова и т. д.).	Step 10: Ask the part to share more of its story with you (it may use images, bodily sensations, words, etc.).
Step 11: Find out what the part is afraid of by asking, “What are you afraid would happen if you didn’t [...]? (Use the part’s exact words for what’s it’s doing to protect you.)	Step 11: Find out what the part is afraid of by asking, “What are you afraid would happen if you didn’t [...]? (Use the part’s exact words for what’s it’s doing to protect you.)	Шаг 11: Узнайте, чего боится эта часть, спросив: «Чего вы боитесь, что произойдет, если вы не сделаете [...]? (Используйте точные слова части, чтобы описать, что она делает, чтобы защитить вас.)	Step 11: Find out what the part is afraid of by asking, “What are you afraid would happen if you didn’t [...]? (Use the part’s exact words for what’s it’s doing to protect you.)
Step 12: Offer hope by saying, “What if I could go to the one who feels [...] (use the part’s exact words) and heal it. Would you be interested?”	Step 12: Offer hope by saying, “What if I could go to the one who feels [...] (use the part’s exact words) and heal it. Would you be interested?”	Шаг 12: Предложите надежду, сказав: «Что, если бы я мог пойти к тому, кто чувствует [...] (используйте точные слова этой части) и исцелить его. Вам будет интересно?»	Step 12: Offer hope by saying, “What if I could go to the one who feels [...] (use the part’s exact words) and heal it. Would you be interested?”
Step 13: Let the part know it does not have to stop doing its job; it only needs to step back.	Step 13: Let the part know it does not have to stop doing its job; it only needs to step back.	Шаг 13: Сообщите детали, что ей не нужно прекращать выполнять свою работу; нужно только отступить.	Step 13: Let the part know it does not have to stop doing its job; it only needs to step back.
CHAPTER 10	CHAPTER 10	ГЛАВА 10	CHAPTER 10
Elemental Healing	Elemental Healing	Элементальное исцеление	Elemental Healing
Unburdening and Healing Your Parts	Unburdening and Healing Your Parts	Освобождение и исцеление ваших частей	Unburdening and Healing Your Parts
In the last chapter, we met my part Pricklee and discovered that she protected a nine-year-old part of me who experienced feelings of abandonment and being alone after the adults in her life hid the truth about her parents’ marriage from her. She knew in her gut that they were separated and getting divorced. She needed her grandmother, aunts, or parents to confirm what she already knew to be true. Because no one did, young Tamala was left to manage her emotions and started to doubt her own sense of reality. Everyone wanted her to continue with her summer as if nothing devastating was occurring in her life, but she couldn’t pretend and deny the real pain of her broken heart. Pricklee took over to protect this vulnerable, hurt, lonely part of me. She exiled the pained one and became hyper-vigilant in her need for predictability. When she didn’t get it, she became anxious, irritated, and angry for fear that I would experience the abandonment, heartbreak, and loneliness of the one she protects by keeping her exiled.	In the last chapter, we met my part Pricklee and discovered that she protected a nine-year-old part of me who experienced feelings of abandonment and being alone after the adults in her life hid the truth about her parents’ marriage from her. She knew in her gut that they were separated and getting divorced. She needed her grandmother, aunts, or parents to confirm what she already knew to be true. Because no one did, young Tamala was left to manage her emotions and started to doubt her own sense of reality. Everyone wanted her to continue with her summer as if nothing devastating was occurring in her life, but she couldn’t pretend and deny the real pain of her broken heart. Pricklee took over to protect this vulnerable, hurt, lonely part of me. She exiled the pained one and became hyper-vigilant in her need for predictability. When she didn’t get it, she became anxious, irritated, and angry for fear that I would experience the abandonment, heartbreak, and loneliness of the one she protects by keeping her exiled.	В последней главе мы познакомились с моей частью Прикли и обнаружили, что она защищает девятилетнюю часть меня, которая испытывала чувство покинутости и одиночества после того, как взрослые в ее жизни скрыли от нее правду о браке ее родителей. Она знала нутром, что они расстались и разводятся. Ей нужно было, чтобы ее бабушка, тети или родители подтвердили то, что, как она уже знала, было правдой. Поскольку никто этого не сделал, юной Тамале пришлось управлять своими эмоциями, и она начала сомневаться в собственном ощущении реальности. Все хотели, чтобы она продолжила лето, как будто в ее жизни не происходило ничего разрушительного, но она не могла притворяться и отрицать настоящую боль своего разбитого сердца. Прикли взял на себя защиту этой уязвимой, обиженной и одинокой части меня. Она изгнала обиженного и стала сверхбдительной в своей потребности в предсказуемости. Когда она этого не поняла, она стала тревожной, раздраженной и злой из-за страха, что я испытаю заброшенность, горе и одиночество того, кого она защищает, оставляя ее в изгнании.	In the last chapter, we met my part Pricklee and discovered that she protected a nine-year-old part of me who experienced feelings of abandonment and being alone after the adults in her life hid the truth about her parents’ marriage from her. She knew in her gut that they were separated and getting divorced. She needed her grandmother, aunts, or parents to confirm what she already knew to be true. Because no one did, young Tamala was left to manage her emotions and started to doubt her own sense of reality. Everyone wanted her to continue with her summer as if nothing devastating was occurring in her life, but she couldn’t pretend and deny the real pain of her broken heart. Pricklee took over to protect this vulnerable, hurt, lonely part of me. She exiled the pained one and became hyper-vigilant in her need for predictability. When she didn’t get it, she became anxious, irritated, and angry for fear that I would experience the abandonment, heartbreak, and loneliness of the one she protects by keeping her exiled.
Although Pricklee expressed skepticism about my ability to heal young Tamala, she allowed access. When I closed my eyes and went inside, I entered a space where I was able to see and even touch young Tamala. I saw my younger self crouching in a corner with her back to me. She was silently crying several feet away. My compassion for her was palpable. I wanted to go scoop her up and hold her, and I wanted to honor her space at the same time. I sent the energy of compassion I felt in her direction. It took several minutes for her to look over her shoulder toward me with interest. I smiled. I asked if I could come closer. She answered by scooting close enough for us to touch, although we didn’t. I continued to energetically share the energy of curiosity and compassion with her. This piqued her curiosity because she asked, “Who are you?” I told her, “I’m you all grown up.” My eyes welled up with her tears as she moved beside me close enough for our legs to touch. I felt her sadness and relief. She looked into my eyes and said, half a statement and half a question, “You’re me and I’m you?” I nodded. Then she asked, “What took you so long?” I simply answered, “I’m here for you now and want to get to know you.” I felt a rush of her deep sadness. But even with feeling her sadness, I was able to remain present with her continuing to extend my Self-energy of genuine curiosity.	Although Pricklee expressed skepticism about my ability to heal young Tamala, she allowed access. When I closed my eyes and went inside, I entered a space where I was able to see and even touch young Tamala. I saw my younger self crouching in a corner with her back to me. She was silently crying several feet away. My compassion for her was palpable. I wanted to go scoop her up and hold her, and I wanted to honor her space at the same time. I sent the energy of compassion I felt in her direction. It took several minutes for her to look over her shoulder toward me with interest. I smiled. I asked if I could come closer. She answered by scooting close enough for us to touch, although we didn’t. I continued to energetically share the energy of curiosity and compassion with her. This piqued her curiosity because she asked, “Who are you?” I told her, “I’m you all grown up.” My eyes welled up with her tears as she moved beside me close enough for our legs to touch. I felt her sadness and relief. She looked into my eyes and said, half a statement and half a question, “You’re me and I’m you?” I nodded. Then she asked, “What took you so long?” I simply answered, “I’m here for you now and want to get to know you.” I felt a rush of her deep sadness. But even with feeling her sadness, I was able to remain present with her continuing to extend my Self-energy of genuine curiosity.	Хотя Прикли выразила скептицизм по поводу моей способности исцелить юную Тамалу, она разрешила доступ. Когда я закрыл глаза и вошел внутрь, я вошел в пространство, где смог увидеть и даже прикоснуться к юной Тамале. Я увидел себя, младшую, сидевшую в углу спиной ко мне. Она тихо плакала в нескольких футах от меня. Мое сострадание к ней было ощутимым. Мне хотелось подхватить ее и подержать, и в то же время я хотел почтить ее пространство. Я направил энергию сострадания, которую чувствовал, в ее сторону. Ей потребовалось несколько минут, чтобы с интересом оглянуться на меня через плечо. Я улыбнулся. Я спросил, могу ли я подойти поближе. В ответ она пододвинулась достаточно близко, чтобы мы могли коснуться ее, хотя мы этого не сделали. Я продолжал энергично делиться с ней энергией любопытства и сострадания. Это возбудило ее любопытство, потому что она спросила: «Кто ты?» Я сказал ей: «Я — ты уже взрослая». Мои глаза наполнились ее слезами, когда она подошла ко мне настолько близко, что наши ноги соприкоснулись. Я почувствовал ее печаль и облегчение. Она посмотрела мне в глаза и сказала наполовину утверждением, наполовину вопросом: «Ты — это я, а я — это ты?» Я кивнул. Затем она спросила: «Почему ты так долго?» Я просто ответил: «Сейчас я здесь ради тебя и хочу с тобой познакомиться». Я почувствовал прилив ее глубокой печали. Но даже чувствуя ее печаль, я смог оставаться рядом с ней, продолжая распространять свою энергию истинного любопытства.	Although Pricklee expressed skepticism about my ability to heal young Tamala, she allowed access. When I closed my eyes and went inside, I entered a space where I was able to see and even touch young Tamala. I saw my younger self crouching in a corner with her back to me. She was silently crying several feet away. My compassion for her was palpable. I wanted to go scoop her up and hold her, and I wanted to honor her space at the same time. I sent the energy of compassion I felt in her direction. It took several minutes for her to look over her shoulder toward me with interest. I smiled. I asked if I could come closer. She answered by scooting close enough for us to touch, although we didn’t. I continued to energetically share the energy of curiosity and compassion with her. This piqued her curiosity because she asked, “Who are you?” I told her, “I’m you all grown up.” My eyes welled up with her tears as she moved beside me close enough for our legs to touch. I felt her sadness and relief. She looked into my eyes and said, half a statement and half a question, “You’re me and I’m you?” I nodded. Then she asked, “What took you so long?” I simply answered, “I’m here for you now and want to get to know you.” I felt a rush of her deep sadness. But even with feeling her sadness, I was able to remain present with her continuing to extend my Self-energy of genuine curiosity.
Tearfully, she said, “No one loves me enough to tell me the truth.” She went on to share how the adults in her life broke her heart. They made it so she could not trust herself any longer. She knew that things were not okay at home when she saw the return address on the letter from her father to her grandmother. But for some reason, the adults tried to convince her that everything was fine. She didn’t understand why they didn’t love her enough to tell her the truth. She was further confused by her grandmother’s lies because she herself was always told to tell the truth. She came to believe that she wasn’t worth being told the truth. When she shared the intense agony of her worthlessness, her body crumpled, and a torrent of tears fell from my eyes. I felt profoundly connected to her in this moment, and my compassion intensified. I reached for her, and she snuggled to the curves of my body, allowing me to comfort her. I let her know I could hold every pain she experienced and that she was no longer alone. I felt her body relax, and her tears began to subside. I softly asked, “Is there more you want to share?” She nodded and asserted, “I trusted myself before this happened. I knew things, and I didn’t know how I knew them. I trusted what I knew because it felt right. But this made me distrust myself. I lost my gift.” I supportively offered, “Are you ready to release your burdens from that experience?” She nodded eagerly.	Tearfully, she said, “No one loves me enough to tell me the truth.” She went on to share how the adults in her life broke her heart. They made it so she could not trust herself any longer. She knew that things were not okay at home when she saw the return address on the letter from her father to her grandmother. But for some reason, the adults tried to convince her that everything was fine. She didn’t understand why they didn’t love her enough to tell her the truth. She was further confused by her grandmother’s lies because she herself was always told to tell the truth. She came to believe that she wasn’t worth being told the truth. When she shared the intense agony of her worthlessness, her body crumpled, and a torrent of tears fell from my eyes. I felt profoundly connected to her in this moment, and my compassion intensified. I reached for her, and she snuggled to the curves of my body, allowing me to comfort her. I let her know I could hold every pain she experienced and that she was no longer alone. I felt her body relax, and her tears began to subside. I softly asked, “Is there more you want to share?” She nodded and asserted, “I trusted myself before this happened. I knew things, and I didn’t know how I knew them. I trusted what I knew because it felt right. But this made me distrust myself. I lost my gift.” I supportively offered, “Are you ready to release your burdens from that experience?” She nodded eagerly.	Со слезами на глазах она сказала: «Никто не любит меня настолько, чтобы сказать мне правду». Далее она рассказала, как взрослые в ее жизни разбили ей сердце. Они сделали это, чтобы она больше не могла доверять себе. Она поняла, что дома не все в порядке, когда увидела обратный адрес в письме отца к бабушке. Но взрослые почему-то пытались убедить ее, что все в порядке. Она не понимала, почему они не любили ее настолько, чтобы сказать ей правду. Ее еще больше смущала ложь бабушки, потому что ей самой всегда говорили говорить правду. Она пришла к выводу, что она не достойна того, чтобы ей говорили правду. Когда она разделила сильную агонию своей никчемности, ее тело сжалось, и поток слез полился из моих глаз. В этот момент я почувствовал глубокую связь с ней, и мое сострадание усилилось. Я потянулся к ней, и она прижалась к изгибам моего тела, позволяя мне утешить ее. Я дал ей понять, что могу выдержать любую боль, которую она испытывала, и что она больше не одна. Я почувствовал, как ее тело расслабилось, и ее слезы начали утихать. Я мягко спросил: «Вы хотите еще чем-нибудь поделиться?» Она кивнула и заявила: «Я доверяла себе до того, как это произошло. Я знал некоторые вещи, но не знал, откуда я их знаю. Я доверял тому, что знал, потому что это казалось правильным. Но это заставило меня не доверять себе. Я потерял свой дар». Я поддержал его: «Готовы ли вы освободиться от бремени этого опыта?» Она энергично кивнула.	Tearfully, she said, “No one loves me enough to tell me the truth.” She went on to share how the adults in her life broke her heart. They made it so she could not trust herself any longer. She knew that things were not okay at home when she saw the return address on the letter from her father to her grandmother. But for some reason, the adults tried to convince her that everything was fine. She didn’t understand why they didn’t love her enough to tell her the truth. She was further confused by her grandmother’s lies because she herself was always told to tell the truth. She came to believe that she wasn’t worth being told the truth. When she shared the intense agony of her worthlessness, her body crumpled, and a torrent of tears fell from my eyes. I felt profoundly connected to her in this moment, and my compassion intensified. I reached for her, and she snuggled to the curves of my body, allowing me to comfort her. I let her know I could hold every pain she experienced and that she was no longer alone. I felt her body relax, and her tears began to subside. I softly asked, “Is there more you want to share?” She nodded and asserted, “I trusted myself before this happened. I knew things, and I didn’t know how I knew them. I trusted what I knew because it felt right. But this made me distrust myself. I lost my gift.” I supportively offered, “Are you ready to release your burdens from that experience?” She nodded eagerly.
IFS CONCEPT 1: BURDENS REVISITED	IFS CONCEPT 1: BURDENS REVISITED	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 1: НОВЫЙ ОБЗОР бремени	IFS CONCEPT 1: BURDENS REVISITED
Burdens are created out of our woundedness. Neglect, abuse, rejection, lack of attunement to our needs, boundary violations, attachment injuries—all these can result in wounding. Our parts get the message that something is wrong with them. From these experiences parts become burdened with extreme beliefs about themselves, others, and the world. These burdens become a part of them, but they are not who the part naturally is. In most cases, parts are not created burdened; rather, their essential nature becomes obscured by the burdens.	Burdens are created out of our woundedness. Neglect, abuse, rejection, lack of attunement to our needs, boundary violations, attachment injuries—all these can result in wounding. Our parts get the message that something is wrong with them. From these experiences parts become burdened with extreme beliefs about themselves, others, and the world. These burdens become a part of them, but they are not who the part naturally is. In most cases, parts are not created burdened; rather, their essential nature becomes obscured by the burdens.	Бремя создается нашей ранимостью. Пренебрежение, жестокое обращение, отвержение, отсутствие настройки на наши потребности, нарушение границ, травмы привязанности — все это может привести к ранениям. Наши части получают сообщение о том, что с ними что-то не так. Из-за этого опыта некоторые части становятся обремененными крайними убеждениями о себе, других и мире. Это бремя становится их частью, но они не являются той частью, которая естественным образом является этой частью. В большинстве случаев детали создаются не отягощенными; скорее, их сущностная природа затемняется бременем.	Burdens are created out of our woundedness. Neglect, abuse, rejection, lack of attunement to our needs, boundary violations, attachment injuries—all these can result in wounding. Our parts get the message that something is wrong with them. From these experiences parts become burdened with extreme beliefs about themselves, others, and the world. These burdens become a part of them, but they are not who the part naturally is. In most cases, parts are not created burdened; rather, their essential nature becomes obscured by the burdens.
In the example of my nine-year-old exiled part, she was burdened with feelings of worthlessness, abandonment, aloneness, and the physical pain of brokenheartedness. These burdens covered up her natural ability to trust her intuition, planting the seeds of self-doubt. Healing involves helping our exiled parts release their burdens.	In the example of my nine-year-old exiled part, she was burdened with feelings of worthlessness, abandonment, aloneness, and the physical pain of brokenheartedness. These burdens covered up her natural ability to trust her intuition, planting the seeds of self-doubt. Healing involves helping our exiled parts release their burdens.	В примере с моей девятилетней изгнанницей она была отягощена чувствами никчемности, покинутости, одиночества и физической болью разбитого сердца. Это бремя скрывало ее естественную способность доверять своей интуиции, посеяв семена неуверенности в себе. Исцеление включает в себя помощь нашим изгнанным частям освободиться от своего бремени.	In the example of my nine-year-old exiled part, she was burdened with feelings of worthlessness, abandonment, aloneness, and the physical pain of brokenheartedness. These burdens covered up her natural ability to trust her intuition, planting the seeds of self-doubt. Healing involves helping our exiled parts release their burdens.
IFS CONCEPT 2: WITNESSING REVISITED	IFS CONCEPT 2: WITNESSING REVISITED	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 2: ВОЗВРАТ СВИДЕТЕЛЬСТВА	IFS CONCEPT 2: WITNESSING REVISITED
The process of healing an exile is called unburdening, and the key step in it is witnessing. The goal of witnessing is for the exiled part to feel heard and understood by Self. It is important to slow down and not rush the process of getting to know exiled parts. When a protector gives permission and access to get to know an exile, we want to notice how we experience the exile when we go inside. The part may express itself as a sensation in the body such as tightness, numbness, chills, or any other sensation. It may allow us to experience its emotions like terror, sadness, or hopelessness. It may even present in physical form. Sometimes our exiled parts show up as a younger version of ourselves.	The process of healing an exile is called unburdening, and the key step in it is witnessing. The goal of witnessing is for the exiled part to feel heard and understood by Self. It is important to slow down and not rush the process of getting to know exiled parts. When a protector gives permission and access to get to know an exile, we want to notice how we experience the exile when we go inside. The part may express itself as a sensation in the body such as tightness, numbness, chills, or any other sensation. It may allow us to experience its emotions like terror, sadness, or hopelessness. It may even present in physical form. Sometimes our exiled parts show up as a younger version of ourselves.	Процесс исцеления изгнанника называется освобождением, и ключевым шагом в нем является свидетельствование. Цель свидетельствования состоит в том, чтобы изгнанная часть почувствовала, что ее «Я» слышит и понимает. Важно замедлить и не торопить процесс знакомства с сосланными частями. Когда защитник дает разрешение и доступ для знакомства с изгнанником, мы хотим отметить, как мы переживаем изгнание, когда заходим внутрь. Эта часть может проявляться в виде ощущения в теле, такого как стеснение, онемение, озноб или любое другое ощущение. Это может позволить нам испытать такие эмоции, как ужас, печаль или безнадежность. Оно может даже присутствовать в физической форме. Иногда наши изгнанные части проявляются как более молодая версия нас самих.	The process of healing an exile is called unburdening, and the key step in it is witnessing. The goal of witnessing is for the exiled part to feel heard and understood by Self. It is important to slow down and not rush the process of getting to know exiled parts. When a protector gives permission and access to get to know an exile, we want to notice how we experience the exile when we go inside. The part may express itself as a sensation in the body such as tightness, numbness, chills, or any other sensation. It may allow us to experience its emotions like terror, sadness, or hopelessness. It may even present in physical form. Sometimes our exiled parts show up as a younger version of ourselves.
It is not uncommon for exile parts to blend with us. They have been hidden away for a long time and are needy of attention. As we learned earlier, we cannot form a relationship with a part when it is blended with us. We want to ask the exile part early on not to blend with us. If it does, we can ask the part to unblend. However, it is easier and more efficient to ask a part not to blend in the beginning than it is to ask it to unblend later.	It is not uncommon for exile parts to blend with us. They have been hidden away for a long time and are needy of attention. As we learned earlier, we cannot form a relationship with a part when it is blended with us. We want to ask the exile part early on not to blend with us. If it does, we can ask the part to unblend. However, it is easier and more efficient to ask a part not to blend in the beginning than it is to ask it to unblend later.	Части изгнанников нередко сливаются с нами. Они давно спрятаны и требуют внимания. Как мы узнали ранее, мы не можем сформировать отношения с частью, когда она слита с нами. Мы хотим попросить изгнанников с самого начала не смешиваться с нами. Если это так, мы можем попросить часть растечься. Однако проще и эффективнее попросить часть не сливаться вначале, чем просить ее разъединиться позже.	It is not uncommon for exile parts to blend with us. They have been hidden away for a long time and are needy of attention. As we learned earlier, we cannot form a relationship with a part when it is blended with us. We want to ask the exile part early on not to blend with us. If it does, we can ask the part to unblend. However, it is easier and more efficient to ask a part not to blend in the beginning than it is to ask it to unblend later.
Regardless of the way exile parts first express themselves, we need to build a trusting relationship with them. We accomplish this by extending Self-energy to the part. Upon first meeting our exiled parts, we may feel compassion for what they have gone through. We also may feel connected to them and curious about their experiences. If they are scared or upset, we may feel calm toward them. Whatever C-word we feel, we let them feel it too, energetically. The part may not notice us or may feel hostile toward us; we want to continue to send our Self-energy to it until it shifts in some way. Experiencing our compassion, curiosity, confidence, etc., will help the exile calm and notice us. It may even get curious about who we are and why we are present. From this awareness, we can begin to build a relationship with the exile. Remember these are usually young parts and we want to engage them as such. Think about how you would interact with a young child. We may soften or lower our voice, speak slower, get on the child’s level, offer a physical connection if the child is open to it. We would use these same methods to build trust with our exiled parts.	Regardless of the way exile parts first express themselves, we need to build a trusting relationship with them. We accomplish this by extending Self-energy to the part. Upon first meeting our exiled parts, we may feel compassion for what they have gone through. We also may feel connected to them and curious about their experiences. If they are scared or upset, we may feel calm toward them. Whatever C-word we feel, we let them feel it too, energetically. The part may not notice us or may feel hostile toward us; we want to continue to send our Self-energy to it until it shifts in some way. Experiencing our compassion, curiosity, confidence, etc., will help the exile calm and notice us. It may even get curious about who we are and why we are present. From this awareness, we can begin to build a relationship with the exile. Remember these are usually young parts and we want to engage them as such. Think about how you would interact with a young child. We may soften or lower our voice, speak slower, get on the child’s level, offer a physical connection if the child is open to it. We would use these same methods to build trust with our exiled parts.	Независимо от того, как части изгнания сначала проявляют себя, нам необходимо построить с ними доверительные отношения. Мы достигаем этого, распространяя на эту часть свою собственную энергию. При первой встрече с нашими изгнанными частями мы можем почувствовать сострадание к тому, через что им пришлось пройти. Мы также можем чувствовать связь с ними и интересоваться их опытом. Если они напуганы или расстроены, мы можем относиться к ним спокойно. Какое бы слово на букву C мы ни чувствовали, мы позволяем им тоже это почувствовать, энергетически. Эта часть может нас не замечать или относиться к нам враждебно; мы хотим продолжать посылать туда нашу собственную энергию до тех пор, пока она каким-то образом не изменится. Переживание нашего сострадания, любопытства, уверенности и т. д. поможет изгнаннику успокоиться и заметить нас. Ему может даже стать любопытно, кто мы и почему мы здесь. Исходя из этого осознания, мы можем начать строить отношения с изгнанником. Помните, что обычно это молодые люди, и мы хотим привлечь их как таковых. Подумайте, как бы вы общались с маленьким ребенком. Мы можем смягчить или понизить голос, говорить медленнее, подняться на уровень ребенка, предложить физическую связь, если ребенок открыт для этого. Мы будем использовать те же самые методы, чтобы завоевать доверие наших изгнанных частей.	Regardless of the way exile parts first express themselves, we need to build a trusting relationship with them. We accomplish this by extending Self-energy to the part. Upon first meeting our exiled parts, we may feel compassion for what they have gone through. We also may feel connected to them and curious about their experiences. If they are scared or upset, we may feel calm toward them. Whatever C-word we feel, we let them feel it too, energetically. The part may not notice us or may feel hostile toward us; we want to continue to send our Self-energy to it until it shifts in some way. Experiencing our compassion, curiosity, confidence, etc., will help the exile calm and notice us. It may even get curious about who we are and why we are present. From this awareness, we can begin to build a relationship with the exile. Remember these are usually young parts and we want to engage them as such. Think about how you would interact with a young child. We may soften or lower our voice, speak slower, get on the child’s level, offer a physical connection if the child is open to it. We would use these same methods to build trust with our exiled parts.
After there is trust between you and your exile, you can move into witnessing. Witnessing is the process by which we learn the exiled part’s story. How was it wounded? The pains and burdens it carries. We let the part know that we want to know about it. You can ask, “What is it you’d like me to know about you?” Listen and be with the part however it needs you to be with it. The beauty of Self is it is intuitive. When we are Self-led, we don’t have to know at a thinking level what to do to support our exiled parts. The part may use various avenues to share its story. Sometimes parts share with images or a movie of what happened to them. There may be multiple scenes they want to share with you. They could use words, sensations, emotions, memories as ways to let you know about their experiences. The process of witnessing takes as long as it needs for the part to share everything it wants to share with you. The most important part of this process is that the part feels heard and validated by you. Up until this point, the part hasn’t had the opportunity to share its story with a compassionate listener who doesn’t judge it.	After there is trust between you and your exile, you can move into witnessing. Witnessing is the process by which we learn the exiled part’s story. How was it wounded? The pains and burdens it carries. We let the part know that we want to know about it. You can ask, “What is it you’d like me to know about you?” Listen and be with the part however it needs you to be with it. The beauty of Self is it is intuitive. When we are Self-led, we don’t have to know at a thinking level what to do to support our exiled parts. The part may use various avenues to share its story. Sometimes parts share with images or a movie of what happened to them. There may be multiple scenes they want to share with you. They could use words, sensations, emotions, memories as ways to let you know about their experiences. The process of witnessing takes as long as it needs for the part to share everything it wants to share with you. The most important part of this process is that the part feels heard and validated by you. Up until this point, the part hasn’t had the opportunity to share its story with a compassionate listener who doesn’t judge it.	После того, как между вами и вашим изгнанником возникнет доверие, вы можете перейти к свидетельствованию. Свидетельствование – это процесс, посредством которого мы узнаем историю изгнанной части. Как оно было ранено? Боль и бремя, которые оно несет. Мы сообщаем части, что хотим о ней знать. Вы можете спросить: «Что вы хотите, чтобы я знал о вас?» Слушайте и будьте с этой частью, как бы ей ни хотелось, чтобы вы были с ней. Красота «Я» в том, что оно интуитивно понятно. Когда мы самостоятельны, нам не нужно на уровне мышления знать, что делать, чтобы поддержать наши изгнанные части. Часть может использовать различные способы, чтобы поделиться своей историей. Иногда части делятся изображениями или фильмами о том, что с ними произошло. Они могут поделиться с вами несколькими сценами. Они могли использовать слова, ощущения, эмоции, воспоминания как способы сообщить вам о своем опыте. Процесс свидетельствования занимает столько времени, сколько необходимо части, чтобы поделиться с вами всем, чем она хочет поделиться. Самая важная часть этого процесса заключается в том, что вы чувствуете, что эта часть услышана и одобрена. До этого момента у этой партии не было возможности поделиться своей историей с сострадательным слушателем, который ее не осуждает.	After there is trust between you and your exile, you can move into witnessing. Witnessing is the process by which we learn the exiled part’s story. How was it wounded? The pains and burdens it carries. We let the part know that we want to know about it. You can ask, “What is it you’d like me to know about you?” Listen and be with the part however it needs you to be with it. The beauty of Self is it is intuitive. When we are Self-led, we don’t have to know at a thinking level what to do to support our exiled parts. The part may use various avenues to share its story. Sometimes parts share with images or a movie of what happened to them. There may be multiple scenes they want to share with you. They could use words, sensations, emotions, memories as ways to let you know about their experiences. The process of witnessing takes as long as it needs for the part to share everything it wants to share with you. The most important part of this process is that the part feels heard and validated by you. Up until this point, the part hasn’t had the opportunity to share its story with a compassionate listener who doesn’t judge it.
In the witnessing, other parts may get overwhelmed, concerned, or fearful about what the exile is sharing. If this happens, ask those parts to step back to allow you to continue to witness the exile’s experience. If the parts are unwilling to step back, take time to hear their concerns or fears. Let them know that you want to help them by helping the exile to heal. Their fears are warranted given their experiences too. Listen to them for as long as it takes to address their fears and return to the exile. The witnessing process is complete when the exile feels understood by Self. When the part expresses that it does feel heard and understood and has nothing more to share, we can move forward.	In the witnessing, other parts may get overwhelmed, concerned, or fearful about what the exile is sharing. If this happens, ask those parts to step back to allow you to continue to witness the exile’s experience. If the parts are unwilling to step back, take time to hear their concerns or fears. Let them know that you want to help them by helping the exile to heal. Their fears are warranted given their experiences too. Listen to them for as long as it takes to address their fears and return to the exile. The witnessing process is complete when the exile feels understood by Self. When the part expresses that it does feel heard and understood and has nothing more to share, we can move forward.	Во время свидетельствования другие части могут быть потрясены, обеспокоены или напуганы тем, чем делится изгнанник. Если это произойдет, попросите эти части отступить, чтобы вы могли продолжать наблюдать за переживаниями изгнанника. Если части не желают отступать, найдите время, чтобы выслушать их опасения и опасения. Дайте им понять, что вы хотите помочь им, помогая изгнаннику исцелиться. Их опасения оправданы, учитывая их опыт. Слушайте их столько, сколько потребуется, чтобы избавиться от своих страхов и вернуться в изгнание. Процесс свидетельствования завершается, когда изгнанник чувствует, что его «Я» понимает. Когда часть выражает, что она чувствует себя услышанной и понятой и ей больше нечем поделиться, мы можем двигаться дальше.	In the witnessing, other parts may get overwhelmed, concerned, or fearful about what the exile is sharing. If this happens, ask those parts to step back to allow you to continue to witness the exile’s experience. If the parts are unwilling to step back, take time to hear their concerns or fears. Let them know that you want to help them by helping the exile to heal. Their fears are warranted given their experiences too. Listen to them for as long as it takes to address their fears and return to the exile. The witnessing process is complete when the exile feels understood by Self. When the part expresses that it does feel heard and understood and has nothing more to share, we can move forward.
IFS CONCEPT 3: THE DO-OVER	IFS CONCEPT 3: THE DO-OVER	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 3: ПЕРЕВЕРНЕНИЕ	IFS CONCEPT 3: THE DO-OVER
Sometimes as part of the healing process, exiles need for something to occur in the scenes from the past that didn’t initially happen; however, this may not be needed for all exiles. As an example, they need support they didn’t receive, or they need to say something or do something that they couldn’t do or say at the time. As part of the witnessing process, you can offer your exile a do-over.	Sometimes as part of the healing process, exiles need for something to occur in the scenes from the past that didn’t initially happen; however, this may not be needed for all exiles. As an example, they need support they didn’t receive, or they need to say something or do something that they couldn’t do or say at the time. As part of the witnessing process, you can offer your exile a do-over.	Иногда в рамках процесса исцеления изгнанникам необходимо, чтобы в сценах прошлого произошло что-то, чего изначально не было; однако это может понадобиться не всем ссыльным. Например, им нужна поддержка, которую они не получили, или им нужно что-то сказать или сделать что-то, чего они не могли сделать или сказать в тот момент. В рамках процесса свидетельствования вы можете предложить изгнаннику новую жизнь.	Sometimes as part of the healing process, exiles need for something to occur in the scenes from the past that didn’t initially happen; however, this may not be needed for all exiles. As an example, they need support they didn’t receive, or they need to say something or do something that they couldn’t do or say at the time. As part of the witnessing process, you can offer your exile a do-over.
A do-over is an emotionally corrective experience. The exile has an opportunity to get their needs met in the manner that eluded them originally. This is accomplished by asking your exile, “What do you need to happen that didn’t?” or “How did you need someone to be with you back then?” Whatever your part requests of you, provide it for them. They may ask you to stand up to a bully or listen to and hold them or help them with big emotions they don’t understand and can’t regulate.	A do-over is an emotionally corrective experience. The exile has an opportunity to get their needs met in the manner that eluded them originally. This is accomplished by asking your exile, “What do you need to happen that didn’t?” or “How did you need someone to be with you back then?” Whatever your part requests of you, provide it for them. They may ask you to stand up to a bully or listen to and hold them or help them with big emotions they don’t understand and can’t regulate.	Переделка — это эмоционально корректирующий опыт. У изгнанников есть возможность удовлетворить свои потребности так, как это ускользнуло от них изначально. Это достигается путем вопроса изгнаннику: «Что тебе нужно, чтобы произошло, чего не произошло?» или «Как тебе тогда нужно было, чтобы кто-то был рядом с тобой?» Чего бы ни требовала от вас ваша часть, предоставьте ей это. Они могут попросить вас противостоять хулигану, выслушать и удержать их, или помочь им с сильными эмоциями, которые они не понимают и не могут контролировать.	A do-over is an emotionally corrective experience. The exile has an opportunity to get their needs met in the manner that eluded them originally. This is accomplished by asking your exile, “What do you need to happen that didn’t?” or “How did you need someone to be with you back then?” Whatever your part requests of you, provide it for them. They may ask you to stand up to a bully or listen to and hold them or help them with big emotions they don’t understand and can’t regulate.
When I offered a do-over to my nine-year-old part, she needed three things to happen differently. First, she needed to be told the truth about her dad’s address change and her parents’ separation. Second, she needed this truth to validate her intuition. Lastly, she needed the adults to help her with the pain of her parents’ separation, let her experience her emotions fully, and not expect her to pretend everything was all right.	When I offered a do-over to my nine-year-old part, she needed three things to happen differently. First, she needed to be told the truth about her dad’s address change and her parents’ separation. Second, she needed this truth to validate her intuition. Lastly, she needed the adults to help her with the pain of her parents’ separation, let her experience her emotions fully, and not expect her to pretend everything was all right.	Когда я предложил переделать свою девятилетнюю роль, ей нужно было, чтобы три вещи произошли по-другому. Во-первых, ей нужно было сказать правду о смене адреса ее отца и разводе родителей. Во-вторых, ей нужна была эта истина, чтобы подтвердить свою интуицию. Наконец, ей нужно было, чтобы взрослые помогли ей пережить боль разлуки родителей, позволили ей полностью пережить свои эмоции, а не ждали, что она будет притворяться, что все в порядке.	When I offered a do-over to my nine-year-old part, she needed three things to happen differently. First, she needed to be told the truth about her dad’s address change and her parents’ separation. Second, she needed this truth to validate her intuition. Lastly, she needed the adults to help her with the pain of her parents’ separation, let her experience her emotions fully, and not expect her to pretend everything was all right.
IFS CONCEPT 4: RETRIEVAL	IFS CONCEPT 4: RETRIEVAL	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 4: ПОИСК	IFS CONCEPT 4: RETRIEVAL
Some exiled parts may be stuck or frozen in a past trauma scene. The part reexperiences their wounding, unable to extricate themselves from perpetual pain. When this is true, retrieval is necessary. Again, this is a step not necessary for every exile. Retrieval is offering the part a choice to leave the trauma scene for a safe place. Parts often choose to come to the present with Self. They may also choose to go to a place that was safe in the past, such as a grandparent’s home. They can also go to an imaginary place or fun location like an amusement park or beach. It is completely the part’s choice. Self can escort the part to any place of its choosing. To begin the retrieval, Self simply needs to ask the part, “Are you ready to leave that time and place to come to the present with me or to any other safe place, imaginary or real?” If the part does not want to leave the past, inquire why it doesn’t want to leave. Sometimes more witnessing is required. The part may not want to leave until it tells more of its story. Or something more may need to happen in the past. It may be concerned about who it is leaving behind, such as younger siblings who were also impacted by the trauma experience. If this is true, invite the part to bring their siblings with them. Once the part is in a safe place, the unburdening can begin.	Some exiled parts may be stuck or frozen in a past trauma scene. The part reexperiences their wounding, unable to extricate themselves from perpetual pain. When this is true, retrieval is necessary. Again, this is a step not necessary for every exile. Retrieval is offering the part a choice to leave the trauma scene for a safe place. Parts often choose to come to the present with Self. They may also choose to go to a place that was safe in the past, such as a grandparent’s home. They can also go to an imaginary place or fun location like an amusement park or beach. It is completely the part’s choice. Self can escort the part to any place of its choosing.
