To begin the retrieval, Self simply needs to ask the part, “Are you ready to leave that time and place to come to the present with me or to any other safe place, imaginary or real?” If the part does not want to leave the past, inquire why it doesn’t want to leave. Sometimes more witnessing is required. The part may not want to leave until it tells more of its story. Or something more may need to happen in the past. It may be concerned about who it is leaving behind, such as younger siblings who were also impacted by the trauma experience. If this is true, invite the part to bring their siblings with them. Once the part is in a safe place, the unburdening can begin.	Некоторые изгнанные части могут застрять или застыть в сцене прошлой травмы. Часть вновь переживает свои ранения, не в силах избавиться от вечной боли. Если это так, необходимо восстановление. Опять же, этот шаг необходим не каждому изгнаннику. Возвращение предлагает части возможность покинуть место травмы и перебраться в безопасное место. Части часто предпочитают прийти в настоящее вместе с «Я». Они также могут выбрать место, которое в прошлом было безопасным, например, дом бабушки и дедушки. Они также могут пойти в воображаемое место или интересное место, например, в парк развлечений или на пляж. Это полностью выбор детали. Селф может сопроводить деталь в любое место по своему выбору. Чтобы начать поиск, Я просто должен спросить часть: «Готовы ли вы покинуть это время и место, чтобы прийти со мной в настоящее или в любое другое безопасное место, воображаемое или реальное?» Если часть не хочет уходить из прошлого, спросите, почему она не хочет уходить. Иногда требуется больше свидетельствования. Часть, возможно, не захочет уходить, пока не расскажет больше о своей истории. Или что-то еще, возможно, должно произойти в прошлом. Он может быть обеспокоен тем, кого он оставляет позади, например, младшими братьями и сестрами, на которых также повлияла травма. Если это правда, предложите этой части привести с собой своих братьев и сестер. Как только деталь окажется в безопасном месте, можно начинать разгрузку.	Some exiled parts may be stuck or frozen in a past trauma scene. The part reexperiences their wounding, unable to extricate themselves from perpetual pain. When this is true, retrieval is necessary. Again, this is a step not necessary for every exile. Retrieval is offering the part a choice to leave the trauma scene for a safe place. Parts often choose to come to the present with Self. They may also choose to go to a place that was safe in the past, such as a grandparent’s home. They can also go to an imaginary place or fun location like an amusement park or beach. It is completely the part’s choice. Self can escort the part to any place of its choosing. To begin the retrieval, Self simply needs to ask the part, “Are you ready to leave that time and place to come to the present with me or to any other safe place, imaginary or real?” If the part does not want to leave the past, inquire why it doesn’t want to leave. Sometimes more witnessing is required. The part may not want to leave until it tells more of its story. Or something more may need to happen in the past. It may be concerned about who it is leaving behind, such as younger siblings who were also impacted by the trauma experience. If this is true, invite the part to bring their siblings with them. Once the part is in a safe place, the unburdening can begin.
Retrieval was not necessary with my nine-year-old exile. She did not feel frozen in the past; she had the ability to leave on her own. When she sat next to me while building trust, she was no longer in the past and felt safe with me in the present.	Retrieval was not necessary with my nine-year-old exile. She did not feel frozen in the past; she had the ability to leave on her own. When she sat next to me while building trust, she was no longer in the past and felt safe with me in the present.	Моему девятилетнему изгнаннику в возвращении не было необходимости. Она не чувствовала себя застывшей в прошлом; у нее была возможность уйти самостоятельно. Когда она сидела рядом со мной, укрепляя доверие, она больше не была в прошлом и чувствовала себя в безопасности со мной в настоящем.	Retrieval was not necessary with my nine-year-old exile. She did not feel frozen in the past; she had the ability to leave on her own. When she sat next to me while building trust, she was no longer in the past and felt safe with me in the present.
IFS CONCEPT 5: UNBURDENING	IFS CONCEPT 5: UNBURDENING	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 5: СНИЖЕНИЕ бремени	IFS CONCEPT 5: UNBURDENING
Unburdening is the process by which the exile releases their burdens. This step is crucial to the healing of the exile. Burdens include extreme beliefs like “I am worthless” or “I am unlovable”; extreme bodily sensations such as reexperiencing the effects of neglect or abuse; and intense feelings and emotions such as shame. Because burdens are often held in the body, this is where we begin with the unburdening process. Self asks the part where it notices the burden in or around its body. Once the part connects with where the burden is, Self asks the part if it is ready to release the burden. Parts are usually eager to let go of their burdens. However, sometimes they are reluctant. In this case, the part may need additional time in witnessing, or Self can explore the fears the part has about releasing the burden. If the exile is ready to release their burdens, the Self can offer the release of the burdens to one of the elements: fire, water, air, earth, or any other way the part would like to release the burdens. It is important for the part to release the burden from where it’s located in the body. Self supports the part in releasing the burden by helping it set up the release to the elements or simply by being present during the unburdening. The burdens can be released together at one time or individually. It’s crucial to check with the exile to see if there’s more to unburden after each burden is released. Similar to witnessing, it is the part that determines when the unburdening is complete.	Unburdening is the process by which the exile releases their burdens. This step is crucial to the healing of the exile. Burdens include extreme beliefs like “I am worthless” or “I am unlovable”; extreme bodily sensations such as reexperiencing the effects of neglect or abuse; and intense feelings and emotions such as shame. Because burdens are often held in the body, this is where we begin with the unburdening process. Self asks the part where it notices the burden in or around its body. Once the part connects with where the burden is, Self asks the part if it is ready to release the burden. Parts are usually eager to let go of their burdens. However, sometimes they are reluctant. In this case, the part may need additional time in witnessing, or Self can explore the fears the part has about releasing the burden. If the exile is ready to release their burdens, the Self can offer the release of the burdens to one of the elements: fire, water, air, earth, or any other way the part would like to release the burdens. It is important for the part to release the burden from where it’s located in the body. Self supports the part in releasing the burden by helping it set up the release to the elements or simply by being present during the unburdening. The burdens can be released together at one time or individually. It’s crucial to check with the exile to see if there’s more to unburden after each burden is released. Similar to witnessing, it is the part that determines when the unburdening is complete.	Освобождение – это процесс, посредством которого изгнанники освобождаются от своего бремени. Этот шаг имеет решающее значение для исцеления изгнанника. Бремя включает в себя крайние убеждения, такие как «Я никчемный» или «Я непривлекательный»; сильные телесные ощущения, такие как повторное переживание последствий пренебрежения или жестокого обращения; и сильные чувства и эмоции, такие как стыд. Поскольку бремя часто удерживается в теле, именно здесь мы начинаем процесс разгрузки. «Я» спрашивает ту часть, где оно замечает бремя внутри или вокруг своего тела. Как только часть соединяется с местом, где находится бремя, «Я» спрашивает часть, готова ли она освободиться от бремени. Части обычно стремятся освободиться от своего бремени. Однако иногда они сопротивляются. В этом случае части может потребоваться дополнительное время для свидетельствования, или «Я» может исследовать страхи части по поводу освобождения от бремени. Если изгнанник готов освободиться от своего бремени, Высшее Я может предложить освобождение от бремени одному из элементов: огню, воде, воздуху, земле или любому другому способу, которым часть желает освободить бремя. Для этой части важно снять нагрузку с того места, где она находится в теле. «Я» поддерживает часть процесса освобождения от бремени, помогая ему освободить элементы или просто присутствуя во время освобождения от бремени. Бремя может быть снято одновременно или по отдельности. Крайне важно посоветоваться с изгнанником, чтобы узнать, есть ли еще что-нибудь, что можно облегчить после того, как каждое бремя будет снято. Подобно свидетельствованию, это та часть, которая определяет, когда освобождение от бремени будет завершено.	Unburdening is the process by which the exile releases their burdens. This step is crucial to the healing of the exile. Burdens include extreme beliefs like “I am worthless” or “I am unlovable”; extreme bodily sensations such as reexperiencing the effects of neglect or abuse; and intense feelings and emotions such as shame. Because burdens are often held in the body, this is where we begin with the unburdening process. Self asks the part where it notices the burden in or around its body. Once the part connects with where the burden is, Self asks the part if it is ready to release the burden. Parts are usually eager to let go of their burdens. However, sometimes they are reluctant. In this case, the part may need additional time in witnessing, or Self can explore the fears the part has about releasing the burden. If the exile is ready to release their burdens, the Self can offer the release of the burdens to one of the elements: fire, water, air, earth, or any other way the part would like to release the burdens. It is important for the part to release the burden from where it’s located in the body. Self supports the part in releasing the burden by helping it set up the release to the elements or simply by being present during the unburdening. The burdens can be released together at one time or individually. It’s crucial to check with the exile to see if there’s more to unburden after each burden is released. Similar to witnessing, it is the part that determines when the unburdening is complete.
When my nine-year-old exile expressed enthusiasm about the prospect of releasing her burdens, I asked her, “What are the burdens you’re ready to let go of?” She didn’t answer in words; instead, I had a felt sense of her desire to release feelings of unworthiness, aloneness, and abandonment, the belief that she was unlovable because if she was lovable people would have told her the truth, difficulty managing her emotions, chest pains of a broken heart, and disconnection from her intuition. Next, I asked her where she noticed these burdens in or around her body. In response, I felt heat in my solar plexus. I then inquired about how she would like to release her burdens by saying, “You can release them to fire, air, water, earth, or any other way you would like to release them.” She said she wanted to release them to water at the beach and watch them float away. Next, we were at the water’s edge on a beach, and I asked her to remove the burdens from her solar plexus and release them to the water. As she did this, I encouraged her to make sure she got it all. It took several minutes for her to empty the many burdens into the surf. We watched the waves take the burdens out toward the horizon until they disappeared.	When my nine-year-old exile expressed enthusiasm about the prospect of releasing her burdens, I asked her, “What are the burdens you’re ready to let go of?” She didn’t answer in words; instead, I had a felt sense of her desire to release feelings of unworthiness, aloneness, and abandonment, the belief that she was unlovable because if she was lovable people would have told her the truth, difficulty managing her emotions, chest pains of a broken heart, and disconnection from her intuition. Next, I asked her where she noticed these burdens in or around her body. In response, I felt heat in my solar plexus. I then inquired about how she would like to release her burdens by saying, “You can release them to fire, air, water, earth, or any other way you would like to release them.” She said she wanted to release them to water at the beach and watch them float away. Next, we were at the water’s edge on a beach, and I asked her to remove the burdens from her solar plexus and release them to the water. As she did this, I encouraged her to make sure she got it all. It took several minutes for her to empty the many burdens into the surf. We watched the waves take the burdens out toward the horizon until they disappeared.	Когда моя девятилетняя изгнанница выразила энтузиазм по поводу перспективы освободиться от своего бремени, я спросил ее: «Какое бремя вы готовы отпустить?» Она не ответила словами; вместо этого я почувствовал ее желание освободиться от чувства никчемности, одиночества и покинутости, веру в то, что она непривлекательна, потому что, если бы она была милой, люди сказали бы ей правду, трудности с управлением своими эмоциями, боли в груди от сломленного состояния. сердце и оторванность от интуиции. Затем я спросил ее, где она заметила эти обременения внутри или вокруг своего тела. В ответ я почувствовал жар в солнечном сплетении. Затем я спросил, как бы она хотела освободить свое бремя, сказав: «Вы можете отпустить его в огонь, воздух, воду, землю или любым другим способом, которым вы захотите освободить его». Она сказала, что хочет выпустить их в воду на пляже и посмотреть, как они уплывут. Далее мы были у кромки воды на пляже, и я попросил ее снять бремя с солнечного сплетения и спустить его в воду. Пока она это делала, я посоветовал ей убедиться, что она получила все это. Ей потребовалось несколько минут, чтобы выбросить множество бремен в прибой. Мы смотрели, как волны уносят бремя к горизонту, пока оно не исчезло.	When my nine-year-old exile expressed enthusiasm about the prospect of releasing her burdens, I asked her, “What are the burdens you’re ready to let go of?” She didn’t answer in words; instead, I had a felt sense of her desire to release feelings of unworthiness, aloneness, and abandonment, the belief that she was unlovable because if she was lovable people would have told her the truth, difficulty managing her emotions, chest pains of a broken heart, and disconnection from her intuition. Next, I asked her where she noticed these burdens in or around her body. In response, I felt heat in my solar plexus. I then inquired about how she would like to release her burdens by saying, “You can release them to fire, air, water, earth, or any other way you would like to release them.” She said she wanted to release them to water at the beach and watch them float away. Next, we were at the water’s edge on a beach, and I asked her to remove the burdens from her solar plexus and release them to the water. As she did this, I encouraged her to make sure she got it all. It took several minutes for her to empty the many burdens into the surf. We watched the waves take the burdens out toward the horizon until they disappeared.
IFS CONCEPT 6: INVITATION	IFS CONCEPT 6: INVITATION	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ 6 IFS: ПРИГЛАШЕНИЕ	IFS CONCEPT 6: INVITATION
When parts are burdened, they do not have access to their natural gifts. The invitation is a way to connect with their essential essence and positive qualities they need moving forward. The release of their burdens opens space for these qualities to exist within. Self encourages the newly unburdened part to invite in qualities it believes it will need in the future and to access their essential qualities that were obscured by the burdens they carried. It is quite common for parts to choose qualities of Self. Just as it was crucial that the part physically released the burdens from its body, it is equally important for the part to embody the qualities it selects. The part can use the elements—fire, air, water, and earth—or any other ritual to assist with embodiment of the qualities. Self is present with the part to offer support.	When parts are burdened, they do not have access to their natural gifts. The invitation is a way to connect with their essential essence and positive qualities they need moving forward. The release of their burdens opens space for these qualities to exist within. Self encourages the newly unburdened part to invite in qualities it believes it will need in the future and to access their essential qualities that were obscured by the burdens they carried. It is quite common for parts to choose qualities of Self. Just as it was crucial that the part physically released the burdens from its body, it is equally important for the part to embody the qualities it selects. The part can use the elements—fire, air, water, and earth—or any other ritual to assist with embodiment of the qualities. Self is present with the part to offer support.	Когда части обременены, они не имеют доступа к своим природным дарам. Приглашение — это способ проникнуться их основной сущностью и положительными качествами, которые им необходимы для продвижения вперед. Освобождение от бремени открывает пространство для существования этих качеств внутри. «Я» побуждает вновь освободившуюся часть проявить качества, которые, по ее мнению, потребуются ей в будущем, и получить доступ к их основным качествам, которые были затемнены бременем, которое они несли. Части часто выбирают качества Самости. Точно так же, как было крайне важно, чтобы часть физически освободила свое тело от бремени, не менее важно, чтобы часть воплощала те качества, которые она выбирает. Часть может использовать элементы — огонь, воздух, воду и землю — или любой другой ритуал, чтобы помочь воплотить качества. «Я» присутствует со своей частью, предлагающей поддержку.	When parts are burdened, they do not have access to their natural gifts. The invitation is a way to connect with their essential essence and positive qualities they need moving forward. The release of their burdens opens space for these qualities to exist within. Self encourages the newly unburdened part to invite in qualities it believes it will need in the future and to access their essential qualities that were obscured by the burdens they carried. It is quite common for parts to choose qualities of Self. Just as it was crucial that the part physically released the burdens from its body, it is equally important for the part to embody the qualities it selects. The part can use the elements—fire, air, water, and earth—or any other ritual to assist with embodiment of the qualities. Self is present with the part to offer support.
When Self asked my nine-year-old part what essential qualities she wanted to embody, she asserted, “Intuition!” She went on to explain that the experience of being lied to by the adults she trusted severed her connection with her sense of knowing. When asked if there were any other qualities she wished to embody, she tearfully answered, “My intuition was my greatest gift, and not trusting it was my greatest loss. If I can get it back, I will be whole. It is all I need.” When asked how she would like to embody intuition, she took a deep inhale and said, “With my breath,” and proceeded to breathe deeply. With each breath, intuition came into my body as well as hers and coursed through our bloodstreams, infusing every inch of our bodies with its energy, with most of it accumulating in our hearts. Self asked my younger self to check her body and see what she noticed. She said, “I feel calm and connected.”	When Self asked my nine-year-old part what essential qualities she wanted to embody, she asserted, “Intuition!” She went on to explain that the experience of being lied to by the adults she trusted severed her connection with her sense of knowing. When asked if there were any other qualities she wished to embody, she tearfully answered, “My intuition was my greatest gift, and not trusting it was my greatest loss. If I can get it back, I will be whole. It is all I need.” When asked how she would like to embody intuition, she took a deep inhale and said, “With my breath,” and proceeded to breathe deeply. With each breath, intuition came into my body as well as hers and coursed through our bloodstreams, infusing every inch of our bodies with its energy, with most of it accumulating in our hearts. Self asked my younger self to check her body and see what she noticed. She said, “I feel calm and connected.”	Когда Селф спросила мою девятилетнюю часть, какие основные качества она хотела бы воплотить, она ответила: «Интуиция!» Далее она объяснила, что опыт лжи со стороны взрослых, которым она доверяла, разорвал ее связь с чувством знания. Когда ее спросили, есть ли еще какие-то качества, которые она хотела бы воплотить, она со слезами на глазах ответила: «Моя интуиция была моим величайшим даром, и не доверять ей было моей величайшей потерей. Если я смогу вернуть его, я буду цел. Это все, что мне нужно». Когда ее спросили, как бы она хотела воплотить интуицию, она сделала глубокий вдох и сказала: «С помощью дыхания», а затем продолжила глубоко дышать. С каждым вздохом интуиция проникала в мое и ее тело и текла по нашим кровотокам, наполняя каждый дюйм наших тел своей энергией, причем большая часть ее накапливалась в наших сердцах. Селф попросил себя в молодости проверить ее тело и посмотреть, что она заметила. Она сказала: «Я чувствую себя спокойной и связанной».	When Self asked my nine-year-old part what essential qualities she wanted to embody, she asserted, “Intuition!” She went on to explain that the experience of being lied to by the adults she trusted severed her connection with her sense of knowing. When asked if there were any other qualities she wished to embody, she tearfully answered, “My intuition was my greatest gift, and not trusting it was my greatest loss. If I can get it back, I will be whole. It is all I need.” When asked how she would like to embody intuition, she took a deep inhale and said, “With my breath,” and proceeded to breathe deeply. With each breath, intuition came into my body as well as hers and coursed through our bloodstreams, infusing every inch of our bodies with its energy, with most of it accumulating in our hearts. Self asked my younger self to check her body and see what she noticed. She said, “I feel calm and connected.”
Case Vignette: Retrieving an Exile	Case Vignette: Retrieving an Exile	Краткое описание дела: возвращение изгнанника	Case Vignette: Retrieving an Exile
The case vignette that follows highlights the retrieval step of the healing process. Again, this step is not always needed. However, when an exiled part is stuck in the past or in a trauma scene, it is used to get them to a place safe enough to continue the healing work.	The case vignette that follows highlights the retrieval step of the healing process. Again, this step is not always needed. However, when an exiled part is stuck in the past or in a trauma scene, it is used to get them to a place safe enough to continue the healing work.	В приведенном ниже описании случая подчеркивается этап восстановления процесса исцеления. Опять же, этот шаг не всегда необходим. Однако, когда изгнанная часть застревает в прошлом или в месте травмы, ее используют, чтобы доставить ее в достаточно безопасное место для продолжения исцеляющей работы.	The case vignette that follows highlights the retrieval step of the healing process. Again, this step is not always needed. However, when an exiled part is stuck in the past or in a trauma scene, it is used to get them to a place safe enough to continue the healing work.
May is Caucasian, in her early 50s, and came to therapy after her decades-long difficulties with sexual penetration were determined to have no physical origins. In her intake she disclosed that she and her younger sister were sexually trafficked by her mother’s boyfriend. As a teacher with summers off, he offered to babysit them to help her mother save on childcare costs. During the summers when May was eight and nine, he sold her and her sister to grown men for sex.	May is Caucasian, in her early 50s, and came to therapy after her decades-long difficulties with sexual penetration were determined to have no physical origins. In her intake she disclosed that she and her younger sister were sexually trafficked by her mother’s boyfriend. As a teacher with summers off, he offered to babysit them to help her mother save on childcare costs. During the summers when May was eight and nine, he sold her and her sister to grown men for sex.	Мэй — европейка, ей около 50 лет, и она пришла на терапию после того, как было установлено, что ее многолетние трудности с половым проникновением не имеют физического происхождения. В своем приеме она рассказала, что ее и ее младшую сестру стал жертвой сексуальной эксплуатации парень ее матери. Будучи учителем с летними каникулами, он предложил присмотреть за ними, чтобы помочь ее матери сэкономить на расходах по уходу за детьми. Летом, когда Мэй было восемь и девять лет, он продавал ее и ее сестру взрослым мужчинам для секса.	May is Caucasian, in her early 50s, and came to therapy after her decades-long difficulties with sexual penetration were determined to have no physical origins. In her intake she disclosed that she and her younger sister were sexually trafficked by her mother’s boyfriend. As a teacher with summers off, he offered to babysit them to help her mother save on childcare costs. During the summers when May was eight and nine, he sold her and her sister to grown men for sex.
In this session, May established a Self-to-part relationship with an exiled part she called Ragdoll, who seemed to trust May’s Self. I asked May to ask Ragdoll if there’s anything she wants May to know about her.	In this session, May established a Self-to-part relationship with an exiled part she called Ragdoll, who seemed to trust May’s Self. I asked May to ask Ragdoll if there’s anything she wants May to know about her.	На этом сеансе Мэй установила отношения «Я-разделение» с изгнанной частью, которую она называла Рэгдолл, которая, казалось, доверяла Самости Мэй. Я попросил Мэй спросить Рэгдолл, хочет ли она, чтобы Мэй знала о ней что-нибудь.	In this session, May established a Self-to-part relationship with an exiled part she called Ragdoll, who seemed to trust May’s Self. I asked May to ask Ragdoll if there’s anything she wants May to know about her.
“Ragdoll, I’m here and you’re safe. What do you want to tell me about you?”	“Ragdoll, I’m here and you’re safe. What do you want to tell me about you?”	«Рэгдолл, я здесь, и ты в безопасности. Что ты хочешь мне рассказать о себе?»	“Ragdoll, I’m here and you’re safe. What do you want to tell me about you?”
May, in Ragdoll’s voice, says, “STOP, no, stop, don’t! They’re hurting me. I don’t want to. Nooooo!” May’s body trembles, and tears flow as she flails her arms at an unseen assailant.	May, in Ragdoll’s voice, says, “STOP, no, stop, don’t! They’re hurting me. I don’t want to. Nooooo!” May’s body trembles, and tears flow as she flails her arms at an unseen assailant.	Мэй голосом Рэгдолла говорит: «СТОП, нет, стоп, не надо! Они причиняют мне боль. Я не хочу. Неееееет!» Тело Мэй дрожит, и слезы текут, когда она размахивает руками в сторону невидимого нападавшего.	May, in Ragdoll’s voice, says, “STOP, no, stop, don’t! They’re hurting me. I don’t want to. Nooooo!” May’s body trembles, and tears flow as she flails her arms at an unseen assailant.
“May, are you there with Ragdoll?”	“May, are you there with Ragdoll?”	— Мэй, ты здесь с Рэгдоллом?	“May, are you there with Ragdoll?”
“Yes, I am. I’m letting her know I’m here.”	“Yes, I am. I’m letting her know I’m here.”	"Да, я. Я сообщаю ей, что я здесь.	“Yes, I am. I’m letting her know I’m here.”
“Does she know you’re there?”	“Does she know you’re there?”	— Она знает, что ты здесь?	“Does she know you’re there?”
May lets out a muffled scream as if her mouth is covered.	May lets out a muffled scream as if her mouth is covered.	Мэй издает приглушенный крик, как будто ее рот закрыт.	May lets out a muffled scream as if her mouth is covered.
“See if Ragdoll can pull herself away from you a bit,” I suggest, realizing Ragdoll is blending somewhat with May.	“See if Ragdoll can pull herself away from you a bit,” I suggest, realizing Ragdoll is blending somewhat with May.	«Посмотри, сможет ли Рэгдолл немного оторваться от тебя», — предлагаю я, понимая, что Рэгдолл в чем-то сливается с Мэй.	“See if Ragdoll can pull herself away from you a bit,” I suggest, realizing Ragdoll is blending somewhat with May.
“Ragdoll, I want to be with you. Can you give me a little space?”	“Ragdoll, I want to be with you. Can you give me a little space?”	«Рэгдолл, я хочу быть с тобой. Можешь дать мне немного места?»	“Ragdoll, I want to be with you. Can you give me a little space?”
Ragdoll responds by shaking her head, still fighting, and says, “Make them stop touching me.”	Ragdoll responds by shaking her head, still fighting, and says, “Make them stop touching me.”	Рэгдолл в ответ качает головой, все еще борясь, и говорит: «Заставь их перестать меня трогать».	Ragdoll responds by shaking her head, still fighting, and says, “Make them stop touching me.”
“May, ask Ragdoll if there’s someplace safe she wants to go. Let her know she can leave there,” I share with hopes of getting Ragdoll out of the trauma scene.	“May, ask Ragdoll if there’s someplace safe she wants to go. Let her know she can leave there,” I share with hopes of getting Ragdoll out of the trauma scene.	— Мэй, спроси Рэгдолл, есть ли какое-нибудь безопасное место, куда она хочет пойти. Дайте ей знать, что она может уйти оттуда», — делюсь я с надеждой вытащить Рэгдолла из места травмы.	“May, ask Ragdoll if there’s someplace safe she wants to go. Let her know she can leave there,” I share with hopes of getting Ragdoll out of the trauma scene.
“Ragdoll, you don’t have to be there,” May says. You can go someplace safe, anyplace. You can come here with me. Where would you like to go?”	“Ragdoll, you don’t have to be there,” May says. You can go someplace safe, anyplace. You can come here with me. Where would you like to go?”	«Рэгдолл, тебе не обязательно там быть», — говорит Мэй. Вы можете пойти в безопасное место, куда угодно. Ты можешь пойти сюда со мной. Куда бы ты хотел поехать?»	“Ragdoll, you don’t have to be there,” May says. You can go someplace safe, anyplace. You can come here with me. Where would you like to go?”
In a whisper, as if to keep others from hearing her, she says to May, “I want to be with you.”	In a whisper, as if to keep others from hearing her, she says to May, “I want to be with you.”	Шепотом, словно для того, чтобы другие не услышали ее, она говорит Мэй: «Я хочу быть с тобой».	In a whisper, as if to keep others from hearing her, she says to May, “I want to be with you.”
“Great,” I say. “May, can you help her to come be with you?”	“Great,” I say. “May, can you help her to come be with you?”	«Отлично», — говорю я. — Мэй, ты можешь помочь ей поехать с тобой?	“Great,” I say. “May, can you help her to come be with you?”
May is quiet being with Ragdoll internally, then says, “She says she wants to leave but can’t.”	May is quiet being with Ragdoll internally, then says, “She says she wants to leave but can’t.”	Мэй тихо общается с Рэгдоллом, а затем говорит: «Она говорит, что хочет уйти, но не может».	May is quiet being with Ragdoll internally, then says, “She says she wants to leave but can’t.”
“Are you curious why she doesn’t want to leave May?”	“Are you curious why she doesn’t want to leave May?”	«Тебе интересно, почему она не хочет покидать Мэй?»	“Are you curious why she doesn’t want to leave May?”
“Yes.”	“Yes.”	"Да."	“Yes.”
“Then ask her why she can’t leave.”	“Then ask her why she can’t leave.”	— Тогда спроси ее, почему она не может уйти.	“Then ask her why she can’t leave.”
May gets quiet again and quickly responds, “Her little sister is in the other room and she won’t leave without her.”	May gets quiet again and quickly responds, “Her little sister is in the other room and she won’t leave without her.”	Мэй снова замолкает и быстро отвечает: «Ее младшая сестра в другой комнате, и она не уйдет без нее».	May gets quiet again and quickly responds, “Her little sister is in the other room and she won’t leave without her.”
“Okay, May, that makes sense. You may have to go into the scene with Ragdoll to help get her sister. Check if she’s open to that.”	“Okay, May, that makes sense. You may have to go into the scene with Ragdoll to help get her sister. Check if she’s open to that.”	— Хорошо, Мэй, это имеет смысл. Возможно, вам придется пойти на сцену с Рэгдолл, чтобы помочь заполучить ее сестру. Проверьте, открыта ли она для этого.	“Okay, May, that makes sense. You may have to go into the scene with Ragdoll to help get her sister. Check if she’s open to that.”
“She is.” After a moment of silence, May says, “I’ve got Ragdoll and she’s taking me to her sister.” Tears are streaming down May’s face as she reports what’s happening. “I’ve got her sister now. They’re both safely with me, curled up in my lap. I’m letting them know they’re safe with me and never have to go back there.”	“She is.” After a moment of silence, May says, “I’ve got Ragdoll and she’s taking me to her sister.” Tears are streaming down May’s face as she reports what’s happening. “I’ve got her sister now. They’re both safely with me, curled up in my lap. I’m letting them know they’re safe with me and never have to go back there.”	"Она." После минуты молчания Мэй говорит: «У меня есть Рэгдолл, и она везет меня к своей сестре». Слёзы текут по лицу Мэй, когда она рассказывает о том, что происходит. «Теперь у меня есть ее сестра. Они оба в безопасности со мной, свернувшись калачиком у меня на коленях. Я даю им понять, что со мной они в безопасности и им никогда не придется туда возвращаться».	“She is.” After a moment of silence, May says, “I’ve got Ragdoll and she’s taking me to her sister.” Tears are streaming down May’s face as she reports what’s happening. “I’ve got her sister now. They’re both safely with me, curled up in my lap. I’m letting them know they’re safe with me and never have to go back there.”
“Good. Hold them like that for as long as they need it.”	“Good. Hold them like that for as long as they need it.”	"Хороший. Держите их так до тех пор, пока они в этом нуждаются.	“Good. Hold them like that for as long as they need it.”
After Ragdoll and her sister were retrieved, Ragdoll felt safe enough to share her experiences through witnessing. She was incapable of doing so while she was stuck in the scene of her trauma, actively experiencing the abuse. Just as in the external world, safety has to be addressed from the inside first.	After Ragdoll and her sister were retrieved, Ragdoll felt safe enough to share her experiences through witnessing. She was incapable of doing so while she was stuck in the scene of her trauma, actively experiencing the abuse. Just as in the external world, safety has to be addressed from the inside first.	После того, как Рэгдолл и ее сестра были найдены, Рэгдолл почувствовала себя в достаточной безопасности, чтобы поделиться своим опытом через свидетельство. Она была неспособна сделать это, пока застряла на месте травмы и активно переживала насилие. Как и во внешнем мире, безопасность должна решаться в первую очередь изнутри.	After Ragdoll and her sister were retrieved, Ragdoll felt safe enough to share her experiences through witnessing. She was incapable of doing so while she was stuck in the scene of her trauma, actively experiencing the abuse. Just as in the external world, safety has to be addressed from the inside first.
Meditation: Elemental Healing	Meditation: Elemental Healing	Медитация: исцеление стихиями	Meditation: Elemental Healing
The Elemental Healing meditation is the second given to me by my ancestors.	The Elemental Healing meditation is the second given to me by my ancestors.	Медитация «Исцеление стихий» — вторая, данная мне моими предками.	The Elemental Healing meditation is the second given to me by my ancestors.
This meditation allows you to meet an Ancestor Guide and, with their support, release a belief, behavior, thought, or feeling that no longer serves you.	This meditation allows you to meet an Ancestor Guide and, with their support, release a belief, behavior, thought, or feeling that no longer serves you.	Эта медитация позволяет вам встретиться с Предком-Наставником и с его поддержкой освободиться от убеждения, поведения, мысли или чувства, которые больше не служат вам.	This meditation allows you to meet an Ancestor Guide and, with their support, release a belief, behavior, thought, or feeling that no longer serves you.
Close your eyes or soften your gaze.	Close your eyes or soften your gaze.	Закройте глаза или смягчите взгляд.	Close your eyes or soften your gaze.
Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.	Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.	Перенесите свое осознание на свое дыхание и просто дышите.	Bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe.
As you go inside, notice how your breath travels through your body, nourishing every place it touches.	As you go inside, notice how your breath travels through your body, nourishing every place it touches.	Зайдя внутрь, обратите внимание, как ваше дыхание проходит через ваше тело, питая каждое место, которого оно касается.	As you go inside, notice how your breath travels through your body, nourishing every place it touches.
Envision yourself near a body of water at sunrise.	Envision yourself near a body of water at sunrise.	Представьте себя возле водоема на рассвете.	Envision yourself near a body of water at sunrise.
It could be a beach, river, lake, stream, or any other body of water.	It could be a beach, river, lake, stream, or any other body of water.	Это может быть пляж, река, озеро, ручей или любой другой водоем.	It could be a beach, river, lake, stream, or any other body of water.
Notice that the sun is just over the horizon, and you marvel at the colors dancing in the sky.	Notice that the sun is just over the horizon, and you marvel at the colors dancing in the sky.	Обратите внимание, что солнце находится прямо за горизонтом, и вы восхищаетесь цветами, танцующими в небе.	Notice that the sun is just over the horizon, and you marvel at the colors dancing in the sky.
You start walking the shore, and in the distance you see a robed figure walking toward you.	You start walking the shore, and in the distance you see a robed figure walking toward you.	Вы начинаете идти по берегу и вдалеке видите идущую к вам фигуру в мантии.	You start walking the shore, and in the distance you see a robed figure walking toward you.
A calmness embraces you as you get closer and see a serene smile on the other’s face.	A calmness embraces you as you get closer and see a serene smile on the other’s face.	Спокойствие охватывает вас, когда вы подходите ближе и видите безмятежную улыбку на лице другого.	A calmness embraces you as you get closer and see a serene smile on the other’s face.
You recognize them as a wise and benevolent Ancestor Guide.	You recognize them as a wise and benevolent Ancestor Guide.	Вы узнаете в них мудрого и доброжелательного Проводника Предков.	You recognize them as a wise and benevolent Ancestor Guide.
The Ancestor Guide says, “I’ve come to help you release something that no longer serves you.”	The Ancestor Guide says, “I’ve come to help you release something that no longer serves you.”	В «Руководстве предков» говорится: «Я пришел помочь вам освободить то, что больше вам не служит».	The Ancestor Guide says, “I’ve come to help you release something that no longer serves you.”
They go on to say, “I’d like you to consider a belief, behavior, feeling, or thought that has outgrown its usefulness.”	They go on to say, “I’d like you to consider a belief, behavior, feeling, or thought that has outgrown its usefulness.”	Далее они говорят: «Я бы хотел, чтобы вы рассмотрели убеждение, поведение, чувство или мысль, которые переросли свою полезность».	They go on to say, “I’d like you to consider a belief, behavior, feeling, or thought that has outgrown its usefulness.”
Once you identify what no longer serves you, notice where you find it in or around your body.	Once you identify what no longer serves you, notice where you find it in or around your body.	Как только вы определите, что вам больше не служит, обратите внимание, где вы находите это внутри или вокруг своего тела.	Once you identify what no longer serves you, notice where you find it in or around your body.
Place your attention on what you notice there.	Place your attention on what you notice there.	Сосредоточьте свое внимание на том, что вы там заметили.	Place your attention on what you notice there.
The Ancestor Guide tells you absent this belief, behavior, feeling, or thought you can be your true Self. All you have to do is release it.	The Ancestor Guide tells you absent this belief, behavior, feeling, or thought you can be your true Self. All you have to do is release it.	«Руководство предков» говорит вам, что при отсутствии этой веры, поведения, чувств или мыслей вы можете быть своим истинным «Я». Все, что вам нужно сделать, это выпустить его.	The Ancestor Guide tells you absent this belief, behavior, feeling, or thought you can be your true Self. All you have to do is release it.
The Ancestor Guide walks with you to the water’s edge and says, “You can release it to this body of water. The Ancestor Guide digs a hole in the earth and says, “You can bury it in the Earth’s belly.” A bonfire appears, and the Ancestor Guide says, “You can allow the fire to consume it.” The Ancestor Guide then waves their arms and says, “You can release it on the wind.” They turn to you and ask, “In which way would you like to be free of what no longer serves you?”	The Ancestor Guide walks with you to the water’s edge and says, “You can release it to this body of water. The Ancestor Guide digs a hole in the earth and says, “You can bury it in the Earth’s belly.” A bonfire appears, and the Ancestor Guide says, “You can allow the fire to consume it.” The Ancestor Guide then waves their arms and says, “You can release it on the wind.” They turn to you and ask, “In which way would you like to be free of what no longer serves you?”	Проводник предков идет с вами к кромке воды и говорит: «Вы можете выпустить его в этот водоем. Путеводитель по предкам роет яму в земле и говорит: «Вы можете закопать ее в чреве Земли». Появляется костер, и Путеводитель предков говорит: «Вы можете позволить огню поглотить его». Затем Проводник Предков машет руками и говорит: «Вы можете выпустить его по ветру». Они обращаются к вам и спрашивают: «Как бы вы хотели освободиться от того, что вам больше не служит?»	The Ancestor Guide walks with you to the water’s edge and says, “You can release it to this body of water. The Ancestor Guide digs a hole in the earth and says, “You can bury it in the Earth’s belly.” A bonfire appears, and the Ancestor Guide says, “You can allow the fire to consume it.” The Ancestor Guide then waves their arms and says, “You can release it on the wind.” They turn to you and ask, “In which way would you like to be free of what no longer serves you?”
If you are not able to release it, let the Ancestor Guide know what you are afraid would happen if you released it. It is okay to spend time getting to know the parts of you that are afraid with the support of your Ancestor Guide.	If you are not able to release it, let the Ancestor Guide know what you are afraid would happen if you released it. It is okay to spend time getting to know the parts of you that are afraid with the support of your Ancestor Guide.	Если вы не можете его выпустить, сообщите «Руководству предков», чего вы опасаетесь, если вы его выпустите. Это нормально — потратить время на то, чтобы узнать те части себя, которые боятся, при поддержке вашего Наставника-предка.	If you are not able to release it, let the Ancestor Guide know what you are afraid would happen if you released it. It is okay to spend time getting to know the parts of you that are afraid with the support of your Ancestor Guide.
If you are ready to release it, the Ancestor Guide helps you in the way of your choosing.	If you are ready to release it, the Ancestor Guide helps you in the way of your choosing.	Если вы готовы выпустить его, «Руководство по предкам» поможет вам выбранным вами способом.	If you are ready to release it, the Ancestor Guide helps you in the way of your choosing.
After the release, take time to share with your Ancestor Guide what it feels like to release what is no longer useful.	After the release, take time to share with your Ancestor Guide what it feels like to release what is no longer useful.	После выпуска найдите время, чтобы рассказать своему Путеводителю по предкам, каково это — выпускать то, что больше не является полезным.	After the release, take time to share with your Ancestor Guide what it feels like to release what is no longer useful.
Take another minute to finish with your Ancestor Guide, knowing you can connect again whenever you like.	Take another minute to finish with your Ancestor Guide, knowing you can connect again whenever you like.	Потратьте еще минуту, чтобы закончить работу со своим Путеводителем по предкам, зная, что вы сможете снова подключиться, когда захотите.	Take another minute to finish with your Ancestor Guide, knowing you can connect again whenever you like.
When it feels right, bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe as you re-enter this moment and space.	When it feels right, bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe as you re-enter this moment and space.	Когда вы почувствуете, что это правильно, сосредоточьте свое внимание на дыхании и просто дышите, возвращаясь в этот момент и пространство.	When it feels right, bring your awareness to your breath and just breathe as you re-enter this moment and space.
Slowly open your eyes when you are ready.	Slowly open your eyes when you are ready.	Медленно откройте глаза, когда будете готовы.	Slowly open your eyes when you are ready.

Journal what you would like to capture from this meditation, like a revelation, reflection, or anything significant you want to remember from this experience. Exercise 2: Elemental Healing Journal Questions	Exercise 2: Elemental Healing Journal Questions	Упражнение 2: Вопросы для журнала «Элементальное исцеление»	Exercise 2: Elemental Healing Journal Questions
After you’ve done the Elemental Healing meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.	After you’ve done the Elemental Healing meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.	После того, как вы выполнили медитацию «Элементальное исцеление» и написали свой быстрый журнал, потратьте некоторое время на более глубокое изучение, ответив на следующие подсказки журнала.	After you’ve done the Elemental Healing meditation and written your quick Journal Capture, take some time to explore more deeply by responding to the following journal prompts.
What did you identify that no longer serves you?	What did you identify that no longer serves you?	Что вы определили из того, что вам больше не служит?	What did you identify that no longer serves you?
What are the reasons it no longer serves you?	What are the reasons it no longer serves you?	По каким причинам он больше не служит вам?	What are the reasons it no longer serves you?
Were you able to release it?	Were you able to release it?	Удалось ли вам его выпустить?	Were you able to release it?
How might your life and relationships be impacted by this release?	How might your life and relationships be impacted by this release?	Как этот выпуск может повлиять на вашу жизнь и отношения?	How might your life and relationships be impacted by this release?
If you were not able to release it, why not?	If you were not able to release it, why not?	Если вы не смогли его выпустить, почему бы и нет?	If you were not able to release it, why not?
What were the fears you discovered?	What were the fears you discovered?	Какие страхи вы обнаружили?	What were the fears you discovered?
How might you address the fears?	How might you address the fears?	Как вы можете справиться со своими страхами?	How might you address the fears?
When you spent time with your Ancestor Guide, what did you learn?	When you spent time with your Ancestor Guide, what did you learn?	Чему вы научились, проводя время со своим Проводником-предком?	When you spent time with your Ancestor Guide, what did you learn?
CHAPTER 11	CHAPTER 11	ГЛАВА 11	CHAPTER 11
Cabin with the Ancestor	Cabin with the Ancestor	Хижина с Предком	Cabin with the Ancestor
Healing Family and Cultural Legacy Burdens	Healing Family and Cultural Legacy Burdens	Исцеление бремени семейного и культурного наследия	Healing Family and Cultural Legacy Burdens
Playa del Rey Elementary School, fifth grade, Mr. Dempsey’s class. I sit motionless as he places the graded science test face down on my desk. I’m too scared to turn it over and look at my score. I rationalize that I did my best. I studied hard. I reviewed my flashcards daily, even up to moments before taking the exam. I re-read the chapters covered and even did some of the experiments at home. But even with all the preparation, I had a sinking feeling that the grade at the top of this test would not be my customary A. It was important to me to get an A, and if it was a 100% A, that was better. A perfect score was my aim in school and everything else I did. I slowly turned the paper over to discover a large, red C.	Playa del Rey Elementary School, fifth grade, Mr. Dempsey’s class. I sit motionless as he places the graded science test face down on my desk. I’m too scared to turn it over and look at my score. I rationalize that I did my best. I studied hard. I reviewed my flashcards daily, even up to moments before taking the exam. I re-read the chapters covered and even did some of the experiments at home. But even with all the preparation, I had a sinking feeling that the grade at the top of this test would not be my customary A. It was important to me to get an A, and if it was a 100% A, that was better. A perfect score was my aim in school and everything else I did. I slowly turned the paper over to discover a large, red C.	Начальная школа Плайя-дель-Рей, пятый класс, класс мистера Демпси. Я сижу неподвижно, пока он кладет тест по естествознанию лицевой стороной вниз на мой стол. Я слишком напуган, чтобы перевернуть его и посмотреть на свой результат. Я объясняю это тем, что сделал все, что мог. Я усердно учился. Я просматривал свои карточки ежедневно, даже за несколько мгновений до сдачи экзамена. Я перечитал пройденные главы и даже провел некоторые эксперименты дома. Но даже несмотря на всю подготовку, у меня было неприятное ощущение, что оценка на вершине этого теста не будет моей обычной пятеркой. Для меня было важно получить пятерку, и если бы это была 100% пятерка, это было бы лучше. . Высшая оценка была моей целью в школе и во всем остальном, что я делал. Я медленно перевернул листок и обнаружил большую красную букву «С».	Playa del Rey Elementary School, fifth grade, Mr. Dempsey’s class. I sit motionless as he places the graded science test face down on my desk. I’m too scared to turn it over and look at my score. I rationalize that I did my best. I studied hard. I reviewed my flashcards daily, even up to moments before taking the exam. I re-read the chapters covered and even did some of the experiments at home. But even with all the preparation, I had a sinking feeling that the grade at the top of this test would not be my customary A. It was important to me to get an A, and if it was a 100% A, that was better. A perfect score was my aim in school and everything else I did. I slowly turned the paper over to discover a large, red C.
Fear gripped me as I studied the curve of the first C of my young academic career. Frozen, I thought, “How can I go home with such a disappointing grade?” I even considered how I could change the C to a B. Staring at the arch of the C, I quickly realized I could not alter it to a believable B. C is for crushed, how I felt being less than perfect.	Fear gripped me as I studied the curve of the first C of my young academic career. Frozen, I thought, “How can I go home with such a disappointing grade?” I even considered how I could change the C to a B. Staring at the arch of the C, I quickly realized I could not alter it to a believable B. C is for crushed, how I felt being less than perfect.	Страх охватил меня, когда я изучал кривую первой тройки моей молодой академической карьеры. Застыв, я подумал: «Как я могу пойти домой с такой неутешительной оценкой?» Я даже обдумывал, как можно изменить букву C на букву B. Глядя на дугу буквы C, я быстро понял, что не смогу изменить ее на правдоподобную букву B. C означает «раздавленный», и я чувствовал себя несовершенным.	Fear gripped me as I studied the curve of the first C of my young academic career. Frozen, I thought, “How can I go home with such a disappointing grade?” I even considered how I could change the C to a B. Staring at the arch of the C, I quickly realized I could not alter it to a believable B. C is for crushed, how I felt being less than perfect.
I grew up with a father who sought perfection at all costs. It was much more important to him how things looked than how they were. He modeled external perfection through his speech, dress, mannerisms, and his strong expression of right and wrong. We had to live in the right neighborhood, go to the right schools, join the right clubs. My siblings and I had to speak articulately, dress impeccably, possess manners beyond reproach, and demonstrate high intellect. But I was a tomboy who didn’t like bows and dresses, at times chewed with my mouth open, and said “ain’t” often. However, I was smart, and although my dad corrected and criticized me for the behaviors that were less than perfect, he praised me for my intellect. I worked hard to fit into his vision of me. I wanted to meet his expectations. I came to equate my dad’s love with the need to be perfect. Scared to present my science test to him, I walked the mile from school to home in record slow time.	I grew up with a father who sought perfection at all costs. It was much more important to him how things looked than how they were. He modeled external perfection through his speech, dress, mannerisms, and his strong expression of right and wrong. We had to live in the right neighborhood, go to the right schools, join the right clubs. My siblings and I had to speak articulately, dress impeccably, possess manners beyond reproach, and demonstrate high intellect. But I was a tomboy who didn’t like bows and dresses, at times chewed with my mouth open, and said “ain’t” often. However, I was smart, and although my dad corrected and criticized me for the behaviors that were less than perfect, he praised me for my intellect. I worked hard to fit into his vision of me. I wanted to meet his expectations. I came to equate my dad’s love with the need to be perfect. Scared to present my science test to him, I walked the mile from school to home in record slow time.	Я вырос с отцом, который стремился к совершенству любой ценой. Для него было гораздо важнее, как все выглядит, чем то, как оно есть. Он моделировал внешнее совершенство через свою речь, одежду, манеры и яркое выражение добра и зла. Нам нужно было жить в правильном районе, ходить в правильные школы, вступать в правильные клубы. Я и мои братья и сестры должны были красноречиво говорить, безупречно одеваться, обладать безупречными манерами и демонстрировать высокий интеллект. Но я был сорванцом, который не любил бантики и платья, временами жевал с открытым ртом и часто говорил «нет». Однако я был умным, и хотя мой отец поправлял и критиковал меня за несовершенное поведение, он хвалил меня за мой интеллект. Я много работал, чтобы соответствовать его видению меня. Я хотел оправдать его ожидания. Я стал приравнивать любовь отца к необходимости быть совершенным. Боясь представить ему свой тест по естествознанию, я прошел милю от школы до дома за рекордно медленное время.	I grew up with a father who sought perfection at all costs. It was much more important to him how things looked than how they were. He modeled external perfection through his speech, dress, mannerisms, and his strong expression of right and wrong. We had to live in the right neighborhood, go to the right schools, join the right clubs. My siblings and I had to speak articulately, dress impeccably, possess manners beyond reproach, and demonstrate high intellect. But I was a tomboy who didn’t like bows and dresses, at times chewed with my mouth open, and said “ain’t” often. However, I was smart, and although my dad corrected and criticized me for the behaviors that were less than perfect, he praised me for my intellect. I worked hard to fit into his vision of me. I wanted to meet his expectations. I came to equate my dad’s love with the need to be perfect. Scared to present my science test to him, I walked the mile from school to home in record slow time.
When I arrived, I found my dad in the living room waiting. He jokingly asked, “Let me see that A.” I cringed at the thought of showing him my test. I stammered in a low voice, “I-I-I didn’t get an A.” Disappointed, he replied, “Getting a B isn’t bad. Let me see it.” I was rooted in place as tears traced my face. When I was able to uproot myself, I slowly moved toward the couch where he sat and handed him the test. I could feel my insides shaking as I nervously waited for his response. The disdain on his face is forever imprinted in my memory, as well as the sting of his words: “I don’t have any average children.” In six words, my dad disowned me. I shut down in the shame that he no longer wanted me. I disconnected from the conversation, and only certain words penetrated my consciousness. I heard “unacceptable, unbelievable, disappointed.” Next, he pointed firmly to the stairs, demanding that I go to my room.	When I arrived, I found my dad in the living room waiting. He jokingly asked, “Let me see that A.” I cringed at the thought of showing him my test. I stammered in a low voice, “I-I-I didn’t get an A.” Disappointed, he replied, “Getting a B isn’t bad. Let me see it.” I was rooted in place as tears traced my face. When I was able to uproot myself, I slowly moved toward the couch where he sat and handed him the test. I could feel my insides shaking as I nervously waited for his response. The disdain on his face is forever imprinted in my memory, as well as the sting of his words: “I don’t have any average children.” In six words, my dad disowned me. I shut down in the shame that he no longer wanted me. I disconnected from the conversation, and only certain words penetrated my consciousness. I heard “unacceptable, unbelievable, disappointed.” Next, he pointed firmly to the stairs, demanding that I go to my room.	Когда я приехал, я обнаружил, что мой отец ждет меня в гостиной. Он в шутку спросил: «Дай мне посмотреть, что А». Я съежился при мысли о том, чтобы показать ему свой тест. Я пробормотал тихим голосом: «Я-я-я не получил пятёрку». Разочарованный, он ответил: «Получить четверку неплохо. Дай мне посмотреть. Я застыл на месте, а слезы текли по моему лицу. Когда мне удалось вырваться с корнем, я медленно подошел к дивану, на котором он сидел, и вручил ему тест. Я чувствовала, как мои внутренности трясутся, нервно ожидая его ответа. Презрение на его лице навсегда запечатлелось в моей памяти, как и острота его слов: «У меня нет обычных детей». В шести словах мой отец отрекся от меня. Я замолчала от стыда, что он больше не хотел меня. Я отключился от разговора, и лишь отдельные слова проникли в мое сознание. Я услышал «неприемлемо, невероятно, разочаровано». Затем он твердо указал на лестницу, требуя, чтобы я пошла в свою комнату.	When I arrived, I found my dad in the living room waiting. He jokingly asked, “Let me see that A.” I cringed at the thought of showing him my test. I stammered in a low voice, “I-I-I didn’t get an A.” Disappointed, he replied, “Getting a B isn’t bad. Let me see it.” I was rooted in place as tears traced my face. When I was able to uproot myself, I slowly moved toward the couch where he sat and handed him the test. I could feel my insides shaking as I nervously waited for his response. The disdain on his face is forever imprinted in my memory, as well as the sting of his words: “I don’t have any average children.” In six words, my dad disowned me. I shut down in the shame that he no longer wanted me. I disconnected from the conversation, and only certain words penetrated my consciousness. I heard “unacceptable, unbelievable, disappointed.” Next, he pointed firmly to the stairs, demanding that I go to my room.
I bawled on my bed inconsolably. When there were no more tears to cry, I started thinking of ways to prove to my dad that I was perfect and deserving. I imagined getting a perfect score on every test I would ever take. I promised myself that I would practice saying “isn’t” instead of “ain’t.” I would walk with perfect posture. I would be the model of perfection. The little girl my father could never disown again.	I bawled on my bed inconsolably. When there were no more tears to cry, I started thinking of ways to prove to my dad that I was perfect and deserving. I imagined getting a perfect score on every test I would ever take. I promised myself that I would practice saying “isn’t” instead of “ain’t.” I would walk with perfect posture. I would be the model of perfection. The little girl my father could never disown again.	Я безутешно рыдала на кровати. Когда слез больше не было, я начал думать о том, как доказать отцу, что я идеален и достоин. Я представлял себе, что получу высший балл на каждом тесте, который когда-либо сдавал. Я пообещал себе, что буду практиковаться говорить «нет» вместо «нет». Я ходил с идеальной осанкой. Я был бы образцом совершенства. Маленькая девочка, от которой мой отец больше никогда не сможет отречься.	I bawled on my bed inconsolably. When there were no more tears to cry, I started thinking of ways to prove to my dad that I was perfect and deserving. I imagined getting a perfect score on every test I would ever take. I promised myself that I would practice saying “isn’t” instead of “ain’t.” I would walk with perfect posture. I would be the model of perfection. The little girl my father could never disown again.
My plans of excellence were interrupted by light knocking on my door. I heard my mom say, “Tamala, can I come in?” as she slowly opened the door. My mom told me that she had spoken with my dad about my science test. When I heard this, I started to sob again. She held me and asked, “Did you do your best?” I answered that I did. She held my face and looked directly into my eyes and said, “Tamala, your best is always good enough. You can’t do better than your best, and sometimes your best is going to be a C, and that’s okay.” It felt good to hear this. But I was split; part of me felt redeemed, while another part could not let go of the need to pursue perfection.	My plans of excellence were interrupted by light knocking on my door. I heard my mom say, “Tamala, can I come in?” as she slowly opened the door. My mom told me that she had spoken with my dad about my science test. When I heard this, I started to sob again. She held me and asked, “Did you do your best?” I answered that I did. She held my face and looked directly into my eyes and said, “Tamala, your best is always good enough. You can’t do better than your best, and sometimes your best is going to be a C, and that’s okay.” It felt good to hear this. But I was split; part of me felt redeemed, while another part could not let go of the need to pursue perfection.	Мои планы совершенства были прерваны легким стуком в дверь. Я услышала, как мама сказала: «Тамала, можно мне войти?» когда она медленно открыла дверь. Моя мама сказала мне, что она говорила с моим отцом о моем тесте по естествознанию. Когда я услышал это, я снова начал рыдать. Она обняла меня и спросила: «Ты сделал все, что мог?» Я ответил, что да. Она взяла мое лицо, посмотрела прямо мне в глаза и сказала: «Тамала, твои лучшие качества всегда достаточно хороши. Вы не можете добиться большего, чем можете, а иногда ваш лучший результат будет на троечку, и это нормально». Было приятно это слышать. Но я был разделен; часть меня чувствовала себя искупленной, в то время как другая часть не могла избавиться от необходимости стремиться к совершенству.	My plans of excellence were interrupted by light knocking on my door. I heard my mom say, “Tamala, can I come in?” as she slowly opened the door. My mom told me that she had spoken with my dad about my science test. When I heard this, I started to sob again. She held me and asked, “Did you do your best?” I answered that I did. She held my face and looked directly into my eyes and said, “Tamala, your best is always good enough. You can’t do better than your best, and sometimes your best is going to be a C, and that’s okay.” It felt good to hear this. But I was split; part of me felt redeemed, while another part could not let go of the need to pursue perfection.
IFS CONCEPT 1: PERSONAL VS. LEGACY BURDENS	IFS CONCEPT 1: PERSONAL VS. LEGACY BURDENS	КОНЦЕПЦИЯ IFS 1: ЛИЧНОЕ VS. бремя наследия	IFS CONCEPT 1: PERSONAL VS. LEGACY BURDENS
As defined earlier, burdens are the extreme thoughts, beliefs, behaviors, emotions, and impulses parts take on because of trauma. Parts are not their burdens. The burden is how they have learned to cope with what happened to them. Parts are highly motivated to protect themselves, other parts, and the person from being hurt again. The pattern of protection becomes so entrenched that parts do not know any other way to operate within the system. A burden is a protective strategy that has outlived its usefulness.	As defined earlier, burdens are the extreme thoughts, beliefs, behaviors, emotions, and impulses parts take on because of trauma. Parts are not their burdens. The burden is how they have learned to cope with what happened to them. Parts are highly motivated to protect themselves, other parts, and the person from being hurt again. The pattern of protection becomes so entrenched that parts do not know any other way to operate within the system. A burden is a protective strategy that has outlived its usefulness.	Как было определено ранее, бремя — это крайние мысли, убеждения, поведение, эмоции и импульсы, которые части тела приобретают из-за травмы. Детали не являются их бременем. Бремя состоит в том, как они научились справляться с тем, что с ними произошло. Части очень мотивированы защищать себя, другие части и человека от повторных повреждений. Модель защиты становится настолько укоренившейся, что части не знают другого способа действовать внутри системы. Бремя — это защитная стратегия, изжившая свою полезность.	As defined earlier, burdens are the extreme thoughts, beliefs, behaviors, emotions, and impulses parts take on because of trauma. Parts are not their burdens. The burden is how they have learned to cope with what happened to them. Parts are highly motivated to protect themselves, other parts, and the person from being hurt again. The pattern of protection becomes so entrenched that parts do not know any other way to operate within the system. A burden is a protective strategy that has outlived its usefulness.
There are two types of burdens: personal and legacy. Personal burdens, as we discussed in Chapter 10, are burdens created through our direct lived experiences, while legacy burdens are defined as burdens inherited or passed down from the family, ethnic group, or culture. With legacy burdens the content of the original trauma is lost over time; however, the shame, lack of safety, and feelings of uncertainty, judgment, and being devalued are what’s passed down through the family lineage.1 Following are two case vignettes showing how the burden of anxiety can develop as a personal or legacy burden.	There are two types of burdens: personal and legacy. Personal burdens, as we discussed in Chapter 10, are burdens created through our direct lived experiences, while legacy burdens are defined as burdens inherited or passed down from the family, ethnic group, or culture. With legacy burdens the content of the original trauma is lost over time; however, the shame, lack of safety, and feelings of uncertainty, judgment, and being devalued are what’s passed down through the family lineage.1 Following are two case vignettes showing how the burden of anxiety can develop as a personal or legacy burden.	Существует два типа бремени: личное и наследственное. Личное бремя, как мы обсуждали в главе 10, — это бремя, созданное нашим непосредственным жизненным опытом, тогда как бремя наследия определяется как бремя, унаследованное или переданное от семьи, этнической группы или культуры. При бремени наследия содержание первоначальной травмы со временем теряется; однако стыд, отсутствие безопасности и чувство неуверенности, осуждения и обесценивания — это то, что передается по семейной линии.1 Ниже приведены два примера случаев, показывающих, как бремя тревоги может перерасти в личное или наследственное бремя.	There are two types of burdens: personal and legacy. Personal burdens, as we discussed in Chapter 10, are burdens created through our direct lived experiences, while legacy burdens are defined as burdens inherited or passed down from the family, ethnic group, or culture. With legacy burdens the content of the original trauma is lost over time; however, the shame, lack of safety, and feelings of uncertainty, judgment, and being devalued are what’s passed down through the family lineage.1 Following are two case vignettes showing how the burden of anxiety can develop as a personal or legacy burden.
Case Vignette 1:	Case Vignette 1:	Пример 1:	Case Vignette 1:
Anxiety as a Personal Burden	Anxiety as a Personal Burden	Тревога как личное бремя	Anxiety as a Personal Burden
Shyla’s family immigrated to the United States from India when she was four years old. Shyla was the oldest of three girls, with the youngest child having special medical needs that required a lot of her mother’s attention. Shyla’s father worked full-time as a university professor. She entered school not speaking English, which caused her a great deal of anxiety. For the first year of kindergarten, she rarely knew what was happening in her classroom. Her anxiety increased with the teasing she received from other children because she looked, dressed, and spoke differently. Eventually, Shyla internalized the teasing and her lack of understanding English as her being stupid and not good enough. Her nervousness escalated to somatic symptoms of stomachaches, headaches, and lack of appetite. These ailments kept her home from school for days at a time. They also kept Shyla safe from uncomfortable situations and feelings of inadequacy.	Shyla’s family immigrated to the United States from India when she was four years old. Shyla was the oldest of three girls, with the youngest child having special medical needs that required a lot of her mother’s attention. Shyla’s father worked full-time as a university professor. She entered school not speaking English, which caused her a great deal of anxiety. For the first year of kindergarten, she rarely knew what was happening in her classroom. Her anxiety increased with the teasing she received from other children because she looked, dressed, and spoke differently. Eventually, Shyla internalized the teasing and her lack of understanding English as her being stupid and not good enough. Her nervousness escalated to somatic symptoms of stomachaches, headaches, and lack of appetite. These ailments kept her home from school for days at a time. They also kept Shyla safe from uncomfortable situations and feelings of inadequacy.	Семья Шайлы иммигрировала в США из Индии, когда ей было четыре года. Шайла была старшей из трех девочек, а у младшего ребенка были особые медицинские потребности, которые требовали много внимания ее матери. Отец Шайлы работал профессором университета полный рабочий день. Она пошла в школу, не говоря по-английски, что вызывало у нее сильное беспокойство. В первый год детского сада она редко знала, что происходит в ее классе. Ее беспокойство усилилось из-за насмешек со стороны других детей, потому что она выглядела, одевалась и говорила по-другому. В конце концов, Шайла осознала, что поддразнивания и ее непонимание английского языка она глупая и недостаточно хорошая. Ее нервозность переросла в соматические симптомы: боли в животе, головные боли и отсутствие аппетита. Эти недуги не позволяли ей ходить в школу по несколько дней. Они также защищали Шайлу от неудобных ситуаций и чувства неполноценности.	Shyla’s family immigrated to the United States from India when she was four years old. Shyla was the oldest of three girls, with the youngest child having special medical needs that required a lot of her mother’s attention. Shyla’s father worked full-time as a university professor. She entered school not speaking English, which caused her a great deal of anxiety. For the first year of kindergarten, she rarely knew what was happening in her classroom. Her anxiety increased with the teasing she received from other children because she looked, dressed, and spoke differently. Eventually, Shyla internalized the teasing and her lack of understanding English as her being stupid and not good enough. Her nervousness escalated to somatic symptoms of stomachaches, headaches, and lack of appetite. These ailments kept her home from school for days at a time. They also kept Shyla safe from uncomfortable situations and feelings of inadequacy.
When I met Shyla in her early 30s, she suffered from debilitating migraine headaches; anxiety had negatively impacted every aspect of her life. She had disconnected from friends, she had quit her job because she was overwhelmed, her marriage was suffering, and she felt she was failing as a mother. The anxiety that began as protection from the uncertainties of her life as a young child had now taken on the extreme role of keeping her from fully engaging in life.	When I met Shyla in her early 30s, she suffered from debilitating migraine headaches; anxiety had negatively impacted every aspect of her life. She had disconnected from friends, she had quit her job because she was overwhelmed, her marriage was suffering, and she felt she was failing as a mother. The anxiety that began as protection from the uncertainties of her life as a young child had now taken on the extreme role of keeping her from fully engaging in life.	Когда я встретил Шайлу, когда ей было чуть больше 30, она страдала от изнурительных мигреней; тревога негативно повлияла на все аспекты ее жизни. Она оторвалась от друзей, ушла с работы, потому что была перегружена, ее брак страдал, и она чувствовала, что терпит неудачу как мать. Тревога, которая началась как защита от неопределенности ее жизни в детстве, теперь взяла на себя крайнюю роль, мешая ей полностью участвовать в жизни.	When I met Shyla in her early 30s, she suffered from debilitating migraine headaches; anxiety had negatively impacted every aspect of her life. She had disconnected from friends, she had quit her job because she was overwhelmed, her marriage was suffering, and she felt she was failing as a mother. The anxiety that began as protection from the uncertainties of her life as a young child had now taken on the extreme role of keeping her from fully engaging in life.
Shyla’s case is an example of anxiety as a personal burden. It developed out of her lived experiences. Parts took on anxiety to cope with what she could not control. Anxiety provided protection from challenging and uncomfortable situations as a child. However, over time, the parts went into overdrive and began protecting Shyla from what they perceived as having the potential of being difficult or causing harm. In this way the anxious parts kept Shyla from experiencing the deeper pain of not being enough.	Shyla’s case is an example of anxiety as a personal burden. It developed out of her lived experiences. Parts took on anxiety to cope with what she could not control. Anxiety provided protection from challenging and uncomfortable situations as a child. However, over time, the parts went into overdrive and began protecting Shyla from what they perceived as having the potential of being difficult or causing harm. In this way the anxious parts kept Shyla from experiencing the deeper pain of not being enough.	Случай Шайлы — пример тревоги как личного бремени. Это развилось из ее жизненного опыта. Партс взяла на себя тревогу, пытаясь справиться с тем, что она не могла контролировать. В детстве тревога защищала от сложных и некомфортных ситуаций. Однако со временем части перегрузились и начали защищать Шайлу от того, что, по их мнению, могло быть трудным или причинить вред. Таким образом, тревожные части не давали Шайле испытать более глубокую боль от того, что ее недостаточно.	Shyla’s case is an example of anxiety as a personal burden. It developed out of her lived experiences. Parts took on anxiety to cope with what she could not control. Anxiety provided protection from challenging and uncomfortable situations as a child. However, over time, the parts went into overdrive and began protecting Shyla from what they perceived as having the potential of being difficult or causing harm. In this way the anxious parts kept Shyla from experiencing the deeper pain of not being enough.
Case Vignette 2:	Case Vignette 2:	Пример случая 2:	Case Vignette 2:
Anxiety as a Legacy Burden	Anxiety as a Legacy Burden	Тревога как унаследованное бремя	Anxiety as a Legacy Burden
The client, a 42-year-old single Black female named Annamarie, presented with extreme anxiety about finances. She questioned every financial decision she made. She worried about not having enough money to take care of her basic needs. She stressed about her business failing and becoming homeless. She felt shame around spending money and buying nice things, although she could afford them. She expressed concern about whether she was saving enough of her income “for a rainy day.” She feared a financial future that was not reflective of her current financial situation.	The client, a 42-year-old single Black female named Annamarie, presented with extreme anxiety about finances. She questioned every financial decision she made. She worried about not having enough money to take care of her basic needs. She stressed about her business failing and becoming homeless. She felt shame around spending money and buying nice things, although she could afford them. She expressed concern about whether she was saving enough of her income “for a rainy day.” She feared a financial future that was not reflective of her current financial situation.
